title: This hotel has the least professional staff and management.
text:
My parents were in town for the first time and from the first moment they stepped into the hotel I knew this is a bad hotel. They were check in by Tani who claimed that she is the manager. She didn’t even greet them at all and from there it went south when I witnessed the most pathetic display of professionalism.
She didn’t explain them anything about the hotel services, the city and what they been charged with- all of this while not looking at them in the eyes as if they were a nuisance. When I stepped in, she called me names. I’m embarrassed that I booked this hotel for my parents.
The front desk should be the entry gate for a hotel and this one was the worst I ever experienced in my life, when so called manager behaves like that. 
My recommendation is to avoid this hotel at all costs even if it means to pay more.

title: Beware this hotel bills you $45 hotel facilities fee on top of your prepaid Expedia cost at check out!
text: Although this hotel is in relatively good condition, I was very disappointed to receive a $45.00 hotel facilities fee on top of the $300.00 prepaid via Expedia and no information alerting you that additional expenses would apply! Why not $200.00 hotel facilities fee next time. A few weeks before I stayed at The Marriott hotel and no such fee was added to my Expedia expense. This hotel is a rip off. The floor in the shower was very old and dirty and no shampoo or shower gel in the shower bottles!

title: Hôtel agréable et bien situé.
text:
Nous avons séjourné pendant 5 jours en famille, hôtel très bien situé, chambre appartement junior n°613 avec cuisine très propre agréable. Seul petits bémols: la vue (sur les climatiseurs) et l’isolation des fenêtres à revoir.
Personnel très professionnel et courtois.

title: Another Wonderful Stay at The Fifty Sonesta!
text: The Fifty Sonesta Select NY team hosted our group again this year and, as usual, they exceeded all expectations.  From the moment we arrived we were greeted as return guests and  treated wonderfully.  This is the only hotel we book in NYC and they never let us down. The accommodations were wonderful and the entire staff goes out of their way to to make us feel welcomed.  I highly recommend the Fifty Sonesta, you won't be disappointed!  Kudos to Ryan McGhee and the entire team! Many thanks!

title: Great hotel for a great break
text:
This hotel in New York was fantastic and would stay there again.
Staff fantastic room so clean and nice and great location.
The man on the door was so friendly and helpful can’t remember his name but so helpful and great at his job.
Location is the best for most sites all walking distance unless going down to lower manhattan.

title: Great stay- spacious accommodation
text:
Great stay at the Fifty Sonesta Select with family and friends.
Reception staff were very friendly and helpful, with a shout out to Romeo and Lenny
Rooms for midtown NYC were very spacious, clean and air conditioning was perfect.
We had a back room which was nice and quiet.
Beds were comfy. Loads of towels, shower gel,shampoo, conditioner etc. 
Kitchen had coffee machine which was restocked daily, small gas hob and heating drawer. 
$15/ room daily allowance for drinks and snacks.
Good location for visiting Times square, Central Park, Top of the Rock etc
Plenty of restaurants nearby.

title: The hotel needs an update desperately
text: Shabby hotel in need of update. The room furniture was very tired and the bathroom was outdated. Also, the window shades didn't block out light or close properly. Located on a busy road so ensure you have a room on the higher floors. There is no water in the room which is very inconvenient.

title: Run down hotel, horrible customer service
text: The front desk told us at 4pm on Thanksgiving Day that the room we booked was not available, even though we arrived around 11am. They kept lying to us for 5h. Then they put us in a tiny, very loud room where we got no sleep. The next day, the day after Thanksgiving there was a loud fire drill which stressed my child out and we couldn't nap or rest that day either. They offered to move us to the room we booked finally which was on the 18th floor. The room was run down, dirty carpet, very dusty. I complained about the cleanliness, but it was as dirty the day after. Sta away.

title: Good stay except for a few things
text:
The hotel was pretty good. The pros were good location, decent sized room for NYC, mostly friendly staff. Very very comfortable beds and decent amenities. Excellent daily cleaning.

However, the rooms are a little outdated. Definitely needs to be freshened up. Also, the white woman with glasses and sweater that works at the front desk is a little rude, dismissive, and uninformative. She could use extra training. Everyone else was fine. The facility fee is confusing but that's New York I guess. I didn't get a room with a view like I requested, but that's fine, I understand it's busy.

Despite all this, I don't want any of this to discourage you from staying here. These things didn't bother me that much and I just like leaving honest reviews. But if those things do bother you, you may want to reconsider. In my opinion, I would stay here again. The cons don't outweigh the pros in my opinion.

title: DO NOT RETURN ROOM DEPOSITS
text:
A not to international travellers... Do not expect to get your room deposit back with out having to chase it! We visited at the beginning of January, it is now the beginning of February and we still do not have our room deposit back. We contacted the hotel, there was no damages therefore no reason that the deposit should be withheld. We were informed it can take up to 30 days... still no sign of our deposit. We have now had to had over to our Credit Card company to case this on our behalf. This is not the way we wanted our family holiday to end! 
Apart from the infuriating issue with the lack of deposit being returned... The hotel was very spacious and well equipped; however it did look tired with food splatter up the wall an light bulbs missing from lamps.

We requested a room on the higher floors after reading previous reviews regarding the noise levels. As it is a city that does not sleep, the noise does not stop. The windows did little to dull the noise and as a result, not much sleep was had... Apart from our teen son who could sleep through anything. 

Extremely peeved to still be chasing our room deposit after visiting over a month ago.

title: STILL HAVE NOT RETURNED OUR DEPOSIT
text:
The hotel itself is well situated, pleasant and spacious. The doormen are ever so polite and so are the majority of the staff. 
We visited over a month ago now and still have not had our £160 room deposit returned. As this news on a credit card, we’ve had to add funds to pay it off to prevent interest accruing. 
On contacting the hotel, they confirmed there were no damages and the money should be returned but can take up to 30 days. A month later, we still have not had our money back. Now having to ask the Credit Card company to step in to recover our funds. Not something we wanted to be constantly chasing up after a holiday.

title: Good Location and Good Hotel
text:
Good location, near Rockefeller Center, near restaurants and a subway station. Supermarket is about 7 min walk. 
We were in a suite with a varanda. Bedroom has a good size, king bed, and lots of space for clothes. 
Small bathroom for an apt for 4 guests.But all amnenities where refilled when asked.
Small kitchen, that could have better appliances. No pans, just one frying pan. The toaster was very old. Small fridge, perfect for a couple, not a family. No bottle opener or wine opener. Horrible cutlery. Very old coffee maker. 
The living room is huge. But the sofa bed can break your back. It's impossible to have a good nights sleep on it. 
Cleaning service was perfect. Romeo, was always ready to help you with your shopping and luggage. 
Elevators were quick, and I never had to wait for one.

title: Black mould in the bathroom
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights, we had an issue upon check in whereby we were given a suit instead of the one bedroom apartment that we booked though another agency. Having paid extra for the one bedroom apartment, it had black mould in the bathroom along with the ceiling being damp and yellow. Considering this was their most expensive room, this was not something we expected to see. The room itself as very spacious and clean. Room service came round daily with new towels which was good. 
Our stay was quite expensive compared to other hotels as we had to pay $45 a night extra.

title: Great Experience at the 50 Sonesta!
text: Just stayed at the 50 Sonesta for two nights, and it was wonderful.  We have stayed there before and always enjoyed it.  We had a studio room with a full kitchen.  Bed is extremely comfortable, room was spotlessly clean on check-in; a maid did check if we required service after one night but we declined (no need).  All staff we met were very nice and helpful.  Special shout-out to Romeo, who has been there on our past trips.  He has been there 20 years, and is the absolute best doorman I have ever encounted; always friendly, couldn't be more helpful and really goes out of his way for his guests.  Hope he stays another 20 years! We will absolutely return on our next NYC trip.  Thanks again!

title: become rather bad over time - used to be very good
text:
I stayed in this hotel multiple times. maybe 10 stays at 5-7 nights. 
the rooms can be bigger than average for Manhattan. usualy not very clean but OK enough. big problem since 2 years they are letting people in who are making a lot of noise and drug stuff. 
the reception staff is very very very unfriendly and unpolite. dont know why. but very arrogant. maybe it also depends what race / status you have

title: Family Trip
text:
Positives:
Excellent location; large rooms; friendly & helpful staff. Close to 5th & Madison Ave  for shopping and some decent restaurants/coffee shops.  Central Park. 

Negatives:
Property is getting quite dated; limited gym facilities.

title: Avoid at all cost!!!
text:
On check in we were charged £1,734.35. 

When I told the man that we have already paid he checked, apologised and said this would be refunded. 

On check out day I questioned this with the lady at the desk (as it was still showing as pending). 

She said it would be released on check out. 

After check out, they have charged us again, a further £1,281.34!

That’s a total of £3,015.69 in charges!

There’s no email for this hotel so you can’t even get in touch. 

It’s such terrible service. To top it off the hotel rooms aren’t even clean!!!

title: Good location and spacious rooms but customer service leaves a lot to be desired
text: Rooms are big and location is convenient but customer service is lacking. At check in, the front desk did not provide their names. After asking for ID and a credit card, they had not verified how much would be charged to the card or how much they would hold for incidentals. The room was not ready when we arrived and when asked where to store the luggage the reply was “talk to the bellhop.” There was no one in the lobby and no sign of who was the bellhop. At check out, customer service was also lacking. For the amount paid, the customer service should mirror those of a chain hotel. Apparently there is a $10 credit for snacks each day? This was never shared with us and we never got to use it.

title: Nice hotel but not for light sleepers!
text:
Firstly the hotel is in a great location and within walking distance to most things! We got our coffee from blank street just around the corner next to McDonald’s and they also did great breakfast pastries! There is also a diner a few yards away that does a great breakfast! 
When we arrived we were greeted by a very unfriendly unwelcoming lady behind reception - which made us question if we had chosen the right hotel for our family trip ! However the doormen soon put this right.. they were all super friendly and couldn’t do enough for you! Subsequently we never saw this lady again and she was replaced by much nicer receptionist’s! 
We were on level 9 which was incredibly noisy at night time and first thing in the morning - from the road below - the sirens are something else!!! there was no sound proofing at all! If you are a light sleeper this isn’t the hotel for you! 
Rooms were a great size and had loads of storage for luggage/clothes etc! A little dated and could do with a little modernisation and also they were quite dark rooms but house keeping was very efficient and we always came back to nicely made beds and fresh towels! 
You also get $10 per day to spend in the little shop - it is enough for a drink and some crisps or chocolate bar - being as it is free it is worth doing it! 
I would recommend this hotel but wouldn’t return myself due to the noise and I would like a hotel with a bar so when you come back at the end of a day you can sit and have a drink and relax rather than going straight to your room!

title: Good Stay
text: Great Location for exploring New York. Room was large, very clean and had a great Kitchen with everything needed . Staff were all great and friendly. We had a room at the back of the Hotel which was very quite.

title: Great place to stay
text:
I absolutely love this hotel. Front staff is super helpful and kind. Our check wasn’t till 4pm, however wee arrived at 11am. Ivan was super kind and let us check in early which really helped us. Rooms are spacious for a NY room. Super clean, neat, nice and warm. We didn’t have any issues with noises or cigarette smells which is very common here in NY. 
We will be definitely coming back!!

title: Great location in central Manhattan
text:
If you are visiting Manhatten would thoroughly recommend this hotel. Check in quick and easy. We had a studio apartment with kitchen with top of the range facilities and coffee making machine. Bathroom/shower excellent.Bedroom spacious with king size bed. Staff very personable and helpful. Plenty of eating establishments within walking distance.[One right next door, ] 5/10 minute walk to nearest Metro for Uptown and Downtown. Also local Bus stop close buy which goes to Cruise Piers. 
Definitely 5*.

title: Great family weekend
text: Had a great weekend with my family in NYC! The front desk was exceptional! From both front desk girls --especially Sherry (thanks Sherry!) and David! Sherry was so friendly, welcoming, and knowledgable! She was always patient and helpful! David was also helpful and considerate! We were running late back to the hotel for a delivery and I was able to speak to David, who was very assuring that it wasn't a problem until we were able to get back! So great! Took alot of stress off of us rushing back. Overall, enjoyed experience and look forward to coming back to NYC. Thank you! 😊

title: Great base for exploring
text:
We have just returned from a 4-night stay with 2 adults and 2 kids (9 and 11).

The location is brilliant, as you are fairly central with access nearby to a subway station.

We travelled here by taxi from the airport $80 and then return by car organised by the hotel for $100. It would be simple to get from JFK via underground to Jamaica and then from Jamaica to Lexington Ave 53, which is close to the hotel. Warning - if travelling later afternoon to JFK, allow 2 hours to get there, we were advised an hour and it cut it fine.

The rooms are a great size and the beds are really comfortable. We were at the front of the hotel and it was noisy late at night and early in the morning, but we expected this in a big city… and there were ear plugs in the bedroom drawer, which helped.

The kitchenette is a great amenity and you are provided with tea bags and coffee pods. There is a microwave oven, kettle, 2 gas hobs, plus crockery and cutlery. There are a few shops nearby where you can buy food - we ate out for most meals, but bought stuff in the room for breakfast.

The service charge of $39 per night includes $10 a day for snacks from the snack bar - it’s enough to get you a drink and snack.

We didn’t use the lounge, so can’t comment on this.

I’d certainly return, as this was a great base to explore the city.

title: the best choice in NYC!!
text: Th fifty sonesta exceed all my expectations, while it is true this hotel is not the cheapest, it pays each penny because its location, nearest to Manhatan cneter,  metro stations, restaurants, diners,  bus stops, etc.  All the crew from the doorman (Mr Romeo, what a gentleman and excelent person) to the manager, all of them very care for the customer.  very confrotable room, everyday cleaned with care.  The best choice that we made to stay in New York. Thanks Fifty sonesta Crew!! we enjoy a lot your hotel.

title: Great large family rooms
text: Family trip to NY, 2 adults and 3 children. Rooms are so big for NY which is why I picked this hotel.  I rang beforehand and was advised our room would have a street view and balcony, but when we arrived this didn’t happen so was disappointed as would have paid for upgrade in this instance when I got the email before our trip. Reception did recommend next day to come back to them but we decided to just stay in current room as didn’t want hassle of waiting around as wanted to go out for the day. Room had 2 big double beds and a big sofa bed. Kitchen with kettle, fridge, microwave, Delph etc.  No great view but we were only in the room on waking and late at night. Cleaners in every morning to make beds and fresh towels. Door men very friendly and every day we used our credit for drinks for the kids when we returned that evening.  Location was great. About 15 min  walk to Times Square and Central Park. One thing I missed though was a bar in the hotel just to unwind with a drink at the end of the day but no biggie. Would return to this hotel

title: Home away from Home
text: The Fifty Sonesta was the perfect stay for our family! We had three families with children. We cannot compliment the doormen enough! They made our trip fabulous! They sang to my daughter for her birthday, helped with directions and recommendations, and were just a joy. It made us feel like we were coming home when we arrived back after a long day. We made sure to take a photo with Romeo before leaving. Our room was huge by New York standards and made for a wonderful stay. We could not have picked a better hotel and will be sure to recommend it to friends and plan a return stay soon.

title: Great position
text:
Hotel was in good position with most main attractions within 15-20 minutes walk, Room was okay but tired, in need of a new bath as the enamel was coming away, and coffee machine leaked everywhere, only other issue was the noise from fire and police station at the back of the hotel and the extractor fans from restaurants below, but for the amount of time we were in the room it was okay, the major plus points of the hotel were the doorman, firstly Romeo, so friendly and nothing was ever to much trouble with his knowledge of nyc and where to visit and best ways to get there going out of his way to make sure we were okay, secondly smaile always on hand to get cars/taxis whenever was needed cannot talk more highly of these two, they made our stay at this hotel (Thank you both). 
Try morning star cafe for breakfast, lunch or dinner
Juliana’s in Brooklyn for the best pizza 
Carmine’s on Broadway for best value as it’s family style
And Ess a bagel

title: Horrible experience, does not deserve 4*
text:
When we arrived in room 708, we found a very noisy room, with a clear soundproofing defect, on the 155E 50th street side, we felt like in the street!! It was impossible to sleep, converse or watch TV. We complained insistently before getting a statement of the noise level. Once admitted, we were offered to visit 3 other rooms where the noise level was still very high on the 50th street side, and also on the opposite side of the street, from the 2nd to the 10th floor. Note that the room on the 2nd floor does not have windows. The staff is very haughty, unprofessional. There is no breakfast service, no catering, not even suggested. 
Overall, we are very disappointed and absolutely do not recommend this hotel.
(we dispose recording of the noises)

title: Lovely stay
text:
This is our 4th visit to NYC and first stay in this hotel - we had room 314 for 5 nights . 

The location is great , close to the main  areas of interest , but away from the hustle of Times Square. 

We had room 314 which was spacious , comfortable and has a huge bed . The room has great air con with a little fridge , excellent as it was very hot when we stayed . 

The iron and ironing board was really handy , there’s a small hairdryer and safe … 

The only negatives and they small
Would be the coffee , just enough for one cup a day …. We did request more , but it never materialised…. 

A few of the front desk staff seemed annoyed and were a little rude at times - the lady who took our check out bill money was quite upset when I gave her 300$  and asked for the change -  

Overall we had a lovely stay , shout out to Romeo who was so very helpful during our check out . 

Also the chaps on the door were always delightful …. 

Great value and would recommend x

title: Excelente opción en nuestro viaje familiar!
text:
Excelente opción en Nueva York. Amplio, limpio y muy bien ubicado. Estaciones del metro cerca y personal muy amable. Muy recomendadas su habitaciones que poseen una cocina adecuada para autoservicio.
Muy recomendable. Nosotros volveríamos de todas maneras en un nuevo viaje a NYC.

title: Great hotel!!
text: This was a great hotel! The staff was friendly and helpful. We were three ladies in NYC for the first time, and we could not have asked for a better place. I don't know the doorman's name who was there for the majority of our stay, but I want to give him a shoutout as he was so helpful in getting us cabs and he always greeting us with a smile. I liked that the hotel was a few blocks away from the busier parts of town. It was clean and the room was a really great space. When we arrived, we were upgraded from a room with 2 kings and sofa bed to a 1 bedroom suite with a sofa bed in the living room area. The suite also had a kitchenette and a balcony from which we could see the top of the Empire State Building. Each day we had fresh towels, which is a service I have not had at a hotel stay in quite a while. The reason I gave it only 4 stars is that I don't want people to be disappointed - it is not a luxurious resort of some sort. It is a very clean, nice hotel with great staff that made us feel safe and welcome. My only "complaint" if you can even call it that is that I would have liked a little more light in the rooms. All the rooms were just a little bit dim including the bathroom, but nothing that was unmanageable or that made the stay any less pleasant. I just really loved our stay here and will be returning if I get the chance.

title: Poor management, poor customer service
text:
I was excited to stay here as I have had good experiences with the brand in the past. Upon arrival in my room, the temperature was 78 degrees on a hot and humid September day. I lowered the ac and when I returned 90 minutes later it had gone down by one degree. After waiting another 90 minutes I called the front desk, guest services, the bell desk and never got anyone to answer. When I called the hotel number from my cell they responded immediately. They sent someone up who used a wrench on the unit itself and declared it fixed. 2 hours later it gone down to 76 degrees. They said they would send someone to my room when I called again. 60 minutes later, no one had arrived. When I called again, they said their service guy said there was nothing else he could do until the morning. Would have been nice to know. But they did say they would send a fan to my room. It never arrived and there was never a call. The next morning I asked at the front desk if there would be some sort of compensation, reduction in cost..  I honestly was looking for  - any semblance of customer service. The response was that I shouldn’t worry since my business was paying, not me. That didn’t settle well with me and when I said that’s not the point the manager had no patience for me. He said the company would have to call and try to work something out but that nothing would be done because they had paid the lowest rate. He got quite frustrated and walked off when I said he was making it the customer’s problem rather the hotel’s. 
Poor management, no customer service, rooms just okay, older than anticipated and. It tech friendly.

title: Great place to stay at!
text:
We enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The staff was super friendly, polite and pleasant. The room was nice. We truly enjoyed our housekeeper Sadia, who was an absolute delight to meet, chat with and just be around.
I recommend the hotel and will definitely plan our future stay here.
Sadia is a star ⭐️!

title: Lackluster experience
text:
Not very friendly customer service
Also during booking it said in my confirmation email that complimentary checkout time was 2pm. 

On the day I left the staff member who called the room rudely informed me that the actual checkout time was 11am. They should state that as you check in and take the 2pm out of the booking email. 
Also as others stated the rooms were subpar and there were people outside making noise all night. Not worth the money find another hotel.

title: EXCELLENT HOTEL A HOME AWAY FROM HOME A+++
text:
Another fantastic experience at the fifty hotel, this is now our regular go to when visiting New York. The staff go above and beyond to make your stay memorable. All the staff work exceptionally hard, they are all polite and serve you with a warm and friendly attitude. A mention to our lovely doormen , Sammy and Smaile you both were very welcoming and attentive to our needs, always with a friendly smile on your faces saying good morning and welcome back. You make the hotel. 
The rooms were spacious and always very clean and tidy, with prompt housekeeping in the morning.
The location is in perfect walking distance for shopping on fifth avenue , Madison and Central Park. Can’t wait to be back in winter. 
Thank you the Fifty, I couldn’t imagine staying anywhere else.

title: Exceptional dog-friendly hotel in Midtown
text: Highly recommend this hotel. We chose it because of location, being dog-friendly and reasonably priced.  We were so pleasantly surprised by the location, fabulous staff, and beautiful room. Can't say enough good things about this hotel and will definitely return.  Try Morninstar Cafe on 2nd ave and 50th for breakfast. Japanese BBQ nearby was a must avoid, though. The staff at this hotel deserve special mention. So warm and friendly. Everyone was truly caring and try to make your stay the very best.  We drove to NY and left the car with valet at $65/day. Book it!

title: Cargos en la tarjeta
text:
Hola, nos hospedamos en julio con mi familia. El hotel no estaba mal, pero el servicio pésimo. Pagamos en efectivo al salir y pedimos específicamente que tuvieran cuidado de no cargarnos de nuevo el importe en la tarjeta que dejamos en garantía a la entrada.
Por supuesto llegó un cargo a la tarjeta. Horrible.

title: Munificent in Midtown
text: Generously-sized and recently renovated room (i upgraded) with plenty of working space and a comfy couch to relax on after marathon meetings or exploring the streets of NYC.  Some wear and tear on the furniture and a "non-standard" selection of viewing options (No HBO or Showtime), but very attentive staff and excellent location on 50th between 3rd and Lex.  Also, $10/day allowance for water and snacks.

title: An overall bad experience!
text: Our stay at this hotel was not positive and my review should not come as a shock as I communicated to the manager and others in the property already.  I was coming back from a long business trip to Europe and meeting with my wife and kids for a week in New York. They were flying across the country from California to meet me at the hotel. Unfortunately JFK that day has severe delays due to the weather so instead of all arriving around the same time in the early evening, my wife and kids did not get into New York until midnight. When I arrived around 8:00pm on a Sunday, I told the person checking me in that my wife and kids would be arriving later than me due to the weather delays and to consequently give them a key to the room upon their arrival. There was no issue with this and the attendant was very polite. It's not the first time that this happens where we don't arrive at the same time and never had any issues. Well, when my wife and two little kids arrived at the hotel around close to 1:00am in the morning, the hotel attendant gave them a super hard time, told them they were not on the reservations and could not give them a key to the room. You can only imagine the despair after 7 hours or travels, delays and 2 crying little kids! No empathy, no emotional intelligence, no phone call to my room  (the room phone I found out later was out of order) etc. My wife tried to reach me but my phone was silenced as I fell asleep with the jet-lag from Europe. Anyway, after about 1/2 hour of begging to get a key to the room, someone the attendant got a ah-ah moment that my family should get a key! I called reception right away upon the arrival and told the lady that she must be deranged for not letting my family to the room after I specified they would arrive late and also the fact that my wife also had called the hotel to let them know she'd be arriving late. This was the main issue here which is why I am giving the lowest possible rating. Beside that the hotel was subpar: uncomfortable beds, no water (constantly out of water at the convenience store and no vending machines to purchase water or snacks: imagine that in 100 degree weather), tiny gym with old equipment and guess what no water as well (constantly out)! They also never replaced the phone in the room after I asked three times. Breakfast was absolutely disgusting and they charged $20 for it! Frankly this hotel should issue me a refund a major apology! I got a very non heartfelt apology from the manager i.e. "We apologize sir but your family was not listed on the reservation" - she could not care less that they waited for over 30 minutes to get the key to the room. This hotel is a pure disgrace and I hope nobody will be treated the same way we were. Just avoid!

title: NYC Weekend
text:
This property is super nice. I checked in with David and he was awesome; super friendly. He quickly requested the required documents and got me checked in to a king bed room on the 9th floor. Upon checking in, I was impressed with the layout of the room. The room was clean, very spacious with a comfortable bed and couch. 

On day two I received an in room phone call from Veronica in Housekeeping who checked in to see if I needed anything as far as amenities, towels etc. as I had a do not disturb sign on the door signaling no service for the room. I felt that was very thoughtful and impactful on her, versus noting the do not disturb sign and moving on to the next room. She provided me with additional towels.  It was the extra thoughtful care and effort put in that made the day.  I feel the staff loves their guest's and have a passion for service. The doormen were also very attentive and friendly. As someone that knows what its like working in this type of setting, I appreciate this team and how they made my stay great. I would definitely recommend. Kudos to David and Veronica-ROCKSTARS! I hope there is some type of incentive/recognition program in place for staff. Thank you for a great stay!

title: Great hotel, staff and location was perfect
text:
The room was spacious and comfortable enough for a family of four plus luggage. The housekeeping was excellent. Every day the room was cleaned like the first day we arrived. Tea, coffee etc were replaced each day as well as towels and toiletries. The staff could not be more helpful. They were polite and courteous and the doormen were very gentle with everyone that walked through the doors. 

We had a kitchenette so bought some cereal and milk from one of the local grocery stores. Kitchen is a good size as is the bathroom. I cannot complain at all with the hotel nor it’s location. Just perfect. 

With it being on 50th street, it is away from the noise you get on one of the avenues but about 30 minutes walk max to a lot of places. Grand Central St is a few minutes walk so we caught the metro a number of times from there. I recommend getting the metro card. 

There are plenty of restaurants around and I recommend Spice Symphony which is an Indian restaurant literally across the road and La Gioconda on 53rd St a lovely Italian. 

Everywhere we went accept debit cards so  we very rarely used cash. I recommend getting a travel debit card, top it up in dollars at the fixed exchange rate and use that card everywhere.

title: Only redeeming quality is the staff
text:
For the price, I expected better rooms. I understand NYC is expensive so I have no problem but the room decor just seemed cheap and outdated. Not a big deal since we spent a lot of time outside but for the money I'm spending, I hoped it would be nicer.

Also we got the breakfast once and it wasn't worth it. I'd rather eat out at a breakfast diner. i'm 

Luckily the staff was great from the bell/concierge to housekeeping to the front desk. Marco is great, he even remembered our names. Our kids loved saying hi to the bellhops. Our housekeeping lady was great as well (I think her name was Maria? Her name ended with an -a). The front desk was very informative and seemed like they knew a lot about the city. (I think the man's name was Dave or Dan, I don't remember. He helped us out. I didn't get the girl's name but she was shorter. She was very friendly as well.)

Overall, I just wished the hotel resembled more of a four-star. At least the staff was good

title: Well
text: The location was great. The rooms are fine... It was outdated but we like the space. Housekeeping staff was good. The bald African American gentleman at the desk seemed a bit distracted when we were asking him questions, like he was more interested in the street outside the window. He might have been tired or bored. The lady at the desk was friendly and helpful. The bellhops were superb. If the rooms get an update, we will come back.

title: Everything we expected
text: To save money we opted for a small room with a king-sized bed. It was clean, well-appointed and comfortable. The wi-fi was free (though it dropped us once) and the in-room coffee was good. The staff was friendly and competent. The location is outstanding -- lots to see and do, and only a couple of blocks from the subway. Nothing spectacular, but a charming older hotel in a great place.

title: Not recommended...
text:
Not recommended due to the Front Desk..

Some aspects of the hotel were way better than others

Housekeeping was excellent, no issues what so ever.

The most important aspect of a hotel is the front desk, and that's were my issues were at..

First bump in the road was at check in, when the front desk tried and failed to register my visa card 3 times (showed up as declined) until they swiped it. Needless to say, many bad thoughts ran through my mind. Had my pre paid purchase been handled the right way back in february I wouldn't standing at check in sweating and worried if we had a room the next 9 nights. 

Then we checked out our room, and the next surprice appeared. Our room with a terrace had 2 doors in it to the terrace. We couldn't open one door and couldn't lock the other door. We went to the front desk and they sent for someone from maintenance. When they came he said the handles were broken and that the hotel had ordered for new handles.  The next day after sleeping with one eye open due to a door that couldn't be locked we again went to the front desk for help.

The maintenance guy that came told a whole different story. He said the handles were taken away as a precaution so children wouldn't open the door themselves and walking out on the terrace alone. Completly understandable decision. 

He said our choice was to either have the doors locked or open permanently during our stay. We chose to have both doors locked. But that left us with a key item of our room unavailable, one feature we really looked forward to. In the future Sonesta would be wise to let customers know in advance that the doors would either have to be locked or open during theire stay.

Next was the biggest headscratcher for us.

When we woke up the first morning we found out that during the night the AC had started leaking water. We notified the front desk early in the morning but the issue was NOT resolved until at night time the day after. 

At least 30 hours after we rapported it we still had water on the carpet. We went to the front desk every time we went out to either ask for info or rapport that we still needed someone to get rid of the water.  The solution was a machine that blew air onto the carpet. This was after the first solution which was to lay a towel over the leakage. I thought carpets with water damage was going to be replaced.

Needles to say I was worried about this, that and the other thing regarding mould due to water on the carpet.  It seemed we were more worried about this issue than others. 

It doesn't ease my mind that we ate,walked and slept here while we waited for the issue to be resolved. One front desk manager said he could look for a new room for us, but we didn't hear more on that matter.

Needless to say I advised the hotel chain to let customers know that the doors on the rooms with a terrace would either have to be permanently locked or permanently open when they book there.

in the future we'll look at hotels elsewhere, which is a shame cause we stayed at this hotels multiple times in the past without issues.

If the hotel want's to get in touch with me, they know where to find me..

title: An excellent experience and lucky find.
text: My wife and I stayed here for a week in June and had a memorable experience.  We luckily booked a  corner Junior Terrace Apartment room which was the size of a large studio apartment - 500 sq. ft., with one king bed.  The terrace, with a table and two comfortable chairs, was huge and afforded spectacular views up and down Third Ave. and 50th Street both.  The hotel has the feel of a chic residential apartment building which suited us fine.  We were impressed with the tasteful contemporary furnishings and decor of our room.  My understanding is  that many rooms have been refreshed but some have not.  It pays to ask if the room you book has a standalone shower (much preferred) instead of a tub/shower combination.  Here is a list of what we liked:  Although it's not listed as an amenity, there was a safe in the closet for locking up valuables or whatever, a nice surprise.  The bed was very comfortable and the pillows extremely so, as was the couch which comes with an upholstered ottoman.  The room was spotlessly clean.  The housekeeping staff is excellent.  The large 50 or 55" Samsung TV with a swivel had an impressive picture.  The kitchen area fit the room nicely and was like new.  The refrigerator didn't make any noise and there was even a quiet dishwasher which housekeeping used to wash glassware. The large shower was terrific and well designed. The towels were  thick and fluffy. The windows in the room were double pane for noise abatement and could be opened for fresh air if so desired.  There are three elevators all of which are sleek and extremely fast.  I can't vouch for the breakfast room, exercise room or lounge as we didn't visit those areas.  I recommend checking out room choices on the hotel website and booking directly with the hotel which offers a variety of deals and options.

title: Second stay not as good as first
text: Second time staying at The Fifty and I must say there has been a big drop off in quality. Maybe it was because my room was a low floor and looked out onto the old Doubletree nextdoor but it felt quite dark and dated. I know most Midtown hotels are not going to have a view but this felt a bit off. The shower was absolutely awful. Barely more than a trickle of water which made it difficult to shower. Had I been staying any longer than one night I would have complained and asked to be moved.

title: Penthouse is awesome!
text: Hotel was great. Walking distance to Starbucks, Subway, Paris Baquette, and Times Square. Got the Penthouse at a deal through Expedia…best views and so big! You can see down two NY city blocks and at night you can even see the Summit! Walked to Grand Central Station and the Summit. Love it!

title: No ac , hot bad rooms
text:
Stay away from this hotel, they say the have ac. This hotel has no ac , but we are in june rooms are so hot , we reserved a room and it is june and the main machine says it os of. Worst night ever. 

We have called  everyone in the hotel and no one has helped us.

title: Fantastic Fifty NYC
text: We stayed at this lovely hotel for 4 nights in mid May. Straight from the beginning we were made to feel welcome which only got better when we discovered we had been upgraded to a suite of rooms on the 20th floor overlooking Third Avenue. The staff were courteous and polite throughout. Do take advantage of the hotel’s breakfast which at 20 dollars represents very good value compared to some of the other diners nearby. Well done the team at The Fifty…we hope to return one day.

title: MB UBICADO, HABITACION CORRECTA HASTA AHI Y PERSONAL PORTEROS Y BOTONES EXC Y FRONT DESK MUY FLOJO
text:
Muchos sentimientos encontrados voy a tratar de. Ir por partes
1) las ubicaciones muy buena  y bien conectado a todos lados
2) las habitaciones bien, podría tener un microwave. Las nuestra tenias mal la puerta del baño y no la arreglaron en 5 días por eso es. Aparte de. Las calificacion
3) Todos los porteros y botones muy amables
4) el front desde excepto 1 que era uno de los jefes (creó) fueron amables este que dirigió tenias un trato inaceptable hasta el último día que al menos no nos trató tan mal,  me tome la molestia de leer otros comentarios y vi una coincidencia en todos que decian lo mismo supongo debe ser de esta persona.
5) Limpieza Bien pero no, ya que NO reponen papel higiénico ni shampoo ni nada, inaceptable en un hotel de  usd400 la noche.
6) No cobraban resort fee en estas fechas pero luego si lo Cobraron!!!. lo bueno dentro de lo malo, es que en ese resort fee que usualmente es un robo te daban 15 Usd de crédito para. Bebidas y papitas (caras perro bueno algo es algo)
8) Cuando le dije a la chica del front desk de mis vicisitudes se disculpo como siempre lo hacen todos suponiendo que con eso está bien o cumplen con algo, pero deberían saber que no está bien en absoluto para nosotros los pasajeros-
9) Esto es grave!! Nunca nos entregaron unas tarjeta de crédito que estoy seguro que llego porque las cartas las tiran a la basura (lo vimos con nuestro propios ojos)
10) ESTO ES LO MÁS GRAVE, ADJUNTO FACTURA DEL HOTEL (donde  usd 179 y me cobraron en la tarjeta de crédito 2 cargos usd 311,37 + 44,75.  (aclaro que no consumi nada del frigobar (porque no tienen productos) y si hubiese habido algun gasto deberia aparecer en la factura que adjunto y no esta.

Finalmente no lo Recomiendo por Usd 400 la noche + resort fee hay cosas mucho mejores por ese valor.
Saludos

title: Avoid this place at all cost
text: I arrived at 4 pm for check in at the Fifty Sonesta Select in NY. The manager informed me that the room was being cleaned and would be ready momentarily. This of course never happened and had to wait 2 extra hours. The apology? A complementary bottle of water….additionally, the hotel is marketed as a renovated hotel when in fact is quite the opposite: the place is filthy and smelly posing health risks to customers.

title: Lindo hotel en Manhattan, con aspectos básicos a mejorar
text: El hotel esta muy bien desde lo edilicio. Las habitaciones son grandes y confortables, las que tienen kitchenette están muy bien, completas y equipadas para poder resolver temas de comidas. Lo malo es que no tienen comodidades para poderte sentar, ni una mínima mesita. La decoración es moderna, lo aleja un poco de los clásicos hoteles de NY con alfombra marrón y papel/pintura beige. La ubicación para mi no es la mejor, hoy todo pasa mas cerca de la 5ta y 42. El personal es bastante corto, no hablan castellano en su mayoría y tampoco son muy amables. Teníamos unos snack gratis x dia y nos lo informaron al 3er dia. Con la ubicación de habitaciones también fue un poco estresante, somos una familia teníamos 2 habitaciones y las solicitamos contiguas o al menos en el mismo piso, llegado ahí hubo que patalear para que esto se cumpliera.

title: Shabby, noisy and avoid
text: Very poor experience and extremely low value for money. This hotel is classified as a boutique hotel. I'm curious to understand why as there is nothing that can be noted as such. The hotel is in desperate need of a renovation. It is shabby, dark and feels dirty. All the decoration in the room is old, chipped and cheap. The curtains don't even close fully - instead there is a shade that can be pulled down to moderately block the light. The windows are old, don't open or close yet have gaps. The hotel is also across the street from a docking station. Trash trucks arrive in front of the hotel at 7.00am each morning and begin their dumping that takes 45+ minutes. All of this can be heard as you were sitting next to them due to the poor windows of the hotel. The hotel also ran out of bottled water while I was here. All in all, would never stay here again.

title: Perfect choice
text: Amazing location just a short walk to major attractions, and good choices of food. The room was ample sized with good facilities and perfectly clean!  From the moment you arrive to the moment you leave you feel at home every day! For our first visit to NYC this was a perfect choice and certainly will be my choice for our next visit !!!!

title: Lovely hotel!
text:
We visited New York over the Easter period, and stayed at the Fifty Sonesta select. The hotel was clean, the staff were friendly and the beds comfy! 
The hotel is pretty close to the tube station so easy to get around, but also close enough to walk to attractions like Empire State Building and Time square

title: Great location great price
text:
Excellently located. Short walk from lots of main attractions and shopping areas including 5th Ave. 
As a party of 4 the room we had was plenty big enough we had plenty of room to move around and get ready. 
Room was pretty basic but that is all we needed. Iron and hairdo are provided. The beds were comfortable and a decent place to crash into after a long day on your feet. 
The staff in the hotel are courteous and friendly, and the doormen are amazing. They will literally help you with anything, extremely knowledgeable about the city. 
I would definitely stay here again.

title: Definitely visit this hotel - just don't give them a credit card!
text: The hotel is nice, the rooms are a good size, the door staff are very friendly and the location is good - close to the tube and about a 20 minute walk to Times Square. That said, a spoiler for me is the $200 dollar deposit they take for incidental charges made to the room. This is a con. They say there is a $10 per day allowance to use their over-priced tuck shop - I'm assuming they have charged us for this as they have not refunded the $200 and we didn't charge anything to the room. They have not replied to any messages regarding this and reading previous reviews this isn't the first occasion. My advice is not to give them a card and say you'll pay as you go for anything you want. Shocking tactics by a hotel chain. Currently in the process of charging-back through my bank.

title: Fabulous Hotel with very helpful staff
text:
Lovely hotel and great staff. Rooms are very spacious and we’re big enough for our family of 3. Always clean, cleaners came in every day.
David on reception was very helpful on our arrival. 
Only thing that got me was the additional $300 I had to pay on arrival. No problem, paid on credit card. Was told we would have $10 credit every day to buy cupboard items. So, we used said $10 and when we went to check out was charged this…..if I had known I wouldn’t have bothered getting the stuff. Was told the travel company we used hadn’t opted for the Credit option! Anyhow, I was refunded the initial  deposit as agreed just charged for the cupboard items we had so no major deal as it wasn’t too expensive m in comparison to the $300 we paid. Overall I could not fault the hotel and I would definitely return if I was ever to visit again!

title: Beware of deposit scam this hotel appears to be doing…
text:
Continued with my reservation despite the bad reviews however, unfortunately I also have not received my $200 deposit back following my trip in February. I knew about the facility fee - which we paid on cash on arrival. 
After some emails to management I was told the facility fee would be deducted from my deposit and the rest refunded - neither of which has happened. There is also no record of me paying cash for the facility fee. So please be wary of this. As of today, two months later, I have received zero refund and have no response from emails to management. 

Despite this, This hotel is nicely situated to travel around New York easily. The doorman was so attentive and friendly and on hand for any tips. Rooms were very spacious as travelled as two adults and three teenagers. They were not immaculately clean, however beds were very comfortable and rooms were not too noisy. 

I assume some of the reviews regarding the meaty smell are because this hotel is right above a McDonald’s, I did not notice the smell to be bad. 

We are frequent travellers to New York, I would say that due to the deposit issue I will not be staying here again.

title: great hotel but don’t use their cars/taxi
text: great location, room a bit tired, but good size, would definately stay again and would recommend. however ordered through the hotel one of their cars/taxi to take us back to jfk, was told $100 flat rate inclusive of tip and tolls. when we got in the car the driver told us the journey would be 3 hours, i looked it up on waze it was showing as 1 hour and 5 mins. he said that was with tolls, and charged us an extra $25!!! furious, should have just got a yellow taxi!!

title: Boutique is better
text: My wife and daughters and I travelled to NYC for most of March Break this year.  The Fifty Sonesta, in my opinion, is a great option for families as the suites are larger and priced better than average for such a good Midtown Manhattan location. Close walk to St Patrick's Cathedral, Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue shops and MoMA. There is an amazing French Bakery called Paris Baguette just around the corner with myriad tasty fresh pastries and remarkably smooth Lavazza lattes.  Yes, we don't all want to wait in line for Ess-A-Bagel nearby. Further, just across the road from Paris Bagutte is a Duane Reade (drug store) if you need some Advil or toothbrush or whatever (snacks - read Krispy Creme).  Be aware now, there is a $39 USD facility fee for the amenities at The Fifty.  This includes a "credit" of $15 USD from this $39 total you pay daily to "buy" items from The Cupboard just adjacent the Front Desk.  Make sure you get something that you already paid for from the Cupboard daily for this $15 USD credit.  It doesn't accumulate so that you can't save it all to use on the last day.  The 1 bedroom terrace suite is about 700 sf on the 21st floor.  Has a small kitchen with dishes and utensils, dishwasher, microwave, keurig coffeemaker; a dining area with table and 4 chairs, large living area with sectional sleeper couch and many windows.  The terrace looks directly down 3rd Avenue (note the NYPD 17th precinct is a block behind the building so you can expect some noise, but likely more of a sense of security). Down side to the suite was the single small bathroom, but we made do. The shower controls needed a Shaman to nail down the best setting for hot water, but I am a quick learn and then was stuck turning on the shower for everyone thereafter. The primary doorman and concierge, Romeo, is likely a key reason why this boutique hotel has so many return visitors. Incredibly polite, pleasant, helpful with great local restaurant or other venue advice.  I mean it. I have never met such a phenomenal gentleman as a concierge. Keep this man, Sonesta Fifty management he's gold.  Marco is pretty darn good too, on the night shift.

title: Fantastic Hotel, Wonderful Staff!
text:
Spent another two nights at this wonderful hotel in celebration of Saint Patrick’s Day. Great location, rooms are fantastic and the staff very accommodating. We highly recommend this hotel and can’t wait to return next year. Special thanks to Ryan and Randolph for taking care of us and exceeding Al expectations!
TIP - the suites with balconies are worth it!

title: Best business and pleasure New York hotel I have ever stayed at
text: My daughters, and I had an amazing experience at this hotel. From the first moment we arrived we were greeted with a smile by the amazing doorman Romeo. Our room wasn’t ready, but they were very helpful at storing our luggage. I had called earlier in the week, and they found a suite and were able to upgrade us. The room was just lovely and very large. My daughter was celebrating her birthday and I was there for an important work function. We were all thrilled. The concierge, Anya, answered my emails, and got flowers for my daughters birthday, a restaurant, reservation for an important business, dinner, and other treats for the girls. Another colleague was staying at the hotel, and the two of us wanted to get a blow dry before the meetings. She found us an amazing stylist, and we looked fabulous. I will definitely be back! Thank you so much for a wonderful stay. I come to New York often on business and it is always hard to find a nice place to stay. This really felt like home.

title: Falsa publicidad
text:
Estuve alojada del 3 al 13 de febrero en habitación con cocina, todo correcto. El manager no habla español y recurre al conserje a que me traduzca una pregunta que le hago de porque ofrecen una hora de vino al día en la reserva si no la dan desde la pandemia. Me  siento ignorada por su parte y me ofrece una botella de agua 😂a unas personas que se van a quedar 10 días en su hotel ( supuestamente hablan inglés ,francés y español.
Pues nada ha pagar por algo que supuestamente  entra en el,precio y no te dan y de detalle un agua. Volver ahí nunca. El manager y sus recepcionistas muy déspotas con las personas que no hablamos inglés.

title: Fantastic stay
text: We have just returned from this hotel, we are are party of 9 with 3 children. The hotel is situated in a great position and has numerous eating and convenience stores nearby. We had 3 suites which were brilliant and included full kitchens. Spotless clean and very roomy.

title: Family stay
text:
Stayed here for 6 nights in early February. 

We are a family of 5 and booked this through virgin holidays. 

The beds were huge and really comfortable. Housekeeping was great, changed the sheets and towels every day and we never ran short of toiletries although we had taken our own. 

The room is the biggest I’ve ever stayed in in New York. Lots of space which is great when we had 5 cases, 5 carry on bags etc. It had a small kitchen too but the fridge froze everything so we didn’t use it after the first day. This didn’t cause great issues but would’ve been better if it had worked. 

We had noisy neighbours who kept slamming their door and arguing throughout the night. They were also clearly smoking weed which stunk but that’s legal in NYC now so I doubt the hotel could have done anything. 

The room was a little tired and doesn’t have a view. That being said I found the location good as it was right near two subway lines and far enough away from Times Square as I couldn’t bear the thought of staying there as it’s just too busy. 

Check in desk and concierge were lovely. Would definitely consider staying again if we returned to nyc.

title: Perfect visit, we will be back
text:
Brilliant Location in Midtown, this hotel continues to be my go- to every time I visit NYC.  I have stayed in some other hotels but they don't measure up.  
So aside from the fantastic location,  for me its the beds, the towels, the size of the rooms and the staff.  Particular shout out to Rome at the door, always a pleasure to be welcomed by you!  The hotel is spotless, the front desk cannot do enough for you and I would suggest using their car service as in rush hour traffic to JFK it was a dream,  better value than an Uber or yellow cab.  
This trip, my 20 year old was with me so we didn't try the breakfast, there are so many other options on the doorstep.  We ate mostly in  great restaurants near by afer some recommendations.  During the day we walked to most places, like Times Square, Central Park, 5th Avenue, Broadway, Rockefeller, The Summit, Grand Central etc.  These are all on the door step.  Felt very looked after and safe.  Thank you for our stay.

title: Bien situé !
text: Petit hôtel qui offre un bon rapport qualité/prix et est bien situé. Nous avions une chambre très bien pour une famille de 5 avec petite cuisinette (nous avions de la nourriture déjà cuite que nous faisions simplement réchauffer). Propreté des lieux et de la chambre correcte et service agréable.

title: IGNORE THE BAD REVIEWS
text: Ignore the bad or nit picky reviews about this hotel. I will definitely be staying here again upon my return to the city. The hotel and our room was spotless to say the least. The only thing about the hotel which would be a con would be the view from your room, however you’re in NYC you shouldn’t be in your room enough to judge like a detective! Along with the outdated hallways but we did not see that as a major problem. It was mine and my brothers first time in NYC and this hotel is in walking distance to everything. Romeo the doorman and a woman in reception (I did not get her name apologies) were so accommodating and friendly. That in mind and the location of the hotel should be enough for you yourself to ignore the reviews and stay here!! We are yet to receive our deposit back however but we have only just got back home, so will give it a week before I contact the hotel.

title: Not what it used to be - beware of additional fees
text:
The hotel is not what it used to be when it was Affinia. Not as clean as it used to be, service is not even close to what it was. Very disappointed. I had stayed here many times in its previous iterations and I loved it.
Also, beware of the $45 facility fee. It's a complete rip off. It raises the price per night in more than 20%

title: AVIOD - Scam facility fee of over €300
text: WARNING - AVIOD THIS Hotel - Rip off Ridiculous Facilities fee per night. No mention of charge when booked in NOR was this mentioned when checked out. Also stated no charge would be made toward the Bank Card when asked the direct question, yet took over €300

title: Room stank, made us wait for hours for new room to be “prepared” - best to avoid.
text:
We arrived and our online checkin did not work. We went up to the room and it stank. All the windows were open and there was a small fan running in the hallway. 

The dishwasher in the room was filled with greasy dishes. 

We asked to move. We were told at first that there were no other rooms. Then they offered a room but said it would be 45 minutes. The manager said, well, maybe an hour. What hotel room takes an hour to clean?  

We left to have a coffee. I asked the manager to text me. He said no just come back in an hour. He finally agreed to text.  After about 1.5 hours, no word so we returned to the hotel. The manager said the room was still not ready.  We are still waiting — closing in on 2 hours for the room to be ready. 

Do not stay here.  Manager is unpleasant, service is clearly pretty bad, and the fact that the windows has been opened in the room and a fan deployed meant they knew the room reeked — a horrible smell— yet still put us in the room.

title: HORRIBLE SMELL room 1014
text:
We are currently staying in this hotel.  The room is on the tenth floor and the windows are closed yet there is a really horrid smell of frying meat from McDonalds below.  We are vegetarian so it’s making us all feel rather sickened, the constant smell of beef getting into the room is vile.  

AVOID, this must be disgusting in the summer!!!

title: Good hotel but please give me back my deposit
text: We stayed at the hotel for our once in a life time Christmas visit to New York. Very pleased that the tax was covered by Virgin. This covered our taxi to and from JFK. On arrival we took a yellow cab and paid less than the car organised by the hotel but it was a luxury vehicle and to be honest the taxi driver in the yellow cab was plain rude. Rooms were big. There were 4 of us. Beds were comfortable. Bathroom big. Strange stain on the floor that stained towels after every shower. Very good position and about 10 minute walk to Times Square. My only gripe (hence not a better review) is that my deposit has not been returning ($100 paid on arrival). I have now emailed so hope this is sorted soon (we stayed in 1607 if management are reading this).

title: Don’t listen to all the reviews.
text:
Reading the last reviews we were a little worried about staying here before we arrived. 
Well, we shouldn’t have been! The hotel staff were friendly and helpful from the word go! They explained that we had already had the taxes and fees paid by Virgin and that we could purchase breakfast vouchers should we wish to. 
The door staff were fantastic. Friendly doesn’t even cut it! Every time we left or arrived back at the hotel they welcomed us “home” and ensured that we were well looked after. 
The rooms are a little dated but exceptionally clean. The beds are so comfortable, which is what you need after a wander round NYC. 
The location is perfect, about 5 minutes from Rockefeller Center and 15 minutes from Times Square. 
On our final day, our luggage was safely secured away and we were offered to have a car arranged for us to transport us to JFK which actually arrived early and got us there in plenty of time for our flight. 
Overall, a lovely place to stay, clean and well staffed. Can’t wait to return!

title: I'll stay somewhere else next time
text: I stayed here when it was an Affinia hotel and was happy with the quiet, boutique vibe, reasonable rates, and convenient location--all of which remain valid today. The rooms have been renovated, but service and maintenance seem to have declined. One closet door and the in-room safe were not working.  Hotel staff came to fix things soon enough, but we shouldn't have had to complain. Tissue and toilet paper were not re-supplied until we asked for them. There are bottles of shampoo, conditioner and bath gel attached to the shower wall, but no place to put my own bar of soap. (I have allergies. Long story.) The toilet wouldn't flush properly and the shower stall didn't drain quickly. And when my wife asked for help arranging a ride to the airport, the front desk told her they don't do that in New York. Minor inconveniences, yeah, and it's New York City, I get it, but I will probably stay somewhere else next time.

title: Great Experience!
text: The staff was extremely helpful and always very nice!  We arrived too early to check in and they held our bags while we enjoyed some sightseeing until the room was ready.  Rooms were clean, spacious (especially for the city), and in a great location!  We would definitely stay again!

title: Good stay December
text: The hotel Has a great location although disappointing that there is NO bar or restaurant or roof terrace as advertised. The staff are really friendly and polite helped us order take out pizza to the room one night always helping get taxis etc . The rooms are quite tired but fine for sleeping in the sofa bed was comfortable we stayed in  room 1111 you can see the Empire State Building and the river from both windows . The lobby is good has free WiFi . Good places near I’d recommend are Maggie’s for drinks / snacks / meal . Penelope for breakfast, Peter dillons for drinks in a local pub very friendly and 1 block down .

title: Christmas in NYC
text: Hotel was clean, staff was friendly and helpful.  Romeo went out of his was to make our stay very enjoyable.  Location was also good.  Within walking distance to major attractions.  Wish there was a restaurant onsite but knew that prior to booking.

title: Lovely hotel with fantastic staff
text:
Upon check in we were greeted by Randolph on reception who was really accommodating, explaining about the hotel.
The room was very clean and spacious and the bed so comfortable.
The toiletries provided smell so good too.
Housekeeping came every day (shoutout in particular to Teresa) and was superb.
The doormen, Romeo & Sammy, we’re also terrific.
Would definitely recommend staying here despite some of the previous negative  reviews published; they proved unfounded from our experience.

title: Nice hotel great location
text: Just spent a week with my spouse at Fifty Sonesta. Location was perfect, close subways, midtown area so easy to get uptown or down. Large rooms and nice helpful staff. Would definitely stay again while in New York.

title: Great location and solid hotel
text: Overall very please.  Unfortunately when we checked in the system was down so we had to walk around for 2.5 hours before we could get into room but that happens.  There are two reasons it was not 5 star for me.  First, they give you a $15 per day credit that you can use to buy things in their convenience area, but unfortunately almost all items were sold out for the entire weekend.  The second challenge was the front desk staff did not seem knowledgeable about the area.  When I asked for a sports bar within walking distance, they could not make any recommendations.  Overall a pleasant experience though!

title: Fairly good value but be sure to include mandatory « facility fee » in the room cost
text:
Fairly good value but beware old fashioned grey wall decor, black plastic bag covering some vent outlet in room, $89 facility fee which is basically simply an add on to the room cost which you need to factor in.

Very friendly doorman, convenient mid town east location.

title: Weekend in New York with family.
text: The size of the room was amazing. Balcony wrapped around with two doors! Huge tiled shower in large bathroom. Plenty of closet space. Accommodating staff.Location was perfect...Fifth Avenue, Rockefeller Center, St Patrick's Csthedral were all within walking distance.

title: 1st visit to Sonesta 50 Select
text: Accommodations were good except wind was coming in through windows-poorly insulated. Not very happy that we were supposed to get certain perks for Sonesta status, but told no bc “was not updated to Sonesta system from Affinia just yet” which didn’t seem right to us.

title: Perfect
text: We give this hotel, our highest recommendation. The room was very nice. Everything was clean and well-kept. The lobby area was invitIng and the staff was extremely accommodating. We found the location to be just wonderful. We look forward to going back soon.

title: Awesome Service!
text: What a nice hotel with an excellent staff. So very accommodating for my mom who has back issues. I asked for a room near the elevator to limit her walking. Ivan is a gem! He upgraded our room to a nicer one right by the elevator. Customer service was top tier! The rooms are big for New York. Lots of space and very clean. Great first stay will return!

title: Not worth the money. Poor Welcome.
text: Took my daughter to New York for her 16th birthday. Awful welcome from who I assume was the manager (French I think?). We walked in with a smile, daughter excited about being in New York. Bubble quickly burst by the person at the desk. No eye contact, abrupt and rude.  Although paid beforehand (with confirmation/receipt)  staff member requested I pay again as my "payment method failed". Instructed me to insert card etc. I showed him proof of payment. He proceeded to slide a room key across the desk and issue me some hurried instructions. All other staff were lovely. Hotel looks well-worn / tired.

title: Hotel zu vermeiden!
text: Dieses Hotel **** wurde über Booking als Familienhotel gebucht, leider ein kompletter Reinfall. Zimmer (Junior Suite) sehr schmutzig, es wurde nur auf Nachfrage gereinigt. Wir hatten um ein anderes Zimmer gebeten, leider war das unfreundliche Personal auch nicht sehr hilfsbereit und es wurde uns weder ein anderes Zimmer noch eine Entschädigung angeboten. Das Hotel hat auch keinen Zimmerservice. Auf jeden Fall hat dieses Hotel keine **** verdient!

title: Wonderful Location, Spacious Rooms
text:
The rooms were so spacious, and Sonesta is one of the few hotels in New York of which have balconies (specifically the apartments in the Sonesta), which is a great place to enjoy breakfast with a beautiful view. The beds were incredibly comfortable and pillows nice and fluffy. 

Through all my hotel checkins, Randolph's was by far the best one I have experienced as a guest. We offer our sincere appreciation to him and his high level of hospitality. As well as his fashion.

Thank you team for a wonderful stay!

title: A Great Place To Stay and Walking Distance to Times Square.
text: Really enjoyed this hotel. The room was surprisingly large and tastefully decorated. Quiet, clean, and convenient. I have not been this comfortable in a New York hotel in a long time. I am looking forward to my next stay.

title: Great value for the price!
text: Great location. Friendly staff. Comfy beds. Clean!!! Would stay here again. Booked through Costco. Easy to access the subway. Great local restaurants. Asked for more linens and received them very quickly.

title: Disappointing
text: We’ve stayed here many times. Since it became Sonesta it has gone downhill. Staff is still great, but it’s obvious they are t taking care of the property… rooms are shabby, AC doesn’t work, our room was very hot the whole time, electrical outlet in bathroom didn’t work.

title: Overpriced and underwhelming
text:
This hotel is very overpriced for what you get. The room was dark and we couldn’t adjust the heat and so it was stuffy. The bathroom is tiny. The shower is weak the bed though was comfortable.
The hotel is located on 50st mid east side not far from Rockefeller Center and Times Square. 
There is a gym on the second floor we did not use it. Nothing else to say about this place other than not worth what they charge.

title: Zero welcome & rip off facilities fee
text:
I felt compelled to write a review, primarily because of the receptionist.  She was the only lady we met on reception and having travelled from the UK we were tired but excited and looking forward to our holiday.  Our greeting by this lady was total indifference.  No "welcome to the Fifty, how was your trip", just the usual passport and card question.  We then mentioned it was our daughters birthday it didn't even get a smile, let alone a "happy birthday".  Service is so important and this was our first experience of NYC, so very disappointed in her indifference....she really couldn't care about anything and should not be in a position where she has to deal with the guests and really set a bad tone for the hotel stay.  Her miserable indifference continued for the whole stay...no "good morning" for example

I can forgive the tired rooms and filthy windows as we spent little time in the hotel but I can't forgive the poor service by this lady. 

While writing they also have the cheek to charge USD44.75 a day for a "facilities fee" which effectively includes a few packets of crisps and the use of wifi.  This fee not charged by all the hotels in NYC (so optional) and is purely a profit play, especially as they don't have any facilities like a pool or bar to warrant the charge.  

On a positive note Ralph and Sam were very helpful (on the door).

title: Great location, spacious Rooms.
text: The hotel was great: spacious, fantastic location. The street was a little loud and there wasn’t any food, besides snacks. You couldn’t use the second floor space either, which was a bummer when I was trying to get some work done. But the staff was fanatic! Every singe one of them that we encountered. And I’ve never seen a bigger standard room in a NYC hotel.

title: Nice hotel.  Good location.
text: I asked my kiddos what the best part of the trip to NYC was and they said, “the man that opens the door! He does magic tricks!”    Having a separate bedroom is great when traveling with kids.  Very nice having a washer/dryer available.

title: Great location, nearby tourist attractions, subway station and friend staff
text:
Great location, walking distance to Central Park, Rockefeller, Grand Central Station. Plenty cozy Restaurants around the area. Room is clean with cute kitchenette. We arrived early but the room was not yet ready which we understood. The gentleman at Front Desk was professional and the bellman named Sammy was so friendly. He always greeted us and have that smile on his face that gave a good vibes to everyone.

The only down side is that the room air condition doesn’t have an option for cooler temperature. They only have heater mode. When we were there during day time it wasn’t cold yet. Called Front Desk and was advised to open the window and the room will get cooler. It was inconvenient because we can hear the street noise and ambulance sirens. It was a challenge for us but we didn’t allow that to ruin our vacation. Overall experience is awesome.

title: Disappointed:   Fifty Sonesta Select Hotel in NYC
text:
The hotel is in a great area next to restaurants, shops, Broadway, Rockefeller Center. 
Very comfortable for  a group of 4. 
I rated it a 3 since you cannot turn on the a/c. We called the lobby to check what was going on and they told us it was neutral, since the hotel is “sustainable” . They told us we should open the windows.  We tried opening the windows but there was a exhaust system from a restaurant down below, which filled the room with kitchen smell. After we ask them several times for a solution to the problem,  they brought us 3 fans. I am allergic to floor fans, so a week has gone by and I am still suffering from the stay.

title: EXTREMELY RUDE staff. Also, NO AC in a boiling HOT ROOM
text:
I stayed here in a room with two double beds during a visit to New York with 3 friends of mine for a "girl's trip" (we're all women in our 60's). Upon arriving, our room was EXTREMELY HOT - in the high 70's/ low 80's. We tried to call the front desk, but the PHONE WAS DEAD, so we had to go down in person. 

When a technician was sent up to the room to fix the broken phone, we asked about the hot temperature and he responded with EXTREMELY INAPPROPRIATE comments: "Obviously this room will be hot, you're four women." After telling him this heat was unbearable he responded with "There's nothing I can do, you can PUNCH ME if you want" (his name was Nelson by the way). We were speechless and went back down to the front desk.

When we asked to turn up the AC at the front desk, we were told that "for sustainability reasons" there was a standard temperature set for the whole building and so the AC was not going to be changed. Their suggestion was to just open the windows - we tried that, but our window faced a restaurant exhaust which shot FRYER SMELLS and GRILL SMOKE into our room (not ideal when one of the guests has ASTHMA). We were forced to close the windows and asked management what other options were available and in turn they suggested WE LEAVE, but didn't help to find any alternative housing. 

NO ONE was helpful at the front desk, we never heard from management, and we felt very UNWANTED and DISRESPECTED. I suggest you THINK TWICE before booking here, I wouldn't want anyone else to experience what we did.

title: DISGUSTING! Menstrual Blood on sheets.
text: My room was absolutely filthy. Crusty pasta sauce stain on the ottoman. And when I went to pull out the couch mattress, then were crumbs and a menstrual blood stain on streets. I will never return. Ever. This actually made me sick to my stomach. I couldn’t even sleep, I sat in the chair for the night. Customer service refused to change my room.

title: Family stay in NYC
text: We spent 7 nights for a family trip with 1 small child (3) and 1 older child (9). The room we got was comfortable and larger from what had I originally booked, we were comfortable and it was very clean. The bathroom was large enough too. We were provided with a crib I had requested in advance. The doormen (especially Sammy)  were so courteous and helpful with directions every day. The location  is truly the star of this place. We were within walking distance from Rockefeller center, Grand central station, Central Park (a little bit longer walk, but our family really enjoys walking), 5th avenue shopping, St Patrick’s Cathedral which was so nice to see pretty much daily. Several subway lines available too. They have a laundry room on premises, which was also very convenient. Definitely recommend and would stay here again.

title: Excellent Customer Service and Beautiful Hotel
text: It looks like the hotel was recently remodeled and it shows! The rooms were large and well designed. The bathrooms were also nice. However taking it over the Top (in a positive way) was the Hotel Staff! The front desk were very helpful and accommodating! The maid service and concierge were very friendly and helpful!! I would STRONGLY RECOMMEND this hotel!

title: Perfect hotel for a weekend of theater
text: Favorite hotel for trips to NYC.  The rooms are quite spacious for New York and very clean. The location is perfect - far enough away from the craziness of Times Square but a 15 minute walk to theater and great restaurants and the subway to Brooklyn. The staff were all attentive and very helpful and for NYC it is reasonably priced.

title: Big rooms, handy (but small) kitchen, good location, slightly tired furniture and decor
text:
The best things about this hotel is the room sizes, which are on the larger side for NYC for this price point. The kitchen is handy. It is not a full kitchen, but it has a small stovetop, microwave and minifridge - and a toaster. These were used and appreciated. 

The hotel is in a handy location, generally walkable to many destinations. The doormen were very friendly - one of them in particular who knows magic wowed our daughter by making a coin appear behind her ear!

Only negatives are the furniture and decor, which is passable but on the tired side. Room layout is very odd, with a closet inside the bathroom. The doors to the room also were slamming very loud.

title: De más a menos
