text: Excelente ubicación, cercana a varias líneas de metro, camas muy cómodas con muchas almohadas y también un TV grande, ambas cosas se agradecen, muy conveniente tener una kitchenette, sin embargo el baño era muy chico, no hacían bien el aseo, nunca sacaron una mascarilla que estaba al costado de una de las camas y el último día no nos hicieron la pieza, además la gente de la recepción no era de lo más amable., sin embargo los porteros si lo eran  La foto de la página web que muestra un pequeño lugar donde comprar algunas cosas, no se parece en nada a la realidad, mientras estuve en el hotel, casi siempre estuvo vacío.

title: Everything Fine...With One Exception
text: I recently attended a trade show in New York, and stayed at the Sonesta Affina 50. My daughter took the train down from Maryland, and she stayed at the same hotel in her own room. I had requested connecting rooms, or, at least, close together. Suffice to say, my room was on the 15th floor, and hers was on the 2nd floor. Other than that, the rooms were more roomy than other New York hotels, and we found the rooms clean and comfortable. The doormen were exceptionally friendly and helpful. There are many great restaurants within walking distance from the hotel.

title: Fabulous!
text: The room was spacious, clean & beautifully decorated. Perfect location to walk to many landmarks-NYC public library, Bryant Park, St. Patrick’s Cathedral, Times Square, Grand Central Station, Rock— Center. The staff could not have been more wonderful. They say “Welcome home” when you get back. Lovely touch. If and when we go back-this will be the only place we stay.

title: Recent stay at fifty sonesta
text: Recently stayed at the fifty  sonesta . Everything was great . Room clean . Towels brought to room very quick.  My only complaint was the front desk woman upon checking out. She was extremely rude . We were checking out . She was annoyed from the moment we asked her question .  We asked if she would like the room keys back and she replied Nah , I’m good . I was very taken back by this as everyone in the hotel was so friendly and helpful .

title: Perfect  stay!
text: Our stay was perfect in every way! The warmth and graciousness of the front desk staff, as well as the doormen made our stay so pleasant. Rooms were spacious and housekeeping efficient. The location was near public transportation and also walkable from much of our sightseeing.

title: Great Location
text: The doormen we’re awesome. Very helpful and welcoming. I loved how they said welcome home every time we returned. Spent 4 nights and enjoyed it. Clean comfortable and great location. Multiple things to do and places to eat within a few blocks to 2 miles of the hotel. Try Sofia for dinner it’s a block away and was excellent.  Try the NY luncheonette a few doors down for a great breakfast. Rooftop bar and restaurant next door. We did park our car here with no issue but this is an extra fee. I am told that it’s better to book through the hotel that the prices are better. Not sure if this is accurate. We booked through Expedia. Oh yes, each room gets 10 dollars a day to purchase water or snacks at the desk. Would stay here again.

title: Loved the Fifty Hotel by Affinity!
text: I chose the Fifty Hotel for its proximity to Mem. Sloan Kettering and the discount they offer MSK patients. It did not disappoint!  My husband, sister and I stayed in a larger room with a kitchenette, and it was perfect; extremely economical for the accommodations, which were clean, stylish and roomy.  We even decided to spend an additional night!   Several times we asked for additional items (like coffee) and the room service was amazingly prompt.  The staff, especially the porters, were friendly and professional. I highly recommend this hotel and will stay again soon I hope!

title: Ideal location for central Manhattan
text:
Stayed here with husband and 2 teenager (boy and girl). Ideal walking distance to places like Rockefeller centre - observation deck, roller skating), 5th Ave (shopping), Times sq/42nd Street. 
There are ample food places nearby to eat in and takeaway.
We arrived very late at night (3.00am) due to flight delays so were tired and hungry. We had asked for adjoining rooms or rooms close to each other well in advance of arrival (our travel agent had made request at time of booking  and I had emailed twice with no response) so was disappointed when they had us on 2 separate floors, 11th and 16th floor. The hotel staff member wasn't as welcoming and not very empathetic when I explained we requested rooms together. He said I'd have to come down at 12pm and ask at the desk! 
The day staff and door men were all lovely, helpful and polite. They were always cheerful and happy to answer any questions.
We had a twin rooms and they were spacious with big windows although one of ours faced on to other buildings (1611) and the other overlooked the street outside(1610). That was fine because we were out most days and didn't really need the view. Air con worked fine, housekeeping did come round quite early on few days had to turn them away (9am!) but they were just as lovely and polite. Rooms (incl bathroom) were cleaned well (behind the nightstand could've done with a thorough vacuum). Nightstand had sockets to plug in devices (USB ports would've been better)
They also have a scale for you to weigh luggage.

title: Very disappointed and waste of money.
text:
It is rare I submit negative reviews but this
has be known. We stayed 8/5-8/7/22.
We have stayed at Fifty Hotel for the past
few years and have aways been happy. The
staff especially ROMEO and SAMMY are so
helpful and nice always!!
First, I was sent a 30% off coupon and it
was not valid. The AC barely worked and
we had maintenance try to fix it 3 times. (it
was 90 degrees out so VERY
uncomfortable). The shower was clogged
and thankfully my bf being a plumber
pulled out a huge horsetail of hair to
unclog it. The toilet seat needed to be
screwed in which he also fixed.
The rug was dirty so we did not not want to
walk with bare feet. The chair was ripped.
On Sunday when we checked out (8/7) , all
elevators but 1 were working so it took
forever to get downstairs with our luggage.
For $700 for 2 nights, I will not be returning back to this hotel!!

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text:
I and myself and my wife have stayed here a number of times. One time for almost a month. We consider this “New York residence.”
Friendly and helpful staff. Clean and well appointed. Ideally located for a number of nearby place of interest and eating options.

title: Comfortable but needs upgrades
text: Mr. E and I just spent 4 nights at this hotel.  The location is good…close to subway, restaurants and the staff are all very friendly.  Our suite was okay however just entering the unit, I could detect a strong urine odor from the bathroom however I now believe it must be the smell of mildew likely embedded in the shower curtain.  There is no fan in the bathroom so this is the result.  You do get used to it eventually but I hope they replace all the shower curtains if this is common.  It is very off putting.  Kitchen is small and you really can’t cook in it…maybe boil some water and use the microwave but that’s it.  Beds are comfortable.   They do provide ear plugs which I highly recommend using since the street noise is very noticeable if you face 50th Street.  On the plus side, the AC made it also comfortable espcially with the high temperatures in NYC.

title: Great Location
text: We had a junior/studio suite and the room was very spacious! The location was phenomenal! Close to 2 subway lines, walking distance to Rockefeller Center and Grand Central Station. This is the 2nd time I've stayed at this location and the 2nd time I've had a view of a brick wall. It appears that fewer than half the rooms face the wall, so apparently I'm just unlucky. :/ The elevator, hallway, and room were VERY warm. The thermostat in the room is apparently just for show because it read about 5 degrees higher than we had it set and felt about 5-7 degrees more than that. Staff were all very courteous.

title: A disappointment in the big apple
text: There were  little to no ventilation in the bathroom.  Water dispenser in the gym was empty for 3 days.  As a platinum status member, i was supposed to receive a bottle of wine.  It was never mentioned.  And when I inquired about it, was told they lost their liquor license.  So too bad:(. No other compensation offered.  Doorman Romeo wad great.   Very jovial and enthusiastic about his job.

title: Peace
text: Very comfortable & pleasant rooms. Staff was really helpful & hospitable. Nearby eateries all over the place. Love the maps on the elevators doors letting you know the historical landmarks and places in your area. Great stay all around.

title: Great hotel, friendly staff, great location
text: This is our second stay here and we really enjoy the hotel.  Responsive staff, very clean rooms and entrance.  Our room was quiet and decently sized got NYC.  The only downside is there is no associated restaurant or bar.  There are ole plenty of restaurants and coffee shops nearby and and easy walk to Times Square and Broadway.

title: Home away from Home
text: First off, NY city apartments and hotel rooms are tiny, but not at Fifty. The location is perfect for business people staying for longer periods of time and ideal for families since it has a small kitchenette. Veronica went above and beyond to help us with our questions after booking and upgraded us when we arrived. We had a 1 bedroom penthouse terrace apt. The room was perfect and the doormen always had a smile of their faces. Thank you Veronica and team!!

title: Comfortable stay, great location
text:
We were greeted with a very friendly welcome on arrival. Whilst we arrived before check--in time, reception staff kindly stored our bags and allowed us use of hotel facilities to freshen up. Lovely location with plenty of nearby amenities and dining options.
We were in a studio on the 22nd floor, incidentally next to a "party room" called the Dream Room. Each day a new group of party-goers would check-in but noise from there thankfully wasn't too much of an issue. As with many other reviews, noise from the road is unfortunately quite apparent, despite us on the very top floor. There is little soundproofing of the windows and so ambulance/ fire engine sirens unfortunately woke us up on occasion.
The room itself was very spacious and of excellent size for NYC. We booked a room with a kitchenette as we stayed for 8 nights and so felt eating out all of the time may get tiresome. Whilst our kitchenette was of reasonable size, it was not what I would call a functional kitchen. There is no oven, just a stove, microwave, coffee machine and toaster. Basic utensils were missing- i.e. no kitchen knife, no cooking pan and so actually cooking would be difficult. Breakfasts are easy however, with the iconic Ess-a-bagel just metres away and countless nearby casual dining options.
The in-room TV was massive and allowed easy Netflix/ casting from our devices. 
The gym on the second floor we found excellent, whilst small equipment was multi-functional and so you can truly get a full-body workout.

All in all a comfortable stay at the Fifty. We would come back (and bring with us a couple more kitchen utensils!)

title: Family trip to NYC
text: Hotel was the perfect location for us. Close enough to the city to get to attractions by subway within a few minutes but far enough away to enjoy a nice slow paced stroll. Junior suite was the perfect size for a family of five and had a nice sized kitchen. Staff was amazing and helpful!

title: Exceptional Visit
text: Stayed at the hotel for a full week to give my daughter a break from the commute for her summer ballet intensive. We live in NJ only 40 miles away and my husband and I work in NYC.  Very few hotels, as I was searching, offer a suite type arrangement with a kitchen that is actually somewhat realistic price wise for a hotel in NYC.  We had such a fantastic experience at the hotel we’ll be back for long weekends and maybe another week before the summer is over. It was spotless clean, updated, and anything you asked for they went out of their way to provide. Truly a special place to stay. Diana and Romeo were like old friends by the time we left. Be back soon.

title: Clean, comfortable, spacious room
text: Solid hotel. Good location if you will be spending most of your time around Midtown. Room was clean and comfortable. It was also quite large by NYC standards. Hotel staff were very friendly and check-in/checkout was easy. Would definitely stay again.

title: Summer Family Trip
text: We enjoyed our 1 week stay at Fifty Hotel NYC.  The staff members were friendly, helpful, courteous, and professional.  The Midtown location is a perfect starting point to Times Square, Broadway, Central Park, and Grand Central Terminal just to name a few.  The hotel and the rooms are updated and the kitchenette is helpful for a family.  However,  I gave the hotel a 4 out of 5 rating since the bathroom lacked a fan to remove the steam from the shower.  The frequent moisture made the bathroom smell musty which in turn affected my allergies.  All in all, this hotel was just right for us in NYC.

title: Great suites - worth the money
text:
We stayed in a one bedroom suite on the 20th floor. With a separate kitchen, dining area and living room. The room was great - and very large. It was worth the money . 
However, when we checked in , they gave us a room with no view. I asked to be moved to a better room -  since we were staying for 6 nights - which they did after two days when it became available.  
I did notice there were pretzel sticks (not from us) under the couch cushions, but everything else was clean. They even washed the dishes that we left in the sink each day. 
And yes - the best location for walking or subway.
I would recommend this hotel if you want a suite with space.

title: Enjoyable stay. Ideal location.
text:
We've just had a week here and though exhausted after the noise and vibrancy that NYC offers, we have enjoyed our stay.

The hotel is in a good location just on the edge of the busier part of Manhatten. It's maybe 15/20 minutes to Times Square.

There's plenty of bars and restaurants in the area, specifically if you head further along 50th and 51st streets towards 2nd Avenue.

All the staff at the hotel are friendly and obliging, particularly Housekeeping who smile and greet you each day. Front of house staff were friendly too.

Our only niggle is the lack of a lounge and/or bar. Some nights, after a long day on our feet we just needed a place to relax for an hour and have a nightcap. We might have had enough of the busy city centre, but a final drink in a comfortable, quiet bar or lounge, close to our room would have been great. 

Happy to recommend and we'd consider staying here again.

title: NYC Trip for consult
text: My wife and I traveled from Charlotte North Carolina to New York City for a consult for her condition. We went to Sloan-Kettering and one of the hotels that had a hospital room rate was 50 Sonesta. We decided to try this boutique hotel instead of Marriott's and Hilton's just to see how it would work out. And yes indeed it worked out extraordinarily. This is a fabulous hotel on the corner of East 50th and 3rd Avenue; we had our own kitchenette as well as room with a king size bed, tv, and everything else you would expect from a hotel room. Square footage much larger than offered by name brand hotels, and we had a spectacular time not only in the city but had no issues whatsoever at this wonderful hotel. Cheers to Sammy and Romeo, the two door men who helped us out each and every day whether it be just to say hello, find us rides, or just be extremely nice gentleman. I would recommend this hotel to anyone whether you are hospital visiting or just sightseeing. Great location, great neighborhood, and great food surrounding this area.

title: Fantastic family stay
text:
We had an incredible five night stay at the Fifty Sonesta. We travelled with Virgin as a family of four (2 adults and 2 children age 13 and 11). The first room we had was incredibly noisy and the air con only worked sporadically. The next morning the staff moved us to another room at our request and it was perfect, with great air con and no noise. The second room was inward facing and higher up in the hotel, which made a huge difference.

The staff at the hotel were really helpful. Special mention to Ryan who moved our room which was really amazing. We hugely appreciated it as it made a huge difference being able to sleep! Also Romeo on the door is an absolute legend. My children were disappointed on the days he wasn't there. He was full of helpful advice and tips for days out.

We loved having a kitchen and it meant we could prepare breakfast each day and sometimes dinner as well. It helped to keep our costs down.  The bathrooms of the rooms are slightly dated, but the water pressure is good and it's not as if you spend much time in them.

The whole holiday was absolutely amazing. The location of the hotel is perfect. It's easy to walk to most places in midtown and the subway is at the end of the street for trips further afield. We would definitely return if we are lucky enough to ever make it back to New York!

title: Perfect base
text:
We stayed here for three nights and it provided a  perfect base for exploring Manhattan.  

The hotel is clean and the bedrooms comfortable.  The staff are helpful and friendly.  

There is diner nearby so you don’t have to go too far for breakfast in the morning.

title: Great Time
text:
Stayed with my other half and our 7 year old daughter as a 40th Birthday present, was on the tenth floor overlooking the street.  Room was spacious and comfortable and the staff went out of there way to say hello and give us New York novices good advice and tips.

The hotel is well situated and most of the major attractions are within walking distance so it was a perfect base for us.

title: Fantastic experience
text: Stayed with a friend for six nights and our room was beautiful.  Staff was very pleasant and attentive and responded quickly to requests.  We slept well due to great beds and linens.  Location is good for walking to theaters and there are good restaurants nearby.  Highly recommend.

title: Basic Hotel
text: Great location and lovely staff especially the door men who were full of local information and very polite - especially Romeo - check in was quick and efficient but first room we were given was very poor - felt like it has not been cleaned - moved to a far better room and was happy for the rest of our stay - hotel is very basic with really no amnesties - but didn’t spend much time in it so not a major problem - the hotel is just a little tired and needs some TLC

title: Love the views, But the room and balcony neglected
text: This is our second trip to NYC and we returned to the same hotel and the same room because we had such a pleasant time in October 2022. We chose the 20th floor Penthouse because of the size, the wrap around balcony and the views. The room was in decent condition. However, the kitchen counter was fractured in two places and held up by a 2 x 4. It was like that in October, but I thought they would have fixed that by now. Also the patio was completely neglected. Dead bushes was all that was out there and empty candle vessels. VERY diss appointed in the neglect. Especially for an $780 per night penthouse. Also the hallways had an unpleasant smell. I just felt like the property was neglected.

title: Excellent hotel.
text: I stayed in Fifty Hotel and Suites on East 50th Street in NYC for 6 nights to be with a family member while they went through medical treatment at MSK. I found it to be extremely comfortable. I am greatly appreciative of the special rate offered for such reasons. It made it possible for me to be there.

title: Fabulous Hotel
text:
This hotel was in Midtown and is to be recommended.  We were only 20 minutes from Times Square and Broadway. A short walk to Grand Central Station and about 25 minutes to The Empre State Building. Just around the corner there were some nice bars and eating places. Just up the road was a diner which was perfect for breakfast each day. There was a lovely restaurant next door too. 

The staff at this hotel were amazing. Nothing  was too trouble. They were friendly, polite, helpful and informative. We needed a taxi to get to the docks to catch a boat and the bell boy went up the street, got in the taxi and brought it to the hotel entrance…fabulous. 

The room was big with two big, comfy double beds. The bathroom was big with loads of hot water. The room was cleaned each day with fresh towels. The standard was very high. 

We loved it here and would definitely recommend you to stay here as it’s good quality at a good price.

title: The beginning of a perfect trip starts with the Fifty Hotel!
text: It really felt like a home away from home. The great room along with the even greater staff made for a wonderful week! The room with kitchen was much larger than anticipated and the free $10 in goodies each night was a nice touch. What did it for overall were the people who couldn’t do enough for us. So happy we chose this great hotel and location.

title: Comfortable and convenient East Side hotel
text:
The Fifty Hotel is convenient and comfortable. Staff were pleasant. 
My room was spacious and attractive, king size bed, sofa bed that was comfortable to sit on, excellent lighting. There was a closet and lots of drawers and shelves. 
The bathroom was nice sized, plenty of thick towels, walk in shower. One oddity, the vanity was about 3’ deep and the only mirror was above it. Hard to see to put on makeup or shave. 
It’s also surprising that there aren’t extra outlets next to the bed for electronics in this day and age. 
The hotel charges an annoying daily resort fee which allows $10 from the snack and beverage selection. The choices were limited however, chips and popcorn were the only edibles. 
On balance this is a good choice and I’d stay again.

title: Good Stay at the Affinia
text: We enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The staff was courteous, helpful and very professional. The furniture in the one bedroom suite could use some updating however the kitchen the was well equipped and the location is excellent. We will stay there again.

title: Very good base for big attractions
text:
Loved this hotel.  From start to finish!  The doormen are amazing - especially Romeo, who learnt our names very quickly.  Check in and out was made very easy.  The reception staff were fab too.
The room was basic - but a very good base for our stay - my view is that it is somewhere to put your head down for the night.  Housekeeping came in every day.  There was little bits missed - like an empty bottle behind one of the bedside tables - but all in all, very good.  
About 15 mins walk from Times Square, so still a little noisy at night with rubbish/garbage collections and horns peeping znd sirens - but that isn't the fault of the hotel.
I would definitely stay here again.  We were made to feel very welcome and even when they had a disruptive guest, they couldn't apologise enough.
Close to Grand Central station, St Patrick's cathedral and Top of the Rock.

title: Spacious! Great staff!
text:
Everyone was friendly and helpful. I suppose the bathroom could have been better cleaned. It smelled a bit musty but I had disinfectant wipes & used them on the shower curtains/shower. It was fine after that. (I didn't bother mentioning to the hotel.) Everything else was great. The location was convenient and nice with the subway 1-2 blocks away as well as a 24 hour Duane Reade. I picked up bagels across the street a few mornings.
The suite was SO nice - kitchenette was really useful with a burner and small pans, small fridge, microwave, dishes/utensils, sink, and dishsoap. It was really roomy and perfect for me & two teenagers. (I told them NY hotels usually aren't this spacious & to lower their expectation for next time.)

title: Fantastic hotel and staff!
text: We stayed 6 nights and will definitely go back! The staff were all really helpful and genuinely friendly. The rooms are a lot bigger than I've previously experienced in New York. What is amazing is the central location to everything. Times Square 15 mins, Rockerfella centre 10 mins. Top tip, if you go to Grand Central Station (10 mins) they have a deli/food market at the front that has an amazing sushi stall! Lots of other deli foods available. Downstairs is Magnolia bakery!

title: No reply to emails
text: I have emailed this hotel via there website as is there preferred method 4 times now and heard nothing back - I have a reservation with them that I need to speak or communicate about but nothing back in over 4 weeks.

title: Debe recuperar su brillo para volver a ser un 4 estrellas
text: Es un hotel que fue 4 estrellas, hoy es 3. Tiene prestaciones de esa epoca como quien abre la puerta y que hacen la habitacion todos los dias, no como otros hoteles que tenes. Tambien nos dieron una habitacion con balcon a la Av. 3. La ubicacion es muy buena en el Este, zona tranquila. La atencion de front desk fue muy buena. Las habitaciones tienen calefaccion individual. Hace años estuvimos affinia de la calle 63 y era otra cosa. Cafe en pb todas las mañanas, microondas en las habitaciones, bicicleta de cortesia. Tambien la limpieza fue un tema de donde surge que hay poco control de calidad. Llegamos y habitacion y habia pelos en el baño. Le avisamos y necesitaro dos dias en limpiarlos. Las paredes de las habitaciones son finitas. Los bomberos estan cerca del hotel.

title: Good stay
text:
The room needs remodeling and clean/replace the carpet.  Overall the room was ok. Housekeeping need to be aware of the bed linen condition before putting it on the bed. One of the bed mattress pad had holes and old blood stains on it. Once it was reported housekeeping provided clean linen. Close walking distance to area attractions (Times Square, 5th Avenue, and Rockefeller Center).
The front desk staff was very good.  And the doorman Romeo was so helpful with our luggage, opening the door, and flagging taxis for us.

title: Appalling hotel, and even worse hotel managers
text:
Could not agree more with this review below. Honestly, this hotel looks like it has not been operational for 20 years. In spite of this the hotel staff's behaviour is appalling. The only staff worthy of any praise are the doormen. They show no regard for the guests, offer you the worst rooms possible and the rooms are in such a state you would rather stay in a hostel. My wife and I could only endure one night (as it was too late to arrange anything else) and had to move immediately. 

https://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/ShowUserReviews-g60763-d502408-r835096040-Fifty_Hotel_Suites_by_Affinia-New_York_City_New_York.html?m=19905

title: Great location for sightseeing in New York
text:
We had a family suite, which had plenty of space and included a small kitchenette.  The rooms were comfortable and clean.  Staff were very friendly.

The hotel is in a great location for sightseeing in New York.  It is near to the subway station and you can walk to several major attractions, including Times Square.

title: Great hotel in a great location.
text: We enjoyed our stay at 50 for a short family trip. Hotel was in a great location. We had a great room with plenty of space. Everything was clean and updated. Staff was very friendly, efficient, and helpful. We will stay here again.

title: Shockingly poorly-run hotel is a stain on NYC
text:
This hotel may have been adequate in the past, but these days it is crumbling in all senses of the word. It is dirty, noisy, drafty, cold and uncomfortable, the wifi is a joke, while the staff (with the notable exception of the doormen) are beyond incompetent. A shockingly poorly-run establishment that's a stain on NYC.

I spent the best part of a week here, examined several different rooms and observed how management - in particular, head "manager" Randolph - deal with everyday issues that come up in any hotel. It's true what they say: the fish rots from the head down. When you have a disinterested and unmotivated person at the top, it sets the tone for everyone else.

The infrastructure: the hotel is in dire need of renovation, the rooms are dirty, the carpets are worn, the walls are stained, the wallpaper is peeling, various fixtures are broken (see photos). Much more problematic: the hotel has next to no sound or heat insulation. The windows are rickety, with 1.5 inch gaps in the frames. If you have a corner room where two of the four sides are covered in windows, it's like you're sleeping on the street - every noise, crash, honk, and scream from outside pierces straight into the room. The same with neighbouring rooms or the hallways: the walls are paper-thin and you involuntary become part of all of your neighbours' conversations. The elevators are noisy and can be heard from most rooms, even those that are not adjacent. The aircon system is old, rickety and super noisy. The pipes in the bathroom leak and make noises. Overall, it is definitely not a restful place - unless you are drunk and passed-out, you WILL be bothered by various noises 24/7.

The management: The hotel appears to be run on an unfortunate combination of: 1) cutting all possible corners to save money, and 2) a total lack of common sense. For example, management took the decision to turn off the heating on 13 April (even though the NYC Heat Law stipulates landlords must provide heating through 31 May). Lo and behold, on 17 April the temperatures plummeted to below 40 Fahrenheit at night, leaving the rooms absolutely freezing, with NO heating for any of the guests. The staff at the front desk simply shrugged it off and said there was nothing they could do, as the decision to switch off the heating was taken by management. They offered extra blankets (!) I've never been so cold in a hotel room anywhere around the world. After two days of repeated complaints, Randolph promised to provide a space heater... I had to chase him three times, each time he said it was on the way and then... he promptly disappeared. When I asked his colleagues, they said he had gone home for the day and they could not help. They said I was free to go a purchase a heater when the shops open on Monday morning (!), or I could again get extra blankets. In the end, facing a third night of sleeping in a freezing room, I decided to ask the doorman for assistance and on my suggestion he kindly found a hotel down the street to borrow a space heater from. Why his colleagues could not come up with a solution was beyond me. Nobody from management or the front-desk staff could be bothered to make the slightest effort to assist or think outside the box - the level of apathy was unreal. The only thing I heard over and over again during my stay were excuses or explanations for various problems; never was there a solution offered. Every single time was a case of "sorry, can't help you".

There are countless other examples of sheer incompetence that would not be tolerated at far less prominent hotels. It is almost impossible to get through on the phone to the front desk; the staff either let it ring or put you on hold indefinitely. When you go downstairs to see what's going on they are not busy, but simply chatting amongst themselves. Anything you request from Housekeeping takes absolute ages (it took them 1hr and 20mins and 3 follow-up calls to bring a simple towel that they had forgotten to put in the bathroom). 

As a \going-away bonus, the hotel also managed to lose my laundry. As per the hotel's service terms, any laundry submitted before 9am should be returned to the guest by 8pm on the same day. I submitted my items at 8am on the penultimate day of my stay, but they were never returned to the hotel (or the hotel lost them). Cue more calls to the front desk, with no-one picking up, then when I went downstairs in person and suggested to Randolph that it was not professional to promise guests to follow up on issues such as no heating or lost laundry and then disappear, he could not be more disinterested. He simply shrugged his shoulders and said he could not remember what he had promised to whom. We are still waiting for the lost items to be located.

It's true that customer service levels have dropped across the board in many industries over the past couple of years, and the hospitality sector is clearly struggling to find qualified staff. Fifty NYC takes this to a whole new level, however. An aged, creaky, noisy, dirty building run by apathetic, disinterested staff with no comprehension of customer service or common sense. 

Don't spoil your NYC and avoid this place like the plague!

title: Amazing Customer Service!
text: Hotel front desk was great. Answered all questions. Checked in and paid online. Went up to the front desk to grab the room key, easy. Doors were opened for us each time we left and came back. They all assisted with directions, held our baggage and even gave us tips about the city. Great location - away from the hustle and bustle but perfect distance to Time Square, subways and Gregory's coffee and Starbucks along with Ess-a-bagel. Amazing experience. The only downfall here was the toilets are so small! Overall, I would recommend. Rome Jefferson was our bellman - the sweetest person ever!

title: Fabulous Family Weekend
text: We had such a wonderful weekend! We had a few special requests that were handled without any struggle. The doorman, Romeo, was spot on with his recommendations and advice. Housekeeping sent an item left behind. This is truly a special place! Thank you all very much!

title: Nice Overnight Stay
text: Enjoyed my visit to Fifty Hotel & Suites in NYC. My husband and I traveled with our teenage son so the 2 Queen size beds were perfect for our family of 3. Staff was welcoming and friendly. We were about a 20 minute walk from the theater district. Nice little dinner a few doors down for breakfast. Not far from Alex Guarnaschelli’s Butter restaurant- definitely worth a visit.

title: Great stay
text:
The staff is so friendly and helpful and our stay was great. I would recommend to everyone. Clean and great service. 
We will be back for sure. Having the full kitchen in the junior suite was helpful. You could easily make a meal. We even had a toaster. Good location too.

title: Great experience
text: The hotel is well situated in midtown Manhattan. The hotel staff were very friendly and professional. The room was clean. We highly recommend this hotel. If you are spending some time in Mew York City, this hotel is definitely a great pick.

title: Great location, friendly staff
text: You can’t beat the location of this hotel.  It’s within walking distance of Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Central Park, 5th Avenue and more!  There are great eateries surrounding it.  Check out Empire burger!  The staff is so friendly, the rooms are spacious and the bedding is VERY comfortable.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Total Gem
text: Great location, service and amenities. We had a king studio suite, which was huge and also had its own balcony.  So great to be able to sit out in the terrace for coffee in the morning and champagne at sunset. Absolutely wonderful weekend - will definitely be back.

title: DCAT 2022
text: 1st business trip since Dec-2019 and Fifty NYC Suites provided a great experience. Kudos to Veronica for scrounging up extra chairs for our meetings. All staff were very friendly and accommodating. Great location, comfortable beds & pillows and a bottle of wine upon check-in was a surprising treat. I will be back next year. Thank you!

title: Another Year, another fantastic stay!
text: My group has been coming to this hotel annually for Saint Patrick's Day for over 25 years, even when it was known as the "Plaza Fifty".  Once again we had a fantastic stay.  Ryan McGhee and the staff took great care of us, as always.  We booked two suites on the 22nd Floor and they always exceed our expectations. Very roomy with wonderful views from the balconies. We are looking forward to next year's visit!  Our kudos to everyone at The Fifty!

title: Perfect for our family
text: We are a family of five and stayed in a junior suite. There was plenty of room, all accommodations needed, very reasonable rate and in a great location. Room was clean and just perfect. Would absolutely recommend to those planning to visit the area.

title: Great midtown Option
text: We actually live in Jersey City and stayed at Fifty Hotel the night before the NYC HALF Marathon so my family could be close to finish line. Great location next to Rock Center, Central Park, Bryant Park, you can really hit most of the great attractions within walking distance plus A TON of great restaurants within 1-5 blocks, from steakhouses to great Italian. And way léger rooms than anything I’ve seen in the “trendier” neighborhoods. This is truly a great option if you are looking for a 3-4 star hotel.

title: Great Stay
text: Great hotel very well located. Walking distance from 5th avenue, central park, rockefeller center. Hotel staff not very friendly, doorman was exceptional. Kitchen needs some renovation, but very good overall.

title: Review
text: Great staff, very helpful. Comfortable accommodations, would stay again. Centrally located for our event. Others stayed here too and all loved it. Valet parking in NYC is the best. Gotta have it, so get the “drive up” package.

title: College Visits
text:
The hotel was very nice and the doormen were helpful. 
Be aware, they charge you an daily hotel facilities fee that I was not expecting. 
When I questioned it, they said it was to cover the “free” $10 a day concessions they offered and the internet. Both I did Not need and then they weren’t actually “free” services, were they!

title: Excellent service
text:
Room was as described cleaned and well taken care off 
Amazing service at front desk. Disclosed all fees related to my stay upfront. Including parking my car fees. 
Will be making this my go to hotel when staying in city

title: Verbally Attacked by Employee
text:
I'm deaf and english is not my mother tongue.
I was smoking at the door and a man that looks like Rupaul came at me and told me something that I couldn't understand as he was wearing a face mask and I do lip reading.
I was confused and I said:
- "I'm sorry. I didn't understand you. What? do you work here?" because I didn't haven't seen him before.
- Yes, I do. Move out of here, move!" he yelled and screamed at me.
I told him:  "excuse me Sir, I'm deaf and a guest and you cannot speak me like that". He ignored me and went back in.
I went into the lobby and told him "Sir, I've stayed at 1 star and 5 star hotels I was never spoken this way, I didn't know it was not allowed to smoke by the door because I've smoked at the door for the last 7 nights and I was never told anything"
- I told you TWICE
"Sir, as I told you before, I'm deaf and this is an hotel, you have to consider the fact not everyone speaks english. I'd like to file a complain"
- OKAY. I DONT CARE.
Then he ignored me.
A group of ladies were witness and told me 'he is crazy'. I was left shaking.
So if you want to be verbally attacked, and pay lots for noisy a/c equipment, dirty floors and awful views, stay here.
Didn't receive any apologies, only a late check out. Big thing...

title: Exceeded our expectations
text:
Took our six year old to NYC for a Broadway show. We landed on this hotel due to proximity to broadway and surrounding attractions. The location was superb, about a 10 block walk to the New Amsterdam theater, but in a quieter part of Manhattan where you weren't overwhelmed and could escape the madness of Times Square.

As for the experience and the hospitality, Im not sure we could have asked for more. Romeo was our bellman, and the minute we arrived on property he made us feel at home. He was so genuine and never overwhelming, we honestly would have come back to this hotel again just because of how he treated us. The check in process was a breeze (you can do an expedited check in online which helps!). On top of that, Randall, who checked us in, saw how many bags we had and upgraded us to a suite with a kitchenette without us even asking.  The extra space ended up being a blessing because we were snowed in the next day and we didnt feel claustrophobic like some NYC hotels can tend to feel. They also honored our rate for the previous nights stay. 
This hotel didnt have a restaurant onsite, but its not like you need one in NYC. The gym was spacious and the foyer was welcoming and clean. 

We will be coming back every year to this hotel. Thank you for making us feel at home and making our daughters first trip to NYC a blast.

title: Great room, great location
text: Stayed here at the recommendation of a friend.  Absolutely great experience.  Front desk was quick, friendly and helpful.  Recommended a few places to eat in the area.  Our room was a suite on the 18th floor- beautiful views of the city and there was a balcony!   The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean and huge!   Stayed only one night, as we were going to a show, and the location was perfect.  Walking distance to the theatre district.  Check out was easy and the doorman was friend and offered directions and a taxi.  Would go back and would recommend.

title: Not a four star hotel by a long shot
text:
Very disappointing, first room had bed bugs, none of the rooms are very clean and thick dust everywhere. Spent nearly 5 hours checking the second room: all the linens, two mattresses, pillows, sofas. Really bad start to our trip.

Most certainly not a four star hotel. The only good point was the location.

title: Pretty good...could do a few things to be even better
text:
Our family of four had a long stay in a One-bedroom King Suite over the Christmas holidays. It's a modern hotel with a small, pleasant lobby, good lighting, three elevators, on a safe, well-lit, busy block. Overall it was a great stay, but there are a few things they could do to get to a solid 5-star rating.

I'll start with the PROS:
- Location, location, location. Seriously awesome spot with so many choices for easy, safe, and timely public transportation. The 4, 6, E, and M subway stops are a block or two away, and these are nicer stations that were safe and busy, even late at night. The uptown buses on 3rd and Madison Avenues, and the downtown buses on 2nd and Lexington Avenues, all run very regularly. We got the 7-day Unlimited passes from MTA (buy at a subway station), and used CityMapper or Apple Maps on our phones to figure out routes to our destinations and back. We got a ton of use from these! There is also a Walgreen's around the corner, which is always handy. Easy walk to Grand Central, Rockefeller, St. Patrick's, MoMA,  and the 5th Avenue shops.
- Friendly, responsive staff. The lobby personnel and housekeeping were awesome. They brought stuff up pretty quickly when we needed something (towels, TP, kitchen stuff, etc.). Everyone always greeted you with a genuine smile.
- Kitchenette. While we did not cook any major meals, it was great to have a small fridge, microwave, sink, 2-burner stove, and dishwasher in our room. We ordered groceries ahead of time and had them delivered via Instacart the day of our arrival. We always had breakfast in the room: cereal, toast, bagels (Ess-a-Bagel is across the street), instant oatmeal. There is a small toaster and coffee maker in the room.
- Big bathroom. When it's just myself and my husband sometimes the quaint, boutique hotels are a fun change. But those little sinks with almost no counter space would not work with us and our two teen girls. The tub/shower and toilet were fine, and the sink with a long counter plus open shelves beneath were great for all our toiletries.

Okay, now the CONS:
- I booked us a One-Bedroom Suite - King Bed. In the photos on their site it shows an L-shaped sectional sofa and a good-sized dining table with four dining chairs in a separate dining nook. Our room did not have all that. The sofa was just a regular sofa, not a sectional. The dining area was a tiny table about 2' in diameter with only two small "dining" chairs, and not in any kind of "nook," but against a small wall next to the kitchen. The bedroom and bathroom were great, but the living area was nowhere near what the photos showed. It was way more cramped and smaller than what we were expecting; it certainly did not feel like a 750 sq ft room. I would have complained but we got in 2 hours later than expected and it was late, and our groceries had already arrived. We just made do. But that was a major bummer and a disappointment.
- A little upgrade on the kitchenette is in order. Yes, there was a toaster and a coffeemaker, which was nice. BUT...a nicer toaster that could actually fit a bagel would be even better. The toaster was so old and small, with burned edges all around. The coffeemaker was sufficient, but if Affinia would upgrade it to at least a Keurig, it would work and taste a lot better. When we got in there was one glass, two mugs, and a bunch of spoons. We had to ask for more drink ware, forks, and knives (which they did bring quickly). The dishwasher's bottom rack was also completely off the rails, literally. To pull it in or out you had to lift it and put it on the door; it no longer slid on the rails properly. 

Would we stay there again? Probably, next time we go again as a family. Our kids love NYC and now that they're older it's so easy to bring them and enjoy more. Next time, though, when booking this same room I will definitely clarify room size and amenities. Would love it, though, if they spruced up some of the kitchen issues I mentioned.

title: NYE
text: We stayed NYE and I was pleasantly surprised. I had some reservations because it was cheaper than some of the other places in the area. It's located in a great location. Everything is a short walk or quick ride. The hotel itself is nice looking not bad by any means. We had a decent view. The staff was very helpful except one person and we only seen her once. She seemed like she didn't want to be bothered. The manager and the daytime bellhop were the most helpful. They had many suggestions and helpful tips. Highly suggest this hotel, the price, location and the hotel overall are a great combo. We travel a lot and I have never reviewed a hotel so that alone says a lot

title: Family Visit to NYC
text: The hotel is very nice and we were greeted by doormen on arrival.  We had a choice of red or white wine with our package but were told they were out of red.  Check in was easy as I had already pre-paid.  Our room was clean and much larger than expected.  We had a nice view down 3rd Avenue and very large windows.   The coffee was not very good so I would recommend bringing your own or going to a cafe.   Checkout was easy and they held our bags for the day without a fee.  The doorman arranged black SUV service to the airport for $55.  Overall I would highly recommend this hotel and probably stay there again.  It is close enough to walk to local landmarks as well as the subway for further destinations.

title: Dave in Orlando
text:
Couldn’t believe how nice and quaint the hotel was. Unbelievable location. 1 block from Subways. Walked to Rock center, time square and the park all in 15-20 mins. Great shopping All the way. Insane upscale hamburger joint just out the front door. 24hr pizza shop 1 block away. 
 The room was just right. Beds very comfortable and the bathroom was very nice. The biggest plus was the price. Impossible to get the boutique feel and quality for these rates anywhere in Manhattan. The place to stay with a family because all you there is sleep and Poop. 
Thanks for accommodations 
 Dave in Orlando

title: Comfortable, great location
text:
Like this brand in NYC.  The room was clean.  There was a cleaning service during our stay of 2 nights, which was a pleasant surprise. Subway just around the corner, walk to the Rock, food, shopping.
Value good for NYC at this time of year.  We will be back.Merry Christmas 🎄

title: Four sisters
text: Four sisters stayed in a Jr Suite and it was perfect! 2 queen beds, couch , chairs and the kitchenette in a separate room. Very spacious and comfy for visiting and down time- we’ll be back for sure! The staff was friendly, great location to restaurants, grocery store, theaters, Bryant Park, Times Square, and the subway!

title: Perfect NYC hotel for families
text: I used to live in NYC and returned to visit w my family. We recently stayed at fifty suites Affinia hotel with 6 of us. The hotel is perfectly located to easily to walk to all of the major NYC Christmas activities in midtown and subway access. If you are traveling as a family this place is great . We had the two terrace adjoining suites - each had their own kitchenette and living rooms. The staff was so kind, Joan was amazing and cleaned our rooms daily. She was so lovely. As was Sammie , one of the doormen. There was plenty of space, even if we had one suite . The rates are ideal. I would recommend this hotel to any small group or family looking for space in apartment type accommodations. The staff is so attentive and welcoming. Thank you for a wonderful stay and helping us make memories !

title: Roomy/Centrally located
text:
The hotel is very neat and clean. The rooms are spacious which is unusual for a boutique hotel in NYC!  The elevators (3) work well.  We never really had to wait.  Water was hot!   It is very conveniently located near the theater district, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, The Rockettes etc etc etc. The only problem I had was at night when I tried to reach the front desk....no one answered.  One night they called me back later...the 2nd. night no one answered and no one called me back. 
The staff (especially the doormen) are very friendly and helpful.  I wasn't happy with the hotel facilities fee of $39.00 per night which is never mentioned when you book.  We didn't need to use the laundry nor did we use the gym.  They no longer have a  happy hour due to Covid.  Essentially, you can use part of the fee ($10.00) to purchase water or a snack....All in all...the stay was great!

title: Nice stay but poor service
text:
We were pleased with the room and location of our hotel. Staff upon arrival at our hotel seem pleasant. We had to leave a deposit of $150 dollars as a reservation on our room (standard practise at hotels). They advised me that my card did not work, so they used my husbands. Upon looking a couple of days later I noticed I had a pending charge from the hotel of £625.81! I was a bit confused as did not know what that amount was for? I told reception who believed it was the amount for the room. I advised this was already pre paid for through Virgin holidays. He said not to worry I will get this removed asap. So we went on our way. It wasn’t until I came home to the UK that I noticed that the whole amount had been charged to my card! I have contacted Virgin and Affinity directly and to date I still not have received this amount back? I tried to call the hotel directly we got cut off. But nobody tried to call me back! Absolutely appalling! I am taking this a lot further with Virgin and have put in a complaint! 
We were also fobbed off by reception with regards to hot water in our room. I asked on Day 1 if someone could come and take a look at our hot water. I asked again on Day 2, 3 and 4. We checked out on Day 5 and still had no hot water. It is such a shame to leave a bad review as the hotel was ok but the service was just appalling.

title: Love NYC
text: This is a great hotel. We will definitely return on our next visit. Room was clean, roomy and comfortable. The kitchenette was perfect for breakfast, in room dining if you chose. We loved the vibe - great atmosphere that you felt as soon as you entered the classy lobby. Extremely friendly, interesting staff who were as nice to each other as they were to us. Very much appreciated how the staff went out of their way to get you a cab in a most timely fashion. When one early evening we returned to a room not cleaned, it was remedied within five minutes, followed by a manager's call offering to reduce the bill by a not insubstantial amount. Our five night stay was fantastic. We are already planning our next visit and will look nowhere else.

title: Great hotel
text: Great courteous staff. In a room for 3 of us which is tight but ok. Rooms are clean. Could do with a mirror at desk rather than a picture. Being 3 women it’s easier for make up etc. Bathroom is very compact but fine. Centrally located. Nice & quiet. We leave here on 23rd November. Thanks so far to the great staff!

title: A good location
text:
The location is close to Times Square and the subway. The area was safe. The first two nights we did not get any sleep due to construction, but after that it was just loud due to city life, people honking and sirens. I had to change my reservation before arriving and the guy who answered the phone was so helpful. 
Pros: The cleaning staff were wonderful and the room and hotel was always clean. The doormen were really nice. Restaurants were next door-LaLuncheonette was great. 
Cons: The hallways were small and not very bright, the bathroom floor had cheap laminate flooring that was warped. There was no continental breakfast and the “store” area was minimal. 
Overall it was a god hotel.

title: Outstanding Value
text: My first trip to NYC and I’m not going to lie I was extremely intimidated. One of the many concerns of course was lodging and location. The Fifty is in the heart of NYC, and came recommended from Sloan Kettering where we would be frequently walking 20-30 minutes. The entire Hotel was exceptional, clean, and very well maintained. Every member of the staff was attentive and helpful, downright friendly. Hip lobby and second floor business center. The room accommodations were excellent, clean, and comfortable. Maid service was excellent, as was front desk and guest services. One tip - if you like to keep your windows open at night, I would recommend the 10th floor or above. If you are used to vibrant city life in a city that never sleeps, you may not notice it - especially with the windows closed. We were on the 14th floor and it was great. Highly recommend. We will definitely stay there again. Great value for the excellent location. We used the laundry service - pricey - but a same day turnaround and perfectly laundered.

title: Great Experience
text:
All around great experience. I stayed here while my family member was in the hospital, booking directly through Sloan Kettering. The staff was extremely accommodating and helpful. I extended the stay multiple times due to my brothers recovery status, then wound up checking out early, with no issues at all.  They made it so easy and did not make me move rooms mid stay. Most importantly I felt safe (as a female alone), and it was extremely clean.  
Also, A+ coffee right in hotel room

title: Cannot Wait to Return!
text:
Our family visited for our annual holiday night in the city, before covid. We had a great experience, loved the holiday decor and the art, and friendly staff! 
We are returning this December and cannot wait! 
Is the The Club Room / Den still functioning? Wine?

title: Nice
text: I have no complaints! Staff was super friendly! Very accommodating and fun to have conversations with. Felt safe the whole time there. Room was clean and friendly. Sheets were a little itchy and room noisy but that’s very common in nyc. Next time I’ll just ask for a higher up room!

title: Nice stay at the Fifty
text: We had a positive experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The bed and the pillows were extremely comfortable and the room was spacious. We liked the location. I did not give 5 stars because our view was a brick wall of the building next door and bathroom was small with a sliding barn door that opened right into the room. I would stay there again.

title: Excellent Value in Midtown Manhattan
text:
Very nice, large room. Excellent location. Friendly staff. Excellent value. 
Two areas which could be improved. First, the water pressure in shower was quite weak. Second, the requirement of a hold of $100 per day for “incidentals” is excessive, especially in the case of prepayment for the room. 
Look forward to staying here again!

title: Stay in the Dream Suite
text: OMG…stay in the DREAM suite for one of the coolest hotel room experiences! The Dream suite was created as a collaboration with a couple of NYC artists. It is colorful and uplifting with inspirational quotes. It is spacious with a kitchen, living room, and large balcony. It has incredible views of the city and the beds are comfy as well! It also has a lighting ring and great back drop for videos, Instagram, etc. it’s basically an influencers dream!

title: 50 out of a 100
text:
The title says it all.  I heard that from my granddaughter on our birthday trip to NYC with our two teenaged granddaughters.  
However, first the good: Romeo and Lenny, both made the arrival to the hotel promising.  They were friendly and welcoming.  Also the Sunday front desk manager went above and beyond to help us retrieve some left behind Airpods.  
Now, the not so good: the front desk manager on our arrival on Saturday.  I had actually spoken with her the day before and requested a room facing the street on a higher floor.  She said she would make note of my request.  I booked a Junior Suite for the size of the room and the photos that travelers had posted on the internet.  I had also sent the same request via the website, but never got a response.
Upon arrival I again mentioned my request for the front facing suite on a higher floor.  She said she remembered the call and checked to see if our room was ready.  She called housekeeping and they were just getting ready to clean it.  We were called back in an hour to check in.  We were given a room on the 10th floor out of 22.  OK, so this time it was "the bottom of the top".  When we got out of the elevator, the room was right next to the elevator.  Never a promising sign.  We entered and noticed first, it was a good size.  Second we noticed that it was very dark and upon opening the shades we had a great view of what could only be called a large airshaft.  So, as it was a special occasion trip and I had talked up the hotel to my granddaughters, I said I would call the manger and see if we could get a better location. However the room phone was not working, it was dead.  So instead I went down to the front desk to speak with the manager.  She would not budge.  She said she remembered speaking with me but there was nothing that she could do about it.  She knew right from the start that for whatever reason that I was going to get the exact opposite of what I had very politely requested beginning a month out from our reservation.  
There are way too many  hotels in NYC to choose from.  While several of the hotel staff were great, the Saturday, Oct. 2, 2021 manager was not.  I won't mention her name, she knows who she is.  The room overall was very average and needed updating.

title: Took Daughter and friend to NYC for her birthday celebration
text: It was a very nice stay. The room was clean, the hotel staff were nice and friendly. The bathroom light went out while we were getting ready. They were prompt to respond and fix it. Neighborhood is convenient to walk to everything. We walked 10-15 min to Grand Central to catch the subway. We walked to Central Park. It was a great trip.

title: Perfect Hotel in NYC
text: Perfect Stay-personnel we’re very accommodating and friendly.  Room immaculate and cool on a hot day.  Whole place was clean and bright. Valet quick and personable. Lots of fabulous restaurants and eateries local to the hotel. Relatively quiet for being just off 2nd Ave.

title: Excellent choice. I will go back.
text: Clean, excellent location and friendly staff. Upper east side with plenty of surrounding restaurants and few steps from subway station. Room is spacious and quite. Bathroom somewhat narrow, could have been more larger. Frig and coffee maker included.

title: Good location. Decent average hotel room, could be cleaner, rugs could use a DEEP cleaning  !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
text:
Good location. 
Room was decent, good size for my family of four. A/C sucked. Rug could use a GOOD cleaning.  Checked in early on my phone and still had to provide the same information to obtain room key. Valet parking was nice, with great service!

title: Hotel to stay
text:
Yes, I came here to celebrate my friend's birthday. There was some issues in starting which I shared to floor manager. Afterwards I enjoyed my stay. Helpful staff and services like home.
If you're looking for hotel to stay around here and it's one of nice property to stay.

title: Fantastic Stay - Fantastic People
text: We were in the city for 6 nights to visit family. We had booked a 1 BR suite and it met all our expectations. We were able to make coffee in the am. My wife was able to sleep in and I could do some work. The front desk was extremely helpful. Rome at the front door was a great help and answered all our questions. We asked about ice, and he had it sent up to the room. Housekeeping staff were helpful as a couple of days we headed out late and we just asked for a couple extra towels.

title: Not bad of a Stay :)
text: Me and my fiancee booked a queen size bed room for 2 nights over the labor day weekend, and because of the tornado and storm happened prior, they only had a double bed room available which is fine. The lobby front desk service was very helpful and nice. The lobby is clean, room was clean expect our shower drain... and the shower knob was lose, and the desk was not dusted, but other than that everything was pretty good!

title: Clean & Friendly
text: Another great stay. Housekeeping on point as always, fast, clean, efficient. Staff always happy and helpful, our go to in the City, always recommended to family and friends as a wonderfully and centrally located to make get in, out and about the City really easy.

title: TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE - ROOM NOT READY BY CHECK IN
text:
I booked TWO junior suites for EIGHT GIRLS. We arrived @ the hotel @ 10am knowing early check-in was based on availability; but @ 330pm, THIRTY MINUTES past check in, ONE ROOM was STILL NOT AVAILABLE. The 2nd room was still “being cleaned” & was expected to be done ‘soon.’ After 10 minutes, no one called w/an UPDATE that it STILL wasn’t ready. Over AN HOUR later, when EIGHT girls w/ OVER TEN LUGGAGES had to use ONE BATHROOM to get ready for dinner (w/TWO BREASTFEEDING women) - I found out @ the front desk our 2nd room wasn’t ready because of a ‘screw on a headboard’. And since we were rushing for dinner, they could only get ONE room key ready instead of 4 - making thatTHE ONE room key we couldn’t loose.

The next day, I explained my dismay to the manager & w/a simple apology, he comped two $5 water bottles & some Seagrams. No other accommodations or concessions to make up for their disappointing & severely inconvenient introduction. 

On our last day, I asked for late check-out & was told “the best we could do is 1pm”; just 1hour additional. I expected some consideration to our experience of NOT HAVING an ENTIRE ROOM available until more than half the reserved day, but instead, on top of this - they couldn’t print my receipt or even email me a copy. I had to call back a few hours later to demand an email be re-sent.

The only good thing was the attentiveness of their employee, Rome. He went above & beyond!! We made sure we compensated him heftily every day of our stay.

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: We stayed at the fifty NYC Hotel for four nights, the staff were amazing, they took care of all of our needs, were  very pleasant, very helpful great to see every morning great to see every night they made our trip to New York City better than we could have imagined.

title: Nice room, perfect stay for the most part
text: Stayed here with my two young adult sons. No complaints, the first night was noisy outside, lots of construction and traffic. However, we didn't notice the noise as much the rest of the stay. The location was worth a little noise. Close to everything, very close to the Subway station. Friendly staff. Nice kitchenette which helped keep costs down.

title: Fifty Hotel review
text:
The hotel was very clean, room was so nice but my only complaint was the air conditioning didn’t get cool enough. However, maintenance came up to the room twice to try to fix it. My suggestion is to move the TV somewhere else so it doesn’t block the vents and make sure the vent in bathroom works .
All the staff members were the nicest, most polite and accommodating people!! Our favorite was Romeo and the other doormen  who worked with him!! They went above & beyond to be kind and helpful!
We will be back in the fall for sure!!!!

title: Prime Location, Awful View.
text:
We spent one night at the Fifty Hotel & Suites while  visiting family in New York City. Upon arriving to the location the valet appeared to be backed with multiple cars double parked in the street. The bell man informed us valet was running behind and we could leave our keys and they'd get to the car in about 20 minutes. Since we were concerned about being double parked we ended up driving 1 block over to a  garage as we didn't want to risk getting a ticket, the garage saved us $8. 
After finally returning to hotel we found you needed a room key to enter the hotel ( which we appreciated later that night when there was lots of unruley people roaming the area).
Upon check in we were greeted with a modern lobby with nice art and a seating area. Check in was seamless as the reservation was  prepayed via Expedia $105. PreCovid the hotel offered a nightly guest reception that includeed wine and treats, since this was not happening due to social distancing they offered a $10 credit towards their pantry stocked with beer, wine & snacks.
We were assigned room 1501 which was a standard king bedroom. The room had ample space which is rare in NYC hotels as well as plenty of outlets. 
With that said we did have a few issues during our stay. Be aware our room views were of dingy buildings. More importantly our thermostat didn't function properly on a warm April day the cooling function wouldn't seem to work which made our room uncomfortable.  In addition, the fan in the bathroom was not working so after taking a shower the ceiling was left with condensation which resulted in mold on the ceiling. 
We pointed out these issues to the manager and they were apologetic and refunded our 'resort fee' saying they'd resolve the problem before the next guest arrived. 
Overall it was an average stay. The hotel has potential to be great with it's prime location, spacious rooms and a reasonably competitive rate ( minus the 45 dollar resort fee which is absurd).  If your staying in the future be sure to ask about maybe getting a room with a better view.  For video of our stay find us on YouTube at jenichael's journey.

title: Nice stay, have appropriate expectations
text:
We were 2 adults and 2 young kids and reserved the Studio with kitchen. Overall we had no major problems. The booking was correct and room ready, location was very convenient and surrounded by lots to do, eat and see. Staff was friendly and helpful. Mini-kitchen was nice to have and I felt the price was very reasonable for the area. A few negatives were the hotel is quite well-aged and it shows, things are a bit worn, it was ‘surface clean’ but not really clean, carpet was visibly dirty, dust bunnies under…everything etc., hot water and pressure were good but tub was very slow to drain and the toilet only flushed all the way half the time which was weird. I called for maintenance to check the toilet and specifically said my kid was sick with a mystery illness so I’d recommend wearing a mask (middle of this Delta wave) and he showed up without a mask, I didn’t particularly care but it seemed a little careless to me. 

As to some reviewers complaints about noise, it’s in the middle of the city. It’s noisy, no doubt. They decided to resurface the damn street our first night there, excavator, dump trucks at 2am. It sucked but I wanted to be in the city so that’s what I get. The internal noise was also pretty loud, neighbors talking in the hall and whatnot but again, it’s a hotel, you’re not getting a soundproof room, sorry.

Overall, I wouldn’t hesitate to stay again. Next time I’d spring for the one bedroom and if I knew which side of the building, I’d even pay for the balcony. The staff did a great job and we appreciated it!

title: Needed space
text: We carefully viewed rooms in Manhattan before our visit, this hotel gave us an affordable room & the space to have 2 accommodate 2 adults & 2 children comfortably. Almost everything is you would like to visit is walking distance, within a 2 mile radius.

title: BEWARE OF PHONE CHARGES!!!
text:
Nice place in very good location. Nice rooms. Clean. And would have qualified with 4 stars...but

BUT ( yes, big BUT) they charged usd 240 for three 15 minute calls to New Jersey.  I feel  very very anoyed with that charge. That's not expensive, its stealing.

title: The Best Midtown Hotel!
text: Highly recommend this hotel!  The rooms are large and the beds are awesome. Great nearby restaurants and convenient to everything .   Wonderful location and the staff will take very good care of you!   I will be back many times!

title: Excellent find!
text:
Traveling with 2 adults and 3 children most hotels only allowed for 2 separate rooms and couldn’t guarantee adjoining rooms, which wouldn’t suffice for our too young kids. We got this room with 2 queen beds and a sofa sleeper expecting tight quarters. To our surprise the room was incredibly spacious, well functioning kitchenette to keep costs low for breakfast, comfortable mattresses and linens, great housekeeping, reception and door staff. A very welcome and pleasant surprise. 

Briefly met another family in the elevator who felt the same way. A gem in NYC. 

Highly recommend.

title: Fifty Hotel New York City
text:
The hotel gave excellent service 
Well located, good and clean room 
Very friendly staff 
Will definitely stay there again 
The room furniture was very comfortable 
The Fifty does not have restaurants but there are good options nearby

title: Great location, very clean
text: Very clean hotel and friendly staff. The room was spacious and comfortable. I had zero view - looked at a wall. It was very quiet - no noise in the hallways and only minimal street noise (i.e., sirens). Super easy location to get around - just a few blocks from several subway stops. Great bagel place across the street. Starbucks a block away. Easy walking distance to St. Patrick's Cathedral, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, and Grand Central Station.

title: A wonderful stay at Fifty Hotel and Suites
text:
My wife and I stayed at this hotel with our son that required outpatient surgery at NYU Medical Center. 

The staff were great during the duration of our stay. We booked two rooms. Our son’s room was fantastic. We booked a suite with a kitchenette. That was great to have. We took full advantage of it. I did not give this hotel 5 stars because our suite was a little tired - needed some updates.

title: Booking cancelled - still got charged!
text:
Booked through booking.com to stay here in June. Because of Covid restrictions cancelled booking well within free cancellation period. To my horror, the hotel put two charges on my credit card (used to auth booking) total over £300.
It’s been a nightmare trying to sort out. No response from hotel, booking.com got one of the charges removed but one still remains. Very disappointing. Mistakes happen but swift resolution and an apology go far, have had neither. 
Suffice to say, won’t be staying here when we re book our trip later in the year.

title: Excellent Stay
text: Our room was surprisingly large especially for a Manhattan hotel. It fit our family of six comfortably. We booked the junior suite with a terrace. My husband enjoyed sitting outside in the morning, drinking his coffee. I even had enough room to lay out my yoga mat and practice yoga everyday (and with the stress of traveling with 4 kids, I needed it). The gym was adequate for a quick work out. They have a lounge on the second floor where I was able to take a 30-minute business call with no interruptions. Our room was clean. The small kitchen and refrigerator allowed us to buy basic food (milk), fruits, bottled water etc. We had Amazon fresh delivery twice during our stay. Location is in midtown so expect a lot of activity during the weekday. Restaurants and shopping is everywhere. Service was always friendly. The basic laundry room also allowed us to travel light since I was able to do laundry for our 10-day trip. We will definitely stay again.

title: Great views, spacious rooms, friendly staff
text: We recently spent 3+ weeks at The Fifty Hotel and it was a great experience. The suites are spacious and perfect for a long term stay - even with two people who work from home. The balcony was the perfect place to relax, have dinner, and enjoy the stunning views. The thing that was most impressive was how kind everyone is. Each staff member is friendly, hard working, loves their job, and makes you feel welcome and at home. That is hospitality at its best. We cannot wait to return.

title: Just a bad place
text: Stayed here a few years ago. Decided to book a one bedroom suite for two weeks. Spent my first night and I am already looking for another place. Noises are everywhere. From a dog barking next door to a party right above us! You cannot stay quiet in your room. Furniture and carpets are old and dirty. I was expecting much more from a $7,000 bill! Just avoid it. It is not worth the price.

title: Hotel as become very rundown
text: Had to change rooms because of pot smelling in allway. Still smelled pot smoking on new floor. Furniture was worn and dirty. Window in bedroom had extenstive water damage. We always stayed here  every year when needing a midtown address. No more!

title: Great week!
text: Traveling for the first time during Covid, I expected some blips because it is what it is. First time back to NYC and originally was supposed to quarantine for 4 days then right before travel, new regulation-Have vaccine, get out of quarantine free card!!  Booked this hotel originally due to quarantine because it had a kitchen plus having family on the East Side, this hotel was convenient to their place.  Quick check in, friendly doorman and front desk.  Went up to room and unfortunately, it wasn't cleaned.  Back to front desk and explained the situation.  Apologies and could we give them about an hour to rectify the situation. Having lived in NYC, we went out and ate...great food all around the hotel.  Returned to the hotel and was given a different room. BOY!!! Did we get a HUGE different room!  We had originally booked a 1 bedroom suite and what we were given in exchange was a one bedroom suite with a terrace.  If this was an apartment, I would've bought it because it was so spacious.   The housekeeping during the week was spotty maybe every other day. That was ok...didn't need new sheets everyday so we just asked for clean bath towels and they were delivered quickly. Will be traveling again the end of summer and will be staying here.  Hopefully the Covid kinks will be worked out and can upgrade to Excellent my review.

title: Wonderful emergency shelter
text:
We needed a hotel when our apartment lost power. This was a great option. The hotel was comfortable and spacious.  Great bed. Great amenities. And next door was a nice restaurant with tasty takeout. The staff was friendly 

They saved us. And we would definitely recommend it to our visiting friends

title: Ruined Valentine's Day Experience!
text:
My room wasn't clean, to the point that my fiancee purchased Clorox wipe to clean all surfaces. On day one of our stay, we requested for assistance; cause our lamp/outlet near the bed didnt work and no one came. Upon our 2nd request, the Gentleman moved the fixture to fix the outlet, and a old kids toothbrush poped up. ( at this point my Valentine's day was ruined)

Throughout our entire stay, the guests services ran out of water on several occasions; which made us uber eat water to our room. 

Overall, i was extremely disappointed with my stay.

title: If.a good nights sleep is what you want....go elsewhere
text:
Was in town for the holidays to visit my son 
Stayed at the fifty hotel for a month in 2020.
For the first 2 weeks, most everything was good
But then in the last 2 weeks they  put guests in the room across the hall from me
(the hotel was less than half full,)
You can hear a penny drop...the walls are so THIN.
The first group had 4 in the room, and visitors until 5:30am
I was dressed at 4:30 am to tell the staff member on duty about it.
He said he would try to change their room the next day
Did absolutely NOTHING>
This kept on happening.
What's worse is the General Manager Joe Rauer also did NOTHING
He had given me his card with his cell number.
I had complained to him earlier in the week about the noise.
After not sleeping the entire night, I I text him to let him know it was happening again.
I never heard back from him...and even days later when I saw him in the lobby her never said a word to me.
That' unconscienable in my book.
The sign of a poorly run place!
After all, I'm paying the Hotel to sleep there!!!! 
I read another review of this place that spoke to the noise factor and how NO ONE did anything.
The hotel is situated on 3rd avenue and you can hear all the noise from the street ALL the time.
It looks nice, but the flaws are worth noting before you accept a room key.
One good spot is the doormen are as good as it gets.
Too bad management doesn't follow their lead.

title: A Gem in Midtown!
text: I stayed at the Fifty by Affinia and I was blown away! The room was so clean and homey with a terrace overlooking Third Ave. It is in a great location and the staff is excellent! Ruth, Ryan, and the GM Joe were so accommodating and made me feel at home. It was a real 5-star experience and I will be recommending the Fifty to my network!

title: Quiet stay during pandemic
text:
Our party of three arrived midafternoon for a 4-night stay on a Thursday. The hotel front doors were accessible with your room key to minimize people entering the building – but they did have the doorman to open the door for you as well.  We were greeted by Joe and he checked us in quickly.  The check-in setup provided the social distancing required, but still provided the opportunity to connect with staff.  We were given a quick rundown of local area points of interest – such as a local supermarket, local Starbucks, etc.  Even though we are very familiar with the area, this information was great to have as not everything was open during our stay.  They had a UV sanitizer on the table for use – which I thought was a great idea. We were lucky enough to get an upgrade to a suite on the 18th floor – 1801.  Our room faced the back of the building, but we were very happy in this suite.  The living room, kitchen and small balcony were all extras that we enjoyed – we loved having the extra TV so we didn’t have to argue about what we were going to watch.
