Our room was nice and cool which made for excellent sleeping conditions.  The room had plenty of closets – two in the bedroom, one in the hallway and one in the living room.  Hand sanitizer machines were right by the elevator and we used them every time we got on and off the elevator. The one on the 18th floor smelled very nice.  This is our second stay here and we just found out there is an ice machine in the building (4th floor!) and we used it every day!  

Everyone was so nice and made us feel super comfortable while staying here.  

Housekeeping service was provided daily which was very nice as some hotels have not been offering it.     

My daughter did say that Saturday night sounded like there was a party in one of the nearby rooms as she heard the door banging shut all night long. When we passed the room early in the morning, it still sounded like the guests were having tons of fun in there.

title: Well situated, clean and spacious
text: This review is for the Denihan Hospitality Group of which the Affinia Fifty NYC is part.  We have been going to NYC for the past 10+ years and have always stayed in a Denihan Group hotel.  Firstly, at the Affinia Dumont sadly when that closed transferring to Shelborne and now at the Affinia Fifty.  The hotels are very conveniently situated, there clean and spacious.  Recently we had to cancel our up and coming stay due to the coronavirus, and the Affinia Fifty (General Manager Mr Joseph Rauer) refunded us in full within a couple of days, no questions asked.  I cannot recommend this hotel and company highly enough

title: Weekend get away
text:
I was so pleased with our stay. We live just outside the city and needed a date night out for a special occasion! The staff was excellent and very accommodating. We got a nice upgrade & bottle of wine for our special night! The hotel was so clean, and made so many precautions to be Covid safe. 
The room was amazing super clean with a great view in a great location. We would certainly stay here again!!!

title: Excellent staff!
text:
We stayed 2 nights because I was having surgery, so it wasn’t quite our usual vacation. We chose the hotel because of proximity to HSS, and reviews. 
It exceeded our expectations. This was not a luxury hotel, but it was perfect for our needs. The room was enormous, especially by NYC standards, with a king bed ( very comfortable), a sofa, a large dining area. It had a full (NY), kitchen, recently updated with gas range, stainless refrigerator. The carpet was showing it’s age but that was the only issue. 

The reason I give it 5 stars was the exceptional staff: They were friendly, helpful beyond belief! They actually came around the block with a wheelchair and helped me back to the hotel! Housekeeping staff was lovely, promptly providing extra pillows and ice. 

They carefully followed Covid 19 protocols, so no worries there. 

Our room faced street on a lower floor, so it was noisy one night- there was construction-, but was fine the next night. We live out in the country and are used to absolute silence, but we’re fine. 
We plan to return, this time when the Pandemic is under control and we can take full advantage of the location and enjoy the city!

title: Amazing Staff & Excellent Hotel
text:
We found ourselves traveling to New York City at the last minute and had pretty specific requirements on what we needed for a hotel.  I spent the better part of 3 days researching every/any hotel in the city and really didn't find anything that ticked all the boxes.  Either a few things were missing, or the price wasn't right.  Then I came across Fifty Hotel & Suites and was shocked that it had everything we wanted.  The hotel was updated, spacious rooms, balcony outside, great location, and the price was perfect.  We booked the hotel and crossed our fingers that it would match our expectations.

When we arrived, we were greeted by the incredibly friendly and welcoming door man, and the very helpful front desk worker.  We were incredibly happy with everything during our stay.  A friend of ours who stopped by to visit (and lives a few blocks away) was astonished at the size of our room.  It really was massive for a hotel in Manhattan.  

We really loved how the door man remembered all of our names each time we entered or left the building. The employees always ask what they can do for YOU, which is something you don't really see in many places these days.

I highly recommend Fifty to anyone traveling to New York City, and we will absolutely be back again in the future.

title: My Home for 2 Months
text: I would like to give the staff a very big shout out . Romeo , Ruth , Veronica , & Francis ! These guys know the definition of customer service . This was my home for the entire month of May && June due to the pandemic . I can truly say they all made me feel at home . Anything that I asked for or needed I recieved with no issue . I was actually upset when it was time to leave cause I was comfortable . Any issues that I had they were more than happy to solve or find a solution . Amazing staff ! The cleanliness was great . && the vicinity of the hotel was great as well . I have plans to come back one day, come and revisit my old home 🥰🥰❤❤❤❤ - Zee

title: Great!
text: Romeo is an excellent employee. Super attentive knowledgeable and friendly. The hotel is immaculate. Very clean and is operating very well under New York  and CDC Guidleness for Corona Virus safety. Our suite was with Terrace and Riverview view. Spacious and comfortable just the way we like it. Would definitely book here again soon. Thank You Fifty Hotel it's been an incredible stay.

title: Get out of Your Apartment and Relax!
text:
I absolutely love this hotel in Manhattan, it was an amazing stay. Not just the location but the staff are fabulous during this time - Romeo and Veronica - I realized how wonderful it is, to have a getaway in New York City. A home away from home! I cannot thank them enough for a lovely stay and room.  I think I slept on the couch next to the air conditioning in front of the TV, with several good bottles of wine. 
Thank you Fifty and thank you Affinia for a lovely time...it's a wonderful thing to get away as a person dealing with heat, protesters and maybe...shedding senior cats...? 
I will definitely be back, if that's okay with you!

title: great
text:
I had an amazing time there. I stayed for the weekend and the service was incredible. no issues with either my room or the service. I needed some extra stuff and i asked and got it in my room 5 minutes later.
You should go if you want to be close to everything.

title: Same poor response from Manager to honest reviews
text: This hotel is shocking and especially if you book via a website and not direct.  Make sure you have the paper work that you have paid in hard copy as they may take the payment again like they did with us AFTER we had checked out, thankfully we had paid with credit card and we had to get the bank involved. and we did get a refund. They take your card details at check in so they are on file so beware!  Rude staff, dirty rooms too and that’s honest not just slating them due to them taking unauthorised money.  I also believe they prefer US visitors. I emailed the manager and never got a response either.

title: FIFTY Hotel NYC
text: Great rooms,great hotel....the staff is just delightful to deal with. Amidst  the COVID crisis, they continue to work diligently to accommodate travelers. They always made me feel like a home away from home while there. The front desk staff and doormen are absolutely the best!

title: AH
text: Absolutely the worst experience in my life. The checkin was pleasant and staff helpful but the night shift was a nightmare rude and unprofessional. Weed smell in the hallways (rooms are none Smoking) but they want to make an issue of my parked car on the street not hotel property at midnight. Midnight want to start banging on my door continued after I answered it already and I was getting dressed bc who moves a car in their underwater. Just super rude and professional. If you do t want your guests parking on front of your hotel maybe give them resources with alternatives when they check in not bang on the door at midnight and yell like the place is on fire and scold me like some child. Also it’s pandemic so put a mask on.

title: FIFTY NYC review
text:
Clean room, decent price.  Doorman (Sammy) was great!  Extremely helpful and a
generally pleasant man. We were highly impressed. Nice part of Manhattan . Hotel staff did their best during Covid time. They saw that valet parking was taken care of
as promised.

title: Ótimo custo-benefício
text: Num primeiro momento pensei em desistir da reserva, pois a achei a entrada do hotel e a recepção  bem confusos. Os recepcionistas tiveram dificuldade em encontrar minha reserva e, apesar de eu ter pedido e eles terem confirmado, via e-mail, com o check in antecipado, na hora não me concederam. Porém , no final do dia qdo finalmente liberaram nossa reserva, gostei da acomodação. Lençóis limpos e macios, quartos espaçosos e troca de toalhas ao longo do dia. O serviço de camareiras é muito bom, mas penso que podiam colocar recepcionistas mais atentos. Apesar da localização excelente e preço convidativo, não sei se pretendo voltar.

title: Stay
text: The hotel is very nice. Staff are a delight. However when calling to confirm my reservation i was hung up on as well as the time before my partner was hung up on and his phone calls were ignored after. My room was wondering with a very pleasant view, i just wish the thermostat went higher than 78, i was a bit cold. Overall though ive been back to this  hotel More than 3 times and don’t regret it! Prices are convenient and rooms are wonderful! Pets are also allowed! A steal in my books

title: COVID Champs!
text: The staff was wonderful: pleasant, kind, engaging, and respectful of our distancing and mask requirements. Stayed here for a month and it was always nice to be greeted by name every time. Very responsive to any requests we had. The whole team went above and beyond any of our expectations and I look forward to staying here again on my next NYC trip!

title: So accomodating
text: We had to cancel our plans to travel to NYC in June this year due to our governments restrictions on international travel. The Fifty NYC were so helpful and accomodating in helping us sort out the situation. They showed a "people before profit" attitude in their interaction with our group. I would feel very confident to rebook with them when we are able to travel to NYC again. Great job Fifty NYC.

title: Comfortable and Friendly
text: We absolutely loved our stay at the Fifty Hotel & Suites by Affinia. The staff was welcoming, friendly, and helpful and the rooms were clean. The location is perfect. We already look forward to coming back to New York and staying at the Fifty on Fifty!

title: Amazing staff. Lovely hotel. Miss this place so much
text:
Came here in feb 2020 for my partners 40th bday with the kids. Child friendly. Lovely rooms great view fab location. 15/20min walk to Times Square, seems far but it’s nice to walk along the side streets before getting to the busy Times Square. 

The staff here are simply amazing. I haven’t got a bad thing to say .... not one! 

Calvin is fab, knows the area so don’t be afraid to ask. He looks big and strong but he’s a gentle giant. He’s literally the best - we miss you x

Rome (Romeo) my kids loved this guy. Couldn’t wait to see him every-time we went to the lobby. Tell the kids to look out for him, he’s magic! He’s the guy in the top hat. 

When I come back to New York, we will be staying here again. No doubt!

title: Great NYC Midtown Choice
text: For our girls’ weekend, we very much enjoyed Affinia’s Hotel 50. Great staff, clean restful rooms, very good value, even with the daily Hotel Facilities Fee.  At check in, they explained how we could use $10 a day from the “Cupboard” of food, beverages, and assorted handy items, along with other benefits from the fee.

title: Truly a home away from home!
text: I have chosen to stay at the Fifty for all my NYC visits.  It's centrally located so close to everything you want to do and see.  The rooms are spacious and we LOVE the nightly wine hour!!!  Whether you want to relax before you head out for the night or mingle with the staff and other guests, it's always a fun time!!

title: Super value
text: This is a fantastic property with an excellent location.  The rooms are large and well appointed and the staff is friendly and accomodating. Will definitely stay again when in NYC.  There are other Affinia locations in NYC which have similar ratings as well.

title: Terrific Value and Great Locates
text: My friend and I have stayed at Fifty Hotel and Suites by Affinia 5 times and we will be back again. The rooms are comfortable and spacious, especially those on the upper floors. The staff is friendly and has always been attentive to any of our requests. Special shout out to Rome, the doorman, who always makes us feel at home. Great neighborhood with easy access to the subway and plenty of good restaurants. We even enjoy the walk across town to the theatre district. Looking forward to our next stay.

title: Twin daughters Birthday in NYC
text: Hotel is very clean and modern. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We had booked 5 rooms and they kept us all together. We got to the hotel early and they held our bags and we were able to eat our own lunch in the shared common space. The free wine hour was very nice.

title: Best Location
text:
We have stayed at Fifty Hotel & Suites by Affinia many times. We originally chose this location because my husband has been visiting MSK frequently and the location is convenient to those appointments. Aside from the location convenience, we are partial to the special care that we receive at this hotel. 
Our last visit was from March 3-5. We had several issues with our room(a hairdryer/outlet problem, and a heating problem) that were handled quickly and satisfactorily. 
We will be back!

title: FEELS LIKE HOME
text:
WHAT A GREAT WEEKEND!

I hosted a family reunion and this hotel made it SO easy and enjoyable.
We had the entire 19th floor which was SUPER FAB because two of the suites were connected so we 
could spread out and hang out and it allowed our elderly guests to find a bed to take a nap/rest  in~ but still feel like part of the fun. 

They have a complimentary wine hour at 5 which was really nice . 
The staff WAS SO KIND AND SMILY AND WONDERFUL AND ACCOMMODATING!!! 

CHEERS to Ruth, Zachery, Calvin and Romeo for taking SUCH GOOD CARE OF US.

The beds were comfortable, there is a diner right next door, and ESSA bagels is  a three minute walk-DELISH!!!

HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!

title: Excelente ubicación y servicios buenos
text:
El hotel tiene una ubicación excelente ya que está a un paso de la mayoría de las atracciones de Nueva York. Si vas por trabajo, como fue mi caso, es genial porque seguramente vas a querer pasear un poco y sin alejarte mucho del hotel tenés gran cantidad de lugares para conocer: las grandes tiendas (Bloomingdale's, Saks Fifth Avenue y Macy's), Rockefeller Center, MoMA, Grand Central Station, el Central Park, Broadway para ir a una obra de teatro o un musical, la sede de la ONU, todo en un rango de 10 cuadras a la redonda. De hecho, yo hice todo caminando. Y subtes tenés a la vuelta nomás. Lugares para comer tenés montones (sobre todo en la calle 53 y Third Avenue).
Ahora sobre el hotel: el lobby era confortable, la temperatura es buena (fui en invierno y estaba calefaccionado pero no al punto de ser un horno), la señal de wi-fi era muy buena. Fueron muy amables en recibir varios paquetes para mí. La habitación me resultó muy cómoda, el baño era lindo, todo muy bien mantenido. El toallón podría haber sido un poco más grande, no era el típico toallón de hotel que quisieras tener en tu casa.  Había una cafetera y por las noches mientras miraba tele podía tomarme un cafecito. 
Tuve que recurrir una o dos veces al personal (no sabía cómo sacar el tapón de la pileta del baño y tuve un inconveniente con el televisor) y me atendieron muy amablemente y resolvieron enseguida mis problemas.
Mi estadía coincidió con un momento de remodelaciones en el hotel,  y una de las consecuencias era que los ascensores tardaban bastante en venir porque uno de ellos estaba afectado al personal de la construcción, pero realmente se notaba que hacían todo lo posible para que las obras no molestaran al huésped. 
El desayuno no era uuuuuyyyyy qué abundancia pero estaba bien. Lo que me llamó la atención fue que había pocas tazas de porcelana y muchos vasos descartables - no muy amistoso con el medio ambiente (para estar a tono con el derroche estadounidense en general).
El personal de recepción era cordial, pero no eran tampoco los Sres. y Sras. Simpatía. ¡El que sí era muy amable y siempre te recibía con una sonrisa era Romeo! Realmente era un placer pasar por la puerta y que te saludara con calidez.

title: Great base for NYC exploring
text:
All staff were so friendly and helpful, it’s such a great location for exploring the Big Apple. 

The room was so comfortable, with such a huge bed, lack of double glazing, meant occasionally noisy! 

Thank you for such a great stay!

title: Wonderful Hotel in wonderful City
text: Spent February half term in this fantastic hotel with my husband and 2 children 17 yrs and 15 yrs. can not fault anything about it , perfect location, every member of staff so helpful and friendly the door men are the nicest we’ve ever met and the house keepers do a wonderful job !. There is some noise from outside which you expect being in Such a fantastic location and weirdly it didn’t bother us at all. We would 100 percent return to this hotel and really hope we do soon . Thankyou to the whole team you do an amazing job ! Keep it up !

title: Completely hassle free stay
text:
Today we have returned home after a fantastic week in NYC. During our visit we stayed at the Fifty and really enjoyed our stay.
We arrived at about 18:00hrs and was checked in by a very professional lady, unfortunately her name escapes me, apparently she had really good nails 💅. She gave us an overview of the hotels amenities with no sales pitch whatsoever.
The room was a regular room with 2 beds, TV, safe, fridge and coffee making facilities. Everything in the room was more than adequate for the four of us, it was never our intention to spend too much time in the room whilst in such a magnificent city.
On the second floor there is a gym and brew making facilities which are all inclusive in the price of the hotel. We made use of the brew facilities every evening when we returned from exploring. 
The doormen were always polite and efficient, Marco in particular. 
In the interest of providing a balanced review its only fair that I mention the noise that comes from the ventilation system outside, (this noise could never be described as the city vibrance) it also emitted a cooking smell. Whilst this was immediately noticeable I wasn't going to let it bother me as the hotel was more somewhere to sleep rather than the centre point of the holiday. The hotel do supply ear plugs, I was in room 519. 
Don't let the above point put you off visiting this hotel because you're right in the middle of everything. You're within walking distance of Central Park, Rockefeller Centre, Times Square and the delights of Broadway. 
Overall we really enjoyed our stay and wouldn't hesitate to return when we make the trip to New York again.

title: Home Away From Home
text: My friends and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Fifty for a long girls' weekend in Manhattan.  We especially appreciated the doormen, Samuel and Romeo, who always greeted us with smiles and welcomed us "home" when we returned.  They and the desk staff were friendly and responsive to any questions or requests we had.  The rooms were neat and tidy, the beds and linens comfortable.  The location was perfect for us with good restaurants and pubs close by, as well as a variety of coffee shops, the Luncheonette, CVS and a host of other fresh food delis.  So conveniently located in midtown.  We would definitely stay here again!

title: Fifty Hotel & Suites
text:
We were extremely impressed with this hotel which was perfect for our visit to see New York - excellent location, excellent value and very good service and facilities
We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to others

title: Excellent value for money
text: Veru good hotel, have stayed a couple of times before, never disappoints. Good location, spacious rooms, good fitness center, good breakfast. Close to the subway and to shops, it is possible to do everything on foot

title: Highly recommended for a NYC break
text:
This is a great hotel located in Mid Town East NYC.  It was a great base location near the Rockefeller centre and walking distance to Time square and Central Park.

The hotel, rooms and facilities were high end and felt luxurious.  A comfortable sleep and good housekeeping ensured the facilities were always welcoming.  

The highlight for me was always receiving a “welcome home” from Romeo at the door.

We used the hotel car to return to the airport as this was a comparable price to a taxi and offered additional luxury to travel

title: Third stay at Fifty
text:
This was our third stay at this hotel and as other people have already said, the location is fantastic. It’s close to some things you have to see whilst not being in the midst of all the madness, and has good transport links.

This time we stayed in a king suite which we wanted as it had a small kitchen. This was great for either preparing your own food or just saving leftovers from the big portions you get in some restaurants! On arrival our room was clean apart from a random wet washcloth over the shower rail which I’d rather hadn’t have been there. Most of the days we stayed, Barbara cleaned our room. She was a delight! So cheerful and chatty and always did a great job of looking after us - thank you Barbara! We definitely noticed a difference on her days off.

My husband was quite disappointed that he had told the front desk before we arrived that I was celebrating a birthday during our stay and even though they said it had been ‘noted’ it wasn’t acknowledged at all. I don’t think it would have bothered him if we didn’t then see reviews of people who received upgrades and bottles of champagne!

In spite of this, we had a great stay. The staff were friendly and we always received a warm welcome from the doormen whenever we arrived ‘home’ which was lovely. I’m sure we’ll be back for a fourth stay next year.

title: Ideal accommodation for central NYC stay
text: We would highly recommend the Fifty Hotel and Suites. We had booked a One Bedroom Deluxe Suite - 2 Queen Beds for my husband, me and our 14 year old daughter. We also booked a separate double room for my mother in law. The suite was ideal for our needs - the bedroom was very spacious with two large beds; bathroom with bath and shower, great walk in little kitchen with hob and toaster and kettle etc, and enough cutlery and plates just for the 4 of us (wouldn't be great if cooking up a feast but no need for eating in in NYC). We tended to have some breakfast first before sightseeing and it worked well. The sitting area was huge with a corner sofa and dining table - massive really for central NYC. The plan was that my daughter would sleep on the sofa bed and that was fine as it was also huge but in the end she shared our room - if you had a larger family there would be ample room for everyone to sleep comfortably. The terrace was great - we were on 20th floor so amazing views - it was very cold whilst we were there so we didn't get the chance to sit outside but I'm sure it would be lovely in the summer. Every day the room was cleaned and beds made and towels sorted so it was very nice to come back to after busy days in the city. We knew it wasn't a typical 'hotel' with lots of facilities and it more than met our expectations. We had read reviews about extra charges so we discussed the price on booking so no nasty surprises. It was a great location, just around the corner from the subway, and also several handy local places to eat: UrbanSpace was a great foothall a minute away that we went to on our first night after a long flight..great. Also enjoyed a delicious breakfast at the Lexington Brass - definitely worth finding. Also Grand Central isn't far to walk for lots of lovely food. Beyond that, the City is your oyster! We would definitely return, and the lovely friendly doormen were so kind and happy.

title: clean and spacious
text: I stayed in a JR SUITE. it was Newly renovated except some tweaking still needed. The TV wasnt working . The tub still needed to be re-glazed . But the room  size ,  kitchenette , bathroom all great . and it was quiet except for street noise .

title: Thanks
text: Very nice mid-range hotel--clean modern rooms, good beds, helpful staff in Midtown East. I especially liked how the hotel managed to be elegant without being pretentious. My family also enjoyed their stay.

title: Sub par room
text: Our room was freezing and drafty. The heat, when used, dried you out and then you froze when you lowered it. The water was brown and had to be run for 10 minutes before a cleared. Both in the shower and the sink. Absolutely disgusting. Definitely won’t stay here again although we have stayed in The Affinia hotels before, Will not stay at the 50 again

title: Quality Customer Service
text:
From the moment Romeo helped me out of the cab welcoming us back home to Affinia, to the checkin-counter, Rocky who held our luggage and all other staff members, the smiles and genuine warmth to see us there were greatly appreciated.  My husband and I were traveling for follow-up medical appointments, and these trips can be stressful. 
We were unable to check-in early, and were offered the second floor lounge to relax.  I brought in food and there was tea and coffee available. There are couches, arm chairs and a table at which to set up a laptop and charge it. This lounge is quiet and a lovely respite after traveling.  Thank you for having this space available. (There's a second lounge on the other side with a fireplace.)
Our room was clean, welcoming and had a terrace from which we could sit and sip tea.  The closet was amazingly large enough to accommodate luggage and then some.  The bathroom was enough space, but lighting is poor for makeup application.
Unlike our previous stay, the bed was hard and the small, square pillows were lumpy.  Had we stayed a second night, I would have asked for new pillows. Traffic noise is at a minimum.
The location is perfect.  There are a number of eateries within walking distance in a wide price range and food selections from which to choose.
We've stayed at other hotels for these trips, but none had made us feel like we were at home away from home like 50 at Affinia.

title: Great stay!
text: Our family of four planned a last minute trip into the city and found the Fifty Hotel by chance. What a great find! Centrally located, spotlessly clean, modern but not "too cool" and with surprisingly nice sized rooms. Very friendly and helpful staff. We enjoyed our stay and will definitely stay there again!

title: NYC visit
text: Our go to hotel when visiting New York City. Easy to get to the subway. Close to a great spot for breakfast and Essa Bagel is around the corner. Lina did an exceptional job on our room. Thanks for a great visit.

title: Feels like Home Away From home
text: Been there many times.  Very clean and comfortable.  Staff is friendly and helpful.  Conveniently located and close to the subway stations.  Short walk to some great restaurants and local bars, as well as to the "lipstick" building.

title: Spacious Rooms
text:
This Hotel has it all. Great customer service, large rooms and easy location.
There is free coffee/water all day.  Happy Hour as well.  They give you a $10 credit for 
anything in the small food/beverage store.

title: great mid town hotel for a city break
text: clean hotel, helpful staff, if several of you are going then there is plenty of room so you don't feel crushed in a room together. 3 of us shared a room may have been a suite, 2 good double beds and a sofa bed that was really rather comfy. room has a kitchenette as well with fridge microwave and hob so we did our own breakfast every morning. free wine early evening was a bonus and whilst you have to pay a daily fee on top of the room cost, you do get vouchers back against it to spend on the bits available in the hotel. good diner next to the hotel, go out and turn right. An easy walk to times square, chrysler building, central station etc.

title: Wonderful reunion
text: The accommodation for 4 old friends was wonderful. Ralph and Marco downstairs were especially helpful  Ralph has a great sense of humor. Jasmine and Leah at desk were always able to accommodate.  With 4 of us in the suite Housekeeping had a big job and did it wonderfully Angela was stellar!  And of course great location

title: Great service and great people
text:
Although they under construction ,the hotel was very clean and the people that they hired were very professional, 
the room service was very thorough and quick ,the front desk were very easy to talk to as well as the info from the front door man

title: Nice NYC experience in Midtown for my 45th
text: The valet, concierge and front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful! I did have two hiccups with my stay, both were immediately rectified (with the caveat that additional credit card hold is refunded). The social sip was nice and the lobby fireplace is an awesome temporary small gathering space.

title: Great mid town location, helpful staff, big rooms
text: Use this hotel when we visit nyc. Mid town, walkable to major attractions, theatre and close to many good food options.  Rooms are large for nyc and good discounts are available.  Staff are friendly and helpful.  Some rooms get street noise.  Drecor is creative and modern.  No restaurant or bar but many nearby.

title: Ok for City Trip New York
text: Some furniture has seen already some years; aircondition / heating was unfortunately very poor , noisy and smell sometimes was awful (cigarette, kitchen, pott,...); Staff tried to assist as good as possible; sometimes you got the feeling that you are not a paying customer but more disturbing than welcomed. Altogether: standard hotel in New York which can be recommended for a city trip

title: easy living in NYC
text:
Nice clean contemporary room with balcony over Lexington!  Close to subway and good neighborhood.
Was not our first Affina visit and not our last!   The balcony off room was like an extra cloud to the outdoors and upper floor was quiet!

title: It always feels like home when we stay here
text: We found this hotel several years ago when we went to NYC for a weekend. We loved the experience, and now this is the only place that we stay when we visit the city. The location is great, the hotel is very nice, but it's the staff that keeps us coming back. Rome, one of the doormen, is absolutely amazing. He actually remembers us when we visit, recalls past conversations with us, and always makes us feel like the most important guests in the hotel. Invariable, when he sees us approach, he says "Welcome home, friends" with a great smile, and we really do feel like we're "coming home" every time we stay here.  The experience is always wonderful!

title: It always feels like home when we stay here
text: We found this property several years ago and had a great experience. The location is very convenient, but the staff is what really sets it apart. We love it so much that it is the only place we will stay in NYC if we have a choice. The doorman (Rome) is like a friend. He recognizes us, remembers where we are from and conversations we have had in the past, and people like that make the experience extra special. This is a great place with great people!

title: Wonderful, cozy NY home
text:
Love this hotel  with its "grand staircase" from the lobby up to the Club Room on the 2nd floor.  Midtown location is great, and the 3-minute walk to the subway stop for the IRT 4, 5 & 6 lines makes getting around the city a breeze.  Staff is gracious, friendly and caring.    A special "shout-out" to Sammy the doorman!

Accommodation was spacious and comfortable, with a fully equipped kitchen and wonderful view.  The only negative was the trash collection next door on the street from 11 pm until after midnight 2 of the 3 nights of our stay.  It then resumed at 7:00 am.  The second night I found the ear plugs in the night stand which made the noise a bit more bearable.

title: Not a good stay.
text: I discussed my experience this stay with Jasmine and Ruth. My bad experience was specific to two employees and one incident. It was in fact the worst hotel experience I have ever had. Not much more to say about this. Please get specifics from Jasmine or Ruth.

title: WOW
text: This hotel is fantastic, not only is it in a good location, the rooms are large and the staff are brilliant. I will go back to this hotel when I go back.rooms are clean, nothing is too much trouble.samual the doorman is so friendly and makes you feel at home. Wine hour in lounge time to mingle , tea and coffee on hand anytime.

title: The Doormen Keep Us Coming Back
text:
We have been staying at the Fifty Hotel for nearly 20 years; the location, price and quality keep us happy.  We never seem to have any issues that are not solved quickly.

In particular, we love seeing Sammy, Rome, and Ralph who always greet us by name.

title: Excellent experience
text: Recently visited NYC with my friend and our daughters.  The deluxe suite was perfect for our stay. The room was clean, quiet and offered plenty of space.  The staff were all extremely friendly and attentive.  We will definitely stay there again!

title: our best stay ever at Affina hotel
text: front desk staff went over and beyond to make our stay memorable.. Calvin (don't know his last name unfortunately)  and his partner at the front desk are so very very skilled at  going the extra mile to afford  a wonderful stay for their guests.

title: Wonderful stay
text: My sisters and I came for a night in the city. We felt so welcomed from check in to check out. The doormen were lovely (shout out to Rome - what a nice guy!) and the front desk staff was so nice and helpful. The rooms were huge for NYC. The bathroom was small but updated and modern. Beds were very comfortable. We felt at home here and will absolutely stay again when we return to the city.

title: Vacation with family
text: Staff friendly & kind. Very safe area with lots to do around the hotel. Food in area is amazing. Loved the visit & will absolutely return to this property. Second floor lounge area nice to gather in if you’re with a group.

title: Birthday
text: We had a wonderful time. Everyone was super friendly. Location was great. The doormen were very knowledgeable about the area. The wine hour was fun. We met several couples. Having coffee available was great too.

title: Fine and Flexible
text: The hotel shifted my room half-way though a four-night stay due to the additional night-time noise of construction in the building across 50th Street. My second room (on the interior) was much quieter and satisfactory. Staff is friendly and responsive from the door to the cleaning staff.

title: Excellent stay!
text: Room was spacious, well appointed, great balcony, wonderful sleeping!  Perfect location. Excellent staff.  Will stay here again.Check in was fast and efficient.  Doorman helped hail a taxi for us.  Great service!

title: AMAZING
text: Rooms were hip, updated and spacious.  The staff was like family and super helpful. Nice to have a little store in the lobby for some munchies and some wine.  There was some construction going on when were were there and without hesitation they moved us to a quieter room.

title: Great Spot
text:
Booked this hotel through Virgin Holidays not much in their brochure so didn’t know what to expect. We paid for upgraded room which was well worth the extra $35 a night. Room spacious, clean and well stocked. 
Hotel staff all really friendly especially Samual and the lady who checked us in (whom I couldn’t quite see her name sorry)
Hotel is an ideal location for Times Square, Fifth Avenue and loads other shopping areas. Subway round the corner taking you downtown and uptown. Sightseeing bus stopped on our street which was handy. 
Wine hour each night at 5-6 serving red, white and lemonade all really nice.  The only down fall was there is no restaurant. They do serve a continental breakfast in the club room which is 17.95 +tax if you have room only. But Starbucks, McDonald’s and other restaurants are nearby so no hardship. All in all it was a nice place to stay and good value for money. We would both return.

title: My mom's Dr appointment
text:
We came for a Dr appointment my mom was very sick one front desk lady was very rude said here's a place call them .. 
I then couldn't remember where she said so I came back and the next lady called and got my mom a wheelchair I wish I could remember her name but it was Sunday January 19 she was amazing I would love for her to know we appreciate her and all she did for us .

title: Misrepresented hotel charges
text: I was informed when I booked my room of the total charge.  But then after I checked in the hotel added another $44 per night a service fee that was not mentioned at the time of booking.  This is completely dishonest and a really deceptive way to treat guests.  Also, my room was freezing no matter how high I turned up the thermostat, all because of the draft from the window.  I thought the room was pleasant enough, but I won't return to this hotel.

title: An average hotel with an excellent location
text: The staff was friendly and helpful.  the room could have been better maintained.  Half of the lights were not plugged in and had no viable means to do so.   The room was drafty through the windows which made the overall temperature of the room on the cool side.

title: Fabulous!
text:
A wonderful stay.  Everything was a positive experience. We will be back for another adventure. 
Thank You to the staff and management. Our Family has been many places....... this was in the upper echelon in experiences.

title: Help
text:
I stayed at the Affinia a couple of years ago. Fantastic hotel and service. Didn’t get a chance to try the food but highly recommend this hotel
Front desk staff were super helpful 

Would like to email them an enquirer but can’t find an email address

title: MLK Weekend Stay
text:
Went with Fifty because of stays at Benjamin. Very good stay but a few slight issues 1) when trying to add another night. Hotel front desk pricing was twice the price as Affinia's website! 2) Studio rooms are a bit dated vs the standard queen rooms. 3) Toilet leaked in Studio room.

Overall, great staff and very helpful.

title: Fantastic Stay!
text:
We stayed in this hotel on a family trip to NYC. The rooms were great, clean and spacious for NY standards. The wine hour was an added bonus each day. 
Rome on the door was amazing. He was so hospitable and full of great tips for the city. 
This was in walking distance for everything you needs to see with some great restaurants located close by. 
Would definitely return to this hotel again.

title: better than expected
text:
The rooms not only are larger than most hotels I've stayed at in Manhatan, but I was pleasantly surprised to find a kitchenette, which could save customers money. 
I also liked the fact that hey have free coffee available throughout the day.

title: Ok but dated
text: We stayed there for three days , the hotel staff were ever so helpful and friendly .Our room was large with good view of the street below but it was slightly dated and things could maybe be arranged slightly different as the tv was really hard to watch from the bed, the tv was on the left wall and the bed was right over on the right you could watch tv but you had to lay on your left side. on the whole it wasn’t bad

title: Disappointed
text: When I get to the hotel the spring an extra $39 plus tax fee for something that I was unaware of when I booked the room I don’t drink I couldn’t use the discount I just thought it was sup surprise billing and I didn’t appreciate it

title: Geat stay in NY
text: The location was great for where I needed to be for work and its close to alot of tourist spots in midtown.  The room was large and very clean. I thought the bed and pillows were very comfortable.  Check-in was a breeze and the staff was very friendly.  I will definitely stay there again and will recommend this hotel to friends and family.

title: Horrendous. Mold, unbearable noise and terrible service.
text:
Probably enough said in the title. Please read the negative reviews. Most of them are accurate (including fees, service, etc). It is the worst hotel I’ve stayed at in NYC. Rooms are also dirty. 
Stay away - there is a reason it is cheap.

title: Amazing Hotel - It did not disappoint!!
text:
We stayed at Fifty Hotel and Suites to celebrate my 40th Birthday. 

The location was perfect, slightly away from the hustle and bustle but close enough to enjoy all the sights, within a short walk.

The staff were very friendly and helpful. Upon arrival we were extremely happy to have been allocated a room on the 19th floor. It was spacious and clean with everything we needed for a wonderful stay. Towels, hair dryer and even ear plugs (the hotel is near the police station, so sometimes you can hear sirens) but it wasn't too noticeable at all. The bed was super comfy and there was also a handwritten birthday card and bottle of prosecco on ice, waiting for me in our room! Which was a lovely touch and made me feel extra special.

The $10 cupboard allowance provided us with a daily bottle of water but there was much more to choose from. I honestly couldn't fault the staff or hotel. We only went to the wine hour once and my only complaint would be that there wasn't Rose wine on offer, only white or red! 

The hotel arranged an easy private transfer to the airport for us, at short notice and also stored our luggage after check out, so we could have a final shopping trip. 

There is a fitness centre onsite, although it wasn't well publicised and to be fair, when you've walked 15miles in a day, exercise is the last thing on your mind! 

I would absolutely recommend this Hotel to anyone travelling to New York and would have no qualms about booking to stay here again. 

Thank you Fifty for helping to make my dream trip a reality!!

title: Great staff, good value for money
text:
Had a wonderful stay at this property. Great staff with pleasant and cheerful attitude!
Great location, not far from a few subways as well as fifth avenue. great value for money.
Didn’t try the breakfast, as there are really great options just around the corners.

title: Great location, but very poor service
text: Our intial check in with the FIFTY went smoothly. We checked in late, but called in ahead and the lone front desk attendant was very accomodating. His name was Javon I believe. Everything went smootly until he became unsure about extra charges for parking past 12hrs. We asked what the additional rates were and he made a call to confirm. After a breif moment he said he must have made a mistake and said "you guys are good, there's no charge". Fast forward to our check out we're being charged double the agreed upon rate and the front desk attendant who's name I regret not getting, is treating my group and I in a manner as if we were lying. She smuggly gets her manager and he tells us that the policy is solid and that we can only pay the balance until they can get a hold of javon to confirm the allegations. My issue with this entire situation is that a representative of their company, Javon, assured us of the rate we were paying. Had this been a misunderstanding on my part I would have happily paid the bill. Instead this was a failure on that employees knowledge, the hotels training, and worst of all the managers lack of acceptance in resolving the issue. He just wanted the bill paid. We did end up paying as the conversation was going in circles, but I can guarantee that my next trip to NYC will not be with any affinia hotels. My friends and family will be sure to stray away. About the only standout positive aspect of our stay there was the bright and attentive doormen that seemed genuinely kind. Give them a raise!

title: mirror on the wall!
text: The staff are very nice but after agreeing to an upgrade (superior room) I was put in a room without a mirror - crazy. I asked for resolution and got a lot of push back from front desk with zero resolution. The next morning I spoke with the manager who was lovely and installed a mirror by the time I returned to my room. I will happily return to this hotel.

title: Comfortable midtown hotel
text: Overnight weekend stay was comfortable and pleasant. Room was large with kitchenette, which we did not really utilize, but handy. Beds were comfortable, elevators fast and room was quiet. However, I did not like the $40 facility fee, as I received nothing for this charge other than an $8 bottle of water. And it also would be nice if the front desk explained that the second floor was where breakfast was served  and where they had the free wine hour. We also were not told where the gym was. A basic discussion about the amenities, especially ones we are paying for, does not seem like too much to expect.

title: Great Stay
text: This is one our favorite hotels in NYC. Full kitchen, centrally located to theatres and subways. Spacious rooms, NY Times in the lobby, fireplace, wine reception at 5PM, friendly staff, good cleaning services.

title: A wonderful stay that may be even better!
text: The family really enjoyed the stay, and the bed is quite comfortable.  The only comment I would like to make is that since I am a light sleeper, the room being right between two elevators made it difficult to have a good night’s rest.  I woke up to the elevator’s “ding” sound when it arrives on our floor.  I woke up to people arriving or leaving in the middle of the night as they talk in the hallway.  I would really appreciate it if our room may be located far away from the elevator the next time.  Or if during check-in I may be given options to the location of the room.  I actually requested for a high floor during reservation, but in the end we were on the 6th floor.  Anyway, it was a good stay.

title: Amazing Staff!
text: Fifty is located walking distance from shopping and a short taxi ride to Broadway theater shows. There are numerous restaurants in every direction, my favorite was Vietnamese, and a delicious Korean-owned cafe "Paris" just around the corner on 52nd Street. What makes this elegant boutique hotel is the staff. Everyone is friendly and creates an atmosphere that is comfortable and welcoming for business travelers and families. The doormen, Romeo and Sammy were charming and attended to our every needs. Romeo is also an amazing magician that put on a show for our son everyday of our stay. We are looking forward to staying at Fifty again!

title: Great stay at Affinia Fifty
text:
We have stayed at this hotel many times. The rooms are large,the staff is great and Brian the manager
was very personable. The hotel is clean and close to everything. Going again in March and already booked my room.

title: Christmas in NYC
text:
Nice hotel, exceptional service, cozy rooms (a studio king bed) with comfortable bedding and space, maybe a little more heat needed in the bathroom.
The continental breakfast fair and more than sufficient, while the place and the service was great.

title: Everything you Need
text:
From the moment you enter you;re taken care of.  My room was ready even though I was early.
I was directed to complimentary coffee on this rainy cold day.  The rooms are very spacious, the mattress and amount of pillows was perfect.

title: Great Stay!
text: Good price, friendly staff, great spacious room with a balcony in a prime location! We stayed on the 20th floor and everything was clean, bell staff was super accomadating! No issues were encountered during our stay! Beds were super comfy! Loved it!

title: Aside from check-in was a nice stay
text:
The front desk was very under-staffed at check-in.
It took almost an hour.  I had to wait in line again after my room was not ready.  One person in the afternoon to check in your guests is not enough.
I should have just been called up when it was ready, but she had me wait In the 20+ minute line all over again before she could check our family into our room.
Glad it was not my first stay at this property or I would probably never book it again.

title: AVOID or at least beware as this  hotel takes UNAUTHORISED money from your credit card.
text: Rooms need a proper clean, staff tried to get us to pay for our room again although fortunately I was able to produce paperwork. Checking out they said we owed nothing and said they had refunded the standard $300 for possible incidentals.   They took the full room payment for our room AFTER  we checked out as they insist on having a card registered for up to $300 incidentals.   I had to get my credit card company involved and they pursued the unauthorised payments taken by this unscrupulous establishment.  It’s also apparent from previous reviews that if you book through a 3rd party they put you in a dingy room that looks onto hotels entire aircon units and brick walls.

title: Disappointing  Holiday Stay
text: We’ve stayed  at this cute boutique hotel in midtown a number of times in the past. Nice location 4 blocks from Rockefeller Center and Essen Bagel is right around the corner. This stay, however, was disappointing. The personable doorman is gone, there was no help with luggage, and the room wasn’t ready when we arrived at 3:30PM. There was also some strange additional daily fee of about $40 which seemed like we were being nickeled and dime. We like the wine at five and the lounge but not some involuntary surcharge. Also a 10% discount at the National is laughable. The place just did not seem as friendly or service oriented. I had trouble printing boarding passes on the business computer printer even when I complained twice about it not working. The junior suite was roomy and comfortable although the bathroom was old and the shower handle came off ( not only in our room, but in our son’s room as well). The place doesn’t seem the same. We wondered if there was a change in management since the last time we were here in 2017. I guess all good things come to an end. We will be looking for a new hotel next holiday season. This place cost too much for such service.

title: Convenient location
text: Clean, comfortable and modern hotel. I liked the shelving available to store items. We had 3 adults, plenty of room to keep everything organized. Walking distance to Grand Central, so everything seemed close.

title: Great stay over Christmas
text: We had a junior suite. Great size. All the staff we encountered were great. Good location. I would definitely stay here again as close to lots of attractions. There was a lot of food options close by to choose

title: Awesome stay
text: A wonderful place to stay for families! The staff was so nice, the rooms updated and spacious and the beds/pillows were super comfy. Couldn’t believe we could get a kitchen, and full tub for such a fair price. Also, can’t beat the location! The police station was close but it (the noise) only bothered me one night.

title: 1st time at this location and it was great!!
text:
Excellent place to stay and I would return. The staff was always smiling and always helpful. A big thank you to the bellmen as they are a great resource to use when you need to know where what or when about a location.

Also get with the bellmen and use their ground transportation to move around the city. It is most reliable!!

title: Awesome Stay in NYC!
text: Our stay in NYC was most memorable.  The hotel service overall was excellent.  The check-in staff were very nice.  The rooms are modern, kept clean, and the beds are very comfy for some good sleeping.  A special mention for Rome, the Bellman, who is one of the sweetest guys around.  The location of the hotel is pretty much in walking distance to everything you wish to see in NYC.   All around, I found New Yorker's friendly and attaching, love that city.

title: High Expectations
text: The friendliness of the staff was top notch. However, the beds were uncomfortable and there were a lack of towels. The dining area where breakfast was being served or rather not served was inconvenient. It lacked a normal dining area from what we saw. It resembled more of a lounge area. And the “breakfast” was over priced for what was being “served”.The cost did not match the experience. At all.

title: Holiday Weekend Stay
text: Managed to get a great deal at this hotel and since we are familiar with the area - this was the perfect hotel for our weekend stay.  Our flight arrived early in the day - so we headed to the hotel to drop off our bags before heading out to Rockefeller Center.  A room was available on a higher floor as an upgrade and we decided it was worth it to get comfortable in our room at that time instead of later in the afternoon.  We were on the 10th floor facing 50th Street.  The room is nice and large and the windows give you a nice view down 3rd Avenue. There were two closets/storage spaces, so we had plenty of space to put our belongings away.  Bathroom was average sized and had a shower (which could have used a little bit of bleaching), it also had a barn door, but it was not leveled so it would keep sliding open. The toiletries smelled great and thought they were pretty good. The beds were comfortable and plenty of pillow (we love our pillows).  There was a small fridge which I set it to the coldest setting as we had already purchased a few beverages on our way to the hotel, and it kept our beverages cold.  Wine hour was a nice treat for us, we enjoyed have a glass (or two) each evening, while they had lemonade for the kids and coffee and tea available as well.  This was a great trip except for the noise level from the street.  I think the windows allow for the noise to enter the room. They do supply ear plugs in the nightstand, but I can't sleep with them.  I have stayed in Midtown before and did not experience this level of noise. The daily $10 credit for their snack/beverage allowed us to get two sodas and a bag of cookies each day (get what you want early or they may not have what you want.)  Staff were always pleasant and offered a smile.  Overall I would love to stay here because of the price and location - but that noise will make me think about it.

title: Excellent service, room, front desk help, etc
text:
I love your hotel. Service is amazing. All workers are kind and very service oriented. Rooms are amazing.  thanks for all.  I will come back.  Love your lobby area and the rooms with fire place.
thanks for all.

title: Great location and very comfortable beds
text: This’place was in  great location, had excellent service from courteous, professional staff.   The beds were extremely comfortable.   The Only downsize to this place was that you could hear the noise of NY at night.  If they would soundproof the place it would be perfect.   Would stay there again.  Definitely.

title: Not Happy
text: I have been staying at this hotel exclusively for the last 15 years. This trip was not enjoyable. There was a beeping noise all night that was most irritating and we discovered in the morning that it was the dishwasher and we opened up the dishwasher and it was full of dishes. Which would explain why we didn’t have any glasses to drink from. The refrigerator did not work properly as it would not get cold. To top off our visit the adjoining room had a room full of children that started screaming and running and playing at 6am this continued until 9:30 am. I have never stayed at the Affinia 50 and felt like I didn’t get rest or that my stay was not satisfactory until this trip. I will have to reconsider my stays in the future.

title: Great hotel, great location.
text:
We stayed at the fifty for 5 nights, on our 4th visit to New York, the first in the Christmas holidays. 

We found the staff at the fifty really welcoming throughout the stay and were keen to please. The guys on the front door were particularly friendly, and could not do enough for you. 

The hotel is located ideally for the Rockefeller Center and tree, less than 5 mins walk away.

Check in was swift and we were soon in our room on the 3rd floor. The room was on the inside of the hotel, so not quite as much street noise, though the view from the room was just the air conditioning fans. There was a little noise from the fans, but nothing that disturbed us. 

The room was spotlessly clean, and was a good size for NYC, with 2 double beds, a huge tv, and plenty of space for our Christmas shopping! 

What with the food choice you can get in NYC we didn’t sample the breakfast at the Fifty but went to the New York Luncheonette a few doors up, and it was superb and recommended. 

Overall we loved the Fifty and would very happily return!

title: BOTTOM FIVE ALL-TIME
text: Not our worst stay but bottom five. Noise all night as we were in 211, just woken up at 5:45Am by guests and staff, could hear Lobby music all night. Staff did not seem to care. #hotels #nyc Noise ramped up after 6AM. The gentleman who appeared to preside over lobby at 10:45 PM was dumbfounded as to why I was upset. Wanted to sleep in this morning.

title: Affinia rules!
text: Your rooms are spacious and clean, your staff is friendly, and your wine hour is a nice way to end the day.  My only suggestion would be a slight upgrade to the wine being offered.  Obviously, this is a gratis benefit, but better bottles of wine are available as very reasonable prices, especially if bought in bulk.  Consider Bogle Cabernet, for example.  About $8-10 per bottle.

title: Nifty Fifty
text: This hotel is in a great location - very convenient and quiet. The business workspace is quiet and comfortable. The hotel partner discounts were very helpful and presented some choice as well. The staff was excellent and friendly. I would definitely return.

title: Christmas visit to the big Apple. It’s always an exciting adventure with so much to do!!
text: This hotel is more than adequate. It’s clean and wonderfully located. Be prepared for a comfortable yet noisy nights sleep. The kitchen option is very nice. Layout of room is odd with lots of wasted space.

title: GREAT SPOT
text: Great place to stay,  not to far from everything you need to do,  Spacious rooms and friendly staff.  Minutes from Times Square, Radio City Music Hall and Rockefeller Center We all had a great time.  Try the Horny Ram for drinks and food too!

title: Recent stay
text:
I have stayed at this hotel several times in the last 6 years and never been disappointed until this last trip.

Our room on the second floor was behind the elevators.  No natural lighting or ambiance as had been every other experience.  We had our grandsons....and they have stayed here with us in the past and we never had this experience..or thought to even ask.

title: Very Spacious Rooms
text: The hotel staff was especially accommodating, the rooms were very spacious compared to most NYC hotels. The lounge was cozy and comfortable, and the location was a block from the 4,5,and 6 Train, walking distance to 5th Ave. and Rockefeller Center. Highly recommend this hotel!

title: a great weekend
text: Hotel is nice in a very central location and easy to get to everything perfect for a weekend in the city exploring, Holiday shopping or seeing a show.  Staff of the property are exceptional.... especially the doormen are fantastic.

title: Falls far short of expectations
text: For the price, one would expect a room free of cobwebs, a clean bathroom floor, furniture that matched, a door on the closet, and room to move around. We spent our time in the room looking at the cobwebs on the ceiling and the ironing board hanging in an alcove.

title: 5 days in New York
text: We found an absolute gem in this hotel! Right in the heart of New York - a 5 minute walk to the Rockerfeller Centre and then on to fifth Avenue for shopping and the awesome Time Square and Broadway. The hotel room was modern and spacious for the five of us, spotlessly clean. Fresh towels daily. The continental breakfast ( at an extra cost) was delicious, you could eat as much as you liked. Staff were friendly and efficient. We will definitely be returning!

title: Rainy Winter Holiday Stay
text: Bathrooms, particularly, but not solely, were not very clean. There was hair in the shower. The tub plumbing water was dirty. The vanity framing, near the toilet was dirty. The bathroom shelf was dirty. The light-switch was dirty. The only soap offered was from a communal pump. Shortly upon check-in, a found a bundle of men's socks on the floor. I had told the Front Desk, that I did not want my room serviced, and the next day, housekeeping came to my room anyways. They left an empty pizza box; which I don't know why. Doorman occasionally would open the hotel-door, but not always. Common bathrooms on 2nd floor were dirty. My main issue with this hotel, was the lack of cleanliness.

title: Always a nice stay at the Affinia 50
text: When travelling to New York there are few better options than the Affinia 50.  Their professional staff, service and cleanliness are exceptional.  In addition to the amenities, the 50 is located for easy access to the theater district and trains for easy access to other locations in the city.  I cannot recommend highly enough.

title: Very nice stay
text:
The location and quality of the hotel made for a very nice visit to New York
They need to work on cell phone conectivity. Suites are very nice, bathrooms are small but clean.
Staff are all very nice and helpful.

title: Highly Recommend
text: Fifty was the perfect place for our family to stay for the weekend. Quiet & convenient location. Clean & spacious room. Not to mention how comfy the bed was & we had a teepee for our little one! Staff was friendly & accommodating. We’ll be back!!

title: Birthday Weekend
text: Good location on quiet street within walking distance of many attractions. Comfortable beds, good sized room but a little tired and probably due for renovation soon. Bathroom small but adequate. Stayed at the Shelburne last trip to NY and which was much nicer and had great rooftop patio...would return there but not to this Affinia.

title: Facility Tax ?
text: Had a great stay the hotel it located perfectly and caters for all your needs. The facility TAX a rip off shame . The kitchen is a great addition. Desk staff some not the friendliest. Hotel taxi company good price $68 back to jfk but driver takes his a your life in his hands great fun if you like jumping queues spoilt it at the end trying to charge extra for toll and then mentioning the tip. I had already confirmed with the concierge the $68 shame . Still back next year .

title: Disappointing hotel support and feedback
text: Good bed.  Bad shower. Amenities promised were not delivered. Non-responsiveness by hotel management even though I was told 3 times I'd be contacted.  Great doormen. Room phone did not work notified desk

title: Disney Quality in NYC
text:
We would give this delightful Hotel a 10 stars! 

The staff was so warm and friendly. From the reservations line to the doorman (Rome, who took such great care of us), everyone on staff that we came in contact with (thanks Leah for always having such a warm smile!) was wonderful. 

I encourage the management team to keep doing whatever they are doing to keep the staff so happy! And if there is any type of awards system in place, please put our three votes in for Leah - Front Desk and Rome - Doorman/Bellman.

Fifty NYC, you are now our NYC home hotel! See you next time!

Also, they have a fantastic American Girl Doll package that sent our little girl over the moon. She said she felt like a princess.

title: Exactly what we needed!
text: Great accommodations - the room was clean, spacious enough, everything was functional, and met our needs for a mom-daughter sight-seeing weekend.  We had a view of the city streets, great lobby areas for relaxing before checkin and after checkout.  The doormen and bellhops were super kind and helpful and Rome even had some special entertainment 'up his sleeve'.  The location was a few blocks east of Rockefeller with plenty of resources/restaurants close by.  Perfect for our needs!

title: Great hotel!
text: We really enjoyed our stay here.  The staff was amazing always smiling and very helpful.  The hotel was well maintained and very comfortable.  The decor was nice and the Christmas decorations made it feel like home.  The second floor was dedicated to providing all the comfort you would need.  There was a room with a fireplace a lounge with tv's and plenty of seating to relax on.  The fitness center was well maintained with quality exercise equipment.  I had everything I needed even away from home.

title: Nice place~
text: We always enjoy staying here, except for the annoying $10 daily credit that is part of the high facilities fee.  Why can't you eliminate this.  Everything is 3x the normal price-a bottle of smart water is $8.50, regular candy bars are $4.50.  It's creating a lot of garbage for the environment with the bottles and unhealthy snacks for people.  Oh, and there are also really ugly NY socks that I can't imagine anyone wanting to wear.  It's a daily stress trying to use your $10. credit there, on top of all the NY room taxes, facilities fees, etc.

title: bedroom Terrace
text:
Earplugs during the nights is  a must because of the  heavy traffic outside 
the bathroom and the kitchen very, very  tiny. unusual for an American Hotel. 
Terrace room very spacios but the carpet needs a good clean.

title: Had a excellent trip to NYC and staying at the Fifty was a bonus!!
text: Very clean rooms, staff was amazing. The doormen were very helpful and friendly. We loved our stay in NYC. It was our first time traveling there. We would stay at the Fifty again for sure in the future.

title: Home away from Home
text: NYC fifty staff are the most welcoming and kind people I have met in New York. They always make you feel like a special guest. The location is perfect, the rooms are not fancy but extremely clean and comfortable.  I always feel safe and well cared for at NYC Fifty. It is my go to hotel in the city.

title: Good! Feels like home!
text: This was the 8th time that I stayed at Affinia! It is a very good hotel! I only had some problems with communication at check in in a couple of times (time of arrival and information about some fees) but after that it is a really good hotel that certainly makes me feel at home!

title: Weekend getaway
text: Loved this hotel:  clean, well-located (great all-day breakfast joint a couple of doors down) and a stone's throw from the subway.  Also appreciated $10 credit to hotel's concession store though with NYC prices, it won't go very far :-).  Would be happy to stay there again on our next trip to NYC--

title: Excelent suite
text: We stayed at suite 2002. The suite is especial, with a nice  terrace and a good kitchen. The sheets and towels very nice too. The housekeeping failed one day, but nothing important. The only updown was maintenance as I asked 2 times to recair the lama at the side of the bad, and they diânt.

title: Great location and staff!
text:
This hotel is in a great location for visiting during holiday (and all other times too!) very close walking distance to Rockefeller and the sights. I choose this hotel because we flew in and had tickets to the Rocketts Christmas special pretty close to our arrival time. Hotel has bag check and a wonderful lounge upstairs so we were able to relax for a few minutes and head out to the show and the sights without worry before our room was ready. I got a great deal on the rate by booking direct through the hotels website. But be aware there is a 44$ facility charge (“free WiFi” happy hour drinks and a $10 store voucher are covered by this fee). There is not a complimentary breakfast but they do serve something upstairs for a fee. The room was clean, bathroom a bit small but most NYC hotels are small. Bed was a little firm for my liking but after walking miles in the city for two days I was out when my head hit the pillow. Street noise was minimal and we didn’t hear much from out in the hallway or the other rooms. Given the opportunity I’d consider staying here again although I like to try out new and different accommodations to get a feel for places when I return. 
Highly recommend for budget conscious yet particular travelers like myself.

title: 5* fancy but with useful amenities, afternoon drinks and warm service!
text: I stayed in a few hotels courtesy of my company after moving to NYC. FIFTY Hotels and Suites was the best by far: fanciest, most comfortable, most amenities, friendliest, best location and best price. It is in the best location: convenient, close to lots of landmarks, and yet really quiet. The rooms are well-equipped with comforts, space, and also useful things (unlike many other places). The staff were the friendliest I encountered, and went out of their way to answer questions and help, and had a real sense of urgency during busy check-in times. I had a minor issue with one room and management were quick to assess and offer me another room and help relocating. Was sorry to leave!

title: Been there before, and am going back!
text:
Great location and clean comfortable rooms. I was there last Xmas visiting with my older son and it was a great central location to make excursions from. Near the subway and walking distance to Grand Central. Lots of nice places to eat nearby and overall a good stay. The prices vary a lot depending on when you go but when I have booked the price has been reasonable and good value.

There is an odd extra fee charged for Wi-fi and the snack bar. I don't think it is optional but I did not need wi-fi and don't eat junk food so I wish that charge could be removed or not charged as it is like $40/day?

Other than that my experience was nice staff and decent hotel. My wife worked as senior management in large hotels in the Caribbean and liked it and she is pretty picky.

title: Warm clean Hotel
text: What a find! We walked into the beautiful Lobby and were warmly greeted by the doorman and the front desk. To the left was a gleaming glowing fireplace that welcomed us with warm after the cold temperatures in New York. There were three elevator so we never had to wait very long for an elevator. Our room was huge for New York and the bathroom was lovely. The amenities were beautiful. There were several spots with fireplaces and small intimate lobbies on different floors in the hotel we really enjoyed our stay.

title: was surprised by extra charges
text: the property was nice. the rooms are large and well laid out. I was surprised by the property fee that was added to the bill. there was absolutely no mention of it when I booked my reservation and may impact on whether i will return. The coffee on the second floor was a nice touch.

title: Fantastic Staff and Location
text: Just returned from a fantastic holiday in New York for my Birthday, staying at the Fifty NYC. Great Location for walking around and subway access. Staff fantastic and provided great recommendations for restaurants. I would like to thank Brian and the Team for making our stay wonderful. I would definitely recommend this Hotel.

title: Excellent well priced hotel on the East Side. The service was great and the staff helpful with every need.
text: This was the best hotel I’ve stayed in in New York in terms of staff, room size, comfort and convenience. The evening wine service as well as the snacks offered in the lobby were a nice add on to an already great hotel.

title: Amazing hotel and staff
text: This hotel is in a excellent location and the rooms are well decorated and very clean. But the best thing about this hotel is the staff, they do so much for you to make your stay perfect 👌. The doorman Marco is amazing at his job!! He really goes out of his way to flag down taxis for hotel guest, gives you direction to places. Your a fantastic doorman Marco and a credit to this hotel. All the staff work extremely hard and would recommend this hotel to everyone, your really can’t go wrong staying here due to the location and the standard of the hotel. Would come back again and I would definitely give this a 10/10.

title: Deixou a desejar
text: Essa é terceira vez que me hospedo nesse hotel. Ótima localização. Porém a limpeza não está tão primorosa, encontrei uma meia de outro hóspede no chão do quarto, muito pó no aparelho de aquecimento. O ponto alto é o vinho que é servido todo final de tarde, porém agora sem aperitivos .

title: Wonderful, wonderful staff
text: We have been to this hotel twice in the past two weeks as it is around the corner from a sloan kettering clinic. We would stay here even if it was across town. Our rooms have been comfortable and clean but the real reason to visit 50 NYC is the staff - professional, kind and willing to go above and beyond. Everyone we have met has been delightful and more than helpful, regardless of our need. Thank you all!

title: Affinia 50 second time
text: Affinia Fifty is a very nice small hotel in mid-town.  It is conveniently located for a visit to NYC with easy access to MOMA, Rockefeller Center and good restaurants in the area.  The staff was very pleasant and helpful.  The lobby is attractive - liked the sculptures.  For the price, the choices on the buffet breakfast could be improved.

title: Espaço e conforto na medida certa.
text:
Num primeiro momento a entrada do hotel até assusta de tão simples e compacta, mas qdo vc entra nos aposentos vc até esquece da primeira impressão. Camas e travesseiros muito confortáveis, roupa de cama e banho de puro algodão, macias e trocadas diariamente sem que vc precise pedir e o melhor de tudo, a localização. 
A equipe foi muito gentil em me presentear com um amável cartão e um delicioso prosecco por ser meu aniversário 
Apesar do café da manhã ter poucas opções, o hotel está a poucos metros de uma das boulangeries mais gostosas da Lexington Av. O staff da recepção do hotel é meio confuso, mas as camareiras são nota dez!! se estiver à toa no hotel entre 5 e 6 da tarde, vale a pena conhecer novos sabores na  degustação de vinhos que é oferecida diariamente no segundo andar. O preço é muito bom pela localização do hotel. Pretendo voltar mais vezes.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: Fifty Hotel & Suites is fantastic.  Clean and comfortable large rooms in a great location.  Easy to walk to many "must see" places/neighborhoods in NYC as well as several subway lines.  Exemplary customer service.  Would highly recommend this hotel and will stay here again the next time I'm in NYC.

title: Great location but daily " facility fee" is a deal killer.
text: This hotel is very well located. However, the front desk is always overwhelmed and chaotic. It makes for a very unwelcoming check in. Plus, the added ( no choice) facility fee is a big negative for us. It is obligatory and is really just an added fee that more honeslty should be included in the room rate, Even though we have stayed here before, we will not stay again.

title: Great option in NYC!
text: First time staying at this property.  Have stayed at other Affinia properties and they have all been good experiences.  This is a great option, fantastic location and great room sizes!  I would definitely recommend this if you are looking for a great boutique hotel in NYC and the midtown area.  Close to everything, great service.  Love the gym and the wine hour!

title: Annual best NYC reunion
text: Each year, around this time of November, I spend at least one Sunday night here with family. This hotel is outstanding in its Rooms, services, meal discounts, friendly staff and helpful information - an all around beautiful location. I highly recommend it

title: Midtown East
text: The hotel has nice size, clean and well appointed room.  5-6pm complimentary wine.  Great location and nice staff but can get very busy at check in as there seems to be only 2 people at the reception desk.

title: Average hotel
text: The hotel as a whole is comfortable and has a good location. Customer service is pretty bad. And mailing room does not exist. Packages are thrown all over the place and can easily get lost or stolen.  The $10 credit equals 1 bottle of water so it is a joke.  Hotel needs a  remodeling, especially elevator and bathrooms. Bathroom has 0 counter space and no towel racks.  This is an average hotel.

title: Excellent Mid-town hotel
text: Rooms are generously sized, clean, and contemporary.  Staff is very friendly.  Convenient location.  With the "pantry" credit you can pick up a nice bottle of water or snack every evening.  Walk down to Sophia Wine Bar, just a block away, for a drink or dinner.

title: Great Pre-cruise stay in NYC
text:
We stay the night before our cruises out of NYC and have stayed at a few other hotels in NYC before.  We have stayed at Ink 48 and Yotel and I got a great deal on this hotel through trip advisor so I booked it.  I am so glad I did.  It was by far the best stay we have had in NYC the 1 bedroom suite we had was wonderful.  The hotel was in a great location.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The suite was large and had everything you need!  I will be staying here next year before our cruise for sure!!  We walked next door to Empire steak house for dinner then caught a cab to see Beetle juice on broadway.  Everything was so simple and close it was just wonderful.  Thank you Affina!!
Jan

title: sizable room but extraordinarily loud.
text: For NYC, the rooms are spacious.  However they are not well-utilized.  Lot of dead space serving no purpose.  Doors SLAM shut and with hallways on the narrow side, the sound reverberates.  There is NO way to solve that problem.  Depending on your location, sounds from outside are also extraordinarily loud.  This is Manhattan so you have to accept sirens, honking, and the usual, but I’ve stayed at many hotels here and this one ranks very low for sound insulation.  A corner of my room (702) smelled like urine.  It was unmistakable.  Spend $$ for this hotel — do not pay a premium.

title: Among the best Midtown Manhattan hotels
text: What a stay!  Walking distance to virtually everything we wanted to see.  The Met, Central Park, Broadway shows, dining and shopping.  Best of all was our room.  Our 19th floor corner suite was fabulous.  Views of the East River, and downtown were outstanding.  Staff and amenities were very decent.  Average bathrooms were only a mild issue.

title: It's Like Coming Home
text:
I have stayed at Affinia properties since 1998, first a long term (7 week) stay at Affinia Gardens, later at the Beekman Tower, the Surrey and others that are no longer a part of the group.  I have always appreciated the large rooms, the extra offers for long term residency--kitchens, cutlery, etc--and the dedication of long-term staff.
