I miss the wide range of Affinia options, but applaud their focus on customer service. What I have come to appreciate and admire about the hotels is the people who work for them.  The hospitality business at the end of the day is all about people right?  Affinia ids able tp deliver excellent, lovely service at an affordable price. WhAT MORE COULD ONE ASK FOR?

title: Excellent Hotel and Great Customer Service
text: My stay at the 50 Affinia was fantastic! The service and hospitality of all the employees was simply terrific, and the location of the hotel was perfect. I arrived on a red-eye early in the morning, and since I was unable to check-in until the afternoon, the concierge was kind enough to let me use the facilities to shower and freshen up before hitting the streets. I will definitely be back on my next trip! Thanks!

title: First NYC visit
text:
After trawling through many hotel reviews last year we decided this would be our base.
When it finally came round we weren’t disappointed.
Lovely tidy and modern rooms, very comfortable beds.
Plenty of space, good shower and half decent views (we faced the road outside).
Staff were all great, friendly and welcoming.
Unfortunately because we were so busy we didn’t really get time to explore the hotel.
Upon arrival your asked to pay a facilities fee, ours totalled $240, when I asked about it they said it would be refunded if we didn’t used the facilities.
We didn’t and it was refunded.
It is in a good location about a 5-10 minute walk to the Rockefeller centre and all the shops.
I would recommend this hotel to people.
Nice to have stayed.

title: This hotel needs some TLC
text: I was travelling to NY on business and needed to book a hotel in a pinch.  Despite the pictures online and front entrance, this hotel is in dire need of some updates.  The carpeted floors were dingy, the bathroom tub needed to be re-caulked, the paint could use some retouching, there was a gap of space in my door where the carpet ended before the front entrance began - overall, the quality of this hotel was minimally satisfactory.

title: 豪華さはないが、広くてきれいでリーズナブル
text: 出張で利用しました。地下鉄の駅まで近く、グランドセントラルにも歩ける距離と便利な立地。静かなエリアでゆっくり眠れます。道の向かいにエッサベーグルがあるのも魅力。ただしタイムズスクエアなどには少し距離があり観光には不便かも。

title: Recent Visit
text: As always, our stay at Fifty NYC was fabulous. The staff is always wonderful and accommodating, including the front desk staff and doormen.  Samuel, Roman and Lenny are the best. We always look forward to our stays at Fifty NYC.

title: Good overall first stay
text: Overall the hotel was a good stay. Front desk was very nice and accommodating. Biggest issue was housekeeping. Upon arrival I found a used ketchup wrapper on the floor near the bed. The freezer was not usable due to needing to be defrosted. I defrosted it myself, but it was smaller in size then expected. Gym was small too.

title: Sneaky hotel amenities fee
text: All was good until they jammed his with a $40/day amenities fees - which was never mentioned to us and for which services we never used.  Scam.  The staff is lovely and its good value for money but we left with a feeling of being ripped off at check out.  How silly to get so much right and frig it up on departure.

title: Business traveler
text: Business trip. I am a return visitor to this property. Great Midtown location close to 6 and E stations. Hotel service very good. Property in good condition though bathrooms could updating, at least judging by my room

title: Great Value
text:
I have stayed at The Fifty Hotel & Suites by Affinia 3-4 times in the past year. The rooms are clean priced very well for ew York. It is a great location for restaurants, work, ans shows. The doorman, Rome, remembers me and is most welcoming. Their computers on the second floor are very useful but slow. 

A great value! You can, and will pay much more in NYC If Trump invites you at stay free at Trump Tower, then go; else, stay and pay at The Affinia Fifty Hotel & Suites.

title: could be better
text: good location. staff hit or miss. garbage in the stairwell all day. common areas locked off hours for no clear reason. I did not like the $40 facility fee, it was a hidden rate hike  woudl chose another hotel next time

title: New York trip
text: We come to NYC a couple of times a year.  This was the first time we stayed at Fifty.  We had a beautiful corner suite.  Everything could not have been better.  The staff was helpful and pleasant.  It was a bit of a walk to Broadway, but would return again.  At least we got our exercise!

title: poor service
text:
The person working the front desk when I checked in late on 10/30, Wednesday, and the same person checked me out early am (7) on Monday 11/4 is surly, rude, uncooperative and couldn't get the credit card withhold straight. And I didn't receive a final bill showing what $$$ had been credited to my account and that the withhold had been released. A very bad choice to work on his own.
Lastly, the breakfast bar is not worth the $18 charge.

title: Great Hotel in NYC
text: Great hotel, rooms are very big and confortable, the hotel location is great. People at the hotel are very nice. Breakfast is very good. I didn't have the chance to go to de fitness room. Overall, the hotel es an excelent choice

title: Perfect Location and Friendly Staff
text: This was our second stay at the Fifty.  We love how big the room is compared to other more expensive NYC hotels.  Since our last stay, they have added a continental breakfast.  This hotel is across the street from Ess-A_Bagel.  This is our favorite bagel place in the city so this is another perk of this hotel.  Everybody at the hotel is so friendly.  Housekeeping, doormen, and the check-in staff were very nice.  The 5:00 wine hour is another great perk.  The only thing that I would have to complain about on this trip was our view.  It was one of a brick wall, however you can pay more for a view and a higher floor.  We were in 902 and it was great since we were not in the room very much anyway.  Subways are just down the street.  We hope to be back at the Fifty again soon!

title: Fantastic stay!
text: My daughter was celebrating her birthday and the staff went out of there way to make it extra special. We were upgraded to a suite and they left a surprise gift of goodies for my daughter to find at arrival. Thank you!

title: Great Hotel
text:
We had a fabulous experience staying here!!
On arrival the staff were extremely helpful and we got an upgrade to a fabulous one bedroom apartment on the 21st floor with amazing views 
We booked via Virgin so all our taxes were included 
Having a kitchen was very useful as we visited Ess- a bagel opposite ( brilliant bagels) every morning and ate in our apartment - location is great - walking distance to Grand Central- Times Square- ESB - Rockerfella Center 
Happy hour was great for a quick glass of wine and juice 
Halloween bags given to the children which was a nice touch
Local pizza delivery was also recommended by receptionist- great pizza!
Would highly recommend fifty Hotel and will definitely stay again

title: Unhelpful management staff
text: The manager on duty Carmel was very standoffish and unhelpful. I’ve been staying here for years and will be staying away while she is manager. The other experiences I have had have been pleasant. The location is great.

title: Quick business trip
text: Service at the hotel is excellent! Great happy hour ! rooms are good size for nyc! very friendly staff! Great location to midtown and upper east side and laguardia and JFK airports ! nice supply of last minute things, water, soda

title: Great location
text:
We were looking for two queen size beds in a room for less than a small fortune, so that  eliminates a lot of hotels right off the bat.  "Fifty NYC" had just that, for a mere $336/night.  In addition to the $336 there is the NYC Occupancy tax of $19.74, Room sales tax of $29.82, Occupancy Tax of $2.00, NYS Development Tax of $1.50, Hotel Facilities Fee (feeble Wi-fi) for $39.00, Sales tax on the Facilities fee for $3.46, and another, unexplained, NYC Occupancy tax for $2.29.  Grand total = $433.81.  
The room was fairly cramped, and the view was, um not great.  But, really, who spends time in a hotel room in New York?  The beds were comfy, and clean, and the maid service was fine.
Oh yeah, the doorman made a joke about me traveling with my son.  I was traveling with a friend who is almost the exact same age. That little comment depressed me for a few days.

title: Nice location, friendly helpful staff, clean, well appointed rooms
text: We stayed at the Affina Fifty for the second time and were very pleased. The hotel is in a nice central location, they have a friendly helpful staff, the common areas and rooms are clean and well appointed. Also for NYC the rooms are a good size.  The lounge on the second floor is particularly nice. Of course this is not a new, 5-star property, but for the category this property is in, we give it 5 stars!

title: Helpful staff
text:
Our room was very hot. We tried setting the thermostat to reduce the temperature but realized it was not working. Upon calling guest services, they informed us that the air conditioning has been turned off. They were nice to send up a fan to our room but this is not expected from a good hotel. Especially when you are paying over $200 per night for a single small room. The coffee was poor as well.
The people were nice and helpful though.

title: Great Room, Service and Stay, Noisy by Night on the 6th Floor
text: The room size was amazing and there was excellent service. However, where our room was there (6th floor facing the street) was quite a lot of noise pollution. Unless you're a deep sleeper, getting to sleep would be a little tricky.

title: Excellent
text:
First class hotel, great location. Friendly helpfull staff. Stayed there to celebrate our Golden Wedding. Reception staff very good, Kirsty, Leah & Jasmin, not forgetting Ron the doorman, a gentleman. Room very good and clean, comfortable bed and pillows. No shocks on checkout, highly recommended.
John & Linda from Yorkshire UK

title: Disappointing, Affinia!
text: We had stayed several times at another Affinia property in NY which has unfortunately been closed. Based on our good experiences there we chose another Affinia hotel for this trip. The Fifty’s location is great, the doormen were always cheerful, and the suite we had was comfortable overall. However, The Fifty did not measure up to our expectations of an Affinia property. There was only one person at the check-in desk the evening we arrived. We had checked in online and simply needed our room key. There were 3 parties ahead of us, so we had to wait in line 30 minutes to get our key. We had requested a “feather-free” room due to allergies. The front desk person said he was sure it had been taken care of. However, decorative pillows on the couch had feathers “leaking” from the seams, so no one had attended to our request. No one had attended to thoroughly cleaning the room between guests either. The trash can in the kitchenette had not been emptied. There were used bath towels hanging on the back of the bathroom door. When we went to tell the front desk, he apparently did not recognize us as people he had just checked in, because he told us if we’d just leave our used towels on the floor, housekeeping would know to pick them up. I told him they weren’t our towels...they were left from the previous guests and I didn’t particularly want to touch them. On the subject of towels, one of the bath towels they stocked in the room had a 4-5 inch rip in it. On the last morning of our four night stay, I decided to make a cup of coffee. When I pulled out the tray to place the coffee pods, there were two used pods (from previous guests) which had been sitting there at least four days. Finally, hotels are now commonly charging a daily “resort” fee in addition to the room charge. To offset part of this fee, the hotel gave a $10 daily credit per room to be used in their “store.” Unfortunately the “store” wasn’t well stocked, rendering the $10 daily credit hardly usable.

title: Guests Beware
text:
The hotel is in a good location, that’s where it ends.
The room i stayed in was dirty and the entire room had an awful smell, the lamp shades on the lamps have been replaced and don’t match, the carpets are only vacuumed around the bedside tables so the carpet here is filthy.  This is a cheap and nasty hotel who somehow have managed a 4 star rating and charge accordingly, they don’t charge what its actually worth which is a lot less. They don’t even advise of any amenities so what do you do, roam around? They do however ask for money upfront with your credit card for the mystery amenities.  The breakfast set up is a joke so don’t consider your set for the day with getting breakfast.

title: Stayed for two nights. Excellent service.
text: Large, very clean suite. The full kitchen was a plus, especially for NYC. Staff is super-friendly and accommodating. I have stayed here several times and it has always been a pleasure. Doormen were especially helpful and cheerful. Great location also - can walk to the Met museum of art.

title: Beautiful hotel in perfect location!
text:
Came to NYC for a wedding and to spend a little extra time sightseeing and Fifty Hotel was in a great central location for all my needs. When I wasn't bouncing between Midtown, Queens and Brooklyn, I really enjoyed hanging around the hotel. The staff was very friendly and the free daily wine hour is a major plus! 

I bragged to my other friends who were in town for the wedding that I picked the best hotel and recommended it to everyone who has a trip here coming up.

title: Ripoff
text:
Amenities charge is a ripoff. None were used. No other comments.
If you want repeat visitors you should change this so that guests pay for what they use.
I repeat.
Amenities charge is a ripoff. None were used. No other comments.
If you want repeat visitors you should change this so that guests pay for what they use.

title: Great home base in NY!
text: I really enjoyed my stay here, the room was really large and the bed was extremely comfortable. The wine hour was a nice touch and I enjoyed have a drink there before heading out each night. I’d highly recommend this place and will stay there again next time I’m in NYC!

title: No A/C and room dirty on arrival
text:
This hotel turns off its A/C after the summer so I couldn’t get my room temp below about 75 degrees. The front desk suggested I open the window but then I just heard constant street noise. It was impossible to sleep well in the hot, stagnant air. I was in town with a group of work colleagues for a conference and everyone commiserated each morning about how horrible their sleep at the hotel was.

Room was also dirty on arrival - photo attached.

I’ve probably logged 500 hotel nights at this point and have never felt a room was worth so little compared to how much it cost.

title: Nightmare on 50th Street!
text:
I have no idea how this hotel appears get good reviews, from arrival the staff are unwelcoming and abrupt unless what appears to be that you are an American or a regular. The only other time I went to reception was to ask for address of nearest Doctor as my husband was very ill, she gave me verbal directions which is no good if your just a visitor to NY, I asked for the address and she huffed and said she would need to do a Google search for it, I waited for her to do that! Even the concierge was rude, on arrival he was casually chatting to someone and didn’t even offer to open the door. He did offer huge smiles when our luggage was being held until 4pm and obviously looking for an equally huge tip.

When we arrIved at the reception of Fifty Suites, the chap on reception stated that we had to pay for our room, I produced our travel documents clearly showing, double room and resort fee included, his colleague came across and without lifting their heads said we had to pay the $300 in advance for incidentals that we use….reluctantly we did so.  I was now having bad vibes of this place and rightly so!   We were given Room 301, this is a dumping room that they don’t even clean the windows of, it’s obviously a room for 3rd party bookings ie, anyone other than direct bookings.  The air con for the entire building is right outside the window, that’s the only view, next to the door is the bin chute and next to lift shaft, reception weren’t too pleased but agreed that we could have another room the next day after 3pm and not to unpack. After an extremely noisy sleepless night we moved to 515, the room smells of dampness, the carpets as sticky at parts, the room is dark and shabby and the bathroom lacked any space to move, the housekeeping really need some basic training, our bed was changed once and only because we asked and the top sheet only went half way down and the pillow menu is a joke as the pillows are all well used & worn. In the safe we found a previous guests boarding tickets, proving these rooms are not properly / suitably  cleaned for new guests  The tea and coffee was also only replenished when requested, the coffee machine is inadequate and fiddly, there is no complimentary water, this is $8 for 500ml at reception the only mirror is in the bathroom and with no fan it steams up and most likely the damp smell is a result of no ventilation,  I have never been in a hotel room without a mirror, the blinds do not fit the width of the window, the décor cushion was soiled, the front of the heater was held on by the edge of the chair and my husband did his best to secure it. In addition, you cannot control the room temp as this is done by the hotel so too bad if your cold. They also charge for Wi-fi at £14.95 per day unless this is part of your package. Nothing is explained at check in, the ‘tuck shop’ we learned of later when getting water and the happy hour which we didn’t use is actually one glass of wine if you chose to go. 

After all of the above it gets even worse, checking out we were told we didn’t have any charges and she had refunded the $300.  Once home I checked our statement as I just could not shake off the bad vibe of this place, they had taken our room payment even though they had seen the paperwork clearly showing we had paid for it and a further 2 unauthorised payments totalling almost $1500.  We have had to get our credit card company involved and thankfully it has been resolved albeit the stress and having to cancel our card in case of any other unauthorised payments being taken, could have been worse if we had not used our credit card and used a debit card! 

We love NY and were revisiting after being married there 18 months ago, our previous stay was at the wonderful Archer Hotel which was fully booked so we chose this one based on reviews & location, I even emailed prior to going requesting a front facing room as it was a special trip, they didn’t respond! The hotel ruined part of our stay but we will return to NYC but most definitely not to the Fifty Suites by Affinia, who’s Management obviously do not take note of the negative reviews.

Please also note that anyone can walk in and around this hotel and the lifts are not operated with your room card so security is non existent.

title: durty water coming out
text:
There was brownish dirty water that was coming out the pipe. the hotel sent a repair guy but in the meantime while it was been fixed when my mother asked where she is suppose to get clean water that can be used, the reception told her to go the second floor. Unbelievable !! your pipe give durty water and you cant even offer bottled water to a guest. the guest is required to go down to the 2rnd floor and serve herlself. 
what a terrible experience. and my mom was also told by a reception lady there that she was not allowed to buy breakfast from their and add to the room bill. Yet the date before she checked into the hotel I went there myself to pay for the room and put my credit card as guarantee so that any expenses ( foods and breakfast and drinks) are charged to my card. the guy sent me the form and it took me a while to fill out and complete. Saying that I am disapointed in this hotel is an understatement,

title: Super hôtel
text: Super hôtel, le personnel est super agréable, l’hôtel hyper bien situé au centre de tout. C’est très propre et bien équipé. Le petit déjeuner continental est bon et très copieux. Je recommande sans hésiter.

title: Comfortable Boutique Hotel, Clean, Nice and Well located
text: Rooms are Giant for NYC, Staff is friendly.  Very comfortable real estate with nice 2nd floor lounge to hang out in.  The only reason I didn't give it a full 5 is this weird daily charge that really was expensive and isn't that useful.  I think happy hour drinks should be for free - and the snacks I can pay for.

title: Excellent Midtown choice!
text: My wife and I stayed here for a long weekend Oct 12th. It is well placed for the theaters and for local restaurants. We also walked to and through Central Park. The staff were wonderful, and we enjoyed the wine hour before going out each evening. What really made this visit special was the upgrade to a Junior Suite. Our room was huge, with very comfortable bed and a balcony with great view. We will be back! Thanks to all of the staff for making our weekend special!

title: New York trip
text: Having booked this at last minute as Thomas cook ceased trading we should have been in the Rui plaza . It was ok beds was comfy shocking view and no bar but they advertise a wine hr . Never went so can’t comment on that it was clean you had to leave a credit card and it was charged 200 dollars for any room service or extra charges we wasn’t told this and only took a debit card and cash they wouldn’t take so they just said with out a credit card we can’t check you in ! Any way it did get charged to my debit card and I will get charged lesson learnt take my credit card . It was about half hr walk to Times Square but not a problem wouldn’t go back as the location was not ideal for us that was the view from our room with virgin holidays we didn’t stay in the room only to sleep but it was a bit disappointing

title: Great hotel for a girl's weekend!
text: Good experience with large rooms and queen size beds for 4 gals on a weekend trip!  Loved the kitchen in room and appreciate hotel's guest services.  Would have liked the wine hour to be longer period of time each day but overall would highly recommend the hotel!

title: All good
text:
The location is very good,  with shops, museums and sights within 20/30 minutes walk.
We chose to upgrade our original booking; this was done swiftly and efficiently by email and our suite had a large terrace. There was some traffic noise but, for us, this was no more than could be expected in midtown Manhattan. 
All staff, from front desk to housekeeping, were unfailingly pleasant and helpful and we would happily return.

title: Hidden fees, hidden rates
text: I was surprised by a “hotel facilities fee” at checkout. These are not part of the rates as explained by clerks and are neither properly explained by clerks at check-in nor at Booking.com website. These hidden fees are circa 10% of the room rate, and is actually a surcharge. When I asked attendants at check out about what the “facilities fee” were relate to, I was explained that the fees “were to provide guests with infrastructure (???) and amenities (???)”. The said hidden fee is charged on a daily basis and one can offset $10 against it, making guests consume  just to minimize the net charge. However, the $10 allowance is lower that the average $40 hidden fee/rate. For long stays, the hidden fee is painful. I was really disappointed about the pricing scheme and will recommend friends and coworkers to avoid the property.

title: Good location - Poor service
text:
Overall the location was good and the hotel ok. However I was unhappy at paying over $200 For 5 nights for the resort fee as not every nyc hotel charges this. 

Out of the 5 nights our room was not cleaned 2 of them. When I approached the front desk I was told that they had finished for the evening and that was that. There was no apology from the management and no attempt to try and resolve this, 

Sorry affinia not good enough must try harder. There are so many other hotels to chose from with better service in NYC, go somewhere else where you will get a better service

The doormen however were great and the knowledge and experience of the area excellent

title: NYC Fall Break Trip
text:
We had a short time in NYC over the weekend.  Yet, the people at the Fifty Hotel made it a GREAT experience.  From the nice people at the counter that continuously were overly nice and accommodating with time, maps, directions, suggestions to see places.... to the 2 doormen which were always in a great mood with High Fiving my kids every time they came to the hotel and doing Magic tricks for a smile as we left the hotel daily.  
The room was nice and bed's were extremely comfortable.   Having a fridge and microwave (and stove although we did not use it) was a nice added convenience.  It is in a great location.  Close to Time Square (walkable) and subway (1 block) and Rockefeller Center.  We also walked to Central Park - little farther but not an issue.  
They also have a free wine hour from 5 - 6.  We were out seeing the city at that time, but nice to have if we would have been back at that time.

title: poor
text:
I slept in 301 directly besides the central air conditioning of the hotel. It was horribly noisy, I had trouble sleeping. Being on a business trip from overseas, allowing me to sleep was the most important task of the hotel room.
Pillows were excellent, though.

title: Customer service wont respond to email
text: the room was great ,location very convenient and the price very reasonable for a New York suite but I had an issue with the credit.Contacted them many times and never got a response back.Still waiting

title: Awesome
text:
In short: fantastic stay that made us feel like home.
Staff was super friendly. Checkin easy. The first appartment we were given had a little food smell (from the outside). We were shown different other rooms and could change. 
The concierge gave high-5 to our kids every day and showed magic tricks. The kids loved it.
The appartment itself was very clean, nicely set up and had a kitchen area incl fridge.

title: Great Midtown Hotel
text: Very nice hotel staff and doormen! Clean hotel with spacious rooms! Walking distance to lots of restaurants, Lexington Gill, Smith & Wollensky's, Serendipity 3, Rockefeller Center & other midtown sights!! It was easy to get taxis as well!!

title: Gem of a place
text: My family and I were staying at the Affinia for a week and then we came back for 2 days the following week. We were dropping off our son to college in Vermont and decided to spend some time in NYC. This place came recommended from a dear friend so we decided to stay here. The staff was awesome, Rome and Lenny made the stay so memorable by always greeting us with a smile and pleasant demeanour. Brian the manager was so accommodating and made us feel very welcome, would like to mention Franz here as well once he saw the bags we had he upgraded us to a suite so we would not be cramped! As ex New Yorkers this will now be our go to place when we visit the city. I would also like to mention that one bad apple can really leave a bad taste and Ruth was that for us. She did not have the right attitude to be in the service industry! That's the reason I gave a four star!

title: Posizione Ottima.
text: Situato in centro, 5 minuti a piedi per rockfeller Center. Metro vicinissima per poter raggiungere le principali attrazioni. wi fi nelle stanze a pagamento con costo abbastanza elevato. Moquette non molto pulita. Noi ultima notte in bagno abbiamo trovato uno scarafaggio

title: Facility fees are too high
text: Adding in facility fees is a scam. The total amount of the facility fees came to over 40 Dollars with tax per day. That was to cover WiFi  and a $10 bar credit and the gym. Not worth the extra cost and you have no choice but to accept, Beware. hotel was other wise nice but it is not a good feeling to be nickeled and dimed. They should have included the cost in the hotel room price.

title: Decent rooms bad service
text:
Rooms: mostly good.  It’s a standard nyc hotel room, but my shower was broken and the temperature constantly fluctuated on it’s own.   

Service: bad.  I had several unanswered calls to the front desk.   When they did pick up, they were generally rude and unhelpful — one woman in particular.  She became frustrated and snappy when I called to ask about laundry service (the number listed in my room for laundry was disconnected).  She incorrectly insisted the hotel only did dry cleaning and not laundry.  I explained that the form in my room gave the option for dry cleaning or laundry, but she angrily insisted I can do my own laundry and they only do dry cleaning.  I had to speak to her manager to get someone send up to pick up my clothes for laundry. 

When I called a second time to make sure my laundry would be returned by 7pm as promised, I got the same lady.  She told me it would probably be 30 min to an hour late because of traffic.  I asked whether there was anything we could do to expedite (I had a event to get to) and she said no, because it’s contracted out.  No apology for it being late and definitely no offer to help.  

Other than that, it was fine.

title: Keep looking
text: The front desk staff was friendly, but could not find our reservation made through hotels.com which delayed our check-in.   I'm assuming that since I made our "budget" reservation through the app that we were given the worst room in the hotel.  I can't imagine the rest of the rooms were this bad. Buyer beware on purchasing hotels with apps.  You'll pay a bit less, but since you've prepaid the hotel now has carte blanche to give you the room they won't give to anyone else.  In this case, it felt like a basement room, one high window 7 feet in the air looking out on the bottom of the a/c units. The room was warm when we walked in. The PTAC unit didn't work.  A wall mounted LG ductless mini-split had been installed. The remote controller for it was non-intuitive.  It kicked on and blew cold air on us all night. There were long hairs all over the bathroom.  Having just completed medical treatment, we were too tired to complain, so I don't know how the staff would have reacted had we done so.  We went to sleep on an old creaky mattress and left early the next morning.  Since it was UN Week in NYC, we paid $650 for a room no better than the worst Motel 6 you've ever stayed in.  Our fave hotel on the same block is The Kimberly.  Second fave is the San Carlos.  Both of those were booked up so we gave 50 a try. We won't be back.

title: Favorite Hotel in NYC - AMAZING STAFF
text:
I’ve stayed at this hotel three times - twice with friends and this last time, solo for a week. Not only is the location perfect but the beds are comfy and the amenities are great! I completely agree with other reviewers that it’s the people working there that continually make this hotel stand out each time. 
I originally started this review for MARCO, ROMAN, and JAVON! Not only were they extremely kind and personable, but they helped me with where to eat, what to do, and how to get everywhere. When you walk in they say ‘Welcome Home’ with huge smiles :). Being alone on this trip was different for me but these guys made me feel safe, informed, heard, and basically ‘at home’ . Literally EVERYONE there blew me away but these guys stood out.
Samuel and Kristin were also one a million! 
I can’t wait to go back and see my new friends!

title: weekend trip NY with a friend
text: very comfortable beds. But a very noisy old fashioned airconditioning. Check in was not very friendly after a journey of 10 hrs. It was oblidate to pay a a feasable fee of 39 dollars per day which made the room even more expensive than it already was.

title: Great stay in heart of midtown
text: Very nice clean rooms. Great view. The staff are incredibly friendly and very helpful. The suite amenities for cooking are very useful, especially if you're staying for extended business trips. 10/10 would recommend

title: Excelente alternativa para conocer NYC
text: Excelente hotel para estar cerca de todo en la gran manzana. Muy cerca también de principales líneas de subte. La atención del personal es excelente. A la noche se duerme de maravilla. Café de cortesía siempre disponible. Éramos 5 en una suite con cocina y resultó super cómoda. Sin duda volvería y lo recomendaría.

title: Loved Loved LOVED!!!!
text:
I’d like to start off with this was my first trip to NYC, EVER! One of my biggest concerns with traveling is my hotel stay. I loved to be comfortable and feel at home, otherwise I could have saved my money and stayed at home. When I tell you this hotel was SPECTACULAR, I mean just that. From the front desk, (ask for Franz, he’s quit AMAZIMG!!), the doormen, the sip and sit, the continual help with directions and recommendations on where to eat, the list goes on and on. But honey, my room/apartment/condo was beyond what I could have asked for. We had a balancing, a kitchenette (with a gas stove, nice touch), a humongous floor to ceiling mirror, two queen plush bed (don’t lay on them if you aren’t trying to go to sleep), a nice sized flat screen, a 180 degree window view and did I forget to mention put BALCONY?? Hands down one of the best trips I’ve had and mostly the credit goes to this amazing hotel! I can’t wait to come visit you all again! 

Thank you kindly!! 
A very happy and appreciative customer!

title: NY in September
text: Have stayed at the Affinia 50 several times over the years and will  continue to refer folks to this hotel as well as stay again.  The hotel has various room sizes, the staff is friendly and helpful and the location can't be beat.

title: Nice place
text:
EVERYONE of the staff were courteous, friendly and made you feel welcome to be their guests.
The breakfast continental buffet was very popular and, as a result, a bit crowded at the buffet table and for seating, however, the same rooms are used for social hour which is most adequate. Our suite was most spacious and quite.  Would definitely stay again and recommend to others.

title: Good experience
text: Had an issue in the beginning but the manager,Ryan, was attentive and worked to fix the issue (brown water in the shower; leaking toilet). His efforts helped to turn our experience around. I was there for medical appointments—typically monthly or twice a month—which are stressful but the hotel environment and quality helped.

title: Great Experience
text: I just spent two nights at Fifty Hotels and Suites. My overall experience was excellent. The room was large, the beds were comfortable, the A/C worked well and the shower was big, especially for NYC. As good as the facilities were. I was most impressed with the Customer Service. I appreciated being greeted at the front door with a "Welcome Home" each time I returned and was also served so well at the Front Desk by Jasmine. I had a coupe specific questions/issues with my bill that she addressed and resolved on the spot! Every team member I encountered had a smile and a friendly greeting for me.

title: Clean Hotel, Friendly Staff, Large Room
text:
The hotel is in a good location.  The staff is very nice, helpful and very attentive to their guests.
The room was very clean, a must for our travels, and we enjoyed the free beverages on the second floor, a very nice touch!

title: Great Location
text: The location was great. The room was very clean and housekeeping was awesome. The bathroom counter was very small and room could use more mirrors. With 4 ladies, it was difficult to get ready in comparison to other hotels we have stayed in. The bell hop was amazing!  We checked our bags with them after checking out and even left our expensive shopping purchases with no issues at all. Overall, I would stay here again.

title: Wonderful stay
text: Staff was excellent. Stayed with my husband and our 4 month old for the weekend. cribs are available upon request - pack  play. Brought our own sheets for the crib, worked out perfectly. rooms were quiet. Would recommend.

title: Wonderful hotel with just as wonderful staff!
text: I have stayed at this hotel three times now.  We drove from Boston so it is great because it is right off of the FDR highway.  Very easy to get to - just valet up to the front, give them my car and off I go.  The staff was wonderful, in particular was the bellman Rome.  He was so personable and extremely helpful.  The rooms were a generous size and very clean.  Will certainly book again if I venture again to NYC!

title: great location in NYC
text: I only stayed one night to visit my college daughter in NYC but enjoyed the light filled room (not always the case in NYC), location (one block to the train station and many food options). the staff was very nice. spotless room.

title: Excelente stadia otra vez/ Great stay again
text:
Cada vez mejor , estuvimos en el Fifty Affinia hace 9 años y fue excelente, volvimos el pasado fin de Julio y principio de Agosto 2019 y fue aun mejor! Todo el hotel fue renovado. nos toco una habitacion super comoda en el piso 12 , luminosa, , con dos ventanales en L , escritorio, frigobar y cafetera y la sopresa al llegar: la heladera estaba llena con frutas, bocados dulces y salados , cajas con crackers, peanut butter, raisings, agua mineral y una boellita de vino , mas, el wine hour de todos los dias en el segundo piso. Conclusión , la heladera y la despensa llenas para picar algo durante el dia cuando volviamos al hotel despues de andar todo el dia, o  para el desayuno durante toda la estadía ( 7 noches) . La cama enorme y super cómoda también! 
Otro detalle es el personal, son todos super amables , las chicas en la recepción, los chicos en la puerta , nos recibian con una sonrisa y un simple Hi Welcome home ! hciendonos sentir en casa. Dejamos la habitacion a las 12 am y nuestro vuelo salia a la noche asi que nos guardaron las valijas y luego nos habiliataron una habitacón y baño completos en planta baja para asearnos y cambiarnos antes de partir, siempre con una sonrisa y muy buena onda, thank you Smalia, Marco , Samuel! la ubicación es otro gran plus!
Sin duda volveria al Fifty y lo recomiendo a todos los que vayan a NYC.

title: Fading Fast
text: I've stayed at Fifty Hotel at least 10 times, and I always found it to have the right balance between affordability, location, comfort and service. This will probably be my last time to stay at this hotel. Not only has the hotel implemented a "resort fee or facilities fee" for basic stuff that used be included such as the gym (which is tiny and poorly maintained), but also the free wine and cheese hour every evening. Now, guests are being forced to pay for stuff that they may or may not even want. Guests are charged $10/day for items at the lobby store (i.e., water, juice, wine, etc.). Of course, it's presented as a "credit" for free stuff at the store, but you have to pay $40 facilities fee whether you consume items from the store or not. The rooms are generally noisy, but this time I had a room close the Lexington Ave and it was so noisy that even my ear plugs were of no use. Even though the beds were made on daily basis, for some reason housekeeping never emptied the garbage can.  That was a real head scratcher. I can't recommend this hotel.

title: nice property in good location to get around
text:
has nice large rooms and as there were 3 of us we used the sofa bed so we each had a bed each, which was very comfortable. they only give you a sheet for it mind, had to ask for a blanket which is needed when you have the air con on. 
its in a good location to get to most stuff, its in a pretty pricey area so we bought our own breakfast for in the room and ate out lunch and dinner
would defo stay here again if i came back to NY

title: Wonderful staff and hotel
text: Everyone at the hotel was very polite, courteous and professional.  The suite was outstanding with fantastic views.  It was so nice to have the credit at the cupboard for a late night snack. There were plenty of things to choose from.

title: stay away from this hotel the front desk associate are very rude
text: I had horrible stay at fifty hotel and suites by affinia, i was racially profiled, i was disrespected and the worst part is i report all the issues for the general manager, i wrote him a letter through gmial, hoping to get a response but no replies at all, and it has been over a month know,

title: Nice room, poor front desk service
text: We arrived in town early, so we could catch a Broadway matinee. We didn't expect our room to be ready and it wasn't, but the front desk clerk was extremely rude about it. We asked them to hold our bags and we went to pick up our show tickets. Over an hour later, we checked back and our room still wasn't ready, although the couple in front of us were given a room with the clerk saying, "Good timing! Your room is ready early!" When we explained we needed to change clothes for the show, they said we could get things out of our bags in the storage room, but never suggested we could use the fitness center to change, so we had to dress in the baggage room! When we finally got our room later, the thermostat was set so low that it was freezing in the room. When we mentioned it to front desk, they took the liberty of putting a space heater in our room while we were gone and turning it on full blast. So we returned to the room later and it was over 80 degrees in there! The room itself was fine, although the bathroom was TINY without a real door, just a sliding barn-type door that didn't close all the way. Very disappointed with the room and service provided.

title: Eenvoudig en lekker centraal
text: Leuk hotel met veel verschillend ingedeelde kamers. Best eenvoudig maar voldoet aan alle wensen voor een zakelijke overnachting. Kamers bij de liften zijn wel erg gehorig. Minibar deed het niet, maar wel goed koffie-apparaat op de kamers. Uitzicht van een enkel raam is tegen een hoge muur dus absoluut geen daglicht naar binnen. Na een paar dagen wordt dat best vervelend.

title: slipping some over the years, still good value
text: square footage for the price is good. Checkin person was not friendly or helpful.  in fact he was rude and didnt know the package I had purchased and was creluctant to help to let you know the stuff you needed to know with the package. May look elsewhere next time because of this person. Everybody else was fine. .

title: Relaxing in Midtown
text: From the moment we exited the cab, we were greeted with warmth and friendliness.  We needed a fan for the room and one was immediately delivered to the room. We are traveling for treatments at Sloan and my husband is now non-verbal.  The bellman remembered this, and as we were leaving the hotel the next morning, he made sure to greet my husband with the best of wishes for the day. We were unexpectedly bumped up to a suite, which provided us with much needed relaxation.  The room was spacious and well furnished.  There are many restaurants in a variety of price ranges within walking distance.  A lovely oasis in Midtown.

title: Pleasantly surprised
text:
Family of 6 staying in 3 rooms. 2 rooms upgraded to accommodate us all on one floor.
All staff were helpful, friendly and courteous 
Rooms a very good size and clean. 2 rooms had view of a brick wall, this didn't bother us as plenty of views seen during the day. 
Was noisy of a night but again we were expecting this staying in a city. 
Everything was in walking distance, plenty of good places to eat near by.
Thoroughly enjoyed our stay in NYC and would certainly recommend this hotel to family and friends

title: Enjoyable stay
text: I have visited this property a few times already and every visit has been a great experience. All of the staff, from the doormen to the desk personnel have always been friendly, helpful and very professional. The rooms are nice and clean with super comfortable beds. I look forward to my next visit.

title: perfect location great staff and large room
text:
I stayed at the fifty and enjoyed my stay very much
the hotel has a great convenient location in midtown and the rooms were roomy and ours even had a kitchen
the staff was very very very helpful and friendly
the den is a nice lounge where you can sit and chat or use your computer - it felt like being at home

title: Labor Day Weekend
text:
Pros: Convenient location, friendly staff, clean room and close to subway
Con: Bathroom on the small size barely accommodate 2 people at the same time. $65 daily parking doesn't allow for unlimited in/out.  Each time you take the car out is $65.

title: carol
text: your maid sprayed cleaning chemicals all over my open suitcase and the clothing in it!  I'm very angry about this and hope my clothes aren't ruined forever.  Not sure how to get the chemicals and strong smell out.

title: Construction
text: We should have been warned before booking about the noise.  Major construction to the point that there were ear plugs in the room.  This was not an emergency, it was ongoing.  Oh well, now we know to call ahead prior to booking in the future.

title: An unexpected surprise in the heart on NYC
text: When I got the final quote for my summer weekend stay (be sure to excavate their website for special offers), I kind of wondered what the catch was. Because for a declared 4-star hotel almost in the heart of NYC, it seemed too good to be true. Well it turned out there was no catch! Yes, there are hidden fees and street noise (either that, or radiator noise), but this is Manhattan. The rooms are spacious, the feel of the hotel, while not exactly luxurious, is fresh and cozy, and overall this was good value for money.

title: Great location
text:
Had an issue with mustiness in bathroom & no trash can. They took care of it immediately when i brought it to their attention. 
i didn't like the extra charge each day for the hotel facilities fee which is an additional $39 + tax a day. It was an unnecessary charge & most not used.

title: US Open trip
text: Great hotel.  Nice to have kitchen and not have to eat out all the time.  Hotel staff was great, service prompt, and love the "free" goodies everyday (makes for an easy snack after running around town).  Close to transit also.

title: Great Experience
text: Took my daughter for to the Big City for her 10th Birthday. Hotel was recommended by the American Girl Store and I was not disappointed. It was by far the best hotel I ever stayed in in NY. Spacious & clean room & bathroom, and a very friendly staff that accommodated our every need. I will definitely return should I find myself in NY again.

title: Good place to enter to NY
text: Fifty Hotel & Suites by Affinia - Very good location, convenient connection to the city, walking distance to many interesting places. 3 rd Ave is not most noisy. Staff is friendly and helpful. Effective price to performance factor.

title: Ok hotel.
text: Ok hotel. Downgraded to a room with a sofa even though we reserved a suite. Wanted to be separated from kids but didn't happen. Long check in line. Rooms should be released as they are ready not all at once at 3PM. Our room had a clogged bathroom tub and sink. But Chrissy at front desk was awesome! Very accommodating. Should get a promotion!

title: Friendly staff, but ...
text: The staff at reception and room cleaning are quite friendly.  The overall facilities are minimum enough, however, I did not recognize the value of additional facility fees of $40 per night.  In addition, some areas of the room has not been cleaned with dust.  Being in the Midtown, the outside noise are on for 24 hours.

title: Comfortable and convenient
text:
We just returned from a nine night stay at this hotel and would definitely recommend.

It's close to a major subway station and walking to either Times Square or Top of the Rock is easy. It's also very comfortable and clean and the staff were very friendly. The rooms are surprisingly big.

So why not five stairs? Well, when we checked in late at night the room we needed with two beds and a bath for our son wasn't available so had to be checked in to a different room in the meantime. We got moved the following day but it would have been great to unpack earlier. Also, there was zero free wifi. Luckily, by perching at the end of the bed we got some free wifi from elsewhere but it's odd to find any hotel today that doesn't give free wifi.

But that aside, this is a real gem.

title: 2 rooms, one with a view sort of...
text: first room we had on the 3rd floor had  terrific view of the AC system, I suspect we drew the worst room going, such is life, we asked to move and the very lovely receptionist said the were full but could move tomorrow. The room had a fairly strong musty smell. Day 2 room 2. Same floor but we could see 50/3rd ave which was much better - same smell oddly enough.

title: Tourist for a day in my hometown
text: Fifty was a great location for taking my cousin who was visiting for a tour nearby. Safe area, lots of options for restaurants in all price ranges and central for most transportation. The staff was very friendly, the rooms were clean & up to date with comfortable beds. The bathroom was extremely spacious especially for a NYC hotel... that was an unexpected perk! The only thing was that the tub was peeling from the high water pressure. Overall it was a great stay and definitely recommend.

title: Great location and wonderful staff/AG package needs improvement
text:
We booked this hotel for its American Girl Package.  I wanted to surprise my child and the Fifty offered a reasonable rate.  We found the AG package to be no frills so if you are seeking a better AG experience I would go to another hotel.  

Upon check-in, the clerk was very friendly and confirmed that I was staying as part of the package, however, I did not receive an explanation/information pamphlet, with the exception of breakfast, on how things worked under this program.  Like other hotels, I assumed that the red AG bag would be waiting in our room, which would have been really nice for my child to see.  Once I realized that the bag was not there, I called the Front Desk to confirm that we have the AG package.  The man who answered asked "is the room not set up?"  when I answered "no" he said that he will come up with the bag right away.  This conversation led me to believe that the red bag was supposed to be in my room prior to check-in.  As we were staying two nights under this package, I also thought that the turn down/sweet treat applied to the two nights (the website was unclear).  The first night was great.  The staff member placed the made-up doll bed with a treat on the main bed and my child was delighted. The second night, there was no such treatment.  

At check-out, I talked to the front desk about the underwhelming experience we had with the AG package and she clarified that the turn down/sweet treat only applied to the first night and that the red bag would have been presented during turn down on the same night.  This was not clear on the website,  If I knew this when I making a reservation on-line, I would have not stayed at the hotel.  

I think the hotel could have put more effort to make the AG experience better such as:  perform a turn down service every night with a sweet treat; my child received a 50 cent lollipop as her sweet treat the first night, a bad choice for a pre-bedtime snack.  Offering cookies or a small chocolate would have been better.  If not, spending another 50 cents on a lollipop for the second night would have been better than nothing; have the red AG bag sitting on the bed prior to check-in.  For a child, seeing the fancy bag waiting for them is really exciting; and hand out an information pamphlet detailing the package at check-in.  I had forgotten about the access to a personal shopper at the AG store since I made the reservation about three weeks prior to arrival.  A pamphlet would have reminded me.  

Despite the disappointing AG package, the stay was great!  The bed was comfortable and the space was pretty big for a NY hotel.  The decor was very stylish with color block curtains and a white leather chair in the corner.  The bathroom was also clean and had fluffy towels.  The best part of our stay was the staff.  They were so friendly and I can tell that they love working there.  Everyone had a smile on their face.  The doorman was very friendly and took his time greeting us every morning.  We stayed on the 12th floor so we had a pretty good view.  The location was wonderful too.  It was a little far from the AG store, but there were restaurants, cafes, a really nice bagel shop, and other shopping amenities nearby.  

All in all we had a great stay and my child was happy because she was able to go to the AG store whenever she wanted.  We will definitely stay there again (sans the AG package)!

title: Fantastic Hotel!
text: Friendly and welcoming staff. Excellent room with a tremendous view of the NYC streets and buildings. Great location in midtown with wonderful eats within walking distance. The metro is easily accessible too. Second stay at this hotel and cannot wait to go back!

title: Nice hotel good location big room
text: Stayed in August had a great room very big room compared to other rooms I’ve stayed at in New York.hotel was also clean and modern.hotel is on 50th street and 3rd ave so not far from Central Park and the shops on 5th ave, time sq is about 10 min walk .parking was $75 for an jeep think small cars are $65. Has a self laundry if need. Would defiantly staff again

title: AMAZING TEAM AND WONDERFUL STAFF! THANK YOU AFFINA
text:
We stayed at Affina Fifty from August 14, 2019 to August 18, 2019.
I would like to thank everyone who works there for making our stay with you extra special.
Special thanks to the following:
Teela Nakashian who was very helpful and supportive when arranging this trip . We needed special accommodations because we were traveling with my disabled dad. 
Teela made sure all accommodations necessary for him were all in place before our arrival.
I will agree with another review: "Jasmine is the front desk Goddess" . Jasmine made sure the check in process went smoothly. She really went above and beyond to make sure our stay was pleasant and memorable.
Kristy at the front desk was also very helpful.
Thank You Rita from housekeeping!!!!!
She kept our suite impeccably clean and was very helpful.
Thanks to the bellman -- Rome, Samuel, Lenny, Marco ( I hope I am not forgetting any of them) They were all so kind. They went above and beyond to help us in anyway that they could.
We had a little problem with the A/C and the front desk manager --- Franz?? on Sunday morning did his best to make thing right.
Congratulations  Mr. Gehlich ! You and your team made this family trip awesome.
I don't have enough words to describe how grateful we are. You and the amazing team you have assembled are " #1. "
Millions of Thank You's !!!
I forward to seeing you soon.
Barbara Bove and Jeffrey Ulness
NYC
#nowords #grateful

title: 1 bedroom apartment
text: Although the one bedroom apt are nice in Affinia and I have booked with them many times, this last stay I did have a few issues with the room. First I had to deal with a loud and annoying noise coming from the kitchen for a whole week, non-stop. Although I complained from the first day it took me three complains to get someone attention and move me to another room after a whole week! The new room was nicer but no AC in the bedroom. I complained about it but none did anything and I have to sleep a whole week without AC in August... not very pleasant.

title: In need of renovations and updating
text: My husband and 2 teenagers stayed here for 3 nights in a room with 2 queen beds. The location is great and overall, the staff is very friendly, especially the doormen. We had a very early flight the day we arrived and unfortunately were not able to get into our room until 4:00 (even though we were told they would try and get us in earlier). The room was decent size considering we were in NYC but not any bigger than a standard hotel room. The beds were comfortable and there was a coffee maker available. The bathroom really was in poor shape. It was very old and worn out plus the vent and the light in the shower were disgustingly dirty. It reminded me of a bathroom in a dorm room. The walls were covered in old, dirty wallpaper and the tile in the shower was coming apart. I was also surprised at the lack of attention by the housekeeping staff. We were left coffee packets the first day when we checked in but not any of the other days when our room was cleaned.  Also, I had to call down for toilet paper because we were left with a tiny roll and no spare. The other thing about the room was that it was very noisy and there was no way to control the temperature. The thermostat consistently said 66 degrees but it was always very warm in there. It was noisy because the windows weren't sealed properly. My husband discovered that they could be opened which is pretty dangerous if you have little kids. There is a common area on the second floor with seating and tv's to watch plus they have coffee in the morning available and wine from 5-6 every day which is nice.  Another example of the way the housekeeping staff operates...one morning we went in to get a cup of coffee while we were waiting for our teenagers to get up and the woman working the buffet breakfast was walking in front of us.  There was a cheerio on the floor and instead of picking it up, she kicked it under the closest couch. The doormen were always very helpful and held our luggage for us because we had a late flight. As long as your expectations aren't too high and you don't pay too much for a room, it's a decent place in a good location.

title: Nice Little City Break!
text: The property is in an ideal location with easy access to attractions such as Times Square and the Rockefeller Centre. The staff at the property are highly attentative and will do what ever they can to cater for the needs of your party as best they can. We was shocked as we entered the room to see how spacious they are and I can say it is the biggest hotel room I have ever stayed in without a doubt in New York and some other cities across the US. The rooms are cleaned to a very high standard with bedding changed daily. There is also a communal area on the 2nd floor which gives you a chance to socialise with other guests with access to wine between 5pm and 6pm and the chance to grab a cup of tea or coffee throughout the day. J.F.K Airport is around a fifty minute drive from the property or around 25 without traffic. I would defiantly stay here again upon my next visit to the city.

title: Good family hotel
text: Room was perfect for our family of 5 with 1 bedroom, living room, and small kitchen.  Doormen and front desk staff very friendly and helpful.  Room was clean and comfortable.  Location convenient to subway.

title: Great Location and Staff
text: This is my second stay at Fifty, and it was very pleasant. The staff is super helpful and nice, and the location is great. The room is clean, and modern. I love the location which is within walking distance to a lot of great shopping and restaurants.

title: Home Away From Home
text: I have a consistently great experience every time I visit.  All of the staff, from the doormen to the desk personnel, is friendly, helpful and professional.  The rooms are clean, updated and comfortable and I love having a choice of different types of pillows.  I'm always sorry to leave and I look forward to my next visit with anticipation.

title: NYC fun trip
text: Every time I visit NYC, we choose 50 Hotel.  Love the location, large rooms, friendly staff, and nightly wine hour.  Easy walking distance from Grand Central, and to all our favorite restaurants.  Great value for the price!

title: Some good, some lacking
text: Decent location, nice area, not noisy.  Good value for the price, good size room, good bed & linens. We had 2 rooms and both baths needed an update, the tile was tired and dated. The shower was strong.  The lighting was pretty good, but the decor was a little sparse. The AC struggled to reach the right temp and smelled stinky the first day. One room's AC really stunk and the hotel brought up a portable AC unit that worked way better than the built in unit.  I'd like to make it 3.5 stars.

title: Great Place to Stay
text: My wife and I stayed here for three weeks. The room was great and the location is even better. Wanted to specifically thank Marco, one of the doormen, who helped us a bunch and was always extremely nice and professional.

title: Nice room, reasonable rate, nice location, great bed, bathroom needs help.
text: My adult son and I were in town and needed 2 beds which can be a challenge.  Fifty Hotel fit the bill.  We got a nice view room on the 17th floor.  The only disappointment was the 25 sq foot bathroom.  Hardly enough room to change your mind; it just didn't make sense.  Other than that it would have been 5-Star

title: Blown Away by the 1bdrm
text: My wife, 2 kids and I stayed at 50 in August for 2 nights in a 1bdrm suite. We got a 30% off deal. We were given a room on the top floor. Walked in and were blown away. The main space and bdrm were huge. The space covered one whole end of the building. There were 2 balconies that almost wrapped all the way around and looked down 3rd Ave, Amazing! We could not believe how big and nice. We usually stay in suites and nowhere else we have stayed in the city compares. One small negative is that the only bathroom is through the bdrm. The doorman, Rome, was so friendly and kind our entire stay. He greeted us by name each time we saw him and made sure we understood the terms of valet parking. Another small negative was that the computers were down at the front desk  the entire day we arrive. This made the process and line lengthy but the staff dealt with it well. The hotel as a whole was very nice and the wine hour is a nice bonus. We would love to do this trip all over again.

title: Excellent Service
text: Marco (doorman) was amazing!!  He was one of the friendlest pereon we meet in New York.  Helped us get a car to the airport and recommeded the Expire Steak house next door and we had an amazing time at dinner.  He is an asset to your business!

title: Fantastic
text: Great hotel, nice area, close to amenities. 10 minute walk to fifth avenue and Rockerfeller. 15 minute walk to central park, Times Square and Empire State. Weather was getting hot and humid so was glad to have air conditioning. Room had two double beds, and was plenty spacious enough for 3 people. Having a fridge in the room was useful for drinks and milk so I could make tea in the morning. Large wardrobe, WiFi and massive TV!! Staff were wonderful, check in and out quick and easy. Stored our bags on last day as had a late flight. Door staff were very happy, friendly and helpful when we needed to hail a taxi or book a car for the airport. Would stay again

title: Mr
text: Nice hotel, convenient location - there are a number of subway stations nearby and the hotel is in a walking distance to Central Park. The staff was very friendly, especially Samuel who goes out of his way to help you.

title: Extremely Unhelpful Front Desk
text:
While I had two names listed for check in on the reservation the front desk would not let the other named adult guest check in. I was not able to arrive until after midnight so the other guest was not allowed to use our room until my arrival after midnight. She was stranded for 9 hours and not permitted to use the hotel room we paid for and booked directly through the Affina site. Furthermore the front desk said they had nearly given away the room because of my supposed late arrival so then we both would have been stranded. I will not ever stay in any properties from this group ever again. 

The cleaning staff also left a walkie talkie phone in the room that would not stop beeping due to low battery throughout the night.

title: NYC
text: Very nice hotel with excellent service.  Computers were down at check-in which made it a long process.  Also as a result of computer issues was provide a key for a room that was already occupied.  Was shocked they didn't offer some kind of accomodation for the delays and embarrassment.

title: Super Comfortable, Well-Located Hotel in Manhattan
text: The room was spacious and comfortable.  The hotel is very conveniently located.  I hurt my knee and was in a wheelchair, and everyone was very accommodating.  They were very quick to resolve a minor plumbing issue.  The guest services are spectacular.

title: Good hotel in the center of the city
text: The hotel is nice. It's clean and quiet. It's located just a short walk from Central Park, The Rockefeller Center and Times Square along with a number of restaurants ranging from McDonalds to upscale. The price is reasonable given its location and considering what the competition charges.

title: Wonderful hotel that is well located for sightseeing and shopping!
text: We were thoroughly happy with our stay at the Fifty Hotel and Suites by Affinia.  The people were all very curtious and helpful.  The room was clean, and the gym was well equipped.  I will go back and stay there again!

title: Agréable séjour  au Fifty Hôtel
text:
Bel emplacement proche de Park Avenue, de la 5 ème avenue (5 mn à pieds)  .. le hall est chaleureux comme l'équipe qui nous a accueillis.  
Décoration sobre, élégante et chaleureuse : le salon où l'on prend aussi le pdj est très agréable. 
Chambre et lits sont irréprochables. Pdj soigné et bien suivi. 
Une bonne surprise globalement. 
Seul bémol, le forfait de services (wifi, accès au business center...) qui apparaissait en petites lignes sur la confirmation de la réservation, imposé et auquel nous n'avions pas prêté attention et qui représente une quarantaine de dollars par nuit. Pas négociable. N'ayant utilisé que le wifi - et encore- cela faisait un peu beaucoup.

title: Average for New York????
text: Rooms showed wear and tear and carpet visibly dirty I' assuming from allowing pets.  Overall average.  Doorman was exceptionally kind and helpful on restaurants, shops, etc.  Great with the children as he did magic tricks with them.  Genuinely great man!

title: Home away from home
text: Beautiful hotel with great people -doormen always day “Welcome home” and they go above and beyond to be helpful. Clean, comfortable and convenient. It’s expensive so it pays to be on their email list to take advantage of deals.

title: Stellar Service from Top Professionals
text: I would follow Jasmin, the front desk Goddess and Marco, the charming and extremely well-mannered keeper of the door and deliverer of the luggage, anywhere.  It put me in a great mood to deal with such professional, cheerful and kind people.  Yes, I like the rest of the hotel, especially the enormous room, but your people really put it all over the top.  Thank you.

title: Great Stay
text:
The room was large and comfortable. The hotel was in great location,near subways and attractions.
The staff was accommodating and friendly, especially Rome. This is the only hotel we stay at while visiting NY.

title: Anniversary Trip to the"Big Apple"
text:
We knew we were going to New York and really didn't expect too much.. BUT i have to say - your staff blew us away !  from the start - checking in earlier - as we took the first flight out of our city -  front staff was very helpful,  smiling, joking and very efficient - explained everything to us  in a way that we didn't feel it was  the "100th time" - but with emphasis on "us" your guests.. the rooms are very comfortable and clean - everything you need is in the room - safe - coffeemaker - TV- refrigerator- iron and board and the bathroom is sufficient ... and this was only the beginning. They have this awesome 1hr wine-get together and (not sure if we were lucky that week) also had ice cream from 5-6 every day.. It was nice to come back from the City and sit down for a minute and even get to know some of the other guests, while sipping on good wine and enjoying a cold treat. 
The doormen - also a very unexpected treat - doors were opened for us every time we came in or left - and always with a very nice greeting and a smile. We didn't eat breakfast - but I'm sure it was as delicious and wonderful as we experienced the rest of our stay. one afternoon we met some of the housekeeping staff in the elevator and all i can say - friendly, engaging and helpful.  - on our last day - we could leave our baggage with the hotel, until we were ready to head back to the airport - AND we even got a private car ride for less what the Uber cost us on the way in.. So all in all - ABSOLUTE great stay.. and Kudos to the management to have such a great team. coming for the service industry myself I know how hard it is to develop and keep people - especially in a fast paced environment.. My hat is off to you for your leadership... THANK YOU FIFTY HOTEL for making our stay an absolute great memory. 
Respectfully
M.Hofmann

title: Great Place!
text: Won't find larger rooms anywhere in NYC. Super friendly and attentive staff.  Great Wine Hour.  Convenient location with plenty of dining on 3rd, 2nd, and 1st.  Great specials on the offer tab of the booking page.

title: hôtel à recommander,
text:
personnel très aimable, hôtel bien placer, spacieux, proche de la plupart des sites à visiter permettant un déplacement à pied, bon rapport qualité/prix, bon service et propreté assez correcte
hôtel à recommander pour une famille

title: Go-to for family trips to NYC
text: Have stayed a couple of times and always been happy. Generally very spacious rooms, though a little older/dated. Don't love resort fees, but the lobby shop has solid options for the $10 daily credit. Service has always been good and friendly.

title: Amazing value for money
text:
Had a wonderful stay at Fifty Suites this past weekend. We were upgraded to a Queen suite which was a really nice touch. The room was extremely spacious, especially for NYC. There was a lot of room to spread out which is great for families. There was a full size kitchen in the suite which was seperate from the living area and it was very well stocked. The beds were super comfortable. The bathrooms were super clean with very nice showers (with temperature regulation). I liked that they are more eco friendly by not providing small bottles of shampoo etc, but instead have refillable bath products. The only negative about the room was the toilet was a little slow to flush, however it was not too much of an inconvenience given everything else in the room.
They had a great Wine and cheese hour. IT was ice cream week last week, so it was a really nice surprise to see that they had different flavored icecream from  the very famous'Serendipity 3', including their signature Frozen hot chocolate icecream cake.My friend from San Francisco was really impressed with the hotel choice. 
Overall, the greatest value for money hotel in NYC according to my experience. Will definetely stay again. Specially recommend for families.

title: Very nice location and accommodations
text: The room was very nice, with a kitchen, comfortable beds and prime location. The service desk was quick and helpful. The staff was courteous and friendly. We will come back for sure in the future. They have a garage (extra cost) so you can valet your car which was very convenient.

title: Superior Hotel
text: Large, comfortable and spacious room. Friendly and helpful staff. Convient location fo major attractions. All in all a worthwhile experience. Fifty Hotel & Suites by Affinia is our go to hotel when we stay in Manhattan.

title: Wonderful experience at Fifty Hotel and Suites
text: I spent almost three weeks in New York for business and they put me up at Fifty Hotel and Suites. It was a very comfortable hotel, loved the kitchenette, wine hour was a great perk, fitness center was great and the staff was lovely.

title: Enjoyed a great weekend
text: Arrived  late at 10pm due to bad weather at airport, but was still greeted by friendly front desk staff. Had booked 2 rooms but forgot to request them close to each other, but hotel staff had already taken care to place them near each other on the same floor. The kids opted for the room facing the street for the view,  while we took the room facing the back. Very quiet with a larger bathroom than the kids', so we lucked out-- request any xx04 room as they seem to have larger bathrooms based on the floorplans on the doors. House cleaning staff was very attentive and communicative. Very close to the Met which was great. They arranged transport to Newark Liberty with pricing competitive with Lyft/Uber so that was easy too. Rates were cheaper than comparable national chains we checked. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Review for Affinia 50
text: If it was not for Martha, the head housekeeper, my trip would not have been a good one at all.  I repeatedly told the front desk that there was a problem in the room and it was only when Martha intervened that the issue was resolved.  Also she came back to ask me that if the new room where I was put was still not ok she would get the sheets re-washed.  Thank you Martha

title: Birthday Suite
text: I visited Fifty Hotel & Suites by Affinia to celebrate my birthday in Manhattan with a few friends. The staff were very welcoming and kind (except for one that didn't let me redeem my $10 credit). The room was clean and spacious.

title: Nothing notable - just OK
text: Fifty was ok.  The last time I was in NYC, I stayed at another Affinia property and preferred that one (Shelbourne?). The location was ok.  I like this side of midtown.  The rooms are ok.  They offer a refrigerator which was good since it was the hottest weekend of the summer.  The thing that really bothers me is the "resort fee" that many NYC hotels enforce.  You get nothing.  This property offers you a $10 credit from their counter store, but there is not much you can buy.  A beer is over $7 and a small bottle of wine is $12.  The large bottle of water (and only water) is $8.  My advice would be to find a hotel that does not have this fee or at least one that you truly get something for it.  I stayed for three nights and nothing stood out.  There was no fabulous customer service, just basic and met the basic standard.  Even the doormen did not always open the door for us.   All I can say is that the price was right with the exception of the added resort fee.

title: Excellent Hotel at great location.
text:
Excellent Hotel at great location. Large rooms and totally updated with current decor. Comfortable bed and fairly quite.considering NYC. 
Definitely will stay here again especially when I travel with family.

title: Grew on me.
text:
Shaky start when we arrived late (though phoned to say we would be a late check in) and got a much smaller room than paid for. 

However, next day got what we booked. Very good, comfortable, clean room. Loads of space, little kitchen and nice sofa area. 

Not a bad location. Near subway and far enough from horrible Tine Square. Not as nice as Affinia Shelbourn but all good. Very friendly door staff were a huge added bonus and added to the whole experience.

title: good location
text: Good room and location.  The $39 per day resort fee is crazy, yes you do get a $10 credit per day to buy at the little store at the checkout however a water is $8, what a deal.  And we were never there for the 5-6 wine tasting since we were out visiting the city, so we paid $39 per day for a bottle of water.

title: 3 nights in NY
text:
Hotel well located, very convenient and comfortable. Lots of room in the junior suite with kitchenette appropriately equipped. Sincerely caring and courteous Staff.  It was the second time we stayed at Affinia 50 and both times we were satisfied.  New York is New York: lots of traffic, lots of tourists, lots of busy people in a hurry and noisy circulation.  The Hotel was an oasis of peace. THANK YOU
Marc & Josée

title: A surprising gem in the heart of it
text:
What makes a great hotel isn't just the location and what it has to offer but the staff as well. I felt as though I often visited this place even though it was my first time.  One front desk staff, Gloria was always smiling and very welcoming every time I had question about things. Her special personality helped  to make everyone feel happy. 

 I also love the fact that there are many lifts in the hotel and the bed is super comfortable with all those special pillows.  
The hotel provides you with earplugs in case some noises disturb you,  but if you all worn out after walking around  then you might not need them. 

Many great eateries around and a great bagel shop is just a Stones throw away. 

Everything is within reach for you to discover NY.

title: Very nice stay
text: We booked on the advice of work colleagues, but will definitely return on future trips to NYC.  Great Midtown location, wonderful staff, large clean rooms (by most NYC standards) and lots of nice touches

title: Fifty Hotel & Suites by Affinia
text: Really good location, walkable distance to many good places.  A lot of restaurants in an area.  Some of them really overpriced, but we found a few good places with reasonable prices and really good food

title: A Nice Surprise Away from the Hustle and Bustle
text:
Our family of four was visiting Manhattan when something unexpected caused us to extend our trip for one day.  The place we were originally staying at was already full, so it was a completely last minute effort to find a place to stay one night in Manhattan.  We checked this hotel online and found a good balance of price and reviews.  I called and booked a double queen room on the phone for us and two young children.  Cost was a good $398/night including taxes and fees, which is actually comparable to many Manhattan hotels during the summer.  But we sure hopeful this was a good find after reading the good reviews.  The rate comes with free wifi, a happy hour free wine in the lobby area, but no breakfast.  Check in time at 3pm and 11am check out.

The hotel is near offices, so amenities and late night entertainment isn't nearby.  But that also means it's quieter and a better night sleep.  There are plenty of food places within a 10 minute walk and McDonalds and Panda Express right downstairs.

We arrived the next day at a nice lobby and greeted by pleasant front desk staff.  Without asking she told us our room was upgraded with no extra cost to a "terrace" room.  We had no idea what that was, but entering the elevator we noticed our room was on the top floor.  Turns out the top floor had only four rooms, and as we opened the door we were surprised that it was a top floor apartment with a full kitchen, dining room, living room, large bedroom, and an outdoor balcony/terrace with views of the Hudson River.  A contrast to the closet sized hotel room common in Manhattan.  The next day, we called the front desk to see if late check out would be a possibility and was automatically granted late check out at 1pm.  Would definitely stay again next time.

title: A mixed bag
text:
