My check in was ok. I thought it was weird that they charged me upfront for my entire stay and added the deposit and all service charges right away. I will definitely be checking my statement that the deposit would be refunded. 
I ended up being assigned a room on the 2nd floor. For me to get a different room meant that I would have to keep all of my bags packed and they would move my things for me once a room was available. A definite inconvenience. I opted to stay after in the room since I didn't want to deal with this. I had to ask them 3 times to make sure my mini-fridge was working. I had some communication issues with the night front desk guy who called me 3 times then only to inform me that he didn't have anyone until the am. He sent a Maitenance guy to bring me some ice for the fridge. The maintenance guy went on to give some unsolicited advise about how I should get a room with a kitchen next time. I thought it was a little out of place. 
Cleanliness: The room had some type of red nasty spot by the bathroom. Hoping it wasn't blood. The decorative pillow was stained. Someone else's bobby pins were left on the floor. It could have been vacuumed better (for the amount of money I am spending) I found a long black hair on a towel. Lamps had some wear and tear. Bathroom is very small, but at least has a bathtub. They didn't provide basic things like Qtips and cotton balls. Breakfast is an extra $17 bucks. Don't do it. Go down the street you will spend way less. The maids were extremely loud not considering they might be disturbing people in the rooms. Service communication issues and being overly contacted: 1) front desk guy calling me 3 times to clarify the mini fridge not working. 2) Privacy sign on my door and housekeeping leaving me a voice message that if I want my room cleaned they are available until 6. 3) Walking in from the street and carrying bags. Have already stayed there a few days and one of the door guys asking me if I'm waiting for a shuttle. 4) Night manager asking me if I'm ok when I'm waiting by the elevator with my suitcase so I can come downstairs and check out. It was weird. 
I could keep going, but naw. The AC is very loud. Get some earplugs or keep it off. I kept it on a certain temp so it wouldn't come on in the middle of the night. The only person that was on point was the hispanic lady who checked me in. Positives: Comfy king bed and pillows. Bathtub, big screen tv, desk, lounge room with free coffee in the am, gym, free gifts

title: Wonderful hotel
text: My family and decided to come to NYC over the Fourth of July and had a wonderful stay here. 4 of us and we had to queen beds which was plenty. Nice small kitchen which we were pleasantly surprised about. Stove, oven, sink and microwave. Staff were very nice and a great location. All in all a great place!!

title: hotel bien ubicado con algunas trampas
text: paramos en este hotel a la ida y a la vuelta de japon para acortar el vuelo. Reservamos por booking a un cierto monto y cuando llegamos nos pasan un presupuesto mucho mas elevado. Resulta que cobran un extra de usd 35 para usar internet, tomar vino de cortesia de 17 a 18hs!, y recibirte paquetes con antelacion, Si bien cuando revise lo reservado en booking figuraba bien abajo suena a la letra chica con la cual siempre uno termina perdiendo. El personal te atiende de mala manera. la habitacion a la ida estuvo bastante bien, y a la vuelta era bastante pequeña al punto que no entraban tres valijas. Esta muy bien ubicado en el east side cerca de muchas atracciones y restaurantes

title: Fab hotel in a great location
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights. Room was slightly disappointing as it was on the 2nd floor and looked out on all the air conditioning units, there was also a constant drone however, hotel staff were very obliging in offering to move us but after the first nights sleep the room was very comfortable and we decided to stay. The bed was so comfy and we never had any problems with noise or sleeping. For New York hotels the room was large and had everything we needed. Great housekeeping service too.
The hotel is in a great location, easy access to all the local tourist attractions but away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. Staff are very courteous and professional nothing was too much trouble, we even got a slightly later than normal check out complimentary- thank you for this. There is a chargeable fee for in room wi if however, we visited the business centre everyday to access messages, emails etc.... which wasn’t a problem at all, it was very comfortable. I loved the doormen they always had a smile on their face and nothing was too much trouble. If I came to New York again I would definitely recommend staying here.

title: We loved it
text: Nice, clean, good size room. Large bathroom. Convenient location, close to Rockefeller center. Friendly welcoming staff made us feel at home away from home. The room was quiet, we did not hear any neighbors. True retreat after long, hot, crowded days walking and touring the city on the forth of July week. About 15min walk to Times square, Central park, Empire State building. Many little stores around the corner going east from the hotel. Clean safe area. Also there are good places to eat next door. Hotel Fifty was the best part of our New York experience.

title: Great trip!
text: I stayed here with my 18 yr old daughter and her friend for a graduation trip in mid June for 5 days. The front desk staff and the bellmen were extremely friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. The main lobby was nicely decorated and clean. I loved the location! We were in a room with 2 full beds and felt like we had plenty of space. The beds were comfortable. The bathroom was pretty small but I expected that. There is a nightly complimentary wine hour and I had a $10 credit to spend in the pantry each day. It was nice to be able to grab a cold beer after walking the streets all day. The only issues we had were with the TV and the shower. The shower was a little difficult to figure out but we finally learned and it was fine after that. The TV seemingly gave an option for us to connect our phones to be able to watch Netflix and other streaming apps, but we never could get it to work. The front desk informed me that they are in the process of adding it / replacing TVs throughout the hotel and so not all rooms had TVs with that function. We were barely in the room to watch TV so it really wasn't an issue. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Large Studio, Great Location
text: Our family of four (2 adults, kids ages 3 and 5) stayed here for 3 nights. We had a studio with two queen beds, a kitchenette, and bathroom. Our first impression - the room was huge. When you walk in, you actually have space to move and aren't immediately on a bed. We loved having a kitchenette (we got groceries from whole foods ~0.5 mile away). We didn't eat at the hotel but did enjoy Morning Star Cafe on 2nd Ave for breakfast each day. The subway is so so so convenient - you can get anywhere you want so easily. We used our $10 credit each day to pick up some Kind Bars or a large bottle of water. Our room was literally across from the elevators and next to maintenance & housekeeping but we didn't have a problem with noise - our room was on street side too but it was normal street noise - honestly, we only heard garbage trucks and fire engines - we also had white noise running on our ipad all night and there were some ear plugs in the bedside table if one needs them. Our only complaints is that when we arrived (travel delays caused us to arrive to the hotel at 11:30 PM) that we didn't have any washcloths (we got them the next day but it was annoying not to have them as we all bathed after our crazy travel day) and I thought the baseboards could use a good clean / fresh paint. Would we stay here again? Absolutely. In fact, my husband travels to NYC for work and may stay here for his business trips.

title: TOP NOTCH
text: Gloria and the other ladies at the counter were phenomenal and treated my wife and I like we were family. J.P. at the door went above and beyond to provide us wirh impeccable service that made are visit to NY City a rememberable one. Will absolutely stay here again

title: Great Family Vacation!!!
text: This hotel is truly the best hotel in NYC! Our suite was truly amazing with stunning views! The staff was the kindest, sweetest, most accommodating group of professionals I have ever dealt with (especially Jasmine)! The wine hour was so friendly, and great coffee in the morning! I will NEVER stay anywhere else!  I have stayed in several hotels in New York over the years, and this is the finest!

title: Mostly great
text:
Wonderful staff.
Room was spacious.
Housekeeping great.
Lots of clean towels, and beds made and changed.
Air conditioning not great and noisy.
Noisy air conditioning units outside window - earplugs provided as standard I believe!

title: Excellent NYC Trip
text: Everything about this place is great including the staff. I only have one very minor thing to pick on and that is the bathroom door. The bathroom door in our room simply slides over the opening leaving gaps that do not allow privacy. May not be suitable for families, but if you're a couple or a single traveler this should not be a problem.

title: Outstanding hotel
text: The staff at the NYC Fifty is the number 1 reason I stay at this hotel.   They are friendly and they make you feel very welcomed.   The 2nd reason I stay at the NYC Fifty are the rooms.  They are clean, spacious and comfortable.    The location is near several metro stations which makes it easy to get around.

title: Excellent Location
text: Two things stand out about this property- The location and the friendly staff. Unfortunately even though the staff was attentive they could not overcome the problem of substandard AC. House keeping was able to loan us a fan which helped - but our room never went below 78 degrees.   BUT the location can't be beat if you want to see Midtown Manhattan. This was our third stay and they have always treated us so very well, giant shout outs to Franz, Kristy and Lenny!!!  (Everyone at the counter and  door :-)  I feel awful that even though they ALWAYS remembered our names I  know I'm missing many of theirs!

title: Frindly service
text: Upon entering the hotel, we received excellent customer service in general, and in particular from Kristy at the front desk, who we found out is a fellow UAlbany Alumni.  We appreciated the large suite, the wine happy hour, clean room an the friendly service.

title: Would stay here again
text: We stayed here for 4 nights. Staff was friendly and helpful. Housekeeping did an excellent job. They made my great nephew happy when we came back to the room to see his stuffed animals placed on the bed. We used the valet parking which was a great service to have. Location is excellent. Would definitely stay here again on our next trip.

title: Amazing Experience!
text: The rooms at the Fifty are very generously sized, especially for Manhattan standards. We stayed in a junior suite, and it was one of the larger hotel rooms I've ever stayed in. Plenty of room to spread out, and the kitchenette was perfect.

title: Giant ripoff!!
text: Inadequately cleaned room and poorly supplied bathroom.  We ordered from the menu and got a delivery from the neighborhood deli.  Dirty pots in the oven and scantily equipped kitchenette and bathroom.  This hotel is a number one scam!

title: Family vacation
text: I would highly recommend Fifty NYC for your next trip to NYC! Jasmin went above and beyond to ensure our first family trip to NYC was exceptional. The rooms are spacious and clean. There are plenty of places within walking distance to eat. All of the staff were very accommodating and we felt well taken care of during our stay. We will absolutely return!!!

title: Saved the Day
text: We found ourselves in an NYC Air BnB disaster.  I booked through Expedia and within an hour we showed up.  Initially, what I had booked wasn't available but the front desk attendant quickly found a solution that worked well for our family of five.  The next morning when I showed up at the front desk Jasmin was amazing at giving me our options for the remainder of our trip.  She consistantly  went above and beyond to accommodate us.  I will be staying there again during college visit tours w/ my son!

title: COULD NOT BE BETTER IN NYC
text: Excellent location, elegant, friendly and modern.  Clean and very well decorated.  Ample and well equipped rooms.  Comfortable beds.  Cute and practical kitchenette.  Nice and attentive staff.  Will repeat every time in NYC.

title: Nice hotel good location but no bar
text: The hotel overall was clean and nice rooms with friendly staff.. There is no bar in the hotel.My room was on the the 2nd floor which was very noisy. I wanted a room with a balcony   but was informed it would be an extra $160 dollars. It's not far from the underground so fairly easy to get to all the attractions.

title: Ideal hotel for exploring NYC
text: We stayed as a family of four for five nights and found this to be a great hotel for exploring Manhattan. Ideally located for Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, UN Building and Grand Central Station. We stayed in a spacious family room that was very comfortable and quiet. The staff are very friendly and helpful. There is a small tuck shop where you can buy snacks and some alcoholic drinks and restaurants and supermarket within a 5 minute walk. The wine hour was a nice touch and gives residents a complimentary glass of wine to relax with in the lounge. If we come back to New York, we'd definitely stay here again.

title: Zentrale Lage, gut geeignet für Gruppen
text:
Die Lage des Hotels ist sehr gut. Fahrt vom Flughafen JFK zum Hotel mit Airlink und Metro ist einfach. Auch die Metro-Anbindung ist fußläufig gut zu erreichen. Sehenswürdigkeiten sind somit leicht zu erreichen. 
Wir waren 5 Personen, hatten eine Junior Suite mit Küchenzeile. Das Frühstücksbuffet wurde von uns am ersten Tag genutzt. Es ist alles da, was man braucht, allerdings ist es nicht gerade günstig. Ab dem zweiten Tag haben wir uns selbst versorgt. Lebensmittelläden befinden sich in Laufweite. Küche ist mit Küchenzeile mit Kühlschrank, Toaster und Herd. Allerdings hatten wir die Suite für 5Personen gebucht,die Teller und Besteck Ausstattung war nur für 4 Personen. Das Zimmer wurde täglich gereinigt und wir waren vo n der Preis-Leistung zufrieden.

title: Es un hotel muy agradable
text: El personal del Hotel es muy amable y la ubicación es muy buena. La habitación es muy cómoda, sobre todo las camas que son un capítulo aparte. A las 5 de la tarde sirven una copa de vino en el segundo piso, me pareció un gesto muy simpático.

title: Great Stay!
text: We had a great stay here!  The rooms are huge (for NYC) and comfortable.  Everything was clean and nice.  The doormen are super nice.  It's very well located with restaurants close by and the subway a short walk.  The only thing we didn't like was the surprise $35 per night "facilities fee."

title: Great Location and value
text: I love the neighborhood that this property is nestled in. Very convenient for sightseeing and for food options. The wine-hour in the lounge is a great bonus as well. Will be staying here whenever I visit the Big Apple for sure.

title: Unbeatable!
text: This was my third or fourth stay. I keep coming back--and this time I came with my wife, our son, and his girlfriend. It was our 40th anniversary, and it was the right place to come! Great people on the staff: genuine caring for guests, true hospitality, low turnover...I commented to a bellman how unusual it was to find someone in the same hotel job for 19 years, and he told me he was low in seniority! The woman at the desk was in her 32nd year. Great location: Ess-a-Bagel around the corner, subway lines nearby, mid-town. By NYC standards, spacious and moderately priced, immaculate, and modern. My only hesitation in writing this review was whether I was creating a problem for finding a room next time!

title: Great Location, Big Room, Friendly Staff
text: Our family of five fit comfortably in the Junior Suite. The location is great with easy access to the subway and a short walk to Grand Central Station and everything else in Midtown. Our room was on the back of the building so it was pretty quiet but did not have much of a view. We would stay there again.

title: Truly great experience
text: What can I say visited NYC celebrating a friends 65th birthday and staying at Fifty Hotel was such a wonderful experience, after being out and about for 2 days we looked forward to returning to the hotel for a great nights sleep.  Fifty Affinia did not disappoint, we don't know what it was but we slept like babies, it could have been the fantastic beds or that we heard no noise whatsoever.  A perk is the coffee in the morning and the wine hour at night.  Thank you Fifty Affinia for a great visit

title: Excellent Location but very expensive area!
text: Having been to New York a few times before, I came with my Fiance and family.  The hotel staff are friendly and we had a nice warm welcome albeit in the middle of the night after a long flight. The room was okay, clean but very dark, no natural light. My son and his girlfriend changed rooms first night as it was on the front of the hotel and SO noisy.  Lobby area is lovely and there is a 5-6oclock free drink area which was nice, although not one person was friendly!! other than staff. Very clicky.  Didn't try breakfast here as so many places around. MUST go to the Bagel shop opposite. We was given a free WiFi code otherwise that is quite pricey daily.  Would def recommend, however there are other hotels in New York equally as nice.  Was great but nothing amazing.

title: Excellent hotel & location, but a bit noisy
text: The hotel is very nice and clean. The location is excellent, close to two metro stations and to the 5th avenue. There are many restaurants & supermarkets nearby. The personel is really kind and very helpful. The room is big and confortable, as well as the bed. It is always very clean, and it has a fridge and a coffee machine. The only bad point is that is it very very noisy, at least for the rooms which look to the street, as well as the ones close to the elevators. I would recommend it but will ask for a room far away from the street and the elevators.

title: Decent hotel but watch out for $40 per night resort fee scam
text: The hotel was reasonable. However, after booking and putting in my credit card info, I realized that I was charge a $40 per night resort fee. I felt very manipulated by this (even though I got a $10 credit from the pantry). Price was one of the main factors in choosing the hotel. $40 per night extra is significant. I only found out about it when receiving the confirmation (after paying). This is apparently not uncommon practice in NYC, so watch out for this.

title: Quick visit
text: Staff is great, hotel lobby area is very nice. Location is very good. Restaurants, coffee shops are nearby. The rooms are OK. There were a few minor problems...dirty carpet, blinking light bulb in the hallway, terrible toilet paper, very low water pressure in the shower...and one kind of major one: The room faced 3rd Ave and it was NOISY! The window did nothing to block out the noise. I ordered up a fan and the white noise did the trick, for the most part. The bed, sheets, pillows and towels are great. It all balanced out and for the price, it was a pleasant stay.

title: ミッドタウンのお気に入りホテル
text: グランドセントラル駅にも近く、仕事にも、観光、ショッピングにも最適のロケーション。周りには、価格の割にはインフラやサービスが伴わないホテルも少なくありませんが、ここは部屋も広く、値段もリーズナブルです。3度目となる今回の滞在に、スタッフからも"Welcome back"のフレンドリーな声が。NYの常宿です。

title: NY2019
text:
All was ok and more
Describe the service you experienced: very good
Tell us how you liked the room: very good
Talk about the location & amenities: very good
Say what you liked best & least: all was very good

title: Great location, nice hotel
text: The Affina fifty suites is in a great location.  Staff is super friendly and nice.  We had a problem with first room air conditioning not working and they quickly moved us to a new room.  Overall great experience

title: Good staying in NY Fifty Hotel & Suites by Affinia
text: Business trip to NY, nice staying experience in FIFTY, hotel location is very good and staff are nice to guests. Good to take family staying with them. Every Thursday afternoon the hotel holds a redwine party for guests which is very enjoyful.

title: Another Great Weekend at Affinia 50 NYC
text: I stay at the Affinia 50 for business and pleasure when I am in New York.  This trip was a combination of the two.   we were upgraded to a beautiful room with a balcony (yes, in NY) very well appointed kitchenette, comfortable sitting area, and dining table.  I did not use the kitchen facilities other than the refrigerator- which was very very handy!  The bed (king) was extraordinarily comfortable, room clean (except a bit of trash left on the balcony from previous guest), and spacious.  I like the built in soap/shampoo/conditioner in shower and they smell great!  The staff at Affinia helped us find an amazing jazz place one night and efficiently accommodated our request for an additional night as we were having too much fun in NY to leave as previously planned!. The doormen are exceptionally friendly and helpful.  The breakfast is very good and nice choices- all included in the room rate.  I love the location and although our firm has moved further away I still continue to stay at Affinia for work and for fun!

title: Great stay!
text: It was a lovely hotel, no issues. The only reason I rated sleep quality poorly was because I felt the black out curtains could have been slightly stronger. Otherwise was a great stay, I would definitely stay there again.

title: Good service and responsive staff
text: First of all, I'm taking the time to write a review because I had an issue, which the frontdesk woman quickly help me out to solve. Each employee I've talked to, were very kind, respectful and understanding.

title: Fantastic hotel, Lovely staff , Impeccable Suite, Great location
text:
From the moment we walked into this modern, design hotel we instantly knew we made the right decision to stay here.We stay at the hotel in  in May 2019  we were a family of 5 : 2 adults 1 teenager and 2 babies under 5 years old.
First: Brian the manager of the hotel is AMAZING, every single hotel needs a Brian works for them, clearly they did something right by having him as a manager. Teela the executive Office Manager is wonderful she went above and beyond to make sure that our stay was the absolute best it could be.

Check in, we are greeted by Jasmine,  she was polite, caring and genuine she was adorable . 
Linny was always listening and gave us lots of tips on nearby shopping.
Samuel the doorman is really professional and always helpful.
All the staff in the hotel were friendly and helpful but special thanks to Jasmine, Samuel, and Linny for making our stay even more special. 
I have visiting a lot of hotel in NYC and in US but clearly this hotel is our favorite because of the team that makes the difference. Smiling, helpful and genuinely caring.
The suite  are phenomenal, spacious, clean, and REALLY confortable.
The kitchen is a big plus when you travel with your family.
The location is great  within walking distance to many important sites.
From the staff to the amenities to the decor to the location everything is perfect. 
Do yourself a favor and book at the Affinia fifty. 
We highly recommend and can’t wait to come back to Affinia fifty.

title: Average over-priced NYC hotel
text:
This hotel comes complete with basic New York city travel issues - overpriced, noisy rooms, tired amenities and rude staff. New York hotels don't just charge you for the room, they also charge you a very hefty facility fee (we are talking US $ 50 a day) for the privilege of using their basic Wifi, small gym and a bottle of water. 
Despite the high room charge, the room was small, tired, with an extremely noisy aircon system, no window, no bottled water, no slippers and no view. 
The hotel is somewhat out of the way of many of the tourist sights of NYC, necessitating cab rides around the place. Heaven help you if it is raining. While many NYC hotels may offer similar levels of price and location, the level of service at this hotel was somewhat below average, making it a second level choice for business or tourist travel.

title: The Fifty: Excellent Hotel and Great Service
text:
Checked in at 4am last night and staying til the 16th. Morris was such a help in checking us in with our 8 huge bags. Our room was ready upon arrival. Room is spacious and neat and modern. Can’t be beat for the price and the space and the location. The best part of my stay is seeing Rome the concierge. He’s been helping us at Fifty since I’ve been checking in here since 2006. I won’t stay anywhere else in Manhattan. This hotel is perfect for kids as we brought my three year old 
That’s Rome in the photo below. And he always greets me in my native language. He always makes us feel welcome

title: Great Hotel
text: Great hotel close to everything the rooms are super clean the staff very nice Leah was at the front desk very helpful. It was right in the middle of stores restaurants. The rooms were so modern the walls had saying written on them by artists. Had a wine hour .Will highly recommend

title: Great expérience
text:
The hotel is very nice. Rooms are very spacious. All the staff is super dedicated and great with kids..  my kids loved them. 
We had a amazing experience. Definitely would come back if I ever return to NY with my kids. Location excellent.

title: Too much noise
text:
Sleep quality was poor due to the garbage removal at 12 midnight, the construction first thing in the morning, the fire engines from around the block, and the traffic noise. I thought being on the 15th floor would help but not so. The hotel can’t do anything about these issues. They are a result of location. 

The doormen were very nice but the weekday front desk staff was not very friendly. 

The location is very convenient and the hotel is very clean.

title: Home in NY
text:
Just back from a 5 night stay at the Affinia - we are a family of 5 adults- all teenage kids. We were in the one bedroom suite -two queen beds in a big bedroom, 1 bathroom, sofa bed in the living area, 2 flat screen TV's and a kitchenette. The beds were so comfortable, fresh perfect bed linen. It was lovely to come back after a full on day of walking, sight seeing to chill out and have a glass of wine, or a cuppa and watch TV and recharge.
The staff were welcoming and friendly. They were always in good form and helpful, from door man, to reception to porter.
The location is great close to Lexington subway. We walked to many of the tourist spots. The area felt safe. There was a fab diner a few doors away, a choice of restaurants close by for whatever meal you might like -lots of reasonable priced options or fine dining or a coffee or a pub. 
Floor 2 is a hangout area with computers for residents use, free cuppa tea or coffee or to just hang out.It was great to be able to print out tickets etc. 
Yes it was noisy at night but I used earplugs and that sorted that. 
I would absolutely recommend this hotel, it did not disappoint us in any way. Thank you to the welcoming friendly staff.

title: NYC half term break
text:
Just returned from New York 
Had a great stay at this hotel 
Staff were awesome 
Room was excellent 
Clean and tidy 
You are right next to 51st subway 
Just around the corner is a great place for breakfast called the Greenacre Park, with a waterfall in Manhattan

title: Everyone is so welcoming and helpful
text: Though it was only one night enjoyed my stay. The staff are lovely! Rooms are spacious relative to other hotels in nyc. Location was great too, one street away from Lexington, close to bloomies. Thank you

title: not what it used to be
text:
The hotel needs to eliminate the daily extra fee and charge people that use the extras.  As a business traveller I do not understand why I am being charged a very high fee for things I never use, they don't even have an umbrella in the room like most hotels. Front desk staff is overly friendly to frequent visitors, but not to others.  I have stayed here many times because I like the location, but the construction and street noise prevent a good night's sleep and I will not stay here again.
The parting shot of indifference by the staff was asking for an envelope for my bill and being told they did not have any.  Cut out basics and over charge with a high extra fee seems to be the business model.

title: Smooth and spacious stay in the heart of Manhattan
text:
An excellent, hassle-free experience, right from reservation to check-out. Location was superb - close to several subway stations with easy access to downtown, uptown, theatre district and Brooklyn. Walking distance (15 min) from Rockefeller Centre, Radio City, Times Square, Grand Central Station. A slightly longer walk (30 min) to Empire State bldg and Macys. 

Staff at reception was always prompt and efficient (warning: sometimes this efficiency may come across as impatience, but if you know NYC, you'll know it's not)! The bellboys and doormen were also extremely helpful - we had a huge amount of luggage and they helped us store all of it for us for a few hours after check-out, as we had a late evening flight. Especially recommended is the car they booked for us to go to JFK airport - it was a nice large SUV driven by Luis Castro, at a very reasonable price of $68.

Highly recommended - you'll find it hard to get such a spacious room for this price and location.

title: Girlfriend Trip
text: From our hotel front desk representative  and concierge assistance to overall general friendliness and helpfulness extended by residents we encountered throughout Manhattan I can without reservation share New York is a wonderful city to visit! I also want to give a shout out to all of the helpful personnel of the subway system. Not a single bad experience and everyone went out to their way to accommodate us. Good Job!

title: Good Stay
text: Stayed here as a party of four, rooms very spacious tho I found lighting to be poor. Bed comfortable and a choice of pillows available. All staff we came into contact with were friendly , accommodating and eager to please with a wealth of knowledge. Location wise towards the top end of the city which having stayed in the city before I would probably choose a hotel more central. All in all a lovely trip.

title: valutazione generale
text: hotel in buona posizione. . manca possibilità di regolare A/C dalla camera in quanto centralizzata. manca un bar. non è stato possibile ottenere late check out considerando che il ns volo di ritorno era alle 23,00. neanche a pagamento.

title: Perfect locatoin
text: We've stayed at the Affinia Shelburne in the past, so I knew this hotel would not disappoint. It is in a perfect location, near two subway stations and close enough to walk most places. The rooms are large for NYC and very comfortable. The doormen were so nice and everyone in the hotel was exceptionally friendly. My only complaint is the ridiculous $35 per night facility fee they add to every bill. I know all the hotels in NYC are doing this now, but I find it most annoying. Just tell us what the actual charge is and don't add on some silly daily fee and then try to justify it through free wi-fi, gym access and a $10 credit.

title: Another great stay
text:
Thank you for looking after me again.  Another great stay.  Location is perfect, room great, hotel spotless.  Seriously comfy beds, great shower and the nicest door men you could meet!  
Just perfect.  Will never stay anywhere else but here.

title: Great base for seeing NY
text:
A very good hotel with good access to restaurants and the best of NY. Very friendly guys on the doors; always have a cheery hello and ask how you are today. Staying in a room with 2 queen beds. Very spacious for 3 of us; beds very comfortable with great pillows (they do have a menu of pillows).

Free wine at 5pm everyday for an hour; not managed to get down (shame) because we are only here 3 nights and cramming it all in but a great perk. 

Ess-a-bagel round the corner for the best of NY breakfasts. 

Highly recommend.

title: This was our 2nd stay at your hotel, was very comfortable and everyone we met was wonderful and kind
text: My husband was at Memorial Sloan the stay was comfortable to come back after a long day. The staff and cleanliness was wonderful . When we return we will be planning to stay at Fifty NYC. Sincerely BCM

title: A perfect location
text:
According of our expectation the room was too small as well as the bed size. The 4th floor is too noicy. 
The fare is too high considering the explanation provided above.
The people are nice and all the door mans very kind

title: Fifty NYC - stayed late May 2019
text: We stayed in the 1 bedroom suite with balcony - love love loved it!!! Staff were amazing, Rome the doorman is awesome!! The room was huge, bed very comfy. Close to everything, within walking distance. Will go back to Fifty NYC!!

title: NYC Midtown Gem
text: Lovely and large rooms; friendly and helpful doormen who serve as concierges too; great location. Would absolutely stay there again. And doesn't hurt that it's across the street from the best bagel place in town--Ess A Bagel.

title: Very nice
text: Staying because of appointment at Sloan Kettering—very nice place to stay with friendly staff!  Front desk staff and front door staff were absolutely wonderful and helpful. Thanks for making everything so easy. It felt like home!!

title: Not what it used to be
text: I have been staying at the Affinia for years.  I go to NY once or twice a year on holiday and I hate staying on the West Side.  The rooms are large, the bathrooms are spacious, the beds comfortable and the location while not perfect is close to shops, restaurants and the subway.  The policy of charging a resort fee infuriates me.  I know this is not exclusive to Affinia but the "cupboard" contains virtually nothing that a diabetic can consume and the happy hour is poorly timed for people who want to make the most of their hours in NYC.  So what exactly do you get out of the resort fee? For me, nothing.  The doormen used to be attentive; they are no longer.  The desk staff are stiff and defensive.  Would I go back?  Probably but the San Carlos across the street is equally good.  And if you are not, like me, strictly an East Side-girl, there are much better locations.

title: Nice people; okay facility
text:
The plug in the bathroom wasn't working. It was a challenge telling housekeeping not to clean my room. I left a privacy notice at the door, but someone still ended up cleaning my room. I had to call and ask for privacy. Next day, received a call again regarding someone cleaning my room. Seems like the information wasn't transferred over. 

All other staff were extremely kind and the place wasn't bad. Could use an upgrade, but wasn't bad.

title: Comfortable stay
text: Very clean room, comfortable bed, and loved the decor.  The balcony was a nice touch. Great location with good restaurants within walking distance.  Elevators were quick; lounge was comfortable.  Check out was simple and quick.  Friendly front desk staff.

title: Nice happy hour!
text: Clean, Quiet, Comfortable, friendly helpful staff, great location ... a bathroom fan would be a bonus though... although the room is quite small it is NYC so we agreed that for the price this place is great!

title: Recent trip
text:
Room was small.
Leaking toilet.
No air conditioning.
Tub would drain.
Was hot.
Couldn’t get a Uber to the airport because a giant fight broke out at like 4am right outside the hotel.
“Room service” food was terrible. 
Overall definitely NOT worth the price.

title: Great hotel for business and leisure
text:
I was surprised to find out that this small hotel has everything needed for my business stay.
Also very comfortable and quite. I strongly recommend to my colleagues and friends.
Enjoyed the evening reception.

title: Great location and very comfortable
text: We stayed for 3 nights and it was one of the best hotels I've stayed at. They have great service and very friendly to everyone which I love. Very clean suite and comfortable bed. We stayed in the terrace suite I believe which has a great view on the 21st floor and a kitchen and spacious living area. It is also a great location which is close to times square and broadway as well as restaurants. The only problem would be the space of the bathroom, it pretty small but that's the only issue I had. Would go again when visiting new york.

title: Very good and goid location
text:
We stayed in a king size bed on the 5th floor. 3rd and 50th
The fridge was poor
The bathroom small
King bed was very comfortable
Air conditioning was hot and could not turn it off
The wine was sth african and was crap at wine hour
I would stay again as we enjoyed the location and the employees all were helpful and friendly 
Alot of food places on 3rd abe  and particularly 2nd ave
Near subway on 50th and lexington
Room was fine

title: Ok overall. Well located
text: The hotel is very well located, near the subway and walking distance to some of NY main attractions. The room was spacious and very clean. The air conditioning /heating did not work so it was a bit cold, and also a bit noisy at night due to the traffic. Anyway, very comfortable for 2 adults and 2 children, with the added value of the kitchen which is definitely a plus when traveling with children and they are too tired to dine out. And... very important, elevators are fast and almost always available, so we never had to wait more than a minute.

title: Spacious and Comfortable in NYC
text:
This is our second time staying at the Fifty Hotel and Suites and we give it a resounding thumbs-up. The rooms are spacious, clean. There is a kitchen too. The location is great with easy access to all parts of the city. The staff is warm, competent, and gracious. We especially love the doormen/bellmen who have panache!
The only downside to our apartment was the bathroom was small; however, there was a drawer under the sink that was great for storing. The shower was excellent too. And the windows open a bit for some fresh air!

title: Family trip
text: The first night wasn't cold outside, but the air conditioner didn't work, because of the weather.  The air conditioner was off for all the rooms. I couldn't sleep well that night. Also you have to pay an extra fee for each day that you only use if you are at the hotel during the day. The rest is fine. Thank you.

title: Awesome hotel
text: Just returned from  a week stay at the Fifty Hotel and would recommend it as an excellent place to stay while in NYC.  It is close enough to Rockerfeller Centre and Time Square for an enjoyable walk and far enough away that it is also quiet.  The staff are exceptional, friendly, courteous and helpful. The room we stayed in was the perfect size for 3 adults.

title: Surprisingly sophisticated. Refreshingly human.
text: The business model of Affinia 50 is focused on practical amenities that speak to comfort and efficiency rather than to over-the-top "luxury attitude."  The lobby, though not unpleasant, gives little or no indication of how truly attractive and functional the rooms actually turn out to be. Moreover, the staff proves friendly and enthusiastic--and lent an unexpectedly personalized, human touch to all my interactions or transactions.

title: Good location and friendly staff
text: The location is very good with lots of nice restaurants nearby.  Friendly staff and the wine hour a great way to meet fellow travelers service at reception efficient although quite a few lengthy waits due to customers using their “free” $10 credit. Would prefer the rate to be reduced as choice of items not that great. Nice and clean although had problems with phone dialling 911 which was a bit inconvenient due to faulty phone and check the shower gel is there before you shower as housekeeping did not always top it up

title: Fined due to clerical error
text: I don't book my own travel. Somehow, two rooms were booked when I only needed one. Because 48 hour cancellation was not received, I was told I would have to pay a fine. Honestly, I don't think this is a good look when it comes to business travelers. I don't pretend to be some big shot, but I wouldn't ever stay here again because of this. It was a booking mistake. If you would have taken care of it, and I would probably be requesting to stay at your hotel again.

title: Perfect location
text:
Stayed as part of a conference at the UN. This hotel is well laid out and is walking distance to all the major NY sights.

It is a block from the train and you can use it as a tourist hub.

The staff are helpful, knowledgeable and try to make you feel like you’re home. Absolutely can not fault the door staff.

My only tip is that there are fridges in the room, and as a vegan their breakfast (with additional cost) wasn’t cost effective. Pop to one of the nearby stores and stock up!

Also near to one of the best Bagel shops in NY.

A good stay, plenty of towels and a range of pillows to choose from- I definitely recommend the speaker pillow.

title: Óptima relación precio/ servicio
text:
Mi cuarta estadía consecutiva en NY en este hotel . Volvería nuevamente!
Excelente ubicación, habitaciones amplias y cómodas y muy buen servicio.  Muy bueno el gym y el espacio común con café y té a toda hora.

title: Thanks
text: It was nice to stay at your hotel because the location is very good and the staff is so nice and helpful. Pricing however is quite complex for foreigners (facility fee, cupboard fee and many different taxes) and it is difficult to compare prices with other actors on market.

title: Great location. Modern, clean, easy
text: I had a short business trip to NY and needed a hotel in mid-town east.  This one was perfect for the trip - easy in and out, modern and clean, friendly staff, no hassles.  There seemed to be a reasonable balance of family/individual tourists and business people, so you avoid the large conference crowd and the bus tours. I'd come back again.

title: family
text: a lot to improve, Charge "resort fee" without a propouse. Low floor are to noise. We stayed 4th and 8th. This thing to use $10,00 per day in reception, dosen´t justify the amount paid as $35 per day. You only can take 1 product with this credict. Do not recomend for the price spend this hotel.

title: Love it!
text:
We upgraded to junior suite because we wanted a kitchen, since we were staying there for a long time. I don't think you could expect a quiet and peaceful stay when you're in Midtown Manhattan. There will always be the honks of cars and the siren making noise almost every hour. 

The location of the hotel is perfect! It has a nearby train station on 51st street, a church just a few blocks away, Panda Express just across the street, McDonalds just around the corner on 3rd Avenue. Front desk staff Jasmine(or was that Janice?) is very friendly and willing to help. There's a fireplace on the lobby which was a good place to chill and lounge in while waiting for a cab or an Uber.

title: Very good
text: Everything ok. But The windows are not isolated and The noise from The street is very  strong. Better a room not facing The street. When we asked ti change room The staff was really nice and found the best solution for us.

title: Delightful.
text: Fantastic location -- close enough for a brisk walk to the theatre district, very close to multiple subway stations.  There's a free wine hour every day for guests, but sadly only one of our group was able to make it as we were booked for the 5 nights we stayed.  I asked to upgrade and was given an excellent discount on a new room if we moved the second day, which we did.  The first room was fine and dandy, but the second was FANTASTIC.  It was the 1 bedroom suite with a pull-out couch and a kitchen/dining area.  The living area was large enough that our handful of local friends could come back after our Broadway outing for a glass of wine and no one was cramped.  It's a fantastic find with excellent customer service.

title: Lovely hotel in a great location
text: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. I was with 2 of my friends and we stayed in a 2 bed room with a kitchenette. The hotel’s location is great, within walking distance to the Chrysler building, Rockerfeller Center, 5th Avenue, Times Square. All the staff were very friendly

title: Fabulous stay in New York
text: This hotel is ideally situated in midtown Manhattan.  The rooms are a generous size.  There is a lounge to work in or relax in and complimentary drinks from 5 to 6.  The 'cupboard' in the lobby is great for snacks and drinks. The staff are super helpful and friendly.

title: Good, but not impressive
text:
We traveled as a family of 3 and stayed at Fifty Hotel & Suites for 5 nights in April.
We stayed at the VIP Junior Suite wich is extremely spacious for any standard and has a nice balcony. The room's cleanliness could be improved (speccially the windows) and the furniture is a bit worn out but the beds are confortable, proper pillows are provided (a rarity !) and the kitchen is well equiped. Work and sitting area are nice pluses.
Even though this was a 17th floor, its position facing 3rd Av. makes it a noisy room -  earplugs were used.
The continental breakfast is quite basic but a good option if you want to grab a quick bite before hitting the streets of Manhattan.

Overall, it is a good but not impressive hotel.

title: Will stay there again!
text: Our family of five stayed in a junior suite late February and it was a spacious room. We had difficulty finding a room in NYC to sleep five without paying high price. This worked great for us! We chose room without a view to save dollars, but it made for a quiet night considering how noisy street rooms can be. ALL the staff were so polite and helpful. We were greeted by name when we entered and exited the hotel. Convenient to all we wanted to do. Highly recommend this hotel. Really enjoyed the sitting area and fireplace. These public areas were roomy but cozy.

title: Worst stay in New York City!
text: I came here for a relaxing overnight stay by myself. It was the worst experience. I was on the third floor facing 50th street and I was kept up all night!!! From garage trucks to Fresh Direct sorting their deliveries at the wee hours of the morning on a Sunday! I have pictures to prove it! Just a horrible stay! I would never recommend it!!!

title: lo recomiendo!
text:
Ubicación; a una cuadra, de las cortas, del metro y dos, de las cortas también, del metro con ascensor. Zona hotelera, muy tranquila de noche, sin carritos de comida en las veredas, por lo que las veredas en gral. están despejadas, a cuatro cuadras de la 5. en la 2 casi 48 hay un super, Martin Williams , muy completo
El descanso fue muy bueno,  la habitación, suite estudio, para los cuatro estuvo muy bien, dos adultos, un bebe y un niño de 4 años
La amabilidad del personal fue excelente, la de limpieza y en recepción a la mañana, uno de los dela puerta nos trataba muy muy bien, no se los nombres pero varios se destacaban sobre otros que fueron mucho mas distantes, En recepcion una de las chicas hasta llamo a un negocio buybuy baby para asegurarme que pudiera ir a comprar un stroller
Lo unico que mejoraria seria el baño, la ducha (con bañera)era difícil de regular la temperatura
y la temperatura en la habitación, si bien se podía seleccionar los grados, si afuera estaba mas caluroso lo manejaban ellos como cool, y no se podia cambiar, sino que uno podia apagarlo si no lo queria tan frio
Todos los dias se pueden gastar 10 dolares del impuesto obligatorio de la ciudad (38.11) en un candy bar, nos resulto muy util
no desayunamos nunca en el hotel , se podia desayunar, no estaba incluido
La habitacion tiene cafetera de capsulas (no me gusto), tostadora, anafe, ollas pava, y un horno que funciona como microondas, todo muy practico con un bebe
Lo que mencionan de los ascensores, no nos pasó. esperamos lo normal para subir o bajar

title: Decent little hotel
text:
Location is great. 
No extra amenities like Qtips, moisturizer, or Cotton pads in washrooms.
Attentive staff.
Simple.
Single rooms are small.
Rooms with 2 Queens are much roomier.
For the price , they need to step it up abit.

title: Good location, satisfactory room but quite tired for the price $$
text: Hotel is well located near the NYC Subway (<5 min) and a short (sub 30 min) walk to many attractions. The staff were friendly and check in was swift and efficient. We stayed in a Junior Suite which was a satisfactory experience - the room was reasonably clean however fairly tired with a number of minor maintenance issues (Non functioning plug outlets; some lights out - nothing needing immediate reporting); the main bed's mattress was squeaky and uncomfortable; the air conditioning was SO noisy it was unbearable to keep on at night. With windows closed still quite a lot of noise; shower was a little weak. We had a great week in NYC but overall standard of accommodation was average. Nothing awful though.

title: Rebe visit
text: I did not appreciate being allocated a room between the elevators. We requested a change and the only available room was a $40 per night upgrade which we took as we had no option. As a result of this  upgrade instead of being on the 18th floor we were on the 15th floor

title: Always a pleasure!
text:
Kind of want to keep this hotel a secret but they asked for a review so i'm obliging (:

This has been my home in NY for a few years now and it's the only one i recommend to friends.  

Great location (subway a block away and bus on the street), 
Big clean rooms, 
Lounge with wine hour, coffee 24/7 and breakfast option (and just lounging even after checkout until my ride to the airport arrives) 
and always a smiling doorman,reception staff and housekeeping.

What can i say?

Waiting for my next city visit.

title: Great Value, great location
text: Similar in style to a Premier Inn in the UK but with the addition of piped Jazz at the entrance and bellboys to cater for your every need. Approx 20 minute walk to 5th Avenue and just minutes from the Subway

title: Was very comfortable
text:
We are very satisfied with yours and another trip we want to come at your excellent hotel. 
Excelente todo, muy limpias y cómodas. Cuando estemos de vuelta , definitivamente nos hospedaremos allí. El precio es acorde con sus comodidades

title: There for MSK
text: We had to visit the hospital, and so we stayed close by.  From the doorman to the help behind the counter everyone was extremely polite, welcoming and pleasant.  The rooms were fine, and nicer than  I thought they would be.  It's NYC so they are not giant, but as a take off point to sleep and see the city this hotel is great.

title: Our new "go to" hotel in NYC
text: This was our first trip to Fifty but it will not  be our last.  Central location, great price, large room, wonderful amenities, and extremely courteous staff.  HI would highly recommend this hotel without any hesitation.

title: Great stay
text: Amazing location and very helpful staff.  Enjoyed the stay and loved the smiling doorman every morning and afternoon.  Coming back in May for another few days stay.  Great happy moment between 5 and 6 every day.

title: Great family stay in the upper east side
text: Location was nice, close Saks 5th Avenue, a short walk to Rockefeller Plaza, a bit more to Times Square. Rooms spacious for NYC, bathroom tight, but fine. Staff pleasant from front desk to bell hop, to cleaning staff. Wine time with lemonade for the kids was nice and an added bonus.

title: Fabulous Hotel
text: Great hotel with large rooms, even kitchenettes. Met every expectation and more. Wonderful location on East Side. Beds very comfortable and even a happy hour in the hotel. I thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We had a good view of 3rd avenue. The area is lined with restaurants and one of the best bagel places in the city is just a block away.

title: Great
text: Great hotel with perfect location. Our room was on a smaller side but very clean. Beds and pillows were very comfortable to sleep. Excellent stay for a family. The hotel has a wonderful staff, they resolved our booking problem with Hotels.com very quickly.

title: Excellent value!
text: This is an excellent value hotel. My family (kids ages range from 10 to 5) stayed here over spring break and the location is fantastic. You're 2 blocks from a couple of different subway options, and walking distance from Central Park and Times Square. The only downside is you will hear quite a bit of street noise until 11pm (or even midnight).  Also, be aware that you are charged a fee of about $35/day not listed in the price. Valet parking is also $65-75 a day which I found to be a pretty good value after checking a few self-park garages.

title: quick trip to nyc
text: hotel is excellent, very spacious rooms and bathroom for nyc standards. All employees were very friendly and helpful and courteous. They have a nice happy hour each night. The room service was very good and prompt. Very nice stay. ! We will stay here again !

title: Fab hotel in a great location
text: We are just back from a 6 night stay in this hotel and couldn't recommend it high enough. We would definetly return. Staff were lovely as was the large spacious rooms. Beds very comfy and we had a lovely balcony

title: Ótima localização
text:
O hotel é bem localizado em Midtown.
Os quartos são de bom tamanho, o aquecimento funciona e a cama é bastante confortável .
Inicialmente nos colocaram num quarto sem janelas, somente uma abertura superior, solicitamos troca que foi prontamente atendida. Porém a cortina não funcionava, pedimos conserto que após dois dias não foi possível ser feito. Gloria, no front desk foi super atenciosa e trocamso de quarto novamente. O gerente Brian Gehlich se desculpou e simpaticamente deixou chocolates Godiva no nosso quarto - nota 10 pela atenção!!
Sabia que havia uma "Taxa de Resort" de uns U$ 40.00 por dia, porém até o momento não entendi que Resort foi esse...
Em resumo, um bom hotel com equipe muito atenciosa.

title: Lovely hotel in a perfect location
text:
I visited with my mum in April and we stayed 3 nights. The location is absolutely perfect. You can walk to many sights and one of the main metros is a 1 minute walk away. It feels like a safe part of town. 

The room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. We had two queen size beds and a view onto the road. We were on the fifth floor so you could hear traffic a bit but it didn’t disturb our sleep. We had a problem with the hair dryer the first day and someone came to fix it in less than 5 minutes-thank you. The toiletries in the bathroom were nice. 

We were so busy that we only got to enjoy wine hour on the last day but I definitely recommend guests enjoy it if they have time! There is always free tea and coffee in the relaxation room. 

Breakfast is an option but we didn’t choose this as there is an amazing bagel place across the road. Sometimes queues down the street but definitely worth going to! 

My only small disappointment was that free WiFi is only included in the lobby. If you want WiFi in the room it’s $20 per day which seemed expensive. Also the lobby WiFi was not strong enough to video call friends but it is fine for sending messages. 

The staff were always extremely friendly, polite and helpful. Thank you for all your help and being so welcoming (the doorman always welcome us ‘home’ after a long day out which was very nice). We really enjoyed our stay!

title: Wonderful stay for the entire family!
text: We absolutely loved staying here.  We are a family of 5 and the 1 bedroom suite was perfect.  The hotel staff was attentive and very accommodating.  We were also a bit unsure of the location as my husband originally wanted to stay in Soho, however, this location ended up being perfect - we were close enough to be able to walk to Times Square and Central Park and an easy Subway ride away from Soho, and the Freedom Tower.  We will definitely be staying here for our next trip to NYC.

title: No individual climate control
text: First, the staff at the hotel was lovely, kind, and welcoming, especially Kristy and the manager (Ruth?). However, the hotel can only have heat or air conditioning on, and there day we arrived it was hot out and we could only turn on heat. They finally turned on the air conditioning, but then turned it off overnight. They told us we could open the windows. We switched to the Westin. Also, the room at the Affinia was not terribly clean or in great repair (mold on the shower floor, bubbling wallpaper, really dusty corners).

title: Pessimo
text:
Ho soggiornato con la mia famiglia per una settimana ad aprile 2019, convinta dalle buonissime recensioni!
Sono rimasta veramente delusa...
La pulizia lasciava molto a desiderare!!
Il bagno era veramente minuscolo,dove non si poteva entrare piu' di uno per volta.
In reception molto professionali.

title: Almost perfect - great location
text:
Great customer service, lobby area and bar area lovely. 

Our rooms were a little tired but clean. Missing some useful extras such as somewhere to hang wet coats when returning from the rain, no mirror next to a plug socket to dry hair, only one hook for wet towels, no plug next to coffee machine, sometimes coffee not replenished.

One room was large and spacious with lots of natural light. It overlooked the main road and as it was on the second floor it was a little noisy at night but they supply ear plugs.

The other room was tiny with a thin strip window at the top of the room. When we opened the blind it overlooked a large extractor fan...which pumped the smell of McDonald’s in to the room. You had to have a light on to see even on a sunny day. 

Location was great, the extras from the snack cupboard was fun and the wine hour was fab! 

We didn’t have breakfast as it was so expensive, but there is a fab luncheonette a few doors down as well as a coffee shop and bagel shop nearby.

WiFi was ok if not doing anything important as slow and dropped out at times. 

Photos on website are obviously the recently updated rooms. 

Fab location 

Would recommend 

Would return

title: Even Motel Six Has AC
text: My family and I arrived late at night. It was 73° in our room. A bit hot for me. The climate control only heats the room even though I lowered the temperature to 68. Now it was 75° in our room. My options were to open the window and listen to the street or sweat through the night. I chose sweat. Next day I got some BS excuse that they only heat the the rooms during the winter and AC doesn't come on untill it's hot outside. It was 78° that day. No AC. I was told the building was in neutral and offered a fan. Motel Six has taken better care of me.

title: Excelente Hotel em NY
text: Hotel com excelente localização, tanto para lazer quanto para negócios, pois fica próximo à bares, restaurantes, lojas e estação do metrô. Quartos grandes e muito confortáveis que garantem uma excelente estada.

title: Good, as always, stay
text: This is my fourth stay at FIFTYNYC, which is a nice hotel in a great location in Mid-town NYC. The rooms are great and the Club area is great so I can do a bit of work away from the room. Also like wine hour - could add some nibbles to the wine! Stayed 3 nights.

title: Great Location, Spacious Rooms & Nice Terraces
text: We had a great stay at this hotel.   The rooms were very spacious and accommodating.  Especially enjoyed sitting on the terrace in the mornings with coffee or in the evenings with a glass of wine or a cocktail.   This location is very close to the UN, Grand Central Station, and not too far from Rockefeller Center and the Theatre District.  In addition, there were some excellent markets, wine/spirit stores, diners, and restaurants nearby (Ess-a-Bagel is right across the street).  Good workout room for its size and they have a wine hour every day!  The only "inconvenience" was having to go to the 4th floor for ice, but it really wasn't too much of a problem, since they had 3 elevators, the wait wasn't too long.  The doorman and bellmen were very polite and extremely helpful.  I'd highly recommend this hotel!

title: Another pleasant stay at Affinia
text: This is our fourth time at Affinia.  50 NYC is across the street from our daughter's apartment. The staff (especially Leah) are always welcoming.  Quiet and generous size room. Tasty continental breakfast and a welcoming complimentary happy hour after a long day of walking, shopping and sightseeing. Perfect location for many of NYC sights in a less touristy area. Another pleasant stay. Thank you.

title: Great stay, silly fees
text: Stayed here for 3 nights for a weekend in NYC.  Overall, great accommodations.   Love the kitchen with fridge and microwave; room was spacious by NYC standards which was appreciated.  Staff and everyone we encountered was very friendly and helpful.  Location is great too just sort of in the middle with easy acess to sites.   Only gripe the "resort fee" although common in the hotel industry the list of what the fee includes is wiifi,   a free wine hour(i took advantage of one night because I felt obligated because it was included in my :"fee" I probably wouldn't have gone otherwise) ,  free local and long distance calls , gym access.  These seem to be pretty standard things a hotel offers (seriously everyone has a cell phone calls not dazzled by a a free phone call option)  Also the $10 credit at the pantry was kind of silly basically got overprice water (can certainly purchase elsewhere for much cheaper)for three days.

title: Great staff and location
text: The staff were great, great location and value for money.  But we had some issues with the room we were first put in and the room where we were moved, did not have a clean toilet and the housekeeping did not clean it despite a request to do so.

title: Quick overnight
text: One night overnight stay to visit someone in town and though I had been in the rooms a few times I had never booked a room myself. I was very pleased, rooms are very spacious even by NYC standards, and everything was incredibly clean and set up nicely. Shower door was a bit awkward but no big deal. You do have to pay a $35 hotel fee, but that gives you access to the WiFi, a $10 credit towards some snacks/drinks they offer down at the front desk, and to a wine bar for free drink(s) between I think 4-5 or 5-6. Unfortunately my train ran late so I got in late and ended up just grabbing some water to make the most of the $10 credit. But I was very pleased with the hotel and would strongly consider staying again anytime I come to NYC and will be in that part of Manhattan.

title: Good But Not Great
text:
I stayed there for 2 weeks with my wife while I was on a business trip. The hotel is nice. Staff is polite.

The rooms are good. We stayed in the one with a small kitchen, it had two queen beds because we couldn't get the one with 1 King bed.
With 2 beds it was really dying on the space. The bathroom was really really small. The kitchen was small too. It had a convection, mini fridge, sink and a cooktop. Sufficient to make breakfast. The walking space in the room was suffocating due to the two beds. However, the storage options were good. It had a cupboard on the right, as you enter the room. Then there was one inside the bathroom, which was enough to hold shoes, towels, laundry items. And there were also bed side table and a TV cabinet.
It was the room space and the small bathroom that put us off, so we asked the manager to change the room. And, he was happy to change it. We downgraded to a room without a kitchen and a King size bed. But, he gave us breakfast coupons for our stay.
The new room had 1 king bed, 1 sliding door cupboard, a couch and a mini fridge. And, also a small balcony (although there was no view).
The bathroom was big this time. But, the storage option was very limited for two people staying for 2 weeks. We were not happy with the storage space but there was nothing we could do about it.

They provide European breakfast, which is tea/coffee. Eggs (only boiled), crossiant, nuts and berries, juices and breads.

They don't have a live kitchen so that's the best you can get which is off putting for me.

We stayed there in Feb, 2019 and it costed around $2700 for 13 nights.

To summarize, I wouldn't stay again there for various reasons:
1) Small rooms
2) Limited breakfast option
3) You can get better hotels in the same price.

If you are staying for longer duration and likes lavish breakfast then this is not for you.
Also, they don't have their own restraunt. So, you cannot have anything late at night.

title: Great experience, would definitely return.
text: We really enjoyed our stay.  We were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room.  The common areas were all well designed to have lots of cozy spots.  The fitness center was great! The location was very convenient, short trip to the subway.

title: Room was way too hot
text: The whole weekend I was visiting the temperature was in the 60's. The room was getting hot because the heat was on. I asked about what can be done about the temperature and was told to just open the window. Mind you its on a busy street and the noise made for very restless nights. There was also hair on the bed and stains on the decorative pillow.

title: Great Location, everything else was OK.
text: The hotel is in great location.  Prices are the same as most in this area.  Service was good.  My room was clean.  Only issue I had was my room was extremely small when compared to a friends room, with both of us having the same type of room.  In my bathroom, you had to leave the door open to turn around.  In my friend's room, he had a walk in shower with plenty of room, plus the rest of the bathroom.

title: Above And Beyond
text: Very central location and extremely clean and well kept. We had a junior suite. Room was comfortable and well maintained. The staff were very helpful shout-out to komal for recommending me to a great restaurant and also helping me set up my wifi.

title: Ottimo hotel per chi è alla prima visita di NYC
text:
La posizione dell'hotel è ottima, a due passi dalla Grand Central Station e da Times Square ed è anche raggiungibile a piedi dalla stazione metro 51st o 53st linea Lexington Avenue e/o dalla 59st. 
Belle camere spaziose e personale preparato. Ho apprezzato il wine hour dalle 5 alle 6. Uniche due pecche: il costo e la colazione non inclusa nel prezzo.

title: Great Hotel for Families
text: We have stayed here as a family of five for many years.  We return here always as the rooms are spacious and in NYC this is important when you are traveling with kids.  Our children are no longer small and we can still all stay here comfortably.  The neighborhood is great with restaurants, shops, and a full grocery store (Morton Williams at 2nd and 49th).

title: arrinia 50
text:
the stay was good, with the exception of three things:
*with HVAC on either heat or a/c for the entire hotel, I could not get the room cool enough.  I sleep best at 66-67;  the room was 70-72.
*the workout facility has good equipment, but the temperature was 72--way too hot for 30 minutes on the treadmill
*I like having a shower stall (rather than a bathtub with a shower).  The water temperature was good.  however, the water pressure was not strong enough, and it was difficult to get shampoo and conditioner out of my hair.

title: Native NY'er as a tourist
text: The service was great!. Very attentive staff.  Hotel was clean, wine sipping was free and daily. The bed was super comfortable, and view awesome. Leah was a super duper front desk receptionist. I did a pre-visit to see the room before my actual stay and Leah escorted me to see the room that I had booked which actually influenced my decision to upgrade.

title: too expensive for what it delivery
text: Too expensive for what it delivery. Do not like the way I eas treated at fron t desk and the way it is a lot of other charges apart from what was informed swhen made reservation. This eas my 3rd time at the hotel and I sure will be the last time.

title: Family visit to NYC
text: We had our 2 young children, ages 8 and 10. Great location, and fabulous service! Our room was on the street side, so it was pretty noisy through the night, but other than that, everything was excellent! Plenty of places to eat, grab coffee, easy walk to subway, and Rockefeller.

title: FIFTY HOTEL NYC
text:
Comfortable and  convenient, with excellent service.
Love the 'wine hour', proximity to subway and walking distance to many places of interest. A lovely atmosphere, SUPER doormen, a real home from home.

title: Birthday Celebrations
text:
I stayed here for my birthday celebration. Is located in a great location and only a short walk to Bloomingdales, Central Park, Radio City, Rockafeller and Times Square. 

The rooms were nicely decorated, clean and had all that you needed for a short stay or longer stay in the suites.

We was booked in the one bedroom suite - this was very spacious with a small kitchen area where you could cook meals if on a budget. The Living room was a decent size with a  great large mirror. We were also lucky to have a small balcony which was nice fir sitting out watching the world go by with a small glass of wine :-)

They also do a Wine hour between 1700/1800 where you can meet some of the staff and other guest - this was in the lounge on the 2nd floor.

title: Excelent
text: The hotel is close to everything, and the staff are wonderful. The room is large and comfortable, overlooking the EARTH AVENUE. The kitchen has lots of fixtures and fittings, and was very handy. We love it.

title: Great Stay in New York
text: A wonderful, affordable, clean stay in New York. Near the Metro. Coffee in the room. Large double room. Didn't take advantage of the complimentary wine and beer (bummer for us!) The windows opened a bit and breeze was wonderful throughout the night. Even though we were on the front side of the building, the eighth floor, street noise was not a problem. Definitely a place I would stay again and recommend to friends.

title: Just a little disappointed in the rooms
text: I booked three rooms for the weekend; booked well in advance, with instructions to have them close together.  Two were Studio Suite (2 Queen) rooms. While both were nice, good sized rooms, one of them had a particularly tiny bathroom.  The third room was a Junior Suite with 2 Queen beds, not on the same floor as the others.  I've stayed in this room before.  Unfortunately, this time, we were assigned the less desirable version of the room (there's 1013 and 1014; the one on the left is way nicer than the one on the right; we got the one on the right.)  Having booked in advance with special instructions, it would have been nice to have had the better room options, rather than luck-of-the-draw, and have them on the same floor.

title: Family weekend visit to NY
text: We had an excellent stay at The Fifty Hotel & Suites by Affinia. We were pleasantly surprised to get an impromtu upgrade to a Jr Suite because we were visiting with our two daughters & grand-daughter. It's our 4th stay here and the front desk and all of the other support staff are always very welcoming and helpful. Very conveniently located to all that we wanted to do.

title: Pleasant Stay
text: Very nice room, well appointed, comfortable bed and pillows.   Coffemaker in the room with very good coffee.  Very clean.  Wonderful to have a refrigerator. Space between wall, commode, and sink could have been bigger, and bathroom light switch inexplicably placed well inside the bathroom. I had to wait online for check-in -- someone who was checking in was also mailing a large package, and this took a great deal of time.  Should have been handled elsewhere. As a result, I missed reception/wine ("You literally just missed it", when my turn came up. I clearly would have had time for one glass of wine if I had been checked-in in a timely manner.

title: Decent location.
text: The property is conveniently located. But rooms are small and noisy, especially near elevators. We noticed the last day our pillows were not clean. Staff tries hard, but seemed overwhelmed. Happy hours are a nice touch.

title: Only issue was with room pricing
text: I really liked this property and would definitely stay here again. My only issue was with pricing. Why is a room with 2 doubles so much more than a King? Otherwise excellent property with central location. Very professional and friendly staff. Plus good pillows!!!

title: The staff is the greatest!
text: Yes, the rooms are spacious and clean and comfortable. Yes, everything works.  What makes the hotel special is that everyone on the staff is warm, welcoming, personable, professional.  We really appreciate being treated like real people.

title: Good location, clean, good value
text:
Walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and a variety of restaurants.
Staff is super helpful and room service is very good. 
Good climate control. 
Fast elevators. 
Floors are carpeted, which is something I don't care for.

title: March 18-22. 2019
text:
Negatives:
- Bathroom was tiny, too small.  I was tripping on myself in there.  It will be way too small when my wife arrives with me next week.
- Set the heat at 68 and it stayed at 71 all week.
- No plugs near the bed
- Odd shower controls, far too many

Positives:
- Good location
- Adequate sized room
- Good bed

title: Affinia 50
text: Excellent hotel with good clean facilities and friendly staff.location is excellent with multiple subway station  close by.There is a good variety of restaurant nearby.The hotel and ffers a daily wine hour between 5-6 daily

title: Amazing Family Vacation to NYC!
text: After staying many times in different NYC hotels, this by far exceeded our expectations.  We had a family suite on the 17th floor and this room was HUGE.  Plenty of room for 2 adults and 3 kids, ages 10-14.  The spacious layout with kitchen, two large windows, and a good sized bathroom gave us plenty of room to spread out and not feel like we were on top of each other.  This hotel is in a great area of midtown, within walking distance to everything.  Housekeeping did a great job, and was very friendly and helpful every time we encountered her. We found the service to be outstanding and had no problems from check-in to check-out.  The only issue we had, which was no fault of the hotels, was the transportation we arranged back to the airport through the concierge.  This was the worst ride we have ever experienced and all felt sick by the time we arrived. This driver should not be allowed on the road and I would suggest the hotel not recommend this service (or driver) anymore.  However, every staff member we encountered at the hotel was extremely nice and professional.  We will definitely stay here again!

title: Not as great as other times
text: I am a frequent visitor, and I always stay at Affinia as it is very convenient, comfortable, well located, service is great.  This time my room in 2nd floor was not that great, very small, no windows, noisy air conditioner (room 204), also some strange charges in my invoice (that never happened before). I showed up after midnight, and I confirm my arrival date-time through the portal, the hotel front-desk did not received the notification and they marked me as no-show... maybe that is why they gave me that room.

title: Great place to host friends and family, bring the dog!
text:
We decided to get a suite and host some friends and family for the St. Patrick's Day Parade - we're all dispersed around the city, the Island and the Northern Burbs so we occasionally all get together for the parade.

My wife and I came in the day before, we paid the $150 pet fee (cheaper than a sitter) and brought the dog.

As they mention on their website, the suite is PERFECT for entertaining - you get a small kitchen with a mini-fridge (but a large mini fridge if you pardon the oxymoron), cook-top, toaster, microwave, etc.  There is also a large table and desk / counter you can spread out on.  There is a sectional couch in the living room with plenty of additional seating.  The bedroom is separated and the bed is large and comfortable.  We set up food trays, wine, chips, etc. all around and people had plenty of space to mingle.  Easily accommodated more than a dozen people.

After everyone left we cleaned up (kids make a much bigger mess than pets!) and enjoyed the rest of our stay.  If you bring Fido, there is a dog park on E51st right along the FDR.  We stopped by a couple of times, very convenient.

Three notes:
Parking - their rate of $65 a day with no in-and-out is high for the East Side.  Get a parking app like ParkingWhiz or SpotHero - I found a lot on E47th that was $60 for the whole weekend.

Bring lots of tip money - it's an NYC thing, you have both a doorman and a bellhop to tip.  One helps you to and from the room and the other to and from the car.  Both were very friendly and helpful getting luggage and food in and out though.  You can park right in front and load / unload your car with their help.

If you sign into WiFi, you get prompted to pay - DON'T, there is a code on the slip your room key came in for free access.  I missed this at first, but WiFi is included in the "resort fee."  So is the daily wine hour, take advantage of that too since you paid for it.

title: Family NYC trip with 3 teen boys
text: We had a corner room jr. Suite on 16th floor, room 1603. It had huge window on both corners, walk out balcony, kitchen, 2 queen beds & pullout queen sofa. We stayed for 6 nights & it was perfect for us. Maid service was spot on & every thing was very clean. About 10 mintute walk to Times Square & Rockefeller Center. Subway was about 1 1/2 blocks away. We will definitely stay here again when bringing the children back.

title: 1st time to NYC!
text:
Great location, great service, and super clean!
We booked a junior suite room for our family of 4 and it suited our needs and then some. Door men remembered our last name and welcomed us back "home" each evening...a nice little touch. Only very small complaint..we would have liked alittle more room in the bathroom.

title: Saint Pattys Day weekend
text: Great hotel!  only one issue the night desk guy was no where to be found early Sunday morning when we returned to the hotel. Myself and other hotel guests had to knock loudly on the window to get someones attention. He eventually emerged from the back room. But great place.

title: Nice spot a few blocks away from all the action
text: A nice clean hotel with spacious room and friendly staff located a few minutes walk to time squares and central park. Parking is available along with restaurants and as shopping. Nice part of New York, I would stay here again.

title: Girls Trip
text: The hotel and employees were good, unfortunately there was a large ADULT party going on that was very disrespectful.  Employees did their best to mitigate & overall we got good sleep in a tough situation.

title: Another Wonderful Experience!
text: Back again for another year staying at our favorite midtown hotel.  Once again, we had a wonderful stay and truly appreciated the hospitality of the entire staff at Fifty NYC!
