We've come to rely on everything being perfect and we're never disappointed.  From the time we pulled up and were greeted warmly by Lenny, to being checked in expeditiously by Ronaldo, to being greeted as we came and went daily, our experience was fantastic!

title: Great stay in midtown
text: Our family stayed at this hotel and enjoyed every minute.  The room was fabulous, the service excellent and the hotel quiet.  The staff were so friendly.  All our needs were met and if made for a very enjoyable trip.  Highly recommend.

title: Great location
text: The hotel is very nice.  It is clean and in a great location to get around NY.  Beware there is a $35 a day charge for "facilities".  They give you a $10 "credit" so the facilities charge is really $25 a day but totally not worth it.  It turns the price fro a great deal to a good deal IMO.  I checked in early and got a room but it was for a disabled person so there was no ledge to keep the shower from going all over the bathroom.  Otherwise all was satisfactory.

title: Great Location
text: I always choose an Affinia property when in NYC and again it did not disappoint. The 50 Hotel was clean. The beds are very comfortable. The ear plugs provided block out any street noise at night. The location allowed us to walk to Broadway shows, Times Square, Central Park, The Empire State Building and Grand Central Station with ease.

title: Super bem localizado! Quarto espaçoso!
text:
Escolhi esse hotel pela localização( tem metrô na mesma quadra) e pelo quarto espaçoso, cama queen( que foi difícil achar por um preço justo).
Bom custo beneficio, aconchegante, escolhemos o quarto com cozinha que funcionou super bem, apesar de não ser completa, bom chuveiro, vários armários, oferecem 01 hora de degustação de vinho gratuitamente todos os dias! Só não dei 05 porque achei as louças mal lavadas, eu precisei lavar novamente por vários dias.

title: This was a great place to stay
text: We truly loved this place. all of people where nice and very helpful. Kristy at the front desk was truly a great help and very sweet. Remember that Kristy with a K. The doormen where always helpful and friendly. The rest of the staff was always nice and answered our questions. I was there for a 2nd opinion at MSK and they made may stay fantastic despite the reason I was there. Thanks again everyone.

title: Great Location, Friendly Staff
text: We needed a room large enough for a king bed and sleeper sofa. Fifty Hotel had that room. It was well appointed, very comfortable bed, and just right pillows. The staff was very welcoming and friendly. The location was great, right next to 3rd and Lexington. There was a subway stop at the end of the street, bus runs right on 2nd and 3rd, cabs easy to find. There is a club room on 2 that serves wine from 5-6. Several restaurants are nearby.

title: always a pleasure
text: This hotel always delivers with very friendly service and pleasant accommodations.  Take advantage of their very affordable sales throughout the year and you will be well rewarded.  The beds are quite comfortable and the complimentary wine hour is a plus.

title: Comfortable, friendly hotel in a great location
text: Clean, comfortable, well appointed rooms. Great wifi, lovely linens and pillows. Friendly and helpful staff. Great location- close to subway and walking distance to all sights. Would definitely book again.

title: Charming Boutique Style Hotel
text: This is my number 1 favorite place to stay in NYC.   Its a charming boutique style hotel.   The staff is always helpful and friendly.  They truly make you feel like you are at home.   The rooms are  clean and the Wi-Fi works great.   The NYC Fifty even has a "pillow menu".   Whether you want a buckwheat pillow or a feather pillow they have them all.    The hotel is close to the subway and a short walk to Times Square.

title: Férias no Carnaval
text: Excelente localização, boa relação custo/ benefício, pessoal sempre atencioso, quarto de bom tamanho, dotado de pequena cozinha, camas muito confortáveis e muito bom banho. Já estive em outro hotel da rede na cidade e as impressões foram as mesmas. Recomendo, é para repetir.

title: OLE Business Trip
text: I am very grateful for this hotel and proximity to the office. Always clean, staff is courtesy, and sleep well at this location.  Look forward to being back soon.  Thank you for a great stay inNYC.  Shawn

title: Great Staff
text: Our stay was for taking my mom to the Rockefeller Pavilion (Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center). The staff at 50 NYC are amazing. They always check and make sure she is ok, and they help out in any way they can if needed!

title: Good Value
text: Room was clean and large enough, and I very much appreciated the location (over an alley, so no noise!).  All employees were outstanding.  Pillows, though, were very uncomfortable, and the first morning I had no shower gel and the outlet in the bathroom did not work (both fixed after first night).  Fact that they had room service was appreciated, but the food was not very good.  Breakfast option not remotely worth the price.  The only reason I went was because they said it was included in my rate, but then I was charged for it and had to call and get the charge reversed (which was not a problem).

title: Loved this hotel
text:
Perfect location and wonderful staff who were friendly and helpful. As 3 single ladies we chose a junior suite to share as we needed a bed each - even the sleeper sofa was comfy and there was still plenty of room when the sofa was pulled out and made up. So lots of space and a kitchenette! 
We were in NY to celebrate a 50th birthday and were thrilled to receive a bottle of fizz all ready on ice for our arrival - thank you!
We particularly enjoyed the Sipping Hour in the lounge - chatting to other guests over a glass of wine - we will definitely stay here again.
Thank you!

title: Great place to enjoy NY
text:
I spent 5 nights at the hotel. Great environment. Nice people willing to support and provide advice. Room was very comfortable. 
My father and my sister had already stayed at the hotel and recommended me to stay at Affinia; they were not wrong!
My mother and grandmother will visit NY in August/September and they will stay at this hotel too!

title: DavidF
text: Excellent  option for the short term vacation in New York. Location (E50th on 3rd Av) is perfect for all amenities...1 Minute walk from Lexington Avenue / 15 mins from Time Square / 5 mins from Grand Central / 1 min Metro & Subway. It took only 35 minutes in a cab from JFK on a Thursday lunch time trip. I took a Guest Room Delux with King Bed which was impeccable and both contemporary and luxurious and serviced daily. The staff were extremely courteous, pleasant and helpful. Check-in and Check-out was very quick and the bill was 100% accurate in line with my reservation. A multitude of cafe, bar and restaurant options nearby for all tastes and budgets. All things considered this is a great place to say in NY and I will be returning soon.

title: Great location, great staff - fab stay!
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights in February. On arrival we were met by Romeo on the door and my 7 year old daughter couldn’t wait to see him
every day! He always had a new magic trick to show her and was so warm and welcoming. “Welcome home” was his greeting!
The lounge did feel like home. We kicked back and relaxed in there every evening for wine hour - a nice touch. Travelling with a 7 year old meant we didn’t miss there being a bar but had we been travelling as a couple I think it would be a negative. 
Didn’t try breakfast at the hotel, preferring to get up and out for a proper NYC breakfast. 
All staff were super helpful and cheerful. 
Great location just a block from the subway which connects you to downtown and close enough to walk to Central Park and all the midtown attractions.
Would definitely come back.

title: Ótimo hotel
text: Além da ótima localização e atendimento o quarto do hotel é muito agradável. Ficamos 3 noites e não tivemos problema algum. Quarto grande, confortável e limpo! O banheiro também estava com tudo muito bem limpo.

title: Stay at Fity hotel in NYC
text:
Very pleasant place to stay and staff very friendly
A lot of space in the room and very clean and quiet
Hotel close to every main attraction in NYC
Special mention to the fireplace and the 2nd floor for the happy hours

title: Intimate and friendly
text: We selected this property because of customer ratings, location and price. Our room was very spacious, comfortable and clean. The daily ‘happy hour’ was a lovely touch and heavily subscribed. The staff were superb and simply couldn’t do enough for us. The decor was contemporary but not generic. MOMA, Rockefeller Centre, Radio City and St. Patrick’s Cathedral and Fifth Avenue were all very close as was a huge selection of excellent restaurants. Couldn’t imagine a better hotel in this price range.

title: We loved it!
text:
After having major problems with booking.com we as a family of four including two children aged 14 and 11. We had become rather stressed over the fact of our trip to New York. 
Let me assure you this hotel is amazing the staff are polite the beds are so comfy I have no complaints at all I would recommend to anyone. 
We loved every bit of the trip, the concierge was open 24 hours there was a couple bars and restaurants on the same street, as well as a Starbucks, McDonald and a small liquor shop. 
All in all the atmosphere was amazing and positive.

title: Comfortable and clean enough for sleeping
text: The room was nicer than I was expecting for the rate we were paying. We really only needed it to sleep and shower. The beds are comfy, the bathroom was clean without any mold or stains, and wifi worked well. We had a lower floor room that faced the rooftop ventilation fan stuff which wasn't a problem for me at night. It was more of a white noise and much better than street traffic and siren noise if facing the street. The room was very dark and of course no view, but we weren't in the room much during waking hours. The heater unit is exceptionally noisy so we turned it off for our stay and the room temp was fine for us, around 68deg while outside was about 30-40deg. Staff are very friendly. Location is easy enough to get around.

title: NY city break
text:
We are a family of 4 with 2 teenagers.

We stayed 4 nights in a room with 2 queen beds. The room and bathroom were spotless, with plenty of space for the 4 of us.

All the staff have been very friendly and have gone above and beyond to help with anything needed.

Location is great as you literally turn right out of the hotel walk a few blocks and you are in the hustle and bustle of the city. You can see some great sights on the walk as well.

Having stayed in New York a few times now, I would have to say we would have no problem recommending this hotel.

title: Depends what your priorities are....
text: Huge space, nice amenities,  friendly staff. could have been more clean. Carpet old and kiind of gross, wallpaper needed a refresh. Not as clean overall as I would have liked/ but overall, a good value.

title: Severe Disappointment
text:
My sister and I and a friend came here from Florida for a birthday girls weekend. We take where we are staying very seriously, and base our decision on reviews, price , and location. 
When I read the reviews for this hotel, I was happy with what I read and that’s why we booked this hotel. 
Unfortunately, upon check in, my review of this hotel would not be as positive and I just want to share some things. 
I’ve attached several photos of what I consider less than “better than expected “ which is noted on their advertising. We came into a dated, dirty and not fully functional room. Bathroom walls and floor were dirty. Outlets and bed lights don’t work. Maid service didn’t come until late afternoon time on our first day here. Very old, dated, and dirty room for the price. And THEN- surprise- we were charged another $120 at check out.  Not for any incidentals. We have NO idea why that charged occurred. 
We spent a lot of money to stay here and I just want you to know we were severely disappointed and won’t be returning nor can I recommend this hotel with a good review. The conditions just aren’t nice. I was given an email to send my feedback to on my receipt and a week later, have not heard anything back from the manager. 
Don’t stay here.

title: Great staff and large rooms
text: This was our first visit to this hotel and, overall, it was great. The staff are very friendly, it is a small boutique hotel feel, and the rooms are larger than most at this price point. I would’ve given 5 stars but for the annoying hospitality charge, which many of the boutique hotels suffer from. Basically, you pay $30 a day above the room charge for a $10 credit at the snack shop (spoiler- water is $9), and a “free” wine service in the lobby. Our room was roomy and comfortable but we only had hot water our first day, which was a little annoying. All in all a nice, very centrally located place near the subway and all the midtown attractions.

title: PERFECT BDAY WEEKEND
text: I absolutely enjoyed my bday weekend!! From the moment we pulled up to the hotel the doorman, the front desk clerks, the lobby was warm and welcoming and everyone was amazing. Check in was a breeze..we stayed on 11th floor king size room was clean and the view was very nice. It really felt like home and very comfortable. We went to 5oclock mixer tasted wine from south africa it was very nice. We definitely will be staying here again!!

title: Lovely hotel and in a great loication
text: The area between Lexington and third abounds in excellent restaurants; easy transportation by subway and bus. The room are lovely large and exceptionally clean. Staff very welcoming! There is an easy cross avenue walk to Broadway for theater; Museum of Modern Art for all that great Museum offers; the Museum of Aft and design, and an easy uptown bus ride to the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: Worth Every Penny
text: When you think about staying at a Manhattan hotel, all you see is $$$$ but the 50 Hotel & Suites was worth every penny! It truly felt like a home away from home with the right amount of modern Manhattan flare.

title: Outstanding, caring staff
text: I was here for a two week medical outpatient medical stay.  The entire staff was always very helpful, caring and quick to help with any need I had.  My spouse enjoyed the nightly wine hour.  This appears to be a business and international crowd who stay here.  This is a pet friendly hotel, I did not have any issues with barking dogs, etc.  All pets were quiet.  City noise can be an issue, if you’re not used to sirens, etc.

title: Great Hotel Experience
text: I'm not sure what the pricing is/value since it was booked for me for a business trip, but it was a great experience.  They have a happy hour with wine and beer at no charge. I like that they had a refillable shampoo, conditioner and shower gel dispensers in the showers instead of wasting or not having enough in those small bottles.  They have different room styles to fit your needs. There's rooms available with a full serviced kitchen.  The room was spacious and very clean.

title: Cutting back to average
text: I stayed, reviewed, and gave the Affinia 50 4 stars previously, as a result of my last stay there in January 2019, I give it 3 stars.  The hotel no longer has a concierge, the staff at the front desk can provide information which it does capably yet, the staff still checks guests in and out so there is usually a wait.  The social hour no longer includes snacks just drinks; a bit disappointing to not have a little something to munch on with a glass of wine.  The breakfast is continental with fair food - the food is pretty pedestrian as evidenced by the grape jelly.

title: Amazing NYC!!
text:
This was our first trip to New York and this hotel was the perfect base!!
We stayed for 4 nights the week of thanks giving and can’t recommend the staff or location enough.
The hotel has had a great renovation and this can be seen throughout.
We never paid for breakfast and from what we saw this was pretty basic in terms of a continental style so was glad that we ventured out to the menu restaurants near by to eat!
The wine hour is a real treat and the staff (especially the door staff) were amazing throughout our stay!! In terms of room sizes I’ve been advised that these are some of the biggest rooms in terms of price bracket and we were really pleased with ours. We did have minor issues with plumbing but the staff sent someone out the same day and this was resolved!!
All in all the hotel is reasonably priced in a great location..we have booked to come back this November :)

title: Good Service, Good Location, Good Room
text: Used this for a week stay in New York, the area is great as a hub to do many activities around the city. Restaurants, Laundry, Metro, Pharmacy, Supermarket, all close to accommodate an longer stay guest. Bathroom is small, water pressure not great. Service at all areas very good. Always helpful. Would stay here again.

title: Will always return
text: My girlfriends and I have been visiting NYC for 14 years. Every year we come back to The Fifty Hotel. The staff is helpful and we love seeing the same Bellmen faces year after year. The room is always nicely appointed.

title: Clean, friendly, and affordable in a great location
text: I stayed here on a business trip. The staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The room was spacious, clean, and very quiet. My only complaint was that the hotel charges $35 per day for a facilities fee, and I felt this was unnecessary. I could do without most of the things it covers (a $10 daily snack credit and wine happy hour). WiFi and phone was also included in this, but most hotels offer you those without a fee.

title: What a find!
text:
We have been visiting NYC for many years now and we have a tried and tested list of hotels we always use but this time we thouught we would try a different hotel so we could expand our list.  After this stay it will be going to the top of our list.  What a wonderful stay we had.  From the second we stepped out of the car we were greeted very warmly by Samuel and that wonderful feeling of being valued as a guest continued throughout our stay.  Every time we left and returned to the hotel Samuel was there to greet us with his charming smile and friendly, helpful manner.  After a very long flight from the UK check in was a joy as we were dealt with by the glorious Jasmin.  We felt like long lost family with her lovely welcome, warm smile and her friendliness.  The room wasnt ready but we didnt mind as all this went to making us feel chilled.  Didnt have to wait long though.  'Our Darling' Jasmin gave us a fabuous corner room wth great views and a balcony.  We felt very special.
The hotel is very convenienlty located and is very well maintained.  Exceptionally clean and certainly passing our acid test of being able to walk on the carpet without slippers!!
All staff we came across were friendly and efficient.  Going back to Jasmin though - this girl is a real asset to the organisation - a keeper!!
Over the years our experience has taught us that you get what you pay for with NYC hotels and we would have no hesitation staying at this great find again.

title: Great Value in NYC
text: The hotel is located in a great location with plenty of places to get food just around the corner. The hotel has a very nice lobby. The check in was fast and efficient. The rooms are smalll but average for NYC. They appear to be newly renovated and nicely done.

title: Business Traveler
text: This is an excellent hotel with equally excellent service and professional staff.  The location is perfectly situated on the East Side.  The rooms are clean and spacious.  The car service to Laguardia made my return home especially easy after a multi-day business trip.

title: CLEAN AND QUICK
text: Great experience - checked in online which was key. Walked in and within seconds got room key and was in the room. Only confusion thing was how rooms are arranged but overall great room! HUGE ROOM for the price! Will return for trips.

title: GREAT WEEKEND
text: we had a great time the hotel location is great the room very clean and good size loved the wine hours but the front desk staff is not friendly, special the overnighter, we checked in at 7AM I know we were early but the front desk person was so nasty. Front desk must be little better with customer

title: Fam Hol.
text: Fantastic. Highly recommended. Great doorman and staff. Wouldn’t hesitate to stay again. Location is great. 10 min walk to time square. And subway 5 min walk. Value for money if you are looking for convenience while in NY.

title: Pleasantly surprised
text: Wasnt sure what to expect as we paid$119 a night.  The numerous taxes and fees are confusing.  I would lump them into the price.  The wine nightly from 5 to 6 is wonderful.  The bell man and concierge are AMAZING. Our room was excellent,  clean,  modern.  The only complaint i have was the$75 parking per day fee.

title: Nice hotel
text: Have stayed here many times on business and with family. Lovely rooms, including some great suites, friendly staff. Good location in Midtown, easy access to the 6 train. Watch out for the $35 "resort fee" added on to each night's bill, including a $10 "credit" at the overpriced snack "shop" -- not included in the advertised rates.

title: Good - could be great.
text: Great location. Very friendly. The service fee and related taxes are a rip off. I don’t want/need your happy hour crap. Gym needs to be bigger - find another room for the cardio and increase weights, machines in current room.

title: Recent 8 Day Stay
text: The hotel, as per usual was pretty good. Nice staff and accomodations. My only two concerns are first, that I got a suite with a kitchen but the refrigerator / freezer could use an upgrade. And more importantly, I needed to stay an extra day but wasn't given the value of my current days which is very hard to understand. I was staying longer, not cutting my trip short, due to unforeseen circumstances, at a hotel I've stayed at many times, and if I was the manager my goal would be to ensure my guest didn't have to negotiate a price. I literally don't get that and encourage you not to do that to any other guest. In fact, I would have probably given a discount from the other dates just to show good faith.

title: WORST HOTEL IN NYC
text: The management staff was extremely rude and I simply would never stay here again.  They treated me with complete contempt and I wouldn't recommend that my worst enemy stay here.  The hotel sucks so don't make the same mistake I did

title: Great Customer Sevice & Location
text:
We booked in this hotel for 6nights with our family. 

We arrived by our own transfer and greeted by a big welcome smile by the doorman and helped take all our luggages yo our room.

The concierge gave us advise that there is a grocery 2 blocks if we want to prepare food ourselves to avoid eating out for every meal as it can get very expensive. Excellent tip!

The hotel has a beautiful fireplace area for guests and they also offer wine/beer complimentary during happy hour.

There’s also s snack bar in reception that you can pick up to US$10 complimentary.

The rooms are spacious with a kitchen & laundry facilities located in the hotel for guests! Great for us to wash our own clothes as we have been traveling for 2 weeks. 

I would recommend this hotel! Great location, within walking distance to Times Square, Trump Tower, Central Park & restaurants nearby.

title: Excellent Stay
text: I spend a lot of time in NYC hotels and this was the nicest surprise that I've had in quite a while.  The room was large, well-appointed, very clean and comfortable.  A great value.  I will be staying here again.

title: Recently refurbished??
text:
We booked 3 nights at the Fifty NYC for a November stay, all booked through Virgin Holidays in the UK. The images look very grand on the website, but on arrival, the reception desk is tucked away to the right and it's not quite as grand as it appeared, but for three nights it was ok, we had a huge city to explore.

We arrived earlier than expected and our room wasnt ready but we were offered an upgraded room with a balcony for a modest fee and that was ready now. So we took it.

A few seconds before our arrival someone else checked in and their bags were taken to their room. We were not offered this luxury and were directed to the lifts which were quite compact.

Up to the 17th floor, corridors were quite small but ok for three days. The room was fine, old large wardrobes built into the room, that's one of the things that makes me doubt the recent refurbishment of the room. But again, ok for three days.

Good size safe in the room and the sheets were clean and tidy. There were steps up from the room to the balcony which we only used for photos on day 1. View out the street and beyond but as new york is so tall, not a great deal to be  seen of the city from there.

We didn't use breakfast as there were top many diners to see and try.

The bell boy, or whatever you would call him organised us a return car to the airport, very reasonable price, would definitely use that again as it was more luxurious than the yellow cabs.

One disappointment as you walked down the road was that at the other hotels the doorman were uniformed with peak caps and the like, always polite as you walked by. In Fifty NYC he wore an anorak most of the time, the quality of those other hotels shone in comparison.

Another thing to note, free WiFi in the lobby and first floor lounge area, but nowhere else in the hotel. In 2018 you might have expected more as standard.

In the lounge area on 1st floor there are tables and chairs, sofas and free coffee, used on the day of departure waiting for our car.

Overall, pretty decent budget hotel without the frills. If you want quality, I am afraid you need to look elsewhere. The location is good as you can walk to the Rockefeller centre in 10 minute and central park in 20. Park avenue shopping is only 15 mins away.

title: Room wasn't made and no hot water, Jan 14th night stay
text: First room I was given was not prepared.  Beds not made yet.  This was at 6:00 PM.  Second room was perfectly fine, and desk woman was very pleasant and apologetic.  Morning of the 15th, no hot water at 7:00AM.  NONE.  Freezing ice cold water in shower and sink.  No email alerting me.  No notice slid under my door alerting me.  Nothing.  Mentioned to front desk person who said major boiler issues.  Hey, things happen, I get it, but how about a little communication, instead of having me run the water for 15 minutes thinking it might heat up at some point.

title: Just Perfect as usual! 😁
text: It’s almost my tenth time at Affinia 50 and very glad to receive the excellent service as usual. Front desk was very expeditive; i arrived 9 am in the morning and the offered me a very nice usd20 upgrade to a more spacy room which i accpected right away in order not to wait untill 3 pm. All 4 doormen very polite al usual, i’ve known them for so many years. Housekeeping very efficient too. Y ears pass by and everything is mantained and moreover even better. The only drawback would be that snacks habe been removed from 5 pm cocktail! Many thanks

title: Wonderful gem of a hotel room!
text: Would HIGHLY recommend this boutique hotel. Very clean, wonderful staff, close to everything and sizeable rooms considering NYC! A friend recommended this hotel and we were not disappointed. We will recommend to others and will stay here again when next in town.

title: Our recent stay
text: I've stayed at all three Affinia properties over the past several years. Always great accommodations, great services, great staff. I've stayed at Affinis properties for business and family visits. As a "displaced New Yorker' living in California, staying at the Affinis hotels allows me to spend time in my native NYC several times a year. Now that my kids are older and decided to be 'displaced Californias' living in NYC, my trips east will be more frequent and more often. Thank you, Affinia for always taking such good care of us!

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: We were very pleased with our stay at Fifty NYC.  With numerous trips in our future to Memorial Sloan Kettering, this could easily be our home away from home.   What also makes your hotel stand out is your staff, they are incredibly accommodating, friendly and helpful.

title: Awesome Affinia
text: First time to New York couldn’t have asked for a better hotel to stay. Great central location in mid town east and really close to the subway green line. Slightly disappointed at first that no free wifi in our room which forced us to use the mezzanine and lobby area. This turned out to be a fantastic area which we used in the morning before going out and when we got back at night. They offer free tea,coffee and water. Happy hour free wine between 5pm and 6pm is a brilliant time to meet others and have a pre dinner drink. Will definitely stay here again.

title: 3rd Stay
text: I have stayed in the hotel several times because of its location and affiliation with MSK. This was the best roo and stay I have had there. Everything in the room worked right (heat was a problem previously), everything was clean, extra blanket available. It was good.

title: Excellent choice for East mid town!
text: I would return again to Fifty Hotel & Suites by Affina.  We arrived early and were able to check in prior to check in time.  All the staff were very gracious, warm and helpful in many ways.  Our room was comfortable and clean, with everything in working order.  This is in a very safe area, charming neighborhood located within walking distance of many attractions, close to subway stations.  It was loud at night, able to hear sirens, just what you would expect in the middle of NYC!

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: Stayed in the hotel from the 17 - 20 December with family. It was a pleasant, clean hotel in a perfect location. All staff friendly and helpful, no complaints or faults what so ever. I would have no problem returning.

title: Christmas Family vacation - 2adults and 3kids - 11nights
text: We arrived early and obviously our room was not ready due to this. We returned back at 3.00pm and still had to wait a further hour for the room and then an additional hour after that for our luggage to come up to our room which when travelling for nearly 24hrs you just wanted to relax and freshen up especially when theirs 5 of you.- Now that's the only bad thing I have to say. From then on it was absolutely fabulous. The desk staff (Kristy) was fabulous and all the doormen; Ralph, Samuel, Smiley and Rome were a blessing to have around. The hotel may not have the facilities of other larger hotels but that doesn't matter. Fabulous location with everything you need right on your doorstep.We had a standard family room which was very large with a good functional kitchen; especially for NYC standards. After day 4 we upgraded to a family room with a separate bedroom with external terraces. WOW that's all I have to say, WOW, WOW, WOW. If you can get this upgrade, do it.We was on the top floor and had great views all be it was cold on the terrace but I could imagine in the summer it would be fantastic.This is my 5th time to NYC, first with the kids but we deffinatley stay again if we travelled back to NYC with or without the kidsWell done to all the staff, the room attendants who everyday did an outstanding job of servicing our room, the desk staff who sorting out all our trips and issues and the Doormen who were a breath of happiness everydayThanks and hope to see you again in the future

title: A very nice place
text: And we got an excellent rate by booking through the Affinia site, where we got five nights’ stay for the price of four, with no resort fee. (If Affinia had tried to charge a resort fee, I would not have stayed there and would not be writing this review.)

title: Noisy
text: I have never stayed in a hotel which supplies ear plugs. The hotel has no double glazing and when the rubbish truck arrives around midnight everyone wakes up. I found the shop which you purchase from often ran out of goods, and the $35 resort fee per day was way too expensive.

title: Fantastic Christmas break!!
text:
We stayed at fifty hotel and suites over the Xmas period and lived it!! Great location - walking distance to Rockefeller, Times Square and grand central. Rooms were spacious with THE most comfortable beds (they even had a pillow menu!!!). Macdonald’s practically below the hotel which was great for a quick and cheap meal! 

Smiler the doorman was always cheerful and ready to say hello to our little one! Also the lady on the front desk in the evening 20/12/18 was lovely and couldn’t have done more to help! 

Overall a fantastic stay - thank you! 

P.s Ellen’s star dust diner is a must if you are visiting New York - around 10 min walk from hotel

title: Good hotel, great location.
text: Decent hotel, certainly not special but perfectly adequate for a visit to NYC where you'll be out-and-about most of the time.  Rooms were spacious and clean.  Location superb.  Staff very nice.  WiFi was very expensive which is just unnecessary when there's plenty of places too get it free.  This was my biggest irritation.

title: Perfect hotel for us
text: It’s been my dream to spend a Christmas in New York and this hotel was the perfect choice! All the staff at the front desk and the men who open the door for you are so helpful and friendly! One of them greets you with ‘Welcome home’ when you return from a day out which I thought was a really nice touch. It is in a great location just a few minutes walk to 5th Avenue, Rockefeller Centre, Radio City Hall and various subway stations. Every night from 5-6 they have drinks on level 2 which is lovely and a great room for our children who enjoyed meeting new friends there. The bed was very comfortable. Would love to come back to stay again- Thankyou for having us.

title: Fantastic Hotel Fifty
text: A fantastic birthday celebration at Hotel Fifty from 30-31 December 2018. The entire staff are extremely service-minded, friendly, and just want you to have a wonderful stay. Will definitely recommend Hotel Fifty to anyone, and will definitely be back!

title: Possible theft in room Unresponsive management .!
text: This was my second stay. First time was great. I had to go to Sloan Kettering for post treatment Scans and follow up with Drs. This hotel gives a discount for MSK patients which is appreciated. I checked out on 12/20 and rushed to appointment. I left my bag with hotel for 6 hours. Upon arriving home( I drove ) I opened suitcase and my LLBean toilette travel organizer was missing. Value of bag and contents is over $200. I’ve reached out to them but both housekeeping and front desk say no one has it. I believe it was stolen by one of their staff. The only time it was out of my site was when it was in the room or baggage hold. One manager said they would conduct an internal investigation but never got back to me. I’ve called 4 times and left messages yet nothing. Thank goodness I took my medication out and moved to my purse or this could be much worse. Why won’t management respond or compensate ?

title: Great location
text: The location of this hotel couldn’t be better. Tons of restaurants and walking distance to everything. Our room was huge and very comfortable and the front desk staff is friendly. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

title: Warm hospitable staff, black/grey walls not so great, CAVE-Y.
text:
Warm and helpful staff but patient not stuffy. Love them😃
So professional but still FUN!
The most COMFORTABLE BED EVER!!!! I fell asleep so fast I forgot to turn off the light.  The rooms was very well laid out , comfy, well supplied and impeccably clean.  
***My only issue was the color motif it was cave-ish - all black and grey.  Not my style.

title: Great location and service. But needed more cleaning
text: Everything okay and staffs are very kind. We used extra blanket from closet. Cause the cover of bed is not clean well. But otherwise is okay. And it little loud outside of cause NYC. Room is big enough to us.

title: A real gem
text: Husband and I stayed for one night last weekend and really enjoyed our stay. Check-in was smooth and pleasant. We had upgraded our room to a  deluxe king and loved the personalized touch of a bottle of wine and note acknowledging our anniversary, the balcony, layout of the room and the view. The room was very clean and spacious, however, the bathroom needed a little attention to the toilet. We visited the Club Room which was nice and cozy and provided complimentary coffee, tea and water. We also checked out the wine “happy hour” and enjoyed a couple glasses of wine. The location of the hotel is great with a lot of restaurants and popular destinations nearby. The only real drawback is even though we were in the 18th floor, the traffic noise was loud. We could hear cars honking their horns during the day and late into the night. We’ve stayed at other properties in the city and never experienced so much noise. If there’s an option to stay in a quieter room, we will definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: NYC
text: Running hot water would have been nice.  On the fifth day of my stay, the decision was made to give me another room.   I had a visit from the engineering department every day up until then trying to get the hot water running.  Management was not very responsive to say the least.

title: Comfortable place
text: Very enjoyable. The room was quiet and comfortable. The fireplace in the lobby was a very welcome feature considering how cold the weather was. The hotel is conveniently located for our purposes and close to several nice restaurants.

title: Amazing Stay
text: I would like to Thank the Fifty Hotel for an amazing stay over Thanksgiving. The Hotel welcomed up with open arms on arrival with 2 toddlers, they were so helpful and the Suite we stayed in was just top class. I highly recommend the area and the hotel especially travelling with young kids, the kitchenette and spacious room was amazing. We will return!

title: Molto buono
text:
Che dire...posizione ottima!!!sia X chi è alla prima visita( mio marito) che la terza X me..camere veramente molto spaziosa , noi abbiamo preso una junior suite , comodissima anche per un ottimo angolo cottura super accessoriato!!unica pecca la moquette in camera.
Okkkk che proprio sotto c è il tree Hours dove hanno veramente di tutto x quanto concerne colazione (sia dolce che bio che light che americana..di tutto insomma)brunch e pranzo!!condigliatissimo

title: ABSOLUTELY FIRST RATE!!
text: I have stayed at the Affinia many times, and I will certainly do so again!I tell anyone who enquires that I like it because it has all of the essentials and none of the frills, and that is exactly what I am looking for,

title: Wonderful location and great staff
text: We stayed at Fifty Hotel & Suites in December for a Christmas vacation.  The staff is excellent and the rooms are a great size for NYC.   We had a wonderful view at the front of the hotel.  We will definitely stay here again.

title: Comfortable hotel in good location
text: The hotel was well placed for seeing all the sights in New York.  The rooms are comfortable and fairly large.  Staff were all friendly.  The reception desk area needs a good tidy up though. Piles of cardboard boxes etc which give a rather scruffy image when you check in/out.  Be aware that you have to pay extra to have wifi in your room.

title: The Perfect Hotel for a Family Vacation
text: This was our first time staying an Affinia Hotel. I was extremely pleased with everything about the Fifty Hotel, from its friendly attentive staff, to the large Jr Suite and the convenient location, within walking distance to many of the downtown attractions and subways. We will definilty be staying here again!

title: A Perfect Stay!
text: Would highly recommend staying at Fifty Hotel & Suites! Not only was the service amazing but everyone was always so kind. The hotel is close to a subway stop and is also really convenient to get to from the airport. They let us store our luggage there before we checked in (since we arrived early), and before we left for the airport (our flight was later in the day). The room was also really spacious considering we were in New York!

title: Great hotel
text: Great hotel, but the woman who is answering phones at the front desk is very rude.  I inquired about a billing question from a previous trip and the way she handled the situation was very unprofessional.

title: Beware of resort fee
text: Made a reservation through Priceline. Good location within reasonable distance to public transportation and Grand Central Station. Clean, comfortable, spacious rooms. Room facing Third Avenue was noisy at times. Check out was rather hectic. Accidentally discovered the $35 resort fee after check in which likely would have prompted me to stay elsewhere. The fee was not referenced at time of check in. With taxes, the fee went up to $40. Included in the resort fee was WiFi which was not very good.

title: Christmas in NY
text: The hotel location was good  and convenient. The reception lady (Jasmin) was very pleasant and helpful. However, we booked 2 rooms (404 & 405). The tub water in room 404 was muddy, so we couldn't take a shower. The table lamp and the reading light in room 405 were not working.

title: Staff is wonderful
text: Staff was wonderful and really great accommodations for the price.  Had 2 queen beds on the 17 floor looking onto 50th street.  Everything is pretty centrally located and the rooms where clean and the staff we really great.  From the doormen to the front desk to the housekeeping team...  All awesome

title: Nyc Weekend
text: Nice hotel ..housekeeping was excellent. The desk staff and doormen were very helpful. Doormen hailed cabs for us and answered any questions about directions, etc. Tge hotel location was so convenient to Rockefeller Center, St Patrick’s Cathedaral, and shopping. We could walk to a lot of sites without worrying about taxis, etc.

title: Include a continental breakfast for a 5
text: Room and staff were great. Good lacation. About 4 blocks from Rockefeller Center and eight blocks from Times Square $400+ should include the continental breakfast. Add $20/person to get your choice of a few muffins, cheese, cereal.

title: Great Location; Nicely-Appointed Rooms
text: We stayed here for 3 nights.  The location was very convenient and within walking distance to several very good restaurants and close to Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue, Park Avenue, etc.  The rooms are good-sized (we had a junior suite) and nicely appointed. Staff was very friendly and attentive.

title: BEST NYC HOTEL
text: We have stayed exclusively at The Fifty for the past 4 years.  We love the central location, spacious rooms and friendly staff.  The nicely wine hour is a fun way to meet new friends and unwind a little before heading out for dinner, a show, etc...

title: Wonderful Property!
text: We loved this hotel which is conveniently located to all the attractions. I was celebrated my 70th birthday with friends. Upgraded to a terrace suite which had a great view of the city. Jazmin at the front desk made our experience GREAT from the moment we arrived.

title: Very good
text: Friendly people Size of the room The Cleaning as good Didnt like to hear the others doors slaming in the middle of the night Gym should have more equipaments Did not Koke the food we paid for.... Didnt go to the breakfast

title: The only hotel in NYC I’ll stay at
text: It may have only been my second time staying here but the first time was all I needed. Fifty NYC is the only hotel I’ll ever stay at again and just when I think the stay can’t be any better I was welcomed this time with a bottle of champagne & note from the gm wishing me a happy birthday.

title: Great stay in NYC!!!
text: For anyone wanting to see the sights experience all that NYC has to offer, this is the perfect location. We were able to walk to most everything. A few good restaurants and bars not far. The Luncheonette is right next door-great breakfast. Blockheads is a couple blocks away-great Mexican and margaritas. The Horny Ram is around the corner-fantastic drinks, food, great brunch, not much of a wait although it always looks crowded. Rockefeller Center and Radio City are a short walk. I have stayed here twice and will stay again!!!

title: Weekend in NYC - December before Xmas
text: Superlative location. Close to Rockefeller Center.Fantastic scenes close to Christmas. Average service and amenities.Really crowded on Friday. Good on Sunday. A little bit expensive regarding services given.

title: Excelente
text:
Adoramos o hotel, quarto espaçoso, confortável, limpo, café bom, bem localizado e com pessoal extremamente simpático, especialmente a recepcionista Glória que deixou minha filha encantada e o carregador Roma. 
Tem um local ao lado do hotel que serve café da manhã muito bom o dia todo também!

title: Excellent location and close to different train lines
text:
The location was perfect, not too busy like Times Square. The subway stations were within walking distance and had choices of different lines depending on where you were headed. Choice of dining at night was also within walking distance.  The rooms were a bit small but did have a kitchenette where you could keep your breakfast groceries and sitting on the bed or desk if you wanted to have a quick breakfast before heading out to see the attractions.
There is a small mini supermarket nearby to buy your breakfast needs or yoghurts from nearby cafes ready for the next day.
As part of the package, the hotel offered a $10 limit per day where you could buy food from their mini snack bar near the reception counter. Use it or lose it as you can't save it up for use the next day.
Tip: Best to book hotel directly rather than through aggregator sites as you get better offers and rooms.

title: Xmas 2018
text: Was looking forward to a different property so I met my family at 50 Hotel and booked 6 rooms for a wekkend. I wasnt too impressed. Very Noisy property and did NOT get a good night sleep either night that I stayed.

title: A wonderful surprise!
text: Took a chance with Affinia as we had never stayed with them before.  From the moment we arrived the service was top notch.  The room was spacious and the beds were very comfortable. Can't say enough about the location either as it is so central.  Price was very competitive and we will be sure to stay there again!

title: Super visit to the Big Apple
text: This hotel is located in a great spot. Between Lexington and 1st, on 50th.  Block away from the 6 train.  A few blocks from Sax 5th Ave and Radio City Music Hall.  Nice room, very comfortable beds with lots of pillows.  Lobby has a wonderful warm and inviting ambiance.  The ONLY drawback is the lower rooms are privy to every car, truck, fire engine, police car on the street.

title: Review of Fifty NYC
text: Overall I was happy with my stay. The room did lack wash clothes which i did not realize until I was showering, so had to reorient myself to call housekeeping and then wait for them to be delivered. A bit inconvenient.The rooms also need alarm clocks. There isn't a clock anywhere in the room, not even analog.

title: VIAGGIO NY
text: posizione strategica, hotel rifatto da poco, camere carine, poca vista, a piedi si raggiunge facilemente la 5 strada. camere pulite ed in ordine, meglio le capre che danno sulla 50, più rumorose ma con vista

title: Great Location
text: The hotel is in a near perfect location . The rooms are a decent size warm a cosy.  Nice area for the wine hour and coffee on tap . Door staff very friendly and helpful . The grocery package was ok but could of contained some milk . Lovely pizza place on 2nd

title: Great midtown location but I wouldn't recommend to my friends
text: This property is either seriously understaffed or staffed by unmotivated/incompetent employees. This comment addresses front desk staff. Our check in was scheduled for 3:00 on 11/24/18. For room 1004, check in was 1 hour delayed. For room 404, over 1.5 hrs. Room 1004 had a very bad draft from the bathroom window which made showering very uncomfortable. It was reported twice and never fixed. We had it covered with a plastic bag for the entire stay. When  we checked in on 11/24, we advised the receptionist that I would be checking out from room 504 on Tuesday 11/27 and not on Thursday 11/29 as originally booked. The clerk did not voiced any objection or mentioned any penalties. When I checked out from room 504 I went to the reception to pay for my valet parking and was told that I had to pay for the entire booking. After a long discussion, the manager agreed to change the rate. I didn't continue the discussion because I was already very late for my appointment in New Jersey. A bad experience

title: A haven of quiet in a sea of people!
text: First, I'd like to recognize and front desk employee, Jasmin.  She was on the day shift at the Fifty Suites 155 East 30th.  She was amazing.  Friendly, coureous and able.  She immediately made friends with my grandchildren and was enthusiastic and helpful.  She should be commended.The Bellman was great too.I find the Affinia hotels to be wonderful.  We are usually at the Affinia Gardens, but took this jr. suite in mid-town to attend the RC Christmas show.  Town was insane with people everywhere.  Getting back to the quiet and safe-feeling environment of the hotel was wonderfulThanks for having such great staff and hotel.

title: Anniversary Weekend
text:
We booked our hotel and flight through Expedia. We chose the Fifty Hotel and Suites because of the decent reviews. We requested a an early check in (1:00pm) but that request was not fulfilled, actually our room wasn't ready until well after 3:00pm (they called our cell phone). The room we selected was advertised as 325 SQ Feet, our room (518) was lucky to be 240 SQ Feet and the view was of the side of another building. My garage at home is 16ft x 20 ft (320 SQ Feet) at home and I could put this room inside there and have tons of extra space, not sure why they are advertising this as a 325 SQ Foot room. The room was clean but the bed was not well made the first night. On our last day we ran out of Kleenex before we set out for the day (around 7:30am), the maid did not give us any Kleenex. When we went to shower on the morning we checked out our shower gel was empty. The rack holding the shower gel was falling apart as well. 

The front desk people were nice and friendly. The doormen were also nice and friendly. 

The hotel is in a nice location.

Not sure why Expedia is not including this "resort fee" in the cost of the hotel, the extra $40.00 US per night (fee and taxes) really adds up.

I doubt we would stay at this hotel again, there are better hotels for the same or less cost. This was our first time in New York and we were disappointed in our room and the service we received.

title: Not a good experience
text: This was my first time staying at this hotel as a business traveler. The first room I was given smelled heavily of smoke. The carpet in the second room was wet, as if it had just been steam cleaned with too much water. I was very calm and asked to be assigned another (a third) room, but was not treated very nicely by the woman at the reception desk, who seemed annoyed. At one point she asked defensively what I wanted her to do about the wet carpet, and I explained that I was just letting her know about the issue so that they wouldn't assign the room to anyone else. I'm extremely disappointed by the quality of the rooms and, more importantly, the quality of customer service.

title: Good location
text: The hotel is in a very good location in Midtown. The staff is very friendly and ready to help. The rooms are on the small side and a bit noisy. There is a fridge in the room and grocery stores nearby to buy your own drinks or you can get them from the reception.

title: Excellent
text: Room was excellent.   Front desk folks helped to make for a very nice trip    Price and cyber discount /deal was important in my decision. I will certainly come back and have already referred my friends to the hotel. Location was fine for my activities

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: We have stayed at this hotel every year for the last few years. We like to spend a weekend in the city around the holidays. This place is in a great location-- close enough to walk to many of the major attractions, but not right in the middle of all craziness. Also just a few blocks from a subway stop, so easy to access farther-away places too. The neighborhood has lots of good restaurants and bars within walking distance. The rooms are fairly spacious (by NYC standards), and the hotel is clean and well-maintained. The rates are reasonable relative to other places in the city. The staff are always friendly and very helpful. We always enjoy the daily wine hour, but we were disappointed that they are no longer serving snacks.

title: Convenient and great location
text: All good as always, I am a frequent guest to the Affinia, Pillows are great, excellent size of roomsThis time I was in a room with a very noisy Heater... $19.90 usd Breakfast is a waste of money, very basic breakfast, expensive... better to walk half a block and have breakfast at the Luncheonette$8 usd Bottle of water at the front desk, no drinking water available at the room

title: A hidden gem in the Big Apple
text: I was born and raised on the island of Manhattan. I returned recently for business and stayed at this property. I did not know of it’s existence but I am certain to return without a doubt. Great location, great staff, decent fitness center, and right in the heart of it all!

title: EXCELENTE HOTEL
text: Ótima localização e bastante confortável ! Importante acrescentar a recepção feita pelo simpático Samuel na entrada do hotel. Cobram us$10,00 por dia para serem gastos em uma "loja" do hotel. Desnecessário!!!

title: Roomy
text: Centrally located near Rockefeller Center, Radio Center Music Hall.  Near theater district and restaurant row.  Rooms are spacious.. Service is excellent.  Bed light was broke...I called downstairs and it was fixed immediately.  Free afternoon wine hour. Our room had a nice view.  Very enjoyable stay!!!

title: great stay
text: went to city to enjoy the christmas deco.. this place is great and has wine happy hour lol close to all the christmas deco, tree, saks windows . will def stay here again bc of big rooms, location and atmosphere

title: Amazing 21st stay at the FIFTY
text:
If you are thinking of booking, or already have, to stay at the Fifty please don't hesitate to do so! The hotel is absolutely immaculate and all the staff are very friendly and helpful. They have a free wine hour everyday for guests, which includes fruit juice and snacks as well, which are equally as lovely as the wine! Both red and white is available. 

We were lucky enough to stay in the Suite as it was my 21st birthday during our stay. The bed was huge and there was also a lengthy pillow menu available, which I thought was a lovely touch. The room was very big which is few and far between in NYC and the bathroom and kitchenette were spacious too. 

The location was also good with cafes/restaurants nearby, we loved The Lexington Brass. Mc Donalds is also only next door but one, which was handy for breakfast on the go too! With only a 10/15 minute walk to Times Square and Rockefeller Plaza, this hotel was perfect in every way.  

Fifty NYC we love you!

title: Perfect for Families
text: Third stay at this hotel and never fails to disappoint. Service is excellent, everyone greets you with a smile and the staff goes above and beyond. The rooms are spacious... great for families. The location is perfect -walking distance from Rockefeller Center, Central Park, 5th Avenue, Times Square, etc.

title: Third time there—we’ll be back!
text: The service is the #1 draw of this hotel, followed very closely by its location. The rooms were very large by NY standards and very clean. Two issues arose: a leaking toilet (fixed within 10 minutes of calling) and no hot water (mechanic showed up promptly but our room needed to be changed, which the hotel did and upgraded us in the process). We will definitely stay there again.

title: Management need to update Air Conditioning
text:
We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights, earlier this month.
The front looks modern, but the partial refit needs more work. We were on the third floor, and we're not happy to be told to open the window, and they would supply us a fan, to get the room temperature to a comfortable level. This is a four star rated hotel!!!! The air con system needs to be replaced. Not fit some rooms with a split system air conditioner, just do the full job. The room temperature was constantly 24C with no way it could be altered in the room.

All the staff were fantastic, and provided friendly, and efficient service.
The location is fairly central, being on E50th & 3rd Streets, it was far from Times Square.
Not in a hurry to rush back

title: Génial
text:
Hôtel très bien situé, proche de toutes commodités: supermarchés, métro, location de voiture......
Chambre propre, spacieuse avec terrasse.
Demander une chambre dans les hauteurs si possible!
Le personnel est chaleureux et accueillant, nous avons adorés !

title: Honesty
text: First let me start with the front desk service. The staff is a mixture of knowledgeable and kind people with rude and unpleasant staff. I asked for an upgrade and had to repeat myself several times to various front desk staff due to an antiquated system. I literally had to book my own room online and was told I had to wait until check in for a upgrade. Then I had to check out and check back in. I paid for a late check out but my key card was deactivated at the regular check out time. The breakfast is too expensive and the coffee is horrible. My room was decent but the drain in the shower and the restroom sink was backed up. The location is fine.

title: Great stay!!
text: We stayed on beautiful November Saturday in NYC.  The staff was very friendly and the suite was perfect.  It was like staying in an apartment. Great location. Many choices for brunch on Sunday that you could walk.

title: Disastrous amenities, be aware of the pet policy
text:
A friend and I stayed at Fifty Affinia a couple weeks ago.  We had a late check in and I must say that the front desk was friendly and amicable initially. Everything was then very disappointing.  NYC was pouring rain on that weekend. To our surprise, no umbrella could be find anywhere, neither at the front desk or in the room. Just remind you this hotel is suppose to be a 4 stars...

We were also with my little dog. For some reason, the reception did not make me sign anything regarding the pet at check in.  When I mentioned the next day that I have a small dog in the room for housekeeping, they wanted to force us to pay a $180. Strangely enough, if you read on their website, the VIPaws program seems to be optional and not mandatory...I had to argue with the manager about this and she kept saying it is mandatory to be finally waived!!!  She also mention that she has been in the industry many many years and no one has umbrella.  I don’t think she realizes I’ve been travelling around the world staying in many many 4 and 5 stars hotels and it is not because I booked through AGODA (a third party booking website) that she is entitled to give me attitude. Unfortunately I forgot her name.  This is another disastrous stay at Affinia. Last time was at Dumont a couple years ago. No wonder they closed.  Hopefully, your team will do something to turn this around. It was unacceptable.

title: Decent hotel enjoyed our stay
text:
Stayed 6 nights with 2 kids. Good hotel great location near metro and walkable to lots of places you want to go. 

Best bits
Location
Good size room
Very comfy beds and pillows
Very quite room for us floor 3 but not facing road
Nice free wine evening
Not having to pay the annoying resort fee (hotel booked with virgin)
Decent price
Reception and concierge very good efficient and friendly

The less good -1 star
It was a little bit shabby in places for example the shower lever just fell off in your hand. Managed to fix it but not the point. Could not be bothered to tell reception

Would u go back yes
2 lovely queen beds in a decent size room, good price, perfect location

title: Great night stay in NYC
text: My wife and I wanted to get away for the night so we took the train down to NYC this past Saturday. Since we wanted to go to MOMA and Madame Tussauds we wanted to stay close to these locations where we could walk. I found Fifty Hotel & Suites on the internet and it had nice reviews. When we arrive at the hotel it was very busy, but Jazman, the women at the front desk was very friendly and personable. Our check-in was at 3pm, but with all the people coming in and out I believe we got into our room around 4pm. The hotel informed us of a wine gathering on the second floor every day from 4:30 to 6 pm so my wife and I went around 5pm. It was crowded, but not overly crowded and people were having a good time. What a great idea to have to get people to meet and greet each other if they want to. The hotel is clean and in a great location. The rooms are fairly large for big city standards. The beds awesome so comfortable. Everyone there were friendly, helpful, and of course professional. I would definitely recommend Fifty Hotel and Suites to everyone. Plus, we made our reservation on Hotelstonight.com and got a great price.

title: Paul Allanson 50th with Ann and two kids
text: Just got back yesterday . This hotel is great , staff were so helpful and friendly and made my birthday a special day champagne in room . The man and lady on wine hour which is great are lovely . Doormen were so friendly they greeted us everytime which made my 7 yr old feel so special . We upgraded to suite well worth it , great location great staff 10 out of 10 for me , one day I will go back

title: Great location
text: you can't beat the convenient location near the subway and midtown area.  Many places to eat.  The hotel was clean.  Why they don't include the Hotel Facilities Fee in room charge is beyond me .I would definitely stay here again.

title: Fifty Hotel
text: I would not recommend the Fifty Hotel.  I think it is important to note that the room temperature could not be adjusted lower than 71 degrees. So if you prefer a cool environment to sleep you will not enjoy.  I also found the shower to be grimy.  I did not want to step on the floor and wished I had shower shoes.

title: Recent stay
text: One week stay in King Suite with urban kitchen. Large clean room well made up every day. Social Sips with other guests between 5-6 each day was a good way to wind down. Staff friendly and helpful. Not sure if kitchen needed to be so big and include a dishwasher as there was no area in the suite to eat food other than in sitting in a chair

title: Great Location and Big Rooms!
text: Mid-Town and spacious rooms. Value for Money especially its in the middle of the city and near subway stations too. right beside ESSA Bagel which is one of the best bagel places in NY and near a lot of landmarks too.

title: Excellent stay
text:
I stayed a week in a very confortable, spacious and clean room. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The location is perfect insofar a UN person is concerned. Breakfast in the room is quite convenient. The facilities are brand new and warm. 
This is one of my best NY stay in the past years.

title: Great comfort and quality in Midtown East
text: Had a wonderful stay at the Fifty with my family and would highly recommend. We looked for a comfortable, clean, convenient hotel for our 10 day stay in the city and the Fifty was perfect. Friendly and welcoming staff, clean and comfortable room, and very quiet. We slept soundly every night. We also loved the complimentary wine happy hour! The location was the perfect home base for all our activities. A lovely hotel in an otherwise overcrowded, overtouristy part of town. We will be back!

title: Excellent Midtown Manhattan Hotel
text: Great location, great rooms and amenities, great happy hour, great service and overall great hotel experience and value.  It is also nice to see many of the same employees over the years.  I highly recommend a stay here while visiting Manhattan.

title: suits our needs
text: great place. been staying here for about 4 Years, 3 times a year. Friendly staff. the suites have a small kitchen that allows us to visit Morton Williams market around the corner and pick up prepared food, etc. for quick meals, they have a nice morning coffee service, and wine from 5-6 PM in a nice sitting area on the second floor. little staff turnover so nice to see familiar faces. Great place.

title: Very poor customer service!!!!
text:
I had booked a suite at this hotel for our family's trip this upcoming Christmas season to New York. We are very seasoned travellers and know there are lots of options of where to stay when traveling. We have status with two other major hotel brands but decided to take a chance on something new as these suites seemed to offer more space than others in the city which would be perfect for the 4 of us traveling together. I originally made a booking on their site using a promotion they were offering. I had noticed in the pictures for the room that some of the pictures showed some furniture that looked different than that shown in the floor plan photos. I called the hotel directly to enquire about this difference and I was told that all rooms are different and there's no way to guarantee particular furniture. We were looking to confirm a sectional sofa with sofa bed for our son who doesn't want to share a bed with his sister. Seems like a reasonable question to me that staff should know about their room inventory. 

Additionally, after a few weeks of making our booking, I was looking at some discount travel sites and noticed there was a rate that was significantly lower than what I booked on their hotel site. I checked their site and sure enough they had a Best Rate Guarantee offer. It said that they would match any competitors rate and offer a hotel credit and room upgrade as well. Responses would be received in 24 hours. 2 days went by and I have not received any response. I forward my email to other emails for Affinia I found online and still no response. Last night I called the hotel directly and was told by the Manager there that they don't deal with the Best Rate Guarantee themselves and that "someone else" handles all of that and they aren't able to change the rate. They did offer to provide their email so I could forward our details on the submission but I have not heard back from them either on this. 3 days have now gone by, no response from anyone. I called the only customer service number available on the Affinia website, which was Reservations. They said they are not able to adjust the rates or do anything with the Best Rate Guarantee. Ironically they tell me it is the hotel directly who makes all of these changes. Quite the contrary to what the hotel told me last night when I called. I explained to the Reservations agent, note not Customer Service agent, what had happened when I called the hotel directly, and they agreed that there should be better customer service. Sounds like this is a regular complaint they hear. 

Being this our first time staying at this hotel, it doesn't bode well for how it's going to go. Currently looking for other options, while waiting to see if anyone actually works there to take our request. We also listed other questions in our email about our stay. No one has followed up to answer those either. Feels more like they just want you to book a room and check in and out, not actually want to have details taken care of during your stay. Difference between offering a service and actual hospitality.

I hope others don't experience the same thing. I did read a review where someone waited 2 weeks with no response on confirming their reservation. I am surprised they can say they are 4 star hotel with this response rate. Get your patience ready!

I will update this review if the situation changes.

Thank you

title: Pretty good
text: Very clean room , very good bed. Part of the rooms are noisy, but the stuff found us another room, .which was much better, pretty good situated, on the 3rd. avenue, whith many good restaurants in the area.

title: Nice hotel, annoying pricing strategies
text: The hotel is in a nice part of town and convenient for all main tourist spots. We had a big room with 2 beds and a sofa bed. There was also a kitchen but we didn’t use it. It was pricey enough but I guess that’s New York. The guest lounge is also nice. What was really annoying though were all the extra charges. As well as tax being on top of the quoted price on the website (perhaps the norm, but pointless given you always have to pay it) but it was made worse by some sort of service charge which was also only advised right at the end of the booking process. They say it’s for the lounge and a daily $10 credit for the hotel shop where it costs $8 for a bottle of water. In a normal hotel you would get these things for free.

title: Very noisey
text: The room was comfortable but overlooked 3rd Ave. There is a fire station around the corner and the 17th precinct police station. Sirens go all night long. We stayed 8 nights and in those 8 night only had one where there were no sirens.

title: Not exactly a suite, but a good size for our family
text: 2 adults and 2 tweens fit pretty comfortably in this space in NYC.  We didn't have a kitchen, but i think some of them do, depending on the room you reserve.  The bathroom was small but workable.  We had a great view of 3rd avenue, and even though we were only on the 11th floor, the street noise was not bad.  The front desk staff, the bell staff, and the doormen were really fantastic.  From check in to check out, we felt welcome, helped, and appreciated.  We would definitely consider Affinia for our next trip to NYC.

title: Nice studio apartment in the city
text: The room size was perfect and although the heating did not work very well the overall stay was good.I always stay in Affinia due to the location and nice rooms, amenities and quiet environment. Will go back for sure.

title: Hotel agréable, bonne situation
text: Suite junior pour famille de 5, spacieuse, lits très confortables, équipée d'une kitchenette, plutôt pour réchauffer que véritable préparation de repas, mais bien pratique pour éviter de sortir au restau le soir avec les enfants. Surtout qu'il y a un petit supermarché à proximité.L'hôtel est très bien situé :  proximité immédiate Rockefeller Center, Chrysler building, Time square à un bon 1/4 h de marche, et station de métro au coin de la rue pour rayonner dans tout NY.Seul bémol, assez bruyant même au 19è étage , mais on ne vient pas au centre de New York pour être au calme! Pour moi bouchons d'oreilles indispensables, mais mon mari et mes enfants n'ont pas été gênés. La climatisation est également très sonore.Le personnel est serviable et agréable.

title: A good priced mid town hotel
text:
The Affinia is located midtown about 8 blocks from grand central, so its easy walking distance. It's also located close to the midtown shopping and other attractions.
The rooms are spacious and clean, it's a bit noisy because of the location so request a higher floor.  Theres a quite a few good places to eat in walking distance, and you have the ability to upgrade your room for a small fee. The only downside is don't expect to check in anytime before 3pm unless you either get lucky or want to pay $99 dollars, but other than that it is a hotel I would stay at again.

title: Great hotel
text: We stay here whenever we visit NYC. Great location and clean rooms.  If only, we could get some smiles from the front desk occasionally.   My only advice for the hotel. Just include wifi on all your rates.  The whole pricing structure is getting very complicated.

title: Great visit with family
text: The hotel had comfortable space for hanging out, enjoying a snack and visiting with family. Street noise was noticeable. However, you provided earplugs and we had our own as well. The staff was amazing and the location was excellent for walking, eating and getting on the subway. For our purposes the resort fee made the rooms more expensive than we would have liked.

title: Good family accomodation,  but could be better
text: My family of 5 stayed for 4 nights in mid October.  Check in and check out was efficient and easy.  We liked the location,  neighborhood feel but easy walk to midtown destinations / attractions and plenty of eating and takeaway places within 1-2 blocks,  and a decent grocery store (Morton Williams) within 3 blocks, subway 1 block away.  Staff were friendly and helpful.We had a Terrace Suite (room 1801).  The bedroom and living area were both a good size and comfortable for our family of 5 (2 adults and kids aged 11,13,15).  Bathroom was fine,  but contained the only mirror in the whole suite which made for a lot of bathroom contention, esp with 2 teenage daughters doing hair/makeup).The terrace was however very small,  (much smaller the photos on the website probably no more than 3 feet wide it was more like a balcony) and it had no furniture, and was not suitable for sitting out on. The view was the side of an adjacent building so we didn't use it other that to allow air into the room.  Other terrace suites may be better but I felt mis-sold on this aspect of the room.  The kitchenette was useful with a microwave,  fridge, kettle and 2 rings.   However, there were only plates and cutlery for 4 people,   which seems a miss for a room which can accommodate up to 6.  It also turned out that the sofa bed in our living area was broken (it could not be folded down),  so the hotel put a single rollaway in the middle of the living area which was fine for one of the kids but dramatically reduced the space in that room.  The hotel made no attempt to replace or repair the sofa bed during our stay, so we had the rollaway in the middle of the living space throughout our stay.   (we would have asked for a change of room but packing and then unpacking again was too much hassle so we stuck with it).Overall,  this is a decent hotel,  but its far from cheap,  they can do better on the small details.  I would use Fifty again but I'd want a room with a better (i.e. usable) terrace so would avoid 1801.

title: Not Sure We'll Be Back
text: I have stayed at this hotel MANY times over the past 3 years -- this was my 8th trip this year.  The location is great, and for the most part, so is the staff.  One of the doormen remembers us and always asks about our dad.  Thing is - there is absolutely NO loyalty program -- nothing to acknowledge in any way that we are major repeat visitors.  (My sisters have also been there almost as many times -- and we all book our own rooms!)  This time, my sister had a lot of issues in room 608 -- the bathroom door would not close and it took many days and a lot of time of workers in the room to partially rectify it.  She also had no washcloths - and despite repeated requests -- waited 2 days to get any.  I was in room 312 and had no issues -- except that I'm missing a brand new top and they did not find it in the room.  So, I don't know if we'll be back -- think next time a Marriott, Hilton, or Hyatt in the area will be our choice -- as we are members of their loyalty programs, and will at least earn SOME benefits by the stay.

title: Tan bien ubicado que te sientes durmiendo en el medio de Manhattan
text:
Es un hotel muy bien ubicado, limpio, cómodo con un staff bueno. Ruidoso. En la noche vas a entender porque es la ciudad que nunca duerme. Imagínate que en la mesa de noche te ponen tapones de oído.
Mi cuatro tenía una cocina completa muy cómoda, a la cual le falta una mesita con 2 banquetas. Cerca del hotel tienes un Morton Williams market súper bueno.

title: Caro para o que oferece
text: Viajar para NY com uma criança pequena, não seria uma tarefa fácil, sabiamos disso desde o momento que deicidimos visitar a cidade para participar de um casamento de grandes amigos. Depois de uma pesquisa exaustiva de hoteis e airbnb acreditavamos ter encontrado no Fifty uma ótima solução para nossas necessidades apesar de ser um tanto mais caro que as outras opções. Acabamos um tanto decepcionados e segue o prParte positiva: quarto amplo, terraço ótimo, localização perfeita O que nos decepcionou:1) No momento da reserva, pelo site do hotel, adicionamos um pacote oferecido para crianças com alguns mimos, não recebemos nada do que estava descrito no site.2) também no momento da reserva optamos por pagar a taxa de late check out para garantir que tivessemos um útlimo dia tranquilo. um dia antes de nossa partida fui avisada de que teria que tentar a sorte. eu só poderia fazer o late check out se o quarto estivesse disponível no dia da saida.. o que não estava.O que não entendi é  : se o late check out só pode ser confirmado no dia da partida, porque oferecer como opção de compra no momento da reserva?3) os rapazes da portaria geralmente bem educados, mas os funcionários da recepção sempre muito impacientes e muitas vezes grossos. Faziam uma mega confusão com os pacotes que chegavam de compras online, tinhamos que insistir para poder pegar nossas encomendas e chegou no absurdo de um funcionário ligar as 11 e meia da noite no quarto (sabendo que havia um criança conosco) para pedir para eu descer para buscar o pacote. 4) Quarto bastante empoeirado e alguma vezes a água da banheira saiu amarelada, quase ocre.5) cozinha pequena, suficiente para nós, mas com quase nenhum utensilio para cozinhar. Não tem forno, só microondas.6) no geral achamos que pagamos caro por um atendimento bem mediano, e em alguns momentos muito rude.

title: Bachelorette weekend
text: We had a perfect bachelorette weekend - the suite was huge and the terrace was a big hit. the beds were very comfortable and the kitchen was a plus.  Service was impeccable.  Location couldn't be better

title: Great location, very helpful staff
text: I found the Fifty hotel by Affinia to be comfortable and clean. The staff was helpful and friendly. I had a great view from my bedroom. There was a 24 hour gym available, which is wonderful. My concern was that my heater in the room was not working. I arrived late to the room, and by the time I became aware of it it was 10 pm. I had to wake up early for a morning meeting so I turned the heater off for the night. The next day I asked for someone to look at it. The "handy" person quickly determined that it could not get fixed on time and brought a space heater. I was grateful for that. Also, please be aware that due to the location of the hotel, there is a lot of noise that comes from the outside (i.e. sirens and honking).

title: Girls weekend
text: Great location, very nice people at the Front desk and doorman very helpful. Everyone was friendly! Great location for Broadway show. Only complaint is the 35 daily fee, I thought all fees were taken care of prior to getting there.

title: Wrong Billing
