text: I am so sorry to write the problem that I am having with the hotel bill, first thing they giving me a special rate for 3 days staying but charged more. I extended 1 day more and charge me 2 days. All this I checked with my credit card bank  and they told me to write to them which I did several times, still waiting reply from the hotel.

title: Jasmine is the best!
text: I called ahead of time with a few questions and Jasmine took her time to make me feel at ease before my trip. Then when I got there, I was warmly welcomed by Jasmine and she remembered our call. She was super helpful my whole trip and the rest of the staff were helpful and had smiles on their faces the whole time. Will definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone.

title: Muy lindo hotel
text: Es un hotel moderno y muy bien ubicado si te gusta la tranquilidad y no tanto el bullicio que puede haber cerca de la 5ta avendia o Times Square. Estas a pocas cuadras del Rockefeller center, y de allí podés arrancar para cualquier lado, además tiene estaciones de subte a 2 cuadras. En cuanto al hotel en si, es muy limpio, las habitaciones son amplias. Nosotros estuvimos 4 personas en una suite con 2 camas queen y nos sobraba lugar. Además tiene una cocina con 2 hornallas, un microondas y una heladerita que te permite cocinarte y comer allí. No le pongo la calificación máxima porque me pareció un poco caro, pero igualmente volvería. Si no hablan inglés no se preocupen porque está Leslie que habla perfecto español y es super amable y eficiente.

title: Recomendo
text: Hotel com uma optima localização, quartos amplos , óptimo para quem  viaja em trabalho ou de ferias com a família. staff atencioso , limpeza otima , perto de bons restaurantes , saida de metro e algum comercio. Tem wifi e um pequeno ginásio.

title: Great size for a family!
text: So pleased we booked this place. We had a junior suite which easily accommodated 3 children and 2 adults. It had a nice kitchen with fridge and microwave, large bathroom, 2 very comfy doubles and a large double sofa bed. PLUS, a seating area, a desk, a safe and a TV. Within 15 mins walk of the "interesting" stuff and nice shops. 30 mins easy walk to Empire State Building, Grand Central Station, Times Square or Madison Square Gardens. Great diner just outside the front of the hotel, plus a Mcdonalds and Panda Express etc etc. So, very convenient. Door men are fabulous and helpful, in particular Smilar, always made us and the children welcome. They also get a good rate on your transportation back to the airport. Much cheaper than anything I could find on the internet - even the shared minibus. The only downside was there was no complimentary in room WiFi  - you have to go down to the lobby or lounge. They charge $15 a day for that which was a bit annoying but we weren't in the hotel much so we didn't bother. It was clean and tidy, the room was serviced daily and we had no problems at all. Happy to recommend especially to those with a family that don't want to pay Times Square prices and want a bit of space.

title: stuff
text: a red flag should have been noticed by myself when they hand out free ear plugs for "a quiet nights sleep", wi-fi access is a purchase in your room, stains on the bath tub floor and rust/grime in the corner of the shower/tub, the globs of dust on the vent in the bathroom are atrocious and the plug besides the bed had a contraption with way too many plugs inserted into it for my well being.  I have pictures to validate these claims

title: A second Home
text: A spotless place with a kind and efficient staff, high quality service, a tranquil place in the middle of NYC.Excellent linens, all the areas smell fresh and clean.Doormen always have nice comments on your way in!

title: Disappointed
text: This is not my usual experience, but the air conditioning went out and it was difficult to get ready, use the gym...breathe...This was not my usual experience here but I had a rough time this stay.Also, someone had McDonalds in the hallway all night and the garbage was not picked up all night.  The odor was awful.  It permeated my room.

title: Huge Room in Great location
text: My family loved the room we had at the fifty, it was huge with plenty of space. The room and location was that good that I had to give a five rating even though we had no hot water on our first night and you have to pay for Wifi. Great all round venue and would stay there again.

title: Decent enough hotel, not worth the price
text: Reception is untidy, boxes stacked up. Had to wait to check in, while staff were shipping a package.Room was ok, wall paper peeling, bad caulking in bathroom.Bed and bedding was nice.Pretty average hotel, worth about $200 less than I paid for the night.Removing them off our preferred vendor list.

title: Espantoso hotel
text:
Es un engaño total , las fotos te engañan , para nada es como te la pintan , pague 611 dlls por una noche en un cuarto sin ventanas , un búnker , el ruido del aire acondicionado no te deja dormir. Además de los insectos asquerosos en el baño.  
Un robo total.  Nunca me sentí tan engañado.

title: Does your country know that you left the place?
text: Jasmin asked me this question, and I found it offensive, being an Indian. Hotel is nice tho. She also talked on the phone for like 15mins, like I was invisible, when I was waiting to ask for check in.

title: Pleasant surprise
text: I had stayed at the next door Kimberly, last time I've been in NYC. Good location but not so good service and rooms. So I decided to stay at the Fifty this time. And I am not disappointed. For me a great location as Kimberly but modern and practical facilities, neat room and nice staff.

title: An amazing stay,
text: After visiting NYC my wife and I wanted our children to experience the city. Selecting Affinia was perfect. The location was great and felt family friendly. Our suite was huge, clean and offered a kitchen. Our room view was amazing. The lobby was fun and inviting and the door man was very knowledgeable. Can't wait to return

title: FIFTY Hotel NYC
text: Wonderful staff, lovely room, we were made to feel very welcome. Good location to travel to all the main attractions. Would recommend and if and when we ever return this would be the hotel of our choice. As a Brit who loves her tea loved the fact we could buy a little carton of milk at the hotel to enjoy a brew. Enjoyed wine hour also.

title: Great stay
text: Nice rooms, nice staff, i like the free wine happy hour. good location for walking to midtown/midtown east. I enjoyed staying here and would stay here again if doing business in the area. the doormen were exceptionally kind and helpful!

title: Manhattan Escape
text: A few terrific days in NYC. to get back to our NY style. Visits to St. Patrick's Cathedral, Fifth Ave, Rockefeller Center, Russian Tea room, and Smith & Wolensky, made the trip very memorable. All the while , staying at Affinia Fifty was perfect. Might add one suggestion for the Affinia, have some sort of snacks for the "wine hour". Thanks...

title: Perfect New York City base
text: My husband and I stayed at the wonderful Fifty Hotel this month for a glorious week and we couldn't have been happier with our choice.  The hotel is in a brilliant location - easy walking distance to 5th Ave, Times Square, subways and lots of other hot spots, but also far enough away to feel a sense of space.  Our room was also absolutely fantastic - very contemporary and stylish, with a kitchen, full bathroom and very comfy bed.  It's so much larger than I was expecting for New York which is famous for it's compact rooms. We even had a fabulous view of Third Avenue, which was great for watching the crazy traffic antics.  The staff, as has been mentioned previously, could not be nicer or more attentive.  They really made us feel special. I can't think of a thing to grumble about!  We didn't try out the guest social evenings but we did have room service which was prompt and truly delicious.  We also thoroughly enjoyed being able to walk just next door to one of the city's cutest rooftop bars at The Kimberley Hotel - so even though the Fifty doesn't have it's own restaurant or bar, if feels as if it does as you are literally next door to a couple of fabulous ones at The Kimberley and another hotel next door, name of which I've forgotten.  I would recommend Fifty Hotel to anyone and everyone and we will certainly stay again next time we visit that amazing city.  Thank you to the team at Fifty!

title: Fabulous Anniversary Weekend!
text:
Fifty Hotel & Suites is perfectly located.  My husband and I were celebrating our 31st Wedding Anniversary.  When we entered this hotel, we were immediately greeted by 
smiles!  Tiffany and Rolando at the front desk were wonderful to us and were able to
upgrade our room to suite and we received a bottle of red wine at check-in.  It was so
nice of them.  That same afternoon, Brian Gehlich, the general manager, had a bottle of champagne delivered to our room.  The staff truly made you feel special. 

Our room, on the 11th floor, was immaculate!  The beds and the pillows were comfortable.  I can't forget to mention one of the doormen/bellhop...his name is 
Smailif (sure I didn't spell it correctly)..sounds like smiles...he was always smiling
and helpful.  

I highly recommend this wonderful hotel and staff.  We hope to return again.  Thank you for making our anniversary weekend so special.

title: Birthday trip
text: Amazing location. Things to consider - Better lighting for makeup application, and improved ventilation in the bathroom. The beds were seriously comfortable, and the tech ports and plugs were very convenient.

title: Great Hotel in Heart of Manhattan!!
text: We wouldn't hesitate to recommend The Fifty Hotel. Location is superb with diners and great pubs nearby. First trip to New York for us from the UK on our silver wedding anniversary and the management left a lovely note with bottle of bubbly for us in our room. A genuine surprise as we opened our cards and left them on the desk on the morning! All staff very helpful and accommodating. First morning some very inconsiderate 'guests' were dropping free weights in the gym above our room at 5.30am! Went down to reception and we were relocated to the fifth floor upon our return that afternoon to a really quiet room. Perfect! Managed to catch one of the wine hours which was great to mix with other guests from all over the world. New York is a fabulous city and we enjoyed every minute of our first visit here. Certainly the Fifty Hotel helped with our experience. Cheers from the UK!!

title: Excelent stay for a family
text: We had a wonderful stay at the Fifty. We stayed in a studio with two beds. The room was very big, clean and comfortable. Great ammenties. Excelent housekeeping service. Front desk assistans very kind and helpful. The kitchen was a real plus for our stay. Excelent location near main NY attractions and subway. I will definetely return to the Fifty in my next trip to New York! Congrats 👏

title: Great east midtown hotel
text: Nice location with good restaurants and shopping nearby. Large clean rooms with great beds and pillows. Loved the complimentary wine each evening. Very nice service staff and front desk. Try Spice symphony restaurant across the street too

title: Great hotel
text: Wonderful hotel in a great location. We were upgraded without asking for it! Bed was wonderfully comfy, room was spacious and very clean, even had a balcony. Staff was top notch.Great hotel, will use again!!

title: a very pleasant weekend stay
text: I was bringing my 9-year-old granddaughter to NYC for his first visit. This was a last-minute reservation, and the price was a real bargain. Location is good - subway and buses nearby. Front desk staff super-helpful with information. Doorman very helpful too. The room was large and comfortable and best of all, quiet. My granddaughter was particularly impressed with the decor!  Only issue was that the room phone never connected on any call, even to front desk - it just rang with a busy signal. I used my cell phone instead and didn't bother to report it until we were leaving. I would definitely stay again (especially if I could get such a good rate :)!)

title: Mi sento a casa
text: Uno dei migliori alberghi di nyc dove ormai mi sento come se fossi a casa. Ottimo per rapporto qualità prezzo... personale sempre disponibile. Location stupenda. Camere pulite e grandi. Assolutamente consigliato

title: Confortable and great location
text: Our first time in Affinia, great location, staff very helpful, we felt home. No luxury but confortable. Many restaurants around and we could come back on foot from Broadway musicals. Supermarket on 2nd x 48th St. only three blocks away. We stayed on 6th floor, with a complete kitchen inside our room and it was not noisy to sleep. Both subway stations on 51st St and on 53rd St Lexington close to the hotel. Really nice place. Social living room with coffee and tea to stay or watch television. The breakfast has fruits, many kinds of bread, yoghurt, granola, pastries, everything you need for beginning your day.

title: LOVED EVERY SECOND OF OUR STAY!!
text: We love this hotel! The rooms are amazing. Everything is clean and well maintained. The staff are super friendly - we forgot we were in NY! All kidding aside we really loved our stay and will recommend the fifty to all our friends and return for another stay! Thanks Fifty for being so amazing!

title: A wonderful experience.
text: I was just in New York and spent six nights at Fifty. It was a fantastic experience from start to finish. The hotel is clean, beautifully put together, it’s in a great location, the staff is absolutely fantastic and respectful and accommodating. I had such a wonderful time and this is exactly where I’m staying every time I’m in town.

title: Great Customer Service
text: Leah and Dinika were GREAT! Actually, all the staff at Fifty were amazing! They made my experience a lot better. I had many questions in regards to traveling throughout NYC and they were right there to answer all of my questions. Keep up the great work ladies!

title: Great location but unfriendly front desk personnel
text: The hotel location, the housekeeping staff and the bell boys are all excellent. However the front desk personnel is just terrible, very unfriendly. The breakfast variety and its staff needs to improve a lot as well.

title: Perfect
text:
We’ve loved the hotel!The staff was nice,helpfull,always smiling.The room was a decent size and clean with lots of towells and complimentary bathroom amenities.Loved the gym and the socializing area!I would definetely recommend the hotel!
Location was fantastic

title: Great small hotel in midtown
text: Excellent value and good location, especially if you come to New York for the USOPEN.  The staff and doormen are very friendly and all requests are quickly taken care of No restaurant or bar, but the neighborhood has many of both

title: Deteriorating quality at Fifty NYC
text: I've stayed at this property at least 10 times and I've noticed that the condition and cleanliness has steadily declined. The AC in my room was incapable of properly cooling the room (even though the room size was tiny). The shower did not properly and the bathroom was generally in a poor state of repair. I usually choose the Fifty NYC because it is a better value than other premium hotels in the area.  On this stay, the room rate was equal to hotels that are considered premium hotels, such as the Parker Meridien. Not sure if I'll stay at this property again.

title: The city ( and this time me) that never slept!
text: I love this hotel. The location, the service, the staff is excellent. How ever the windows are shadowing this perfection. They are not sound proof and the outside noise is in the room . And believe me this city is very noisy! They must invest on this!

title: Short break in NYC
text:
Booked a short break to NYC and stayed at the above hotel - read the reviews prior to leaving, which were very mixed and decidedwe had form our own opinion:

What a great place!! Great rooms, great location and the added advantage of a free wine hour every evening was the icing on the cake!!

The hotel was two minutes to a great breakfast diner and only 15 minutes to the Rockerfeller Tower.

The rooms were well appointed, clean with huge comfortable beds and a great maid service. 

Forget the negative reviews, the place is great!!! Enjoy your trip

title: Nice Hotel in Manhattan
text: Hotel associates are very friendly and helpful. They helped me on a couple of occasions. Breakfast is average. There is also a $75 nightly valet parking, and $34 room service/tax that quickly adds up to cost of stay.

title: NYC- Affinia 50
text: I have used this property for work travel in the past and it was a convenient and economical option for an overnight trip to NY to attend the tennis US Open Championships over Labor Day weekend.  The hotel accommodated my request for a king bed and an early check in which was much appreciated.  The room was very clean and well appointed; the housekeeping staff was friendly and made sure we had extra items that we requested.  Wine in the evening was lovely as was the continental breakfast on Sunday morning (we received this complimentary, but normally a charge of $20 which I would not have paid).  Overall a very nice stay, fantastic location, and comfortable room at a good value for New York!  Will definitely stay again!

title: FiftyNYC-meet all of our requirements.
text: Good stay. Excellent location with numerous restaurants and hotspots nearby. Easy to get around. The staff were pleasant and helpful. Engaged with us on numerous occasions. The wine (free) event in the late afternoons were a nice touch. I enjoyed having the option to go down to the 2nd floor area  to just hang out, relax, watch tv (us open) on the three large screen TV's or read or mingle. Nice to have a spot to get out of the room. Rooms were fine though- no real issues.

title: Frequent visitor.
text: Preferred place to stay when going to NYC. Booking in advance gets us reasonable rates, usually. Convenient location to restaurants, Metro, coffee, etc. although sad about closing of TreeHaus.  Only complaint was having to wait 50 minutes for valet to bring car. Yes, 5-0.

title: Ottima posizione
text: Carino, camera per 5 spaziosa e pulita...unico neo: c'è la cucina ben attrezzata ma....manca il tavolo! Personale gentile e posizione comodissima per visitare midtown e Central park. Anche la metro è vicina.

title: Hotel céntrico
text: Hotel cercano a la 5a Avenida y con restaurantes y servicios muy cerca. Los empleados de la recepción muy amables. La habitación cómoda aunque se oía el ruido de fuera, aunque no tuvimos ningún problema a la hora de dormir. Lavabo con jabón, champú, acondicionador y crema corporal. Se debe pagar 30$ por día por una serie de servicios como el wi-fi, hora de vino diaria o 10$ diarios en productos como patatas, agua, golosinas, etc.

title: Excellent Hotel in great location
text: Plenty of excellent restaurants within a short stroll.  Excellent friendly staff, rooms are large and very clean and comfortable.  Great location for the subway and easy to get around Manhattan.  The restaurant in the sister hotel just up the street was also excellent.

title: Clean, comfortable, modern facilities
text: I was gladly surprised by this hotel, the facilities are modern and with good taste. I will definitely stay here again. Room was spacious and very comfortable, front desk service was good in general. Greg is an excellent customer representative.

title: ANGEL
text: My room was very nice, with a little kitchen and very confortable beds. The staff was attentive with us. The situacion is good. Perhaps you must change the windows (noisy) and  air aconditionated a bit noisy too, and then you must forget the ear plugs

title: Old, dated, tatty
text: Spent a week here at Easter 2018.  Location is great, center of midtown.  Family of 4 so we went with the family room.  This constituted one room with an old sofa bed and weird unmatching and unsuitable furniture pieces, one thin room with 2 queen beds crammed into it and a bathroom in which it was difficult to open the door to get out of because it was so ridiculously small.  The furniture is old, the entire place needs complete refurbishment.  There is almost no reception to speak of and the queue was always long. The most painful thing was the lifts.   There are 2 very small and old lifts for the entire hotel.  One day we waited over half an hour for an available lift to get us from our floor (we were only about half way up) to the ground.  Waits of 15 minutes were the norm.  It was incredibly infuriating.  Our bill for this stay was $4,300.....  Do not stay here, we are kicking ourselves that we did so and will never be back.

title: Excelente ubicación, muy buen servicio y buena relación precio-calidad
text:
El hotel tiene una excelente ubicacion, queda cerca de muchos puntos de interes para visitar y del subte que permite moverse hacia todos lados. 
Volviendo de noche, la zona es muy segura e iluminada. 
La habitacion que nos toco era preciosa, super amplia y con todas las comodidades como plancha, cafetera, secador de pelo, etc...
El trato de todo el personal fue excelente! 
A las tarifas publicadas, hay que adicionarle usd35 por dia de gastos, de los cuales usd10 se pueden canjear por productos del store, y todos los dias de 17 a 18 hs, el hotel ofrece encuentros de vino y snacks sin cargo para fomentar la camaradería entre huespedes. 
Super recomendable.

title: Great stay overall
text:
I think the location is the best part of the hotel. Right in the middle of everything but far enough that you don't have crowded streets all the time. Pharmacies, stores, little markets and a bunch of good restaurants nearby.
Hotel seems renovated, super fast elevators, small but OK lobby.
We stayed in a studio suite with kitchen because of our baby, and it was the best decision. Good size, equipped kitchen, we used it every single day.
On the not so positives, we arrived a bit late and the checkin process was OK, not great. Crib wasn't in the room and then they brought it without sheets.
Air conditioner is super dated and it was too cold. Impossible to set properly.
No room service at breakfast, and at night only until 11pm. Couldn't use it once.

title: Great Midtown location
text: I recently stayed at 50 Hotel with my husband and 2 teenagers for four nights.  We had a suite with kitchenette and 2 beds.  It was a large room for NYC and the kitchen had everything we needed.  The beds were comfortable and we had a decent view of the city from our window. Blackout shades were great.  Heard occasional noise from traffic below (we were on 12th floor), but to be expected in NYC.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  The only thing I wasn't expecting was the $35 daily fee for "free" wifi.  It also gave us a daily $10 credit for their mini-store snack items (beer $ wine available, too).  Overall, this was a great location and I recommend it to others who want to explore the city but want a somewhat quieter place to return to at the end of each day.

title: Crappiest hotel
text: I stayed at the hotel with family. The staff were not friendly. I had to pay them $500 which was used when  we were using their WiFi and watching the tv. Complete rip off. I requested a room on the 6th floor but we ended on the 3rd. We could not sleep AT ALL due to the rubbish trucks coming by at 3am every morning. I don't intend on going back. If you intend on visiting New York do not stay at this dump.

title: Great Hotel
text: Large room for New York. Staff were nice and always greeted you in the morning and evening. Resort fee was excessive. Should just include it automatically in the nightly price if room. Will stay again

title: Great hotel experience.
text: We had an awesome time at Fifty by Affinia. The staff from the door to the front desk provided exceptional service and made us feel at home. Our room was above our expectations. Room was clean and spacious. We had a balcony and a great view. The happy hour wine thing was fun but also helpful as we chatted with other families and exchanged recommendations. We will most definitely be back.

title: Great time in N.Y. City
text: A very fun time! Great services at the hotel with fun and helpful staff! We are looking forward to our next visit. Happy hour was a nice relaxing time and with four little girls we needed that!! The girls enjoyed their lemonade and talking with everyone there. The room had plenty of space and was very quiet at night . We woke up well rested and ready to go. The continental breakfast was a great start to our day. Thank you all for making it an easy stay and enjoyable.

title: Brilliant staff
text: The Fifty is very well located. Walking distance to a number of landmarks and subway stations.  Spacious and Comfy Family room.Incredibly nice, dedicated and thorough staff!The free luggage store on departure date is also a plus.

title: Loved it!!!
text: Fifty is located just a couple of blocks away from the crazy NYC, with plenty of transportations options  in the area, as well as great food just a few feet away. We stayed at a corner room with a great view. Staff was always kind and helpful. I recommend it.

title: Some good. Some bad.
text: Overall the hotel is conveniently located and the staff was courteous. We had a total of 4 rooms between 4 couples. Some of the rooms were nice but some of the rooms were not so great. One big issue was the air conditioning in the rooms which  just did not cool effectively. In the summer heat it was impossible to sleep at night. The staff was prompt on sending engineers to check the air conditioning but there was nothing they could do. Cleanliness and other comfort were good.

title: Friendly Hotel
text:
I stayed here for four nights with my teenagers. The friendliest doormen I have ever come across. Rooms are clean and spacious. The hotel breakfast is really nice. Free coffee available all day, and free wine and lemonade from 5pm - 6pm. Near the subway station. 

One slightly strange thing - the hotel booked me a cab to the airport. After a few blocks we were pulled over by the police and made to get into a yellow cab - there was something illegal about our original transportation. The hotel may want to review their car provider!

title: Terrace Suite has amazing views of the city!
text: First, I’d like to say check-in was a pleasure. Leslie Tapia helped us and she was adorable…super sweet and friendly. At check-in, we upgraded to a terrace suite on the top floor. Our suite was beautiful!  It was spacious with lots of windows looking out onto the city. The suite had a kitchen, dining room, living room, and a separate bedroom with king bed and bathroom.(I must say the bathroom was a bit small) The best part was the huge wrap around outside terrace, which had amazing views of the city! Well worth the extra $. If we’re ever in the city … we will definitely stay at the Fifty Hotel and Suites.

title: NYC August 2018
text: Room a little small but I guess that's what I was paying for. Shower curtain was moldy. Elevators a little bit of a trick bag. Overall, though, room, hotel, location very good (this is my 3rd stay at the hotel).

title: Great hotel with perfect location and the room had all I needed for my family stay
text: The hotel is located on the same road as Rockefeller Center, only a 5 minutes walk. We had a studio with a King bed, Sofa bed, Balcony, Kitchen. The beds were very comfortable, the kitchen had all what we needed, bathroom small but still big enough. The balcony was a great way to end the evenings. We stayed on 18th floor and did not have any problems with traffic noice. The aircondition worked perfect. We will definately come back for our next stay.

title: Receptionist cordiality could be better
text: Customer service doesn’t really makes you feel welcome and are always impatient. If you have any common tourist questions, better keep it to yourself if you don’t want to be rudely treated. Also, I thought room illumination could be better.

title: what went wrong
text: slight smell --had to open windows.  helped with the smell somewhat.daughter had no  hot water. $40 resort fee was misleadingly annoying. do all hotels charge this or only you.wine without cheese and chips was chintzy. other hotels have the cheese part of the amenity.

title: Another Great Stay
text: This was my 5th stay at Fifty Hotel.  It never skips a beat.  Room was comfortable and clean- Staff is wonderful.  I am usually on higher floor but was on 7th this stay- It was noiser than being up higher but   it did not impact my sleep.  Hotel is withen walking distance to everything including bus and subway.  Good food all around-

title: Great value
text: Great value!  The size of the room was big enough to accommodate 2 adults and 2 children and the bathroom was huge, compared to other NY hotels! Nice wine reception in the afternoon and the staff was friendly. Only complaint is that our room was facing the street side, which was VERY noisy at times. Next time I know to ask for a room located within the hotel, without a view. Clean room. comfy blanket and pillows and didn't have any issues!

title: A Welcome, Delightful  Weekend with the Great Staff at Affinia 50
text: First of all I would sincerely like to thank Ms. L Tapia for her outstanding service. It started with a phone call earlier in the week for advice and setting up a reservation for other family members, arriving at all different times. I was given very helpful advice, for setting up the arrival to check in  and how to be sure the other guests were listed in the reservation properly, (in order to make things smooth). Very helpful. Later, long  travel delays, for some family  members, did not effect the others from checking in properly. Also every detail about the perks, the  hotel conveniences, were covered in the nicest way by Leslie.We never felt like our questions were an inconvenience. We got great advice on all our questions, with  a happy, kind attitude. In addition to Leslie ,the  people at the front desk were always kind and helpful, but she was "amazing "with all our family arrangements. Everyone in the family remarked about her efficiency, kindness and excellent help.The housekeepers on floor 14 were also "great."  The rooms were very well cleaned and prepared. Every time we passed one, or had a need, they were friendly happy, helpful, never intrusive. I was carrying 2 cups of hot coffee and one lovely housekeeper rushed to help me when I needed to reach for my key. Another lovely lady, helped get us an elevator, and I had left a polite note that the shower curtain liner smelled  musty. It was changed as soon as they came to clean my room. I think the only thing that was not perfect was the person on the second floor during coffee time. I  have dairy issues, so just have coffee, not the breakfast. We asked if any non-dairy  products were available for the coffee, such as nondairy  substitutes, soy milk , or anything?? We looked, but only cream and milk were out. She seemed very annoyed and just said no, pointed at the craft thermos and said just milk. We have been going to  Affinia"s for about 15 years. I thought in the past, they may have had some nondairy  source, ( really, not a big deal drank it without ). It was an attitude that we were an inconvenience so different than the front desk and housekeepers, who were OUTSTANDING. Not really a big deal, perhaps, I misunderstood or , maybe I was one of a very  few that  made this request in a  long time.)Also, the doormen were  wonderful. They were attentive to every detail, kind, helpful, and made the social experience of visiting the Affinia fun , and very very efficient!! Thank You!

title: Friendly and professional staff. Great Amenities.
text: Enjoyed the location. Staff was polite and professional. Clean linen, bathroom clean, Wi-Fi is not free $35.00 resort fee.  They have a common lounge on the Second Floor. Great to have a glass of wine with family.

title: Great Staff. Nice Locatioin but..
text:
but the $35 hotel fee is a joke. $10 for overpriced store. Claim fee covers wifi and gym and happy hour. 
I do not want wifi.  Gym used to be free and I can use use NYSC. (At other hotels  gym and wifi are free these days especially if you are a member of frequent flyer club.)  It used to be you are always welcome back as a former guest to happy hour- it was a 'club'.   Brian, get real and kill teh add on.  Also, a little food with the wine. Where did the snacks go? Also, the staff sneaks out right on the hour- cant go beyond 60 minutes or a last call?
I trust this fee goes away soon.  
Rooms are nice since they rehabed a few years ago.   Pleasant place to stay.

title: A pleasant stay
text: Hotel is very centrally located. Rooms are quiet; beds are very comfotable Staff is very friendly, especially the doorkeepers Price setting however is not so transparent We did not understand fully the mandatory fee for (extra) facililties

title: New York pad
text: A clean, comfortable, well located hotel within easy access to major attractions.Easy to check in and a lovely welcome.Plenty of elavators and large beds.Hotel accommodated our request for two rooms on same floorFront desk always asking if they can help.

title: Chambres spacieuses et confortables
text:
Idéalement situé, dans un quartier agréable, il est un excellent point de départ pour des ballades à pied vers différents quartiers. Il est également proche de stations de métro stratégiques.
Il propose des chambres agréables, spacieuses, propres et très confortables. Nous y avons très bien dormi. Nous étions au 17ème étage, ce qui a limité le bruit de New York, difficilement évitable. 
Le personnel est sympathique et à l'écoute.
Un excellent rapport qualité prix. nous y retournerons sans hésiter.

title: Birthday Holiday
text:
We booked a junior suite. Upon arrival the hotel looks clean and decent. When we exited the lift on the 19th floor to go to our room, my first impression was that the hotel needs updating. Upon opening the door to our room, we were very surprised. It was amazing. Big, spacious, and just want is needed. We have stayed at other hotels and the rooms are tiny. The room was the right size as we had our little girl who just wanted to play when coming back for all the walking we had done. 
It was my little girls birthday and the house keeper for our floor while we were out put a little card, cupcake and lollipop on her bed wishing her a happy birthday.
All staff from check in to leaving were very friendly and accommodating.
Only downside is that if you spend most of your time around Times Square, its a little walk to this hotel. If you don't mind walking, stay here.

title: Reality Check for NYC affinia fifty revewed  aug 2018
text: The silly idea of MUST SPEND $10 USD daily in drinks which is not combinable is an extra that is confusing and NOT client friendly. Room 15 08 or 1504  I think is NOT usable in toilet section , as badly designed. Staff at front desk should be 2 at least not one as grabbing those mandatory drinks sometimes took 15 minutes to allow staff to log in against room account. This is a waste of time and illogical. . Extra RESORT FEE style addons are confusing and should be included in tariff as they are compulsory anyway. Dealing direct policy in marketing the AFFINIA Hotels is bad marketing as it deliberately negates any Travel Agency loyalty. I asked to have times in Lifts amended to correct time zones 3 times. Nothing ever done. Night Manager GREG was excellent in allowing us to change rooms and his ongoing sensibility in servicing us.  LASTLY this questionnaire is sent in 3 point font size !  R U serious !!! This Hotel can be much better if you paid more attention to detail!

title: Great Stay
text: We had traveled here due to a medical appointment. The junior suite was spacious with great views. Bed was comfortable and the complimentary wine happy hour was great. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Great location - good clean hotel
text:
I have stayed here for business and pleasure.  I would recommend based on location, space and price.   Good accommodations.   Valet parking available.  

Close to shops and convenient to several attractions.  👍

title: Perfect Location
text: Great location for a short break, travelled in the April of 2017 for my sons 18th. A couple of blocks from most attractions. Exceptional staff, eager to assist. Great place a few doors down for a breakfast!

title: Great service. Great room.
text: I always enjoy my stays at the Fifty. The staff, from the door greeters to the check in desk to the room service and housekeeping are always personable and professional. The amenities are convenient and the value provided is fantastic.

title: Good location, so-so hotel
text: The location of the hotel is fairly close to Rockefeller Center and Times Square (about a mile walk to TS). The overall hotel is ok - based on their website and photos I had higher expectations honestly. The staff was very nice. The rooms were large for NY (we had 2 queen superior room). My main complaint is the air system - we could not get our room to cool down to our satisfaction, the AC kept running and running and the thermostat would never change or after we were in the room for a while, it would go up. There was not a fan in the bathroom so the room quickly became humid after someone showered. It was pretty uncomfortable at times. I called the front desk 3 times on this and they supposedly sent someone to look at it while we were gone during the day. They told us to keep it on auto (which we did) and it should cool off. There never really was an improvement. The room used some energy saving feature on the thermostat so I'm not sure if that was the issue or not. They never followed up with us to see if there was improvement and after complaining 3x we gave up. The room itself was in need of updating and the carpet seemed dirty. Overall the price was good however we would not recommend this hotel or stay here again, there are many other options in the city.

title: Overall nice place to stay
text: Good location, room almost too spacious. Do keep an eye on the bill at check in and check out, as they tack on so many fees its likely to be 50% more expensive than on booking. Bed was comfortable. 10$ tacked on credit (mandatory) is great in theory except with the 5x inflation on all goods (usually hotels are happy to leave it at 2 or 3x but that was just silly).

title: Très bonne hôtel.
text: Nous avons passés un très beau séjour a l'hôtel. Le personnel étais très courtois certains parlais même un petit peu français. L'hôtel est super bien situé nous avons pu aller visiter beaucoup de lieu a pied.

title: Good location
text: Fifty Hotel is in the middle of Mahattan, you can go and visit by foot lots of places. Lobby is nice and well decorated. The room was clean, modern and big and there is a fitness center. The staff is very kind and helpful.

title: Pleasant stay, attentive service
text: Initial room was not to my liking;  they immediately re-assigned me to a larger, nicer room with hardwood floor hallway/entrance.  Very nice stay for 4 nights.  Breakfast is available on 2nd floor each morning.  Coffee machine in lobby is free.  Very nice staff members.  Clean hotel.

title: Ideale per Business
text: Hotel raffinato, pulito e ben collegato nel cuore della grande mela. Il personale è gentile, educato e sempre disponibile a qualsiasi ora della notte. Un particolare interessante è l'offerta di vino dalle 5 alle 6 del pomeriggio.

title: Nice 4 star in Times Square/Broadway area
text: The room was nice, but not amazing. Staff was friendly and helpful. The ventilation wasn’t great. The room itself was reasonably appointed. The bar fridge worked, but was also leaky. The valet took care of our luggage and car, but no in/out privileges was a bit of a pain. I would stay again if I needed to be in that area and got a rate deal.

title: Great location!
text: I have always enjoyed staying at the Affinia Dumont, so this was first time at Fifty. It seems older than Dumont. It was very convenient for me and loved the location in midtown. I realize I am in NYC, but room was loud, even with earplugs. A window in the bathroom contributed. I love the efficiency kitchen. Super amenity! I was charged  a $50 or $60 incidental fee in addition to all the other fees, which was a surprise. I was told it would be subtracted after check out. Request a room without a window in bathroom if noise bothers you.

title: Exceptional find!
text: I couldn’t have been more pleased with our stay here. The staff, each and everyone of them, was friendly helpful and managed to make our trip more enjoyable. The rooms were clean, the option of having breakfast on the second floor was a huge plus as well. Add to that the happy hour from 5-6pm with wine to unwind...nice touch. I truly have no complaints at all. I would, and will recommend this hotel to any and all of my friends.

title: NOT WHAT IT USE TO BE
text: Lately I have been having bad luck with my hotel choices.I recently spend 6 night in The Affinia and its not what it use to be.Since our arrival all the way to the last day we were really dissapointed.On arrival we had to wait over 3 hours to get our Junior suite.From 3pm until 6pm.The room was a total disappointment.The small kitchen is for the photos only.It lacks all basic to prepair a breakfast and the appliances are from a past era...For 3 consecutive days we had to call house keeping to arrange the room(7pm and the room was not done)...Guess the only thing left is the room size which is good and the location which is great...Done with the nostalgia Im not coming back.

title: Convenient Location...That's about it
text:
I typically stay in a very large (unnamed) chain hotel when in NYC for business.  I decided to go with the Fifty based on the proximity to the location where our meetings were being held.  
I arrived in the evening to the front desk attendant watching something on her phone with one earbud while barely being able to check us in. 
The room was OK, but needed some TLC.  The carpets had large noticeable stains and the bathroom seemed to be just barely cleaned.  
The bed was comfortable though!

title: Hotel centrale ben collegato
text: L'hotel è molto centrale e ben collegato. La zona è molto tranquilla e piena di supermercati a buon prezzo (morton williams nyc). Nella tariffa resort vengono offerti, a notte, 10$ al giorno per l'acquisto di snack, bibite o acqua. Personale molto gentile e premuroso.

title: Great stay!
text: Our family visited NYC and had a great time. This hotel exceeded expectations in location and experience.  The room was clean and comfortable. Happy hour was enjoyable.  Everyone was friendly and helpful.  Especially the doorman, Rome. He went out of his help us find places to eat and arrange transportation. It was nice to return to the hotel and see his smile as he opened the door for us. Highly recommend!

title: Good hotel for visiting the City
text:
We visited as a family of three.  We were in room 419 which was right by the elevator but we didn't get any noise from there at all.  The is no view from this room - only a blank wall of a neighbouring building.  However, the benefit of this as that you don't get any noise from the street.

The room is quite spacious for NYC with two comfortable beds, a nice big TV and a fridge which is welcome in the summer.  The aircon is not too noisy.  The bathroom is very compact but still has both a bath and shower.

There are three elevators and we never waited more than 30 seconds for one to arrive.  You can purchase wifi at the hotel - we chose the premium service for four devices and speeds were very good which allowed us to FaceTime home with no issues at all.

The front desk staff are friendly and helpful and the doormen are very welcoming and well presented.

title: Trip with friends
text: My friends and I were looking for a place to stay during our annual get together trip. Our concern was to find a nice hotel for a reasonable price and also walk-able to the subway or any other place around Manhattan. My friends and I arrived during different times and I was the first one to arrive. The reservation was under my friend's name and the staff was very kind and let me leave my luggage in the hotel while my friend was arriving. We were in 3 people and we had a great time there! The bedroom was pretty clean and the rest of the hotel either. The only point to improve is the elevator that only 2 was working at in the peak hours is faster to use the stairs but I would definitively stay there again! You surprisingly can't hear too much noise for a hotel in the middle of the city!

title: Our weeekend stay
text: We recently stayed for 2 nights.  Our room was scheduled to be ready by 3pm Friday.  We arrived early morning, dropped our bags and checked in.  We were told the room would be ready at 3 and if not, they would call us to give us a heads up.  Traveling with 2 children, we came back right at 3 for some down time.  The room wasn't ready.  We were assured it would be another 15 minutes.  Those 15 minutes lasted 40.  This is inexcusable when we paid over $300 for this room.  Though our room was tidy and sufficient, the shower temperature was broken and continuously wound back to the hottest temperature which lead to us unable to have our children shower during the stay.  The adults continuously had to reset the temperature during a 10 minute shower.

title: Fifty Hotel & Suites
text: This hotel is acceptional. The customer service from the attentive greeting of the doorman Mr. Rome Jefferson to all the staff this hotel delivers top A1 Service. I will only stay in this hotel when visiting New York

title: Had a great stay with great staff
text: My son and I, stayed here for 8 days and were both very happy with the hotel.  The book in process was seamless, we had a very large room with two queen beds which were lovely and comfortable.  The room had AC and daily room service.  Nice touch was the daily wine tasting at 4pm.  All the door staff were very friendly, polite, welcoming and helpful.  The location is great - easy to get to all the tourist sites and the main shopping / theatre areas.  Lots of places to eat nearby inc a great diner a few yards away from hotel.  We could not find any fault at all with this hotel and would gladly stay here again.

title: Excelente ubicación, habitaciones y servicio
text:
El hotel tiene una ubicación muy cómoda, en esquina con Commonweatlh Av donde se encuentran muchas tiendas para hacer compras. Enfrente al Boston Common, hermoso parque para pasear.
El hotel es muy arreglado, las habitaciones son espaciosas y cómodas. El servicio de baño (toallas, accesorios) es muy buenos. Los precios acordes al lugar. El restaurante tiene precios elevados.

title: Weekend in the city
text: My children enjoyed a weekend getaway.  Friendly and helpful staff, close to subway, clean, and fairly quiet location.  The bellmen were playful with the kids and so kind.  Great places to eat within walking distance.  This will be my go to hotel in the city!

title: LOVE this hotel
text: We have stayed at the Affinia 50 Hotel around 12 times, and every experience is a great one. The staff is terrific, the rooms are clean and on the large side, and the location is super-convenience. Also, they have rooms with 2 queen beds, a must when traveling with an 18 yo boy.

title: very disappointed
text:
I'n staying at affinia a LOT . almost in every business trip to NY at both Fifty or affinia
i was surprised to see that the front desk in both places don;t even have my history visit to see my spending over the years 
in this visit i got a room on the 2nd floor that that was a huge disappointing point.  
I'm returning again on the 25th for one night

title: Great for business traverllers
text:
I was on a business trip to NYC and stayed at the Fifty for 3 nights. The hotel checks out in almost everything. A great location mostly overlooking 3rd Avenue, very clean rooms and a reliable free Wi-Fi. 
The drawbacks were: 1/ Service.. OK. Not exactly 'with a smile'. Passable… and 2/ Breakfast; which was limited in variety. I guess it's designed for health-conscious people [not me]. 

Fifty Affinia is pricier than its counterparts. Also, rates vary from one night to another, which is very confusing.

title: Awesome Experience!
text: The Concierges were amazing. They were helpful and friendly. It made the process of checking in easier sense it was my first time staying in NYC. The hotel was beautiful, clean, and so close to the center of the city. It only took a few minutes to walk to the sights I wanted to see.

title: Very nice hotel
text: Very good location, the room was nice, clean of bathroom can be better, comfortable beds, silence room, overall nice hotel and very good location it was our 4 time in this hotel anf the 6 time in the affinias group !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Best location for a hotel in NYC
text: We loved the location of this hotel.  Close to all the sights, safe because it was next door to the police dept. and warm staff members.  It's pricey but what do you expect for NYC?  Be sure to hold out for a high room, eat at the local luncheonette, food is amazing.  Get bagels at Essen Bagel, you won't be sorry.

title: Last night in NYC
text: Right when you walk in your greeted but the best bellman! They are so welcoming and more than happy to get you bags out the car. It’s always first impressions that guide your thoughts. I had come in early and I was lucky enough to get the early check in. Once I walked into the room instantly felt in awe with the new redesign. I personally love sliding doors so that was a pleasantly surprised. The location was amazing as well close to bars and  convenience stores. The room was beyond spacious had a beautiful view of the city of course the artwork into court in the main lobby was my favorite part of the trip with the blue hanging man around the staircase. If anyone has the opportunity to stop by I would recommend this hotel because service is what makes the difference from the hotel to home.

title: 2nd time in NY 1st time at Fifty
text: The first thing you notice when you walk in to this beautiful hotel is the staff. The doormen here are some of the best doormen in NYC.  The front desk staff are all very sweet and helpful as well. The blue chandelier of "people" above the staircase is a The beds were so comfortable I slept like a baby. I will definitely will be coming back .

title: Watch out for hidden charges
text:
Let me start by saying this hotel is comfortable and the rooms and bathrooms are spacious by New York standards. Guest services was professional and friendly. However, the hotel isn’t inexpensive so you’re paying for all the little niceties. 

Ordinarily I would have rated my stay with 4 stars except for the nasty $40 “mandatory activity fee” surprise I was assessed at check out. Not that I was actually aware or used any of the activities. 

So, beware of these additional fees when you compare hotels and prices as the deal you think you’re getting may not be such a deal.

title: Great Location with service to match
text:
Once again stayed at the 50 NYC and loved it. It is the perfect pied a terre when in New York for a weeklong stay. Clean and friendly. You get all the necessary amenities without the extra cost and even though there is no in house restaurant you have great options next door.
Highly recommended for long stays

title: Second stay at hotel even better
text: Stayed again at the Fifty this past Monday night confirmed a standard room but got upgraded to a Studio suite with a terrace. The view I had from the terrace was amazing. The weather couldn't have been better either. The staff was just as friendly as they were the last time. As I was checking out waiting on my Uber to the airport one of the doorman decided he wanted to come over and do a magic trick and was pretty good at it. I did the breakfast on the 2nd floor this time and wasn't too bad. It was just a continental breakfast but for the price it was pretty good.

title: If you like noisy places ...
text:
Don’t look further. I have stayed in many hotels in NYC but this one beats them all in terms of noise. It’s street noise and elevator noise and just plain and simple the ac, which in a couple of years will be transferred to the Smithsonian...
No sleep with ac and no sleep without.
There are better places for sure

title: What an awesome hotel!
text:
We had a great time here enjoying the sights of New York whilst staying in this luxurious boutique hotel very near to amenities including transport links and the famous Eesa Bagel place as well as lots of breakfast and dinner options nearby.

The staff were very friendly and accommodating. 
The room was fantastic and so spacious considering it was NY.
Would definitely recommend it highly.
We found having a kitchenette in our room so handy for breakfast in the mornings or to prepare a light lunch and store leftovers for later!

title: Great Stay!
text: Great hotel with a good location. Stayed here for a vacation and was a short walk from major tourist attractions. Room was nice and clean. Employees were friendly and always greeted us when we got back to the hotel. Only thing that was a con was that it took awhile for the water to warm up to take a shower on the fourth floor. It eventually warmed up so it was not a big deal. Overall a great stay and would come back again!

title: Excellent birthday stay!!
text: Had an amazing stay here. Leslie at the front desk was extremely kind and professional.  All staff when encountered were very pleasant and helpful. Thank you Affinia for a wonderful birthday weekend stay!!

title: Horrible Experience.
text: After a hot day in NY expected a cool room. Our room was 82 degrees with no air flow from unit.The staff were not helpful and quite rude. Tub drain didn’t work and two lamps were broken. Room smelled of smoke and mildew. Staff brought a fan and said that’s the coolest it would get. Never again will I use This hotel.

title: Great hotel, value and location
text: Fourth stay at this hotel gem.  Great value, huge rooms, well appointed baths.  Great location Turtle Bay (50th and 3rd).  Ess a bagel and Radiance Tea House (chinese restaurant)great 1/2 block away.  Highly recommended.

title: Family vacation
text: My husband, three children, and I am were in New York for a family vacation. This hotel is perfect for families. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room accommodations were excellent.   The hotel is located just around the corner from a address stop. This made travel very easy. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We will certainly stay here again.

title: Family Visit to the City
text:
Everything about the staff & our stay was excellent.  Everyone was very helpful & accommodating, and the staff were all very professional.  My husband and I definitely loved the 5-6pm wine hour each evening!  I was very happy to find a hotel with 2 Queen beds in a room {vs 2 Doubles}, and even with that + the dresser + the desk, it was still a very spacious room.  We were also happy to have a fridge in the room.  
The only issue we had was using the hotel car service for our 30/45 minute drive to JFK on the day we checked out.  It was 90*, the air conditioning in the car wasn't working at all, the driver spoke zero English, and answered two different calls, on speaker phone, during the drive. We told him we refused to pay the $68+tip that he wanted, but the most he would come down was to $60.  It was a very disappointing & frustrating way to end our experience.

title: If you like to stay cool in your room, DO NOT plan a stay here.
text: If you like to stay cool in your room, do not plan a stay here.  A/C is pitiful and staff treats you like an idiot when you complain about it.  Shower knobs fall off and tub paint is peeling, also does not hold water completely.  If you take a shower, the whole room turns into a sauna.  We have been miserable since we arrived.  Moved rooms at 12:30am to one that was supposed to be cooler.  No such luck.  Lowest temp it reached was 75-78 when the air was set on 66. The staff absolutely doesn't seem to care one bit either.  They haven't offered any compensation and have a "deal with it" attitude.  Never have I experienced service this bad in a hotel.

title: simply perfect
text: everything was perfect...room, location, service...we stayed 4 nights with 2 little kids and was really comfortable. If I go back to Manhattan it will surely be my first choice.....it is pretty expensive but I think you get what you pay for

title: Great stay
text: Recently stayed at the Fifty NYC. A great hotel but the best thing by far was the staff. So friendly, so helpful. Nice rooms and good facilities too. Great central location. Would really recommend staying here for the service

title: Perect
text: Very nice staff, ready to do all to accomodate your requests. Perfect location,close to the subway. Clean, big, comfortable rooms, although the bathroom could be sligthly bigger. Good breakfast. Relaxed atmosphere. Pet friendly.

title: Gem in NYC
text: First visit to NYC so a bit daunting but all good once we booked into this wonderful hotel. Met at the cab by doorman Smiler & from his friendly greeting on just got better. Huge room by NYC standards, 2 queen beds & urban kitchen in the room made for a perfect 9 day stay. Located on cnr of 50th & 3rd within walking distance to everything, subway stations, huge 24 hour supermart, dozens of restaurants & cafes. Rockefeller Centre, St Patrick’s Church Radio City Music Hall etc. The staff was amazing & couldn’t have been more helpful. Hi & thanks to Smiler, Sammy, & the most perfect doorman ever Rome, who warmly greeted us back each night, with a warm welcome home & a genuine interest in our daily activities. We learned so much from all the staff to help us get the most from our stay in this incredible city. Thank you all, we’ll never forget you and our perfect first visit to NYC.

title: Very nice visit
text: We stayed for two nights. Two adults and two kids under 11. The beds were queens and extremely comfortable. The room itself was on the bigger size for New York City. The bathroom was tiny, but again this NYC. The location via subway was 30 min to Battery Park and 35 min to Yankees Stadium. Great food spots close by, and the hotel had a wine and lemonade happy hour which was nice. Overall the room was modern and clean and roomy enough for a family of 4 for 2 nights.

title: Ottimo Hotel
text: Situato in posizione centrale, vicino alla metro e circondato da numerosi bar e ristoranti. Camere spaziose, pulite con letti molto comodi e possibilità di scegliere il cuscino dal menù. Personale cortese e sempre disponibile. Dispone inoltre di funzionale, sicuro e sorvegliato deposito bagagli gratuito.

title: Trip to NYC
text: Rooms between elevators are loud. Asked to be moved but they wanted to charge an upgrade fee to move.  There were rooms available on their web site and they did not offer a free upgrade.  I received no accommodation.

title: Great hotel in NYC
text:
Had an awesome stay with our family of 6 at Fifty NYC. The entire staff was outstanding, so helpful and friendly. The suites and rooms are great to accommodate the needs of our family along with comfortable beds and spacious room. Location was great!
I would highly recommend this hotel for families!

title: Family visit to NYC
text: The Fifty NYC was a great place to stay. Just off the busy streets and noise. We were on the 19th floor and had a balcony to see the streets. The bell hops were the greatest! They were so helpful to me and my daughters and granddaughters!

title: Great visit at Fifty NYC
text: We had a terrific couple of days in NYC at the Fifty NYC!  It was conveniently located to all that we were doing and had all the amenities we needed.  The only complaint we had was that the room had a particular

title: Exceeded our expectations
text: Everything about our experience was top notch. From the time we got there until the time we left, we met with courteous service and competent employees. The room was outstanding. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. We really like the location being close to 'what is happening' but nearby neighborhoods that really enhance the NYC experience. Thank you to the staff for making it a special weekend.

title: Second Stay Just as Sweet
text: Although I was only able to stay one night this trip, I was again impressed by the friendly staff and all the amenities...coffee in the a.m. wine/snacks in evening, great in-room soap/lotion, etc, refrigerator, and more. Bed very comfortable. Shower refreshing. Decor is modern but warm. A little noisy in my second floor room but, HEY!, it is NYC.

title: Comfortable and very convenient
text: I always stay at your hotel, I am always surprised with the rates.. I understand high during summer but.. I sometimes have my reservations through my company, sometimes directly on line... the complimentary services always different, I usually get more through internet  ($10 dollars at the counter, breakfast...) it just weird as sometimes the rates are higher when I do it through my company and I do not get anything extra.  Always miss the shower cap and the room service is not the best, better to go out. Anyway, Net net... you do not recognize the frequent guests anyway... should think about some kind of rewards or recognition program. Anyway always like to stay at  your hotel as it is very convenient, rooms are good size and comfortable, and also the personnel always very gentile and helpful.

title: Hotel not worth the money
text: Despite the great location and high-recommendation, the hotel with both interior as well as services were not meeting the standards of a 2* hotel in Europe. Very much confusing pricing structure and a lot of

title: Odors
text: Hi. My last room on the 2nd floor had a very musty odor. Like humidity feeling. Made me feel as if the room was not clean. My friend’s smelled like fried chicken. Oberall very confortable beds and pretty decor. Great Service staff.

title: Wonderful Hotel!
text: Our room was bright, airy and spotlessly clean. Fantastic and helpful staff who were always willing to answer our questions.  Planning on staying at this hotel again. We would highly recommend this hotel to our friends.

title: Great stay in NYC
text: Excellent apartments to stay when travelling with young kids... perfect location and rates... staff was extremely cordial and helpful especially with the kids.. apartments were a little small and a second bathroom in the living room would have been useful.. and windows need to be soundproof.. but otherwise excellent..

title: Great stay at Fifty NYC
text:
First visit to NYC for us. Looked at dozens of hotel reviews and decided Fifty NYC was the place to stay. Great location and decent rooms. All the employees were very friendly, especially the doormwn. They were funny and one of them was showing us magic tricks one night. Overal, the hotel is on the small side, but it was fine for us. The lobby and lounge upstairs were very nice. Wine tasting at 5pm on the 2nd floor every day. You get a $10 credit for the pantry every day, so make sure you use it. 

Plenty of restaurants in the area. There is a nice little luncheonette around the corner that serves food all day long...we ate there twice and it was a cool little NYC diner. And a bagel place is right across the street.

The room was a decent size and bigger than your average NYC hotel room. It was clean and, most importantly, the AC worked well. It was very hot the week we were there. 95 the first day and we came back to cool down a few times. The bathroom was small, but just fine. We did like the walk in shower. We hate those shower/tub combos many older hotels have.  My only gripe about the bathroom is it didn’t have an exhaust fan. Now we have been all over in big cities and noticed this a lot in many hotels. You would think the building code would require a bathroom fan. Without one, black mold starts to form on the ceiling.  And there was spots of mold on the ceiling and along the corner of the shower. Management should have this cleaned off regularly....it is a health issue. 

Another small issue is the noise at night. We we on 15th floor, yet you can hear everything from the street. Especially sirens and car horns. It seemed like our window was open, but it wasn’t. We heard what sounded like construction every night until about 1:30 am. This wasn’t a huge thing...we are in the heart of NYC...but just something to mention. 

But all in all, a great hotel and I would certainly recommend it.

title: il lusso della 3rd
text: Molto bello questo hotel: nel centro di nyc, sulla 3rd. lussuoso, ma non costosissimo ... Camere eleganti, pulite, personale educato e gentile. ... colori grigi  e vetrate tralucide. consiglio vivamente questo hotel quando siete a NYC

title: our stay
text: we have stayed there several times..not quite up to the level of previous stays..the check in took quite a while..we had to ask for a robe and shower cap..there hall outside our room had dirty cups for a few days, a ladder by the elevator the entire time..the service door propped up with dirty linens..fan circulating air in the hall..the staff was nice and accommodating.

title: Spacious room with a kitchen
text: This was a short vacation.  We were able to have nice home-cooked meals which reduced our costs a lot, with the added benefit of maintaining our vegan regimen.  The room is spacious but the bathtub drain was a little slow.  We all loved the room but it was very expensive.  If we stay again, we'll plan more in advance to cut the costs by using internet specials.  I don't know if was the location or just New York City in general but the street noise was loud even on the 16th floor.

title: Great Midtown Hotel
text: After much research, we decided on the Fifty Affinia for a 5 night stay in NYC.  It did not disappoint.  We got the studio studio/2 queen beds and it was very comfortable and suited the needs for our family of 2adults/1 child.  Room size at 40+sqm is very comfortable, ample storage space, 1 main closet w/ safe + 1 coat cabinet by the entrance.  Full kitchenette facilites extremely convenient.   Our flight arrived at 7am, and we  paid the early check in fee of usd 100 for a guaranteed 11am check in, but since the room was available, we got in on arrival.  That allowed us a full day in NYC on day 1.  The only downside is the rather narrow corridors to the rooms,  that took some getting used to.  Other than that, it was a very good stay and would recommend it.

title: Great Location and Friendly
text: From the Doorman to the Housekeeper this property has a very friendly staff and a wonderful location in NYC. Would go back anytime! The rooms were comfortable and the free wine happy hour created a nice sense of community.

title: Great stay at Fifty
text: Our stay at Fifty Hotel and Suites was an AWESOME experience.  The room was was spacious and extremely comfortable. The staff was amazing, especially Gloria.  She made us feel as though we were family and even gave us a hug goodbye when we left.  I highly recommend this hotel on your next visit to NYC.

title: "Conference"weekend in NYC
text: Great place to stay. Room was large, clean, Staff were friendly,polite and ready to help with a smile. Jasmine at front desk was excellent, wish we knew names of doormen and baggage handlers-they wer also very good. Complimentary wine social was a hit. Location is great!  10" from Grand Central, 15-20 from Time Square and Broadway. Will definitely be staying here again!

title: Great location
text: Just back from Fifty Hotel midtown East.The room included coffee and fridge facilities. Location was excellent with plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance. Bloomingdales and 5th avenue 10 mins away and station less than 5 mins. Saff very friendly and helpful

title: Another Great Weekend at The Affinia Fifty Horel
text: Always a great stay when at this hotel. The Hotel Staff are very nice and professional. The hotel rooms are very clean. The hotel was remodeled not long ago and is absolutely Beautiful. A shout out to Long time Staff Member Rome.Rome is always professional, helpful, and knowledgeable. He always has kind words to say. If you're traveling to New York City and you're looking for a nice, clean, and cozy place to stay, I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Excellent accomodation with great staff
text:
This was a wonderful hotel, great location and awesome staff.
Free happy hour 5-6pm daily was a great initiative and great way to meet fellow travellers.
Our room was spacious and very clean. Highly recommended, would stay again.
Doorman, Rome Jefferson was delightful and very helpful.

title: The perfect hotel experience.
text:
Still glowing from an amazing weekend, which was almost entirely due to the backdrop of my stay at the Fifty. From the second I was greeted by the doorman on Friday night, to pausing to say goodbye to our wonderful room this morning, my stay at the Fifty was just perfect. 

Jasmine THANK YOU for all you did at check in. Your kindness and care was so appreciated. Our suite was more than we could have expected and it made us feel like we had our own NYC apartment for the weekend. Leslie THANK YOU for continuing the care by getting us settled. And although I didn’t get her name, the other woman working with you - I witnessed her get reamed out by what can only be described as the Guest From Hell. Your professionalism was amazing and you should be commended for staying firm yet courteous. 

The hotel itself was fantastic and the location couldn’t have been better. There are so many great restaurants and bars close by and you are a short walk to the subway and GCT. While some may balk at the resort fee, it’s VERY common in the city and does cover WiFi, a daily $10 credit to their snacks and drinks in the lobby (oh and YES to the Martinelli’s apple juice), and a daily complimentary wine hour. It’s a little on the high side, at $60/day but I would gladly pay it for the service received. 

Our room was a 7th floor studio corner suite overlooking 3rd Avenue, which proved to be an excellent vantage point for watching the line at Ess-A-Bagel. There was a separate ikea-esque kitchen, spacious bathroom with a huge window - I love a nice breeze while in the shower. The bed was comfortable, with tons of pillows. The room itself felt huge, with a desk, armchair, builtin closet/shelving unit and kind sized bed. 

For a hotel with over 200 rooms, once you got upstairs, you wondered if anyone else actually was there. It was so incredibly quiet, even with the expected noise from the street below. 

I hope I have the opportunity to stay here again soon! Thank you for everything!

title: Clean, friendly, modern, and quiet hotel in midtown east
text: Perfect stay! From the minute we checked in the staff was very welcoming. Enjoyed the hospitality room each morning for a complimentary hot cup of coffee and newspaper. Room was quiet and especially large by NYC standards. Very comfortable for 3-4 guests. The entire staff was very friendly and the midtown east location was perfect for our needs.

title: Great place—staff always goes the extra mile
text: We stay here often. The staff is absolutely lovely and accommodating. The location is perfect. And it is one of the few places where we can find a nice room that accommodates us and our children for a reasonable rate. Always a pleasure!

title: PRIMAVERA EM NEW YORK
text:
Hotel muito bem localizado, perto de ótimos  restaurantes ao redor, metro,   comercio, duas quadras da Catedral de Saint Patrick e da 5a Avenida.
Este Apart foi reformado a pouco tempo, quartos amplos e limpos, uma cozinha a disposição dos hospedes, nos quartos, com talheres, pratos, copos, cafeteria e geladeira, ótimo para aqueles que gostam de fazer uma refeição ligeira.
O apartamento que ficamos hospedados no 6o. andar, sem vista mas muito silencioso, com duas camas de casal, trocavam sempre os lençóis, confortável para até 3 pessoas, internet / wifi nos quartos.
O café da manhã é servido no 2 andar, num ambiente muito agradável com opção de duas salas, uma mais tranquila com jornais, revistas e TV's e a outra espaçosa com mesas a disposição dos hóspedes que é servido café da manhã até às 10:30hs.
Staff da recepção atenciosos e simpáticos, a Concierge nos deu boas dicas de restaurantes e locais interessantes de conhecer, como o "Ground Zero" e como fazer o trajeto de metro, providencia também compra de ingresso de teatro bem como faz reserva de restaurantes e locais interessantes de conhecer.
Ficamos duas semanas em NYC e recomendo também fazer  um lindo passeio ao Brooklin.

title: Thank you!
text: Thank you for the wonderful stay! All staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating from check in right until leaving. Especially woman checking us in and men working the door. I wish I remembered their names. Location of this hotel is ideal and we were able to walk to most of our planned attractions. I will definitely be coming back!

title: Will stay again.
text: Everything was great. Stay was very enjoyable.  Check in and check out went smoothly. The people at the front desk were pleasant and friendly. Room was spacious and clean.  Decor is contemporary and visually appealing. The beds were comfortable and bathroom was large with plenty of room to put your things Valet service was friendly and prompt. Comfortable common space.  Happy hour was a nice bonus and a chance to gather and chat with fellow travelers.  The location was very convenient. Close to St Patrick’s Cathedral, Rockefeller Plaza and the today show, Radio City Music Hall, Saks Fifth Avenue, Bloomingdales, The American Girl Store, Magnolia Bakery, and Grand Central Station. There is a Starbucks on the corner just 2 minutes away. Easy access to the subway. It was very easy to get to downtown and other midtown neighborhoods.  Nice walk to Times Square, The Theater District, and Central Park. Continental breakfast is available for $19.95 if interested or there are several breakfast options on the block with the hotel. Will definitely be my top choice next time I’m in the Big Apple.

title: Questionable staff
text: The hotel itself and the room was lovely. Unfortunately, the staff is not. Three articles of clothing went missing. I called the hotel twice to see if they were found. No. We left our bags at they desk for a few hours while we toured. The porter put them in the car. Not in the bag when we arrived home. Some one in the hotel took them, plain and simple.

title: Lovely Accommodations in Midtown!
text: My daughter and I were very pleased with our accommodations at the Affinia this past weekend.  The staff goes out of their way to make certain that you are comfortable.  I was especially pleased to be able to drop my bags off prior to check-in and to leave them following check-out so that I could enjoy traveling around Manhattan without the encumbrance of baggage.  They also provide complimentary wine between the hours of 5:00 and 6:00 and complimentary coffee and tea 24/7.  The hotel itself was modern with edgy artwork.  The only thing which was less than wonderful was the addition of a

title: Massive change in pet policy
text: Arrived at the Fifty for what was probably our 25th stay at an Affinia hotel, which was always our favorite place to stay when traveling with our pets, only to find out that they recently changed their policy to charge $150 PER PET per stay.  We were shocked to say the least, that this formerly pet-friendly oasis has changed their policy.  And unlike every past stay, our room wasn't great either, and had a very strange odor in the bathroom (and we avoided showering all weekend).  We'll be going back to Kimpton for all our future stays, where pets are still treated like family!

title: Beautiful birthday weekend!
text: My girlfriend and I were happy to celebrate our birthdays in style at the Fifty Hotel & Suites. Immediately upon arrival we were told our room was upgraded from the Standard Guest Room to the Terrace Penthouse Room. As we walked in, we were greeted with a bottle of Chardonnay and cupcakes with a little Happy Birthday note. What a way to start our weekend. I can't thank the team enough! It was surely a weekend to remember.

title: Fantastic East Midtown Location - Friendly and Smiling throughout our stay
text:
A great find in East Midtown!  Attractively priced and walkable to so many midtown favorites including 30 Rock, Central Park and many excellent restaurant options.  

We all had some of the best night's sleep in our year's of travel experience!  Clean room, good sized for Manhattan and well worth the extra money to have a small kitchen.  

The staff throughout the entire hotel was very welcoming, helpful and cheery.  We can't ask for more during a stay in Gotham.

title: Indimenticabile vacanza
text:
Posizione ottima, personale gentile e premuroso, ambienti curati e puliti. Negozi a pochi passi e metro vicinissima. 
Vista stupenda sulla 3rd avenue dalla nostra suite al 20esimo piano con terrazza panoramica angolare. 
Nella nostra stanza era presente una cucina con angolo cottura, lavastoviglie, forno elettrico e macchina per the e caffè e un ampio e luminoso soggiorno per rilassarsi guardando i grattacieli dalle ampie vetrate. Se disponibile chiedete una stanza con terrazzo, noi lo abbiamo amato.
Comodissimo ed enorme il letto, tra i migliori sui quali abbiamo mai dormito!
Da non perdere la wine hour che si svolge nella lobby ogni giorno dalle 17 alle 18 con un calice di vino gratuito e la possibilità di chiacchierare con gli altri ospiti dell'hotel. 
Ideale per chi vuole vivere la vita di Manhattan

title: Nice room...but pricey
text: After already purchasing the one of the most expensive suites, they wanted to charge me an additional $30 per guest. All of the hotels that I have been to prior have never done that to me. Other hotels usually waive it or simply ignore it. Front desk service was surely poor. However, the other staff members and the room itself were nice. If I were to return to New York, I may have to choose a different hotel because they were getting too expensive.

title: I'm having nice stays
text:
I am staying most weekdays in May and June 2018. Each room is a bit different, which I like. Design sensibility and functionality are good. Gym is pretty good for a hotel but not huge. Lounge is nice though I use only occasionally. I'm on biz so can't take advantage of winer hour from 5-6 but that's a nice feature.
Perhaps most important, I have found all the staff - front desk and doormen - to be extremely friendly and helpful.
My only complaint is HVAC. Heating and cooling is via pumped water - heated or chilled - as best as I can tell. With AC on, if you leave fan blowing, room gets much colder than thermostat setting.

title: You feel at home right by the door
text: Everything is nicely design, so many space in the room. The front desk ladies are very nice and very helpful. I would definitely go back. The view is amazing especially at night time on those skyscrapers around you!

title: Great staff and rooms
