text: My stay got off to a wonderful start thanks to Jasmin at the front desk. She cheerfully greeted me and then went out of her way to find me a room so I could check in instead of just checking my bags. My room was spacious clean comfortable and quiet. I highly recommend this hotel

title: Standard rooms
text:
We were upgraded from a One Bdr King Bed Suite to a Terrace Suite, but did not receive the terrace, just a balcony.
The size of the suite was very good, but the bathroom is small and not adequate for 6 people. Not much space to hang or store clothes for 6 people.

title: Impecable Stop-by
text:
Stopped by for a short weekend in New York. The room was spacious and perfectly comfortable. Located a walk away from many of the points of interest in the city and very near the subway it was very comfortable to get by. 
The staff at the service desk were also very helpful with each of the concerns I had during my stay.

title: Nice Property, Poor Customer Experience & Service
text:
I booked two rooms for the weekend for a group of ladies. Prior to my stay, I visited the hotel in person, met the management, and took a peek at the public space available. I explained that I would be having a small welcome gathering for folks coming from out of town and asked if our room wasn't available by midday, was there a public space we could use as a meeting point? The manager on duty showed me the 2nd floor lounge space, which she explained was open to the public. I let her know that was totally fine; we didn't need much time and were happy to share our snacks with anyone who wanted to sit with us!

Upon arriving, our room wasn't ready, so we did set up our welcome gathering in the lounge area. It was a small gathering -- four people -- and we had some cute little photo booth props sitting on a table. A manager entered to tell me that this was a "family friendly" hotel and we had to remove anything that didn't fit that didn't fit that bill. I was pretty surprised and confused in the moment by her statement -- what could have possibly been "not family friendly" about girly, pink photo booth props that said "Bride to be" and had glasses and lipsticks on them, and jazz music playing in the background? In the moment, I was so confused, but I went back downstairs to the desk later to as what she meant and she said one of her staffers saw some "penis props." There were no penis props. She simply made an assumption about us -- hopefully not because of our race -- possibly because we were celebrating a bride to be. There were no penis props at all, only girly lipsticks, veils, etc.

The hotel was also very unorganized -- a member of our group had booked the hotel, and added a couple of our names to the reservation so that we'd be able to check in without her, but the hotel couldn't find the record so our friend had to repeatedly do this while she was attending a conference and couldn't be present. It was a tremendous nuisance.

The hotel itself was nice -- nice location, rooms, space in general -- but the staff and our treatment would ensure that I never return and would not recommend it.

title: Going Downhill Fast
text:
I've stayed at the Fifty Hotel & Suites five times since 2016, but the last visit will be the last.

What was once a nice boutique hotel with service, facilities, amenities and price on par with other mid-town East competitors is now a poorly-maintained, dirty, and over-priced hotel with inexcusable hidden charges.

First, know that the rooms vary widely. I've stayed in a good size (for New York) room with two queen beds, a suite with its own kitchen and balcony, and a tiny room about the size of what you get in a New York City "pod" hotel.  

Second, the cleanliness and upkeep of the hotel is sorely lacking and, in my experience, getting worse. Every surface of my room on the last visit seemed stained, from the black (mold? mildew?) surrounding the tub, to the smudged door handles, to the sticky TV remote control.  My room smelled like marijuana smoke and the bed smelled like it had just been sprayed with insecticide. 

Third, the hotel still can't seem to provide basic soundproofing from doors slamming. The noise and concussion from closing doors literally shook my bed. Conveniently, the hotel provides free ear plugs -- the only free thing they do provide (more on this later.) It should not be difficult to provide some sort of sound dampening device on room doors.

Fourth, this hotel does not provide even the most basic security found in every other NYC hotel in its class and in most suburban hotels I've stayed in around the country. While most hotels require a room key to use the elevator (sometimes only at night), the Fifty's elevators are wide open 24/7 and the fact that elevators are only a few steps from the front door makes this security lapse even more glaring.

Fifth, and this was the last straw for me, the hotel charges a ridiculous "facilities fee' that is now $35 per room, per night on top of the room fee.  Looking at previous reviews, it seems that this has, over the past year or so, gone from $25 to $30 and now to $35.  What is this for?  1) access to a free wine sipping every night from 5-6pm. 2) A $10 daily credit to use in the tiny snack bar near the front desk that has extremely over-priced bottled water, juice, and soda, chips, candy and granola bars that can all be bought at a fraction of the cost from any of the stores within a block of the hotel. 3) Free local and long distance calls (who uses a hotel phone in 2018?). 4) Access to the gym. 5) WiFi.   These are ALL things that other hotels offer for free or provide as paid options not as paid requirements, whether you use them or not.  This type of hidden price gouging is the last straw and I will not be returning to the Fifty Hotel & Suites by Affinia. There are many other options for hotels in this area of New York City and they will now be getting my money.

title: Enjoyable stay overall
text:
The hotel location is very good in terms of accessibility to public transportation.  There are two subway stations located nearby. However, it is right at the intersection of 3rd avenue and E. 50th street, which is a very busy corner.  The noise of the street was quite significant inside of our room which means that we had to sleep every night with ear plugs, which is fine I guess but gets annoying after a few days.  On the positive side, it is a good and safe neighbourhood with a wide rage of restaurant options.  We enjoyed the area very much.
Otherwise, the room was clean and the beds very confortable.  The shower was OK but nothing special (no shower head though...).  We had a studio with a small kitchen.  I was disappointed that there was no microwave, the toaster was so basic that we could hardly put the bread down and there were very few (2!) pans and pots to cook anything in the room - which is why you rent a room with a kitchen, right?  The fridge was of a good size.
The staff was lovely and helpful.  Overall we enjoyed this hotel but if we come back to NYC we might look for another one in a more quiet street next time.

title: A leisure week with family
text: Me and my family stayed at this hotel for a week and we enjoyed it very much. The hotel is in a convenient location, close to subway and Grand Central. The room was big and comfortable. Coffee and tea always available for free, nice gym. Very helpful and cheerful staff. Good value!

title: Decent place to stay midtown east NYC
text: The hotel was attractive and offered good service and amenities. Staff was responsive. The rooms were surprisingly spacious for NYC. I liked the contemporary decor. The drawback was a cheapness to furnishings and their installation. Rack in shower with shampoo etc. was loose and ffalling off. TV was crooked and wobbly. Above headboard artwork was wrinkled. But it was good value for the price. The happy hour was a nice feature as was the cupboard credit.

title: Manhattan Gem
text: We stayed on property for 4 nights.  The room was very spacious, the beds were comfortable, the pillows were amazing, the bathroom had more than enough towels stocked, and the wifi was strong.  My only complaint is the air conditioner; it always felt muggy and not cool.

title: Loved everything about our stay here
text: We come to Manhattan about 4 times a year and have stayed all over. I selected Fifty because a good rate came up. I think this is my new favorite hotel. The staff was so friendly and helpful. Our room was not a fancy one but had everything we needed:good shower,coffee,extra lounge chair with foot stool!great mattress and QUIET.  Location was terrific with wonderful restaurants in easy walk.  Finally the wine reception at 5 was another nice touch. Oh and the speedy elevators!  I felt welcomed and safe at all times.

title: Great Stay!!!
text:
We had a great stay. All the staff were extremely helpful and kind. 
This is a great hotel for families all the amenities of a luxury hotel with the understanding and convenience of a family friendly hotel.

title: Good location, nice hotel
text:
For Brits abroad this is like half a notch up from Premier Inn (a brand I rate highly.) Reliable three-star level, and in a good location. 
Not the best atmosphere on arrival after the horror that is flying into the US. Three staff around and none of them served us for a while. The person who did serve us apologised and was very friendly and helpful. The reception area is a bit scruffy, but OK. They have a strange system where $10 of your price each day is credit with their little snack shop. A nice idea but in practice not easy to spend and you need to register your choice with the desk each time so leads to queues. 
Our room was big and comfortable and a big bathroom with bath and shower. Most things worked fine (except my reading light.)The road outside was noisy. Perhaps everywhere in Manhattan is. They provided ear plugs, but because it’s a constant drone it didn’t wake me up. 
Location is great. It’s a hotel area, near a Metro station, easy walking distance of Central Park, Fifth Avenue and Times Square. 
Nice touch is the free wine hour in the main club room at 5-6pm. The guests didn’t talk to each other - just stared at their phones but can’t blame the hotel for that! 
As with lots of US hotels breakfast not worth paying for, but there is a great local place - New York Luncheonette -  a few doors down and that was where we ate each morning.  There was no restaurant in the hotel though you can get room service. There aren’t lots of restaurants locally, we ate at Toscana 49 which was pricey but fine, and the Oyster Bar in Grand Central station. There were other options. 
I would stay here again.

title: Short trip made special because of the people
text:
I stayed at the Affinia from May 22nd 2018 to May 23rd 2018.

It was a short trip and I had an interview the next day and needed a place to store my luggage which was provided. 

Two people who made my stay amazing would be: 

1) Gloria who calmed my nerves before my interview and asked me if I enjoyed my lunch when I went back to the hotel. She is so caring and gave me a slice of home even though I was far away.

2) Rome who was instrumental in me catching my taxi to the airport when no driver was willing to take me there. He was very personable and honestly an employee you cannot lose. Ever. 

I would definitely stay at the Affinia again for these people.

title: Mother's Day Stay
text: Every aspect was wonderful except for the unpleasant dealings with Leslie at the reception desk. Check in was a chore and a request for late check hour (1/2 hour) was met with resentment. I had come into the city to run a 10K with my daughter for Mother's Day and was afraid I may run late.

title: Our usual spot in NYC
text: We have been staying in this hotel for years.  Spacious rooms and suites with a friendly and professional staff.  One of the best hotels to stay when traveling with children.  In room Wifi works great and the second floor club room is well outfitted for social and business activities.

title: Erica's Graduation
text: Smyler and Rome were most helpful. They know how to care of people. They helped with parking and transportation. They cared about us as people not just as guests. Will stay at Fifty 50 when we are in NYC.

title: Great hotel! Outstanding Services!
text:
Great room and very friendly and helpful staff.  Jasmine and Smailey (pardon the spelling) were fantastic, they both went out their way to help me and my family.
Thank you for making this special family vacation even more memorable.

title: Price changed from when I originally booked the hotel.
text: Dissappointed with the hotel in general. Prices charged for two of the nights not the same amount than prices when I booked the hotel. Left very early in the morning and had no time to review with front desk, I will follow up on my return with hotel.  they charged me $467 per night plus all the fees, these are kot the prices when I booked the hotel. Adding the fees and taxes is over $540 for a very small room facing the back of a building.

title: Muy buena estadía
text: Excelente ubicacion para ir por primera vez a NY. La gente que trabaja en el hotel es divina, amable, simpática y servicial. La habitación que nos toco es linda, nada guau quizás porque era interna y no era para nada luminosa.

title: 50th Birthday Trip to NYC
text: Was very pleased with the hotel, the staff and overall experience at The Fifty NYC. The Fifty NYC is in a great location - close to everything. Stephanie at the Front Desk was very pleasant and all of the Bellmen were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Would stay there again if I return to NYC.

title: Great location and very good value!
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Fifty NYC and thought the accommodations and location were very good.  Our room was large with comfortable beds and bathrooms were nice and clean.  Overall I would say you get very good value for the money.

title: Ótima Localização
text:
Hotel muito bem localizado. Quarto amplo e agradável, banheiro limpo e cama confortável. 
Café da manhã gostoso porém sem muitas opções. 
Academia pequena e quase sem aparelhos, mesma coisa do que nada.
Atendimento no check in pouco amigável, existe uma atendente extremamente mal educada e sem vontade. 
Tirando isso, eu recomendo.

title: Convenient location
text:
We were given a room on the 2nd floor on which the guest lounge and fitness facility were also located. The noise insulation was very poor as door slamming, elevator pings, and guests enjoying themselves in the lounge could be heard. Also the window could not be opened because it was butting against the adjacent building whose roof was almost at the top of our ceiling. The room could not be ventilated as a result and dampness lingered throughout our stay (4 nights).

The staff were not overly friendly, but they addressed our questions and helped us adequately. The concierge lady was very helpful with information.

The bed was very comfortable.

Once we booked (about 6 weeks before our arrival), we received about dozen emails soliciting room upgrades. I guess in hindsight it was because our room was maybe the worst in the house. But considering the price of our stay, we feel we received poor value.

The midtown east location was very convenient and safe.

title: A Spacious and Quiet Retreat
text: We really enjoyed our stay at Fifty NYC. The front desk crew was, for the most part, extremely professional and very helpful. The bellmen were fantastic, and the lobby was lovely. The room seemed to me to be more spacious than the typical NYC hotel room. Beds were very comfortable. I only rated it a 4-star because the a/c was not working on the day we arrived. I called the front desk who sent someone up after a delay. We were told the a/c was fine and to just let the fan run. An hour later, the thermostat was still reading 79 in the room (it was a muggy day). I called again and then again; the front desk finally had someone come up who adjusted the valve. The a/c immediately began working. By this point, we'd been in the room two hours, and it was very uncomfortable. We got ready and left for the theater. When I arrived back in the room late that evening, the thermostat was registering 79 or 80, again. My father had returned earlier and was asleep so I went to the front desk to report the issue (the third report), but we had to sleep through it that night. I did not sleep well because of the heat and the humidity in the room. The next day as we left, I asked the front desk to ensure someone fixed the a/c. When we returned in the afternoon, it was running and almost chilly--a welcome change! Apparently the thermostat was the issue and had to be reset. They left us a small, chocolate wrench as an apology. It was a nice token, but I found it galling that after a sleepless night (at approximately $400 a night after you calculate taxes and fees) in a  hot, humid room, that's all we were offered--a chocolate wrench. No credit, no discount. A chocolate wrench. Not even a word from the manager. Apart from that hiccup, it really was great.

title: Great boutique hotel
text:
This hotel was booked as part of our package holiday via Virgin. When I did my research & looked at some of the reviews I was a little bit nervous seeing “extra charges” “wrongly billed” so when we arrived I asked about it & was told there were no “local charges” as we’d booked via Virgin.
I must say, what a great little hostel. Far enough away from the hustle & bustle but close enough to get into some of the main attractions quite quickly. 
The hotel itself was comfortable we had 2 rooms both with 2 queen size beds the only grumble I had was that our kids were on a seperate floor. When we asked, unfortunately they couldn’t be moved to the same floor but managed to get them one floor above. We were on the 10th floor so the road noise wasn’t horrendous. You could still hear the sirens of the emergency vehicles. Earplugs were provided though. The view from our window was fabulous. 
I must make a special mention of Smilia, the doorman. What he doesn’t know about English Premiership football isn’t worth knowing. My lads were very impressed and of course like the name, he always had a smile and was very helpful. 
All in all, a great stay in NYC

title: Best boutique hotel in NYC
text: We found this hotel many years ago and have been staying there every time we visit NY (which is about twice a year). Many of the staff have been there as long as we have been coming. Ask for Gloria at the front desk. She will take good care of you.
